story:
Mi az a szalma szívószál?

Ezt nem magyaráznánk túl. Az szalma szívószál egy szívószál, ami szalmából van, azaz nem marad szemét utána, mert lebomlik. 

 

Miért jó / fontos ez? 

  • A fesztiválokon / rendezvényeken / falunapokon ... biztonsági okok miatt nem lehet semmi balesetveszélyes eszköz (fém, porcelán, üveg ..), ezért rengeteg az egyszer használatos műanyag, ami óriási nyersanyag és energia pazarlás.
  • Ezekre keresünk mi környezetbarát megoldásokat, olyat, mint a szalma szívószál,  vagy anno a RE:pohár és a komposzt étkészlet, amik bevezetésével 2010-ben, több mint 20%-kal csökkentettük a SZIN-en keletkező szemét mennyiségét. A RE:poharat és komposzt étkészletet azóta sokan sokfelé használják már Magyarországon. Reméljük ez a szalma szívószállal sem lesz másképp.

 

Mire kérünk most pénzt tőled?

Arra, hogy a Szegedi Ifjúsági Napokon csinálhassunk idén egy fasza kampányt és próbaüzemet, valamint, hogy utána elkezdhessük megalapozni a szalmaszál hosszútávú Magyarországi jelenlétét. Konkrétan erre:

 

1) 5000 db-os készlet legyártása, csomagolás, szállítás 

2) Szükséges hatósági engedélyek beszerzése

3) Próbaüzem fesztiválkörnyezetben: SZIN-en a KINO RE:kocsmában. 

a) helyszíni kommunikáció (mi ez, miért van, stb.), szalmaszál visszagyűjtő edényzet kialakítása, stb.

b) gyermekbetegségek, első körös problémák és visszajelzések begyűjtése 

c) Videók, fényképek és közvélemény kutatás készítése

4) Fesztivál után: tapasztalatok összegzése, környezeti hatástanulmány elkészítése. 

5) Ipari termelés első lépései (3-6 hónap szervezői munka): 

a) kiajánló elkészítése (SZIN-en szerzett tapasztalatok alapján): vevői elegédettség, környezeti hatástanyulmány értékei, gazdasági adatok. 

b) megfelelő magyar gyártó keresése, optimális gyártási folyamat megalkotása

c) piac kiépítése (rendezvény és fesztiválszervezők, áruházláncok ..)

 

Miért a közösségi finanszírozás?

  • A környezetvédelem mindig egy furcsa kísérleti ló, amit ugyan mindenki fontosnak tart, meg szupernek, de valahogy pénz az sosincs rá. Egy ideig még voltak pályázatok, amik így-úgy befoltozták ezeket a lukakat, de mára ezek is jobbára elapadtak. 
  • Szóval elegünk lett, hogy az íróasztalnak ötleteljünk és tervezzünk, ezért úgy gondoltuk megpróbáljuk inkább a kezünkbe venni a dolgok irányítását és meghírdetjük itt a dolgot.
  • Nekünk már az is nagy segítség, ha dobsz egy ezrest / ötöst, de nagyon örülünk, ha többet is megengedhetsz magadnak. 

 

Hogyan működik?

  • Az ajánlott adományok listájából a jobb oldalon választhatsz és bankkártyával juttathatod el hozzánk a támogatásod. Természetesen, hogyha úgy érzed, az ajánlottnál többet is adhatsz.
  • Az adományodért cserébe ajánlott ajándékod, a kampány lejárta után postán fogjuk eljuttatni neked, illetve ha eljössz a SZIN-re, akkor személyesen is átveheted. 
  • Az általunk használt Indiegogo rendszerének sajátosságai miatt a kiírások amerikai dollárban vannak, ám tájékoztatásképpen a forintban értendő körülbelüli  összeget is odaírtunk. Az árfolyam ingadozásai miatt ez azonban valamennyire eltérhet.
  • Többször felmerült kérdésként, úgyhogy: A billing postal code az a lakcímed irányítószáma, ami a bankkal kötött szerződésedben van. a többi elvileg logikus, bár angolul van, de ha nem tudtok valamit kérdezzetek itt az indin keresztül, vagy: mangel.koppany@gmail.com.

 

KÖSZÖNJÜK.

story:
Support our Uniting Sustainable Superheroes crowdfunding campaign to  connect and help young scientists & engineers to be the sustainable superheroes we need and create a bright, positive and prosperous future for us all.

Thanks to all your donations so far. Through matchfunding and offline donations we're raised an additional $1300. Keep giving to help us reach our target!

Who we are:

NESSE is a unique bottom-up global network of young researchers and professionals working on innovative solutions to today’s most pressing global environmental challenges.

Currently we have a very basic website. To achieve our bold mission and transform science & technology through our grassroots network we need to build a responsive interactive platform. For this we need experts and your help!

What we want to do:

Global sustainability challenges require a new type of scientist and engineer. We need to be collaborative researchers, inspiring thinkers, dreamers, entrepreneurs and storytellers to develop truly disruptive solutions that are available to all.

To do this we need to connect people both globally and locally and share creative, radical ideas. There are thousands of young scientists & engineers who want to use their skills to develop sustainable solutions for the world. With your support we will build a new platform that will enable the conversations, learning and connections for sustainable science & technology. The platform will be:

  • a hub for inspirational stories and videos about the solutions that are already being developed to show everyone a positive vision of the future
  • an interactive organizing space for scientists and engineers to share resources, learn, ask for help and initiate joint projects around global challenges including renewable energy, food security and clean water.
  • a place to discover mentors so that scientists & engineers can build sustainability into their careers and utilise their knowledge and passion
  • a space to build and connect our growing network of local groups so they can run events, fundraise and share outreach resources.

NESSE has already achieved a huge amount in a year on a shoestring budget. We've run events at three international conferences, we've supported four local groups to start (with four more starting up), we've run a course on ecological economics and reached over 18,000 people through our website and communications.

We want to create a platform that will give our members and anyone interested in sustainable science the ability to directly engage and participate - to set-up a workshop or outreach event locally, communicate their science, share their knowledge and skills with others and gain the connections to work across boundaries. This will allow us to achieve so much more with small amounts of money and build the community rapidly.

Your support will allow us to achieve so much! Find out more about our #SustainableSuperhero scientists & engineers that you will be supporting and connecting with below or on our website. And donate today!


The funding we need:

To do all this we need to raise $8,000 in total. This will enable us to research potential users to understand how they will use and what they want. It will pay for the back-end building of the interactive infrastructure, the design of the site and maintenance. By creating a platform that is automated, interactive and beautifully designed we will be able to achieve so much more with our resources and reach thousands of people.

All of the money we raise will go directly to building the platform, as NESSE is run by a volunteer group of amazing early-career scientists around the world.

Via this crowdfunding campaign we hope to raise as much of the money as possible. We are also contacting companies and other organizations for support. And...we’ve already raised $750 from the American Chemical Society and $250 through an amazing interdisciplinary Bio-based Economy event we ran at the University of York. We’re using this to carry out the initial research to understand our users and map the initial site.  So….only $7,000 to go!

To actually build the platform that can have an impact on the scale we’re imagining we need your support! If we don’t reach the full amount we will still be able to transform our communication platform. If we raise more we will use it for all the other projects, events and activities we’ve got planned!


$3,000 will enable us to research our users and redesign our existing website

$4,500 A new static website will be built that will create the media hub but without user interactivity

$6,000 Functional interactive website will be built but not all individual member profile options and project collaborating aspects will be functional  

$8,000 Fully functional website which members can use to connect globally and run grassroots events.

>$8000 Donations will go directly to funding NESSE events and activities


Any donations above and beyond our goal will go directly to funding NESSE events worldwide. With additional funding we would be able to hold more events that will engage NESSE members (both individuals and groups) from around the world. This will simultaneously promote local engagement within NESSE member's community as well as foster a sense of connection between NESSE members around the world.

Who is doing the work:

Three fantastic young developers will build the platform. They will need two months to build it and only have time until the end of January. So we need to raise the money now! As soon as you commit to supporting the project we can get started!

Bruno Barboza is a software developer from México. He just finished studying an MSc in Human-Centred Interactive Technologies at the University of York funded through a Chevening Scholarship from the UK Foreign & Commonwealth Office.

Vivek Warriar is a User Interaction designer. He just completed his Masters in Human-computer Interaction and is currently working on freelance projects. He is specialises in responsive design for user-interaction of website applications.

Kenny Mathew is a software developer by profession. He worked for 2 years at the national bank of Kuwait in IT operations and 1 and half years in Kuwait University as a PHP developer. He has finished studying the MSc in Human-Centred Interactive Technologies at the University of York. He is currently working on a freelance project with a start up company in Amsterdam.

Get Involved:

Beyond just donating you can get involved in the community by joining NESSE for FREE  - Here! Read our blog for interesting research in the field of sustainable science and engineering. Share info with us on twitter (@greenscientists) or facebook (NESSE) or tell us your #SustainableSuperhero story. You can promote our cause by telling scientist and engineers you know about our organization. Every bit of support is valued and vital so we hope you’ll like the thank you presents!

story:
My name is Prasad Erande from Wai,Maharashtra,India.I am Passioanate about cycling and Guinness World Record.Last year 2104 i rode 14576 km cycling throughout India and get my Guinness world Record Holder Tilte. 
http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/longest-journey-by-bicycle-in-a-single-country

Facebook-https://www.facebook.com/prasad.erande

whatsapp +919373710070

20 Dec 2015 i started my journey Round Around The World By Cycle.. I want to ride through out more than 25 countries, I Want to present a TV show based on cycling in different conditions, different tracks, different weather, and verity of food. 
I Have many life cycling questions and tricks to show and demonstrate.

How to survive on the road with a cycle? 
How to choose the right road for long distance cycling? 
How to choose a safe place for stay? 
How to choose foods in different weather conditions? 
How to ride long distance with minimum calories? 
How to ride in hot, summer, and winter conditions? 
What is the important equipment needed for your tour? 
How to take advantage of sun, air, heat, and water? 
How much water, bananas, and bakery products are need for a cyclist? 

I am confident when people see this TV SHOW, they will pump up and be confident about long distance cycling. These days in India 10 CR people ride a cycle daily but those are not dare to tour. However after watching this TV show many people will be ready to ride. The base of the show is where to ride, stay ,and what to eat. If I give them info about road quality and elevation, safety places to stay, and preferred nutrition choices for riding, the tips will help solve their basic problems. This show is destined to guide millions of people. 
Riding long distance a on cycle is a really adventurous thing. I want to remove this thought from people's mind. Cycling is a simple form of enjoy, traveling, sharing moments, and the source of understanding oneself. This show will benefit people worldwide and give confidence to many people to live a healthier lifestyle, be ecofriendly, and have a taste of adventure.

story:
Why We're Here. Help us expand our food waste reduction technology from an existing orange peel plant in Mexico to a new wild salmon processing plant in Alaska. 

This is the first time our diverse technologies have come together under one roof to create an effective process to recover wasted food materials.


What You Get.  We have just established our first operating partners with a citrus plant in Mexico. This means we can guarantee your reward - our delicious and nutritious 100% Non-GMO Orange Peel Powder. No other orange peel powder made by conventional dehydration has the same nutritional value as ours.

Your pledge will directly impact low-income areas by creating new jobs while also providing highly nutritious food resources through our unique recovery of “leftovers.”

Orange peel contains a variety of goodness, including 10 times more Vitamin C than juice. It also has 10 times more beta-carotene than orange juice as well as valuable bioflavonoids such as rutin, hesperidin and d-limonene.

Actual Orange Peel Powder in Package.

Contribute now and you will receive individual, sealed ½ lb-225 gram packages of our Orange Peel Powder. The more you pledge, the more you receive.  It has a multi-year shelf life when stored in a sealed container in a cool place.

What We Can Do With Your Support.  

We are seeking $75,000 (U.S.) to fund a verification  for a major waste recovery project to dehydrate wild-caught salmon . 

The "Alaska Salmon Recovery Project" will be our first aquaculture venture. Based on our initial success with citrus peel, it will allow us to focus on the thousands of tons of highly nutritious salmon “leftovers” associated with the Alaska fishing industry.

The plan is to establish a micro preservation process at a facility location in association with Native Tribe corporation(s), beginning with a verification this will allow us to then scale up, growing into a full capability operation. As we expand  and the local populace becomes trained, we will transfer the operation to complete local ownership. During the verification period, we will intensely document  the operation's build, process and results. Including independent analysis of the operation and its final output, amazing nutritious salmon powder. Our intention is to then distribute the results and in association with major manufacturers roll out the process in multiple locations worldwide.

I Initial tests reveal processed salmon retained high nutritional values.

The above chart represents the proportion of allocation of funds for the project
With your help we will say; "Together we initiated, raised necessary funds, changed attitudes and started a movement that will re-purpose thousands of tons of salmon by-products per year, which is enough to provide protein to millions of people!"

What We Do. Our sustainable food recycling technology for agriculture and aquaculture products uses unique preservation, dehydration and milling technologies. We train food processors to set up and use our technique to bring you nutritious and delicious foods. 

Sustainability is a buzzword.  We, however, have several direct improvements over traditional preservation techniques, plus we are less expensive to build and operate!

The System/Process

Our process relies on our proprietary protein preservation coating, combined with our unique interaction of relative humidity, temperature and air flow. This means we are able to preserve the highest possible levels of vitamins and minerals. Conventional gas and electric heat drying methods result in cellular damage and “burn off” of valuable vitamins and minerals.

Our 3 steps to achieve closed-loop for food and drink manufacturers:

Why Us? Our system has many benefits, including that the dehydration process could be powered by solar or wind energy systems. Systems start at a very low cost, which means they can be easily used by both smaller agricultural producers and large industrial food and beverage producers.

Science. The foundation of our technology is based on nature itself. Simply stated, we start with a natural protein coating that encapsulates and protects natural food sources. This allows us additional time for a non-invasive preservation approach. We provide a controlled environment to establish a precise relative humidity, defined air flows, and specific processing placement that will provide exact conditions for a careful and gentle removal of moisture from the source material. The moisture that we remove is recoverable and potable. The resulting dehydrated product is shelf-stable and can be fully rehydrated by simply adding water. 


Here is a short overview of  the facility in Mexico that produces our Orange Peel Powder.

Citrus peel pilot plant in Hermosillo, Mexico. 100%-natural processing.

PLANT OWNER TESTIMONIAL. "At Citro Des we are proud to be pioneers in the use of the new and unique dehydration method being utilized by NewfoodZ. It is so much more efficient and fits with our goal of using a 100% natural process for dehydrating our orange peels products. This eco-sustainable process presented by NewfoodZ has proven to be extremely effective in its 'gentle' heat-free approach for preserving our citrus peel material." - Arnoldo Pena

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks. The key challenge is time. We estimate it will take 12-18 months to achieve the appropriate exposure for big companies to adopt our process. Additional risks are that we may not reach our full Indiegogo goal, and therefore our project moves slower than we desire, or due to accidents or illness team members may not be available. 

Risk Offset

We mitigate time risk by already having experience with the existing plant in Mexico. In addition to this campaign, we are also actively pursuing private fundraising. We are moving ahead with our own continued investment. This is a life choice for us. A shared knowledge base is already being built, so that the knowledge will be available for all. Specifically, we are bringing players from the local areas of planned production to assure that the knowledge base is appropriately transferred and enables independent operation.

Even if we do not reach our goal we can make headway because we are already committed to the project. We also are promoting our new process with a sweet potato partner and readying launch of an apple pomace project in the UK.

Our team all has experience with start-ups and overcoming challenges as they arrive.

Team. We are Eric, Ed and Christian. Eric and Ed both have extensive careers and experience in ecological technologies. Christian hails from the film industry with 2 years of ecological focus projects.  More details on our website.


Thanks to our associates: Michael Bolan, Kevin White, Dr. Jeff Gwirtz, Martin Glastsetter, Mark Henry.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are looking for people to join our growing team, including operating partners, private investors, chefs and food creators. Please email us if you are interested: info@newfoodz.com. Please share our project with your friends and on social media.

  • https://www.facebook.com/NewfoodZ
  • https://twitter.com/NewfoodZ
  • www.newfoodz.com

Thank you for your time and consideration. Peace and Joy :)
story_txt:
Why We're Here. Help us expand our food waste reduction technology from an existing orange peel plant in Mexico to a new wild salmon processing plant in Alaska. 

This is the first time our diverse technologies have come together under one roof to create an effective process to recover wasted food materials.










What You Get.  We have just established our first operating partners with a citrus plant in Mexico. This means we can guarantee your reward - our delicious and nutritious 100% Non-GMO Orange Peel Powder. No other orange peel powder made by conventional dehydration has the same nutritional value as ours.
Your pledge will directly impact low-income areas by creating new jobs while also providing highly nutritious food resources through our unique recovery of “leftovers.”






Orange peel contains a variety of goodness, including 10 times more Vitamin C than juice. It also has 10 times more beta-carotene than orange juice as well as valuable bioflavonoids such as rutin, hesperidin and d-limonene.








Actual Orange Peel Powder in Package.
Contribute now and you will receive individual, sealed ½ lb-225 gram packages of our Orange Peel Powder. The more you pledge, the more you receive.  It has a multi-year shelf life when stored in a sealed container in a cool place.
What We Can Do With Your Support.  
We are seeking $75,000 (U.S.) to fund a verification  for a major waste recovery project to dehydrate wild-caught salmon . 
The "Alaska Salmon Recovery Project" will be our first aquaculture venture. Based on our initial success with citrus peel, it will allow us to focus on the thousands of tons of highly nutritious salmon “leftovers” associated with the Alaska fishing industry.
The plan is to establish a micro preservation process at a facility location in association with Native Tribe corporation(s), beginning with a verification this will allow us to then scale up, growing into a full capability operation. As we expand  and the local populace becomes trained, we will transfer the operation to complete local ownership. During the verification period, we will intensely document  the operation's build, process and results. Including independent analysis of the operation and its final output, amazing nutritious salmon powder. Our intention is to then distribute the results and in association with major manufacturers roll out the process in multiple locations worldwide.
















I Initial tests reveal processed salmon retained high nutritional values.




The above chart represents the proportion of allocation of funds for the project


With your help we will say; "Together we initiated, raised necessary funds, changed attitudes and started a movement that will re-purpose thousands of tons of salmon by-products per year, which is enough to provide protein to millions of people!"



What We Do. Our sustainable food recycling technology for agriculture and aquaculture products uses unique preservation, dehydration and milling technologies. We train food processors to set up and use our technique to bring you nutritious and delicious foods. 



Sustainability is a buzzword.  We, however, have several direct improvements over traditional preservation techniques, plus we are less expensive to build and operate!








The System/Process
Our process relies on our proprietary protein preservation coating, combined with our unique interaction of relative humidity, temperature and air flow. This means we are able to preserve the highest possible levels of vitamins and minerals. Conventional gas and electric heat drying methods result in cellular damage and “burn off” of valuable vitamins and minerals.


Our 3 steps to achieve closed-loop for food and drink manufacturers:









Why Us? Our system has many benefits, including that the dehydration process could be powered by solar or wind energy systems. Systems start at a very low cost, which means they can be easily used by both smaller agricultural producers and large industrial food and beverage producers.




Science. The foundation of our technology is based on nature itself. Simply stated, we start with a natural protein coating that encapsulates and protects natural food sources. This allows us additional time for a non-invasive preservation approach. We provide a controlled environment to establish a precise relative humidity, defined air flows, and specific processing placement that will provide exact conditions for a careful and gentle removal of moisture from the source material. The moisture that we remove is recoverable and potable. The resulting dehydrated product is shelf-stable and can be fully rehydrated by simply adding water. 




Here is a short overview of  the facility in Mexico that produces our Orange Peel Powder.
Citrus peel pilot plant in Hermosillo, Mexico. 100%-natural processing.
PLANT OWNER TESTIMONIAL. "At Citro Des we are proud to be pioneers in the use of the new and unique dehydration method being utilized by NewfoodZ. It is so much more efficient and fits with our goal of using a 100% natural process for dehydrating our orange peels products. This eco-sustainable process presented by NewfoodZ has proven to be extremely effective in its 'gentle' heat-free approach for preserving our citrus peel material." - Arnoldo Pena
Risks & Challenges
There are always risks. The key challenge is time. We estimate it will take 12-18 months to achieve the appropriate exposure for big companies to adopt our process. Additional risks are that we may not reach our full Indiegogo goal, and therefore our project moves slower than we desire, or due to accidents or illness team members may not be available. 

Risk Offset
We mitigate time risk by already having experience with the existing plant in Mexico. In addition to this campaign, we are also actively pursuing private fundraising. We are moving ahead with our own continued investment. This is a life choice for us. A shared knowledge base is already being built, so that the knowledge will be available for all. Specifically, we are bringing players from the local areas of planned production to assure that the knowledge base is appropriately transferred and enables independent operation.
Even if we do not reach our goal we can make headway because we are already committed to the project. We also are promoting our new process with a sweet potato partner and readying launch of an apple pomace project in the UK.
Our team all has experience with start-ups and overcoming challenges as they arrive.
 

Team. We are Eric, Ed and Christian. Eric and Ed both have extensive careers and experience in ecological technologies. Christian hails from the film industry with 2 years of ecological focus projects.  More details on our website.





Thanks to our associates: Michael Bolan, Kevin White, Dr. Jeff Gwirtz, Martin Glastsetter, Mark Henry.

Other Ways You Can Help
We are looking for people to join our growing team, including operating partners, private investors, chefs and food creators. Please email us if you are interested: info@newfoodz.com. Please share our project with your friends and on social media.

story:
Recycling, Upcycling, Reusing, Second life, all this can be applied to many previously used things in our lives. This process known by different terms, but the fact is that this process reduces the amount of pollution and makes the environment on our planet healthier.

Although we may be separated by boundaries, continents, seas and oceans, we all live in one big house, and this house is our planet.

Thousands of people in different countries, everyday are looking for a new solutions to resolve the problem with a plastic waste recycling (PET bottles, cans, etc.)

We (our team, including our family) decided to take part in searching and implementing solutions to this issue. 

We made our first step in this way and we hope that peoples who care about the purity of our common home will endorse and follow this idea. 

After spending thousands of hours of research and investigating alternate means, we have come a conclusion that the optimal solution is useful (Recycling, Upcycling, Reusing, Second life) in place. This means that now anyone can make a contribution to solving the problem where it resides (without high cost and effort), and thus make the planet cleaner.


P.S. We believe that each person, each family is able to create a clean and tidy house. 

 
Yes, the idea is not new and the internet is full of information about how you can make this device. But we believe that our device is more flexible and useful in everyday life. After spending a lot of hours of design, process worksheet development and tests, finally we can present you a plastic bottle and can cutter.

KEY FEATURES

  • Easy use 
  • Cut any plastic materials like PET, HDPE, PP, etc…
  • Cut plastic bottles with different surfaces (with ridges and irregularities), it can cut any plastic bottle up to 3 mm of ridges 
  • Cut plastic bottles with thickness up to 1.2 mm (the average bottle thickness, depending on the shape and manufacture are 0.2 - 0.3 mm) 
  • Simple adjustment of the cut width, you can adjust the width from 2 mm to 15 mm.

CHARACTERISTICS

  • Base - engineering plastic.
  • Knives - tempered steel, safety double-sided blade and easy sharpening.
  • Bottle holder - aluminium.
  • Other details - stainless steel.
  • Mounting holes for mounting on a horizontal or vertical surfaces.
  • Screws - for mounting (if you wish to mount on a horizontal or vertical surfaces).



How can you save money using our cutter.  

(some examples of using a rope)


Risks and challenges

There are always risks involved, and the the biggest risk to shipping on the stated delivery date. As for the rest, there are no any major risks or challenges ahead.

story:
"Facts not Fiction" The contamination of the groundwater, the massive earthquakes to states that should NEVER have to expierence a earthquake, water waste
usage in drought conditons, these are ALL proven dangers of current fracking methods. So with these dangers and all the news coverage this controversial topic is getting, why is their no remedy yet? Finally there is a solution; our product Eco-Fracking is a single pipe system, using a tested and sealed vacuum pump to extract resources, this method uses no harsh
chemicals, and no water therefore saving the 70 to 140 billion gallons of water used each year. Imagine doing yard work, using a leaf blower your making things more difficult to finsh, but say you were a bit unconventional  and used a vaccuum that mess would be cleaned simply. That was ultimately our original goal, to keep things simple and safe. I originally started this project when I saw the huge find in oil in Texas just a couple months ago, for so
long this area was dry. This area in texas had been dry for many years, and then in a gracious turn of events Texas had hit the jackpot, now with a estimated 20 billion barrels of oil! Peaking my interest, and sparking hope that although may take time, but miracles can happen anywhere! With that new found encouragement I sought out to aid in the safe, clean method that is now Eco-Fracking!

To start let me give you a bit of background about fracking. Fracking is the extraction technique for oil and gas wells, in which rocks are artificially fractured with the use of pressurized liquid. This technique dates back to the 1860's. When this now full grown industry monster first started out, they used nitro-glycerin and dynamite as their main
technique. The current oil fracking method is chemicals in the water and explosions that all leak into the aquifer, because you have 50,000lbs. pushing along existing pipes that went through soft dirt and shale. My mother used to tell me there are always three sides to every story, yours, mine, and the truth. With this said I am to explain the truths, the facts in regards to these dangerous methods oil companies are using. Just like big pharmacutical companies, they both want the world to use their products, but minimize the side effects. We will not idly stand by and be silent. The team at The Inventors Depot and I, Dennis Cortese will attempt to protect the future of our world!
You may not know this but Oklahoma has had a recent rise in earthquakes. Oklahoma averaged 2 earthquakes over a 3.0 on the Richter Scale per year, then halfway through 2014 had a registered number of 230 earthquakes. Oklahoma surpassed California as the most quake prone state, due to  disposing fracking fluid into the wells. The contamination of
groundwater is probably the biggest issue, groundwater can be contaminated through many different ways. Such as spills happening, a piece in the system not being built right, whether fluid can escape the formation worked on. Another issue is the air pollution, while transporting these supplies companies are releasing pollutants in the air. Pollutants
like benzene, which can cause cancer. The idea of these dangers affecting families makes me sick.
Finally, our revolutionary product, Eco-Fracking is here! Developed by our team of inventors and oil experts weighing in with their experience every step of the way. We came up with the concept of a vacuum pump to draw the resources through our single pipe system. The people at The Inventors Depot have also found a improved way to prevent that pipe from
cracking during our process. That concept is now our reality, our pump is patented and also uses a special auger. As we are extracting those resources from the wells, our vacuum pump is filtering out unnecessary toxins, and condensing the particles and fumes safely. Personally ensuring an odorless method! My goal is not to stop or ban fracking all
together, just to build a better way of performing the methods. Honestly our hope is that the oil industry will see the potential in our system and seek to adapt it for their own methods in the future. To protect our assets, an agency will be implemented in regards to our product to certify the businesses using Eco-Fracking keep it the way we intended. The reasoning for this application is to ensure that our product continues to operate the same 5 years into selling as the first day this product made it way into our shop!  Our fundraising goal is 25,000 to market this amazing product. Any contribution helps push us that much closer, so I urge you to stand up, and join this growing movement! Don't miss out on this huge opportunity to make a difference! For more information feel free to contact me Dennis Cortese at 970-388-6117.

Any contribution helps push us that much closer, so I urge you to stand up, and join this growing movement! Don't miss out on this huge opportunity to make a difference! story:
Particulate matter (particles suspended in the atmosphere including gas, smoke and soot, as well as pollen and soil particles) is one of the greatest aspects concerning scientists and communities nowadays, affecting both human health and climate.

Smaller particles are mostly produced by anthropogenic activities. The smaller the particles, the deeper they can penetrate into the respiratory system and the more hazardous they are to breathe. On high pollution days, particles can cause additional hospital admissions and deaths. So, atmospheric conditions should be ensured to provide a healthy and clear environment for everyday activities.

Particles affect also the climate by changing the Earth’s energy balance by scattering and absorbing solar radiation. Their overall effect on climate change is one of the hottest research questions for the scientific community.

 

 

Our dream is beyond just data

Data themselves are just numbers. The scope of Aether is to provide real time information about air quality in synergy with public awareness and care about the air we breathe and the impact on health and climate.

 

 

Aether project

Aether is just the first step of our vision in raising awareness and promoting education on the aspect of human health and climate change actions. Since particles in the atmosphere are tiny they consist an invisible enemy for our health and environment to fight.

Aether is a project aiming to create an air quality database fully accessible and easy to understand by everyone.

Aether is a hybrid system that consists of:

  • 180° panoramic high resolution cameras to monitor the visibility conditions
  • Counters to measure air particles
  • A web-based platform and app to present the information to the public in real time, in an easy and user-friendly way.

 

Aether will be placed in crucial places in the city of Patras:

  • University of Patras, close to Rio-Antirrio bridge along with meteo and solar radiation monitoring stations
  • Port of Patras, along with particle hi-end monitoring station
  • City center, where emissions from transport and households affect everyday life
  • Old town castle, where a panoramic view will provide a full city coverage

Why only at Patras?

Patras is our hometown and will be the first testbed to set up and validate Aether. The expansion of our network in more cities in Greece and abroad is one of our dreams. Building public awareness on air quality importance and taking precautions to ensure crystal clear and unpolluted atmospheric conditions is a goal to achieve everywhere.

 

 

 

 
Science for all

We believe that air quality conditions concern everyone and all data and findings should be presented in a popularized base. Real time images and air quality data will be freely available informing everyone about current atmospheric conditions via air pollution indexes. Additionally, diurnal visibility images, time lapses and videos will be available for free use for anyone interested in 180o panoramic views. 

 

Your help is needed

  • Our dream is big but it can become real thanks to you.
  • Our passion and knowledge on atmospheric science is not enough. Monitoring air quality is an expensive procedure due to the specialized and high accuracy equipment needed.
  • Hard work and time needed to be done is overcomed by the sense of responsibility towards community and our passion on atmospheric sciences and sustainability. 
  • Standalone unfortunately all remain “A Midsummer Night's Dream” depending on your community sense of care to help us equip our project with the necessary hardware and software.

Equipment needed:

  • 3  network cameras (40 Megapixel 180˚ Panoramic IP Camera)
  • Particulate Sensor System for small and large particles
  • Network development 
  • Connectors and hardware
  • Web-based platform and app

 

The Impact

Leave your stamp on the environmental care. The cause of taking action is not about gaining more but giving more to the world and protecting the most vulnerable groups. Getting familiar with Aether images and videos will educate you and provide you with experience to evaluate air quality just with your vision. Being aware of what you breathe can help you protect your favorite people and add new knowledge in climate change studies.

 

FACTS

  • The lower the levels of air pollution, the better the cardiovascular and respiratory health of the population will be.
  • Scientific studies revealed 3 million premature deaths worldwide in 2012 due to air pollution.
  • Children under 5 years old, pregnant and elderly people are most affected groups. Nearly one-third of the 6.6 million under-5 child deaths every year are associated with environment-related causes and conditions. 

However, environmental burden diseases are preventable. 

 

Who we are

story:
Welcome to Crystal Ocean    

My name is JENJEN. I have been a singer/songwriter most of my life, picking up my first guitar, aged 7, encouraged by my wonderful Dad, who designed helicopters, and who now sadly has dementia. I don't normally do covers, but my Dad features on my new album ~ in my cover version of Annie's Song, his and my Mums love song, illuminating their 60+ years together. It is deeply poignant to me in so many ways, that he plays harmonica on this song, and that he remembered every note during recording - such is the power of music to heal and allow us to re-member - a gift we never truly forget..

My music is inspired by the whales and the dolphins who bring depth and meaning to my life, and joy to my heart. My new album, Crystal Ocean, is dedicated to the waters of Mother Earth, and inspired by this fragile life we all share, that is always only a heartbeat away, and by the delicate intricacies that unite us all together, whichever side of the veil we are on. For all of us have known joy, grief, longing and a feeling of oneness with all of life.

The heartfelt songs on the album are born from my passion for all of life, especially the water and water beings, who I feel a strong affinity with. This album aims to ease our challenges and remind us of our Divine nature and our synergistic connection with all of life. These songs called me from the depths of my being, were born from my experience of this beautiful fragile life, and they are for all of you. In Joy. With love, gratitude, grace, blessings and peace. 

This video, along with many others telling the same story, PLASTIC IS KILLING WHALES                  is why we are launching our plastic ocean clean up project. 

 

What is this Campaign for? 

I have created this heartfelt campaign for two reasons. One is to raise money to help complete the production and marketing of my new album, Crystal Ocean.

Weaving triphop, dub, ethnic beats and hang drum, with haunting strings, whalesong, my signature eclectic vocals, and the resonant tones of my beautiful crystal bowls, the album features the amazing talents of New Yorks very own hiphop rap legend Kev Hutch, the extraordinarily talented Maxine Venton (Fat Panthers, Firepit Collective) on strings, Craig R Ninjah on Pantam and Tim Gallagher on baran. 

The album has now been mixed and mastered at Abbey Road Studios in London, and we are in the next stages, the production of professionally mastered CD's and a demo music video.

The second reason for this campaign, is to donate a percentage of the album sales towards setting up a vital environmental project which will implement a simple, yet effective strategy to cleanse the world's ocean, rivers and beaches of plastic pollution, while having a positive impact on local, marginalised people, in tourist areas around the world. This global incentive to reduce plastic pollution, also aims to raise awareness of the urgent need for us all to take responsibility. The ocean clean up project is pioneered by Marco Jackson, film maker and producer of The Truth for the Dash for Cash, which helped to raise awareness of the dangers of fracking. 

Through our ocean clean up campaign, we will not only raise awareness about our detrimental impact on the natural world, but we will create a solution where we can all become pro-active about our footprint, which is vital if we are not only to survive, but to thrive and shine in this beautiful world we all share together. Our ocean clean up project will effect change within some of the most critical issues on our planet, on a global scale. 

We are water. Water is life. All life is sacred.  ❤️

PLEASE BE A PART OF OUR GLOBAL PROJECT & 

DONATE TO OUR OCEAN CLEAN UP CAMPAIGN

 IN EXCHANGE FOR SOME GREAT MUSIC. 

Every little helps this awesome project and our ocean ! THANKYOU! 

​   CRYSTAL OCEAN

 

Several years in the making, the songs for this album have now been mixed and mastered at Abbey Rd studios in London,  but there is still some way to go to release and promote my new album, Crystal Ocean.

The final stage is to turn these 10 tracks into a professional masterpiece, replicate CDs, and birth the album into the world. With your sweet kindness and generosity, we can do this. ❤️

What needs to be done?  

Things that need to be done to complete this musical adventure, release the album, and launch our ocean clean up project are :

Mixing and Mastering - Completed! 

CD production ~ £1300

Professional PR, radio and Digital Marketing campaign ~ £1500

Artwork, Cover Design ~ £500

Demo video production ~ £1000

Funds for making the documentary and a proposal to launch the ocean clean up campaign will be raised through sponsors, backers and album sales...

Challenges 

The album is almost completed, artwork done, CD production is underway, and digital marketers lined up to ensure album sales. With an expert team of visionarys, a motivated film-maker, dynamic fund-raiser and creative entrepreneur,  all exemplary at achieving success in effecting much needed change in the world, we are well on the way to achieving our goal of launching both the album, and the ocean clean up campaign. 

As well as thru your kind donations and album sales, our ocean clean-up proposal will be backed by funders and sponsors, before launching the project to Governments of the world. Our major challenge, and all we really need, is an extra boost of financial help to ensure our project is made visible, highlighted - and fulfilled - through a highly effective marketing strategy - to the most influential people, environmental activists and pro-active eco-warriors in the world.

Together, we can do this ❤️

   My Story & Bio

I have written songs and played round camp fires, on stages and at festivals across the UK,  Europe, Canada and USA for many years. I sang in several bands, including Magnum Force (who went on to become punk legends, the Mob), The O'Roonies (Eat Static spin off), and Snipe, who I co-produced, singing with Peewee Ellis (James Brown band) and touring SW England for several years. Snipe were favorited by John Peel, sought after by 4AD, and quoted as being "the next biggest thing to come out of Bristol after Massive Attack and Portishead," before the band split in 2003. 

I became a DJ in the early 90's, one of few female DJ's of the time. The hedonism of rave culture became a great escape for a very traumatic time in my life. For over two decades, I toured the globe, resident at many top clubs, playing alongside some of the worlds greatest DJ's and MC's, including Grandmaster Flash,  the Freestylers and Scratch Perverts. The glitz and glamour soon wore off however, and my attention turned back to my guitar, to music production, and I began following my passion for sound.

I qualified as a sound engineer in 1998, increasingly fascinated with sound, harmonic frequencies, vibration, and the healing power of quartz crystal singing bowls, of which I am blessed with 14! Learning music production meant I could weave together all the wonderful grooves and sounds I could hear in my head and in the natural world around me, and I began to produce beautiful, funky and etheric soundscapes, which kept me connected to something greater than "this," gave me a sense of well-being, but mostly, kept me attuned to mySelf, my higher nature.  I  learned the art of video production and was never without my video camera, recording weird and wonderful footage to use in my music videos.

Following the tragic loss of my partner in 2009, I travelled the world, hungry for healing. I swam with whales and dolphins, and explored the depths of my soul, as well as exotic corners of the globe. I began to see the degradation in the ocean, and the growing threat to our wonderful planet and her most loyal, magnificent guardians, our whales and dolphins. 

Manifesting some of the world's finest studios to record in, from Mick Fleetwood's in Maui, to Stanley Jordan's in Arizona, using Frank Zappa's U87 mic in LA, mixing and mastering at Real World with TIm Oliver in Bath, it took me 8 years, amidst my grief and wonder, to record and produce my debut album... Finally in 2012, ENTER, my "lament" to my beloved Mark, and to my Divine Self, was born.

Since my first album release, it has been in my bones to return to my trip-hop, dub and breakbeat roots for my next album;  to produce something more upbeat, that would also serve to raise awareness of the plight within the ocean, and critical issues in our world as a whole. An album which combines the grooves and funk of my favourite dance genres, with shamanic, healing sounds from nature, and the myriad of world music I have discovered on my travels.

My music has been compared to Portishead, Thom Yorke, Liz Fraser (Cocteau Twins), Enya, Kate Bush, early Massive Attack, Sandy Denny, Joan Baez, Natasha Atlas, Joni Mitchell, Melanie, and Aphex Twin!​​

How can YOU help? 

To offer our gratitude for helping to support the creation of this album, and the birth of the ocean campaign, I've put together some awesome thankyou gifts. 

Check them out here on the right  --->--->---> 

You can, if you prefer, donate any amount you feel by just pressing "Back It" by the video at the top of the page.. My heartfelt thanks and deep gratitude go out to you if you opt to help in any way ❤️

PLEASE NOTE ~ Due to touring, I will not be able to fulfil UK live performances and gigs until Spring 2018.  All other item 'perks' will be fulfilled by Oct 2017. 

If you are not in a position to, or don't feel you want to donate, but would like to contribute in another way, please help us to get the word out and help this campaign grow, through sharing it with your friends, family and tribe on facebook and email lists, using Indiegogo's share tools, and good old fashioned word of mouth..  

You can join JENJEN's mail list and also stay in the loop of our ocean clean up project by signing up to the mail list HERE 

Thankyou from the bottom of my heart for reading this and for supporting this project, in whichever way your heart may lead you to feel to.

Blessings and peace one and all. Bless the water. Bless the whales  ❤️

One Love  ❤️

PRE-BUY THE ALBUM NOW or  EXCHANGE FOR SOME GREAT MUSIC and GREAT PERKS.

Every little helps this awesome project ! THANKYOU! 

      JENJEN.CO.UK 

I Like what Im hearing ~ John Peel 

"A breath of fresh air.. comparisons to Sandy Denny, Portishead and the Cocteau Twins..but there’s something else, an earthy spirit.. there is something really sublime about this music" ~ John Hole, SomerValley Radio​

"I love your music” ~ Jean Paul Vivini, Mother Gong

"Her music is ahead of its time.. A careful blend of true beauty” ~ Mark Wolffe​

‘You are fearless in the spectrum of what you take on” ~ Keith da Bass, Here and Now

JENJEN ‘strikes without warning, and leaves a mark on the Heart of your Soul’ ~ Pat McCormick​

"Eerily reminiscent of Sandy Denny with songs that just ooze chill out..  perfect for those long hot summer festival days."   ~Acoustic magazine, 2012,​

"Sounds like Sandy Denny.. and praise for an acoustic artist doesn't get much better than that”

~ Somerset Gazette 2011​

"Something a  little fresh and different” ~ Eli Heath

'Very different..I like' ~ For Folks Sake
story_txt:
Welcome to Crystal Ocean    
My name is JENJEN. I have been a singer/songwriter most of my life, picking up my first guitar, aged 7, encouraged by my wonderful Dad, who designed helicopters, and who now sadly has dementia. I don't normally do covers, but my Dad features on my new album ~ in my cover version of Annie's Song, his and my Mums love song, illuminating their 60+ years together. It is deeply poignant to me in so many ways, that he plays harmonica on this song, and that he remembered every note during recording - such is the power of music to heal and allow us to re-member - a gift we never truly forget..

My music is inspired by the whales and the dolphins who bring depth and meaning to my life, and joy to my heart. My new album, Crystal Ocean, is dedicated to the waters of Mother Earth, and inspired by this fragile life we all share, that is always only a heartbeat away, and by the delicate intricacies that unite us all together, whichever side of the veil we are on. For all of us have known joy, grief, longing and a feeling of oneness with all of life.

Through our ocean clean up campaign, we will not only raise awareness about our detrimental impact on the natural world, but we will create a solution where we can all become pro-active about our footprint, which is vital if we are not only to survive, but to thrive and shine in this beautiful world we all share together. Our ocean clean up project will effect change within some of the most critical issues on our planet, on a global scale.

story:
ENGLISH 

(En español después del texto en inglés)

With your support, it will be possible to establish the first step of a pilot project to create a social surveillance network focused on a California sea lion colony located on the Gulf of California. The goal is to create a future internet platform, so people can have access from any device, and to provide knowledge regarding the proper use of natural resources.

         

 

What are the problems or conflicts related to this topic?

Did you know that the colony of California sea lions found in the National Park Espiritu Santo island is one of the most important tourist-economic resources for the inhabitants of La Paz Baja California Sur? This makes it a natural resource of great importance for the world.

                                                                                           

This colony is one of the most visited by tourists because of its easy access. As a result, this place has one of the highest rates of human-sea lion interaction,

          

Propitiating that some providers of tourism service, make recklessness for not having the necessary training for this type of activities, causing disturbances in the behavior of sea lions and risking tourists during the course of the trip. 

                 

Another problem is with sea lions that accidentally become entangled in fishing nets and are not taken care of in time. Have you ever seen a sea lion or other animal injured due to human activities? Is a feeling of impotence that arises when not being able to do anything to avoid or to reverse this situation. 

     

It is becoming impossible for the authorities to patrol the area full time. This initiative seeks to provide a solution to these problems and to allow you the opportunity to help these marine mammals when they are in trouble, as well as helping to promote the sustainable use of the area for both tourists and the sea lions.

 

ABOUT US 

This is an initiative of M.Sc. Ricardo Mirsha Mata-Cruz, Dr. Fernando Elorriaga-Verplancken, and M.Sc. Marcia Valenzuela-Molina from Centro Interdisciplinario de Ciencias Marinas, which belongs to Instituto Politécnico Nacional (CICIMAR-IPN) in La Paz, México, in collaboration with the Biol. Irma González-López from the Natural Protected Area (NPA), denominated as “Marine Area of the Espíritu Santo Archipelago National Park”, from the Comisión Nacional de Áreas Naturales Protegidas (CONANP).

(help us sharing  in the social media)

 

What are the solutions we propose?

In the long run, we are trying to consolidate a social surveillance network using a website and an app for mobile phones that will be used to access videos (e.g. see video below) and images taken in real time by IP cameras (Internet Protocol system for a future internet connection).

                                                

Besides this access to images and videos, people will receive useful information regarding the Natural Protected Area and how they can visit this place, they will also be able to visualize the experiences of others tourists (video below).

                                                

 

What are the steps to follow in order to achieve our goal?

Step one: Prototype network. Installation of IP camera in Los Islotes, a rookery where you can find one of the most important California sea lion colony (See flow chart).

Step two: Creation of a webpage and a mobile app. This will be used as a link to provide interactive and educative information about California sea lions, and additional information about tourist activities that take place in the area.

Step three: Social surveillance network. Society will be able to learn and participate in the conservation of this species, through the use of electronic devices.

     

 

Your support will help us to accomplish

the first step of this project!

 

How your donation will help us?

A surveillance system using an IP camera will be installed in Los Islotes; previously, we will determine the best location to place the devices. This non-invasive technique will promote the beginning of California sea lion surveillance network.

         

The budget presented below belongs to expenses related to the equipment needed to install the IP camera in the study site.

Material

Description

Support requested

(USD)

Solar Power System

Solar cell, aluminum frame, battery, connection accessories.

$1,650.53

IP Camera System

IP camera, NVR (video/images recording system), 2 Tb., connection accessories.

$1,830.24

Aluminum Mount Base

 Structure for mount camera system.

$575.00

Cost for travelling

(La Paz- Los Islotes)

$125 day-trip, per 7 days

 

$875.00

Total:

  

$4,931.00

 

The installation of the surveillance system will allow short-term recording of the following information:

-Natural behavior of sea lions with respect to tide changes, as well as presence and absence of tourists.

       

 

-Entangled (injuries caused by fishing nets) sea lions as well as other accidents that could be related to the tourist interactions. Such data will be recorded and reported to the authorities.

       

 

- The responsible interaction between tourists and sea lions and their environment.

        

*Recordings will be share with the community and authorities periodically in this first step; subsequently, with the project progress we will continue to push forward the second and third step to accomplish real time transmission.

 

What are the benefits in the future?

      


What are the retributions for donors?

*All rewards are in digital format (with excellent quality and design, we choose digital format to benefit the environment) with the logos of the organizations participating in the project. All of them will be sent via email.

 

For 10 dollars:

- Acknowledgements (Once the campaign is over we will post a list of acknowledgements).

 

For 20 dollars:

- Digital recognition certificate (.PDF format).

                                                            

For 50 dollars:

- Certificate + 1 Digital photo of sea lion (.JPG format; 8.3 x 9.8 inches; 710 x 596 pixels).

                                                            

For 75 dollars:

- Certificate + 1 photo (8.3 x 9.8 inches) + 1 digital page bookmark (.PDF format; 4 x 16 inches).

                                                          

For 100 dollars:

- Certificate + 1 photo + 1 digital bookmark + 1 digital postcard (.PDF & .JPG format; 442 x 343 pixels).

                                                   

For 150 dollars:

- Certificate + 1 photo + 1 digital bookmark + 1 postcard + 1 Sea lion poster (.JPG format; 17 x 11 inches; 5100 x 3300 pixels).

                                           

For 250 dollars:

- Certificate + 3 photos (8.3 x 9.8 inches) + 1 digital bookmark + 2 postcards + 1 poster + 1 exclusive sea lion video (.MOV format; 2 mins duration).

                                                       

For 500 dollars:

- Certificate + 3 photos + 1 digital bookmark + 1 postcard + 1 poster + 1 calendar 2017 (.PDF & .JPG format; 1021 x 683 pixels, each image per month).

                                        

 

Other ways to help

Spread our campaign in social networks sharing our link. It would only take you one minute and will help us a lot.

 

Project Main Team

Project initiative: M.Sc. Ricardo Mirsha Mata Cruz and M.Sc. Marcia Valenzuela Molina, both specialized in Management of Marine Resources; Sea lions specialist: Dr. Fernando Elorriaga Verplancken (see photos below); Director of the Natural Protected Area: Biol. Irma González López; Surveillance cameras specialist: Eng. Daniel Soto; Web pages design specialist: Odin Rojas, B.Sc. in Computer System.

                              

                                        M.Sc. Ricardo Mirsha & Dr. Fernando Elorriaga

                                          

                                                          M.Sc. Marcia Valenzuela

Special Acknowledgements

Direction and audiovisual production: Mar. Biol. Leonardo Luna, who is currently developing a Project called “The Color of Memory”, which spreads the history of communities from Baja California Sur, México, through videos and murals that tell the local history (see other of his Work in: www.elcolordelamemoria.com/). Graphic designs of rewards: Carolina Guadalupe Martínez, B.Sc. in Graphic design. 

 

-- EN ESPAÑOL --

 

Gracias al avance de la tecnología, la comunicación mediante dispositivos electrónicos es posible, permitiendo compartir fotos y vídeos de sucesos en tiempo real. Por ello, en este proyecto se busca implementar estas ventajas en beneficio de una especie prioritaria del Golfo de California el lobo marino.

Con tu apoyo será posible establecer la primera etapa del proyecto piloto para crear una red de vigilancia social dirigida a esta especie, el cual consistirá en colocar la primera cámara de grabación en una colonia de lobos marinos ubicada en el Golfo de California con la finalidad de crear en el futuro una plataforma de Internet a la cual la comunidad podrá acceder desde cualquier dispositivo y así fomentar el adecuado aprovechamiento de los recursos naturales.

       

¿Cuáles son los problemas o conflictos relacionados con el tema?

Sabías que la colonia de lobos marinos de California que se encuentra en el parque Nacional de La Isla Espíritu Santo, es uno de los recursos turístico-económicos más importantes para los habitantes de La Paz Baja California Sur, convirtiéndolo en un recurso natural de gran importancia para el mundo.

                            

Esta colonia es una de las más visitadas por grupos turísticos, debido al fácil acceso a la zona y por ende es una de las loberas con una mayor interacción con los humanos.

        

Propiciando que algunos prestadores de servicio turístico, cometan imprudencias por no tener el entrenamiento necesario para este tipo de actividades, ocasionando perturbaciones en el comportamiento de los lobos marinos y arriesgando a los turistas en el transcurso del viaje.

                    

Otro problema son los lobos marinos que se enredan accidentalmente en las redes de pesca. ¿Alguna vez has visto a un lobo marino u otro animal herido debido a descuidos humanos? es una sensación de impotencia que surge al no poder hacer algo para evitar o revertir esto.

          

El monitoreo constante por parte de las autoridades para vigilar el área se ha vuelto difícil. Esta iniciativa busca dar una solución a estas problemáticas y darte la oportunidad de ayudar a estos mamíferos marinos cuando se encuentren en problemas. Además de ayudar a que se use la zona de forma sustentable, para el beneficio de los turistas y del lobo marino.

 

Quiénes somos 

Esta es una iniciativa del M. en C.  Ricardo Mirsha Mata Cruz, el Dr. Fernando Elorriaga Verplancken y la M. en C. Marcia Valenzuela Molina del Centro Interdisciplinario de Ciencias Marinas perteneciente al Instituto Politécnico Nacional (CICIMAR-IPN) en La Paz, B.C.S., en colaboración con la Biol. Irma González López del área natural protegida (ANP) Parque Nacional zona marina del Archipiélago de Espíritu Santo de la Comisión Nacional de Áreas Naturales Protegidas (CONANP).

 

(Compártelo en las redes sociales)

 

¿Cuáles son las soluciones que propone este proyecto?

Lo que se busca lograr a largo plazo es consolidar una red de vigilancia social a través de una plataforma en Internet, basado en una página web y una aplicación (app) para teléfonos móviles, en donde se pueda acceder a vídeos (Ejemplo de vídeo abajo) e imágenes en tiempo real captadas por cámaras IP (cámaras con Protocolo de Internet, para que se puedan conectar a la red en el futuro). 

                                                 
Además de poder acceder a las imágenes y vídeos, las personas podrán obtener información útil del área natural protegida y de cómo poder visitar el lugar, así como de visualizar y conocer experiencias de otras personas (vídeo abajo).
                                                
 

¿Cuáles son los pasos a seguir para lograr el objetivo del proyecto?

Primera etapa: red prototipo. Instalación de una cámara IP en Los Islotes, lugar donde se encuentra una de las colonias más importantes de lobo marino (ver el diagrama de flujo).

Segunda etapa: creación de una página web y una app móvil. Servirá como un enlace para brindar información interactiva y educativa a las personas e información adicional sobre las actividades turísticas que se lleven a cabo en la zona.  

Tercera etapa: red de vigilancia social. Donde la comunidad podrá aprender y participar en la conservación de esta especie, mediante el uso de dispositivos electrónicos.  

         

 

¡Con tu apoyo lograremos llevar a cabo

la primera etapa de este proyecto!

 

¿Cómo tu donación nos ayudará?

Se colocará un sistema de vigilancia utilizando una cámara IP en Los Islotes; previamente, se determinará cual es la mejor ubicación para instalar los dispositivos. Ésta técnica no invasiva impulsará el comienzo de la Red de vigilancia del lobo marino de California.

         

El presupuesto que se muestra a continuación corresponde a los gastos necesarios para adquirir el equipo de instalación de la cámara IP en el área de estudio.

Material

Descripción

Apoyo solicitado

(USD)

Sistema de panel solar

Panel solar, estructura de aluminio, batería, y accesorios de conexión. 

$1,650.53

Sistema de cámara IP

Cámara IP, NVR (sistema de grabación de video e imágenes), 2Tb, accesorios de conexión.

$1,830.24

Base de aluminio

Base para montar la cámara en Los Islotes

$1,450.00

Costos de viaje, para transportar material

(La Paz-Los Islotes)

$125 viaje por día,

por 7 días

$875.00

Total:

  

$4,931.00

 

La instalación del sistema de vigilancia permitirá registrar * a corto plazo la siguiente información:

- Comportamiento natural de los lobos marinos con respecto al cambio de las mareas, así como en presencia y ausencia de turistas.

         

- Lobos marinos que se encuentren en peligro por enmalle con redes de pesca u otros accidentes que se llegarán a presentar relacionados con la interacción turística. Dichos datos serán registrados y reportados a las autoridades.

        

-Interacción responsable de los turistas con los lobos marinos y su hábitat.

         

*Los registros de grabación serán compartidos de manera periódica con la comunidad y  las autoridades en esta primera etapa; posteriormente, con los avances de este proyecto continuaremos impulsando la segunda y tercera etapa para lograr una transmisión en tiempo real.

¿Cuáles son los beneficios en el futuro?

      

¿Cuáles son las retribuciones para los donadores?

*Todas las recompensas son en formato digital (excelente formato y diseño, en beneficio del medio ambiente) con los logos de las organizaciones que participan en el proyecto y se enviarán por correo electrónico.

Por 10 dólares:

- Agradecimientos (lista de agradecimientos en las publicaciones que se deriven del proyecto una vez que termine la campaña).

 

Por 20 dólares:

- Certificado digital de reconocimiento (formato .PDF).

                                                          

Por 50 dolares:

- Certificado + 1 Foto digital de lobo marino (formato JPG; 21 x 25 cm; 710 x 596 pixels).

                                                         

Por 75 dolares

- Certificado + 1 foto (21 x 25 cm) + 1 separador de libros digital (formato .PDF; 4 x 16cm).

                                                      

Por 100 dolares

- Certificado + 1 foto + 1 separador de libro digital + 1 postal digital (formato .PDF y .JPG; 442 x 343 píxeles).

                                                 

Por 150 dolares

- Certificado + 1 foto + 1 separador de libros digital + 1 postal + 1 poster de lobo marino (formato .JPG; 43.2 x 27.9 cm; 5100 x 3300 pixels).

                                         

Por 250 dolares

- Certificado + 3 fotos (21 x 25 cm) + 1 separador de libros digital + 2 postales + 1 poster (43.2 x 27.9 cm) + 1 vídeo exclusivo de los lobos marinos (formato .MOV; 2 min. de duración).

                                                        

Por 500 dolares

- Certificado + 3 foto + 1 separador de libros digital + 1 postal + 1 poster + 1 calendario 2017 (formato .PDF y .JPG; 1021 x 683 píxeles, de cada imagen por mes.  

                                         

 

Otra forma de ayuda

Difunde nuestra campaña en las redes sociales compartiendo el enlace, te toma menos de 1 minuto y nos ayudas mucho.

 

Grupo principal del proyecto

Idea del proyecto: M. en C. Ricardo Mirsha Mata Cruz y M. en C. Marcia Valenzuela Molina, Ambos con Maestría en manejo de recursos marinos; Especialista en lobos marinos: Dr. Fernando Elorriaga Verplancken; Directora del Área Natural Protegida: Biol. Irma González López; Especialista en cámaras de vigilancia: Ing. Daniel Soto; Especialista en creación de páginas web: Lic. en sistemas computacionales Odin Rojas.

                      

                                    M. en C. Ricardo Mirsha y Dr. Fernando Elorriaga

                                          

                                                          M. en C. Marcia Valenzuela

Agradecimientos especiales

Dirección y producción audiovisual: Biol. Mar. Leonardo Luna, quien actualmente se encuentra desarrollando un proyecto llamado “El Color de la Memoria” que se enfoca en hacer difusión de la historia de las comunidades de Baja California Sur, México, a través de vídeos y murales que cuentan la historia local (ver otros de sus trabajos en: www.elcolordelamemoria.com/). Diseño gráfico de las recompensas: Lic. en diseño gráfico Carolina Guadalupe Martínez.
story_txt:
ENGLISH (En español después del texto en inglés)With your support, it will be possible to establish the first step of a pilot project to create a social surveillance network focused on a California sea lion colony located on the Gulf of California. The goal is to create a future internet platform, so people can have access from any device, and to provide knowledge regarding the proper use of natural resources.          What are the problems or conflicts related to this topic?Did you know that the colony of California sea lions found in the National Park Espiritu Santo island is one of the most important tourist-economic resources for the inhabitants of La Paz Baja California Sur? This makes it a natural resource of great importance for the world.                                                                                           This colony is one of the most visited by tourists because of its easy access. As a result, this place has one of the highest rates of human-sea lion interaction,          Propitiating that some providers of tourism service, make recklessness for not having the necessary training for this type of activities, causing disturbances in the behavior of sea lions and risking tourists during the course of the trip.                  Another problem is with sea lions that accidentally become entangled in fishing nets and are not taken care of in time. Have you ever seen a sea lion or other animal injured due to human activities? Is a feeling of impotence that arises when not being able to do anything to avoid or to reverse this situation.      It is becoming impossible for the authorities to patrol the area full time. This initiative seeks to provide a solution to these problems and to allow you the opportunity to help these marine mammals when they are in trouble, as well as helping to promote the sustainable use of the area for both tourists and the sea lions. ABOUT US This is an initiative of M.Sc. Ricardo Mirsha Mata-Cruz, Dr. Fernando Elorriaga-Verplancken, and M.Sc. Marcia Valenzuela-Molina from Centro Interdisciplinario de Ciencias Marinas, which belongs to Instituto Politécnico Nacional (CICIMAR-IPN) in La Paz, México, in collaboration with the Biol. Irma González-López from the Natural Protected Area (NPA), denominated as “Marine Area of the Espíritu Santo Archipelago National Park”, from the Comisión Nacional de Áreas Naturales Protegidas (CONANP).(help us sharing  in the social media) 
What are the solutions we propose?In the long run, we are trying to consolidate a social surveillance network using a website and an app for mobile phones that will be used to access videos (e.g. see video below) and images taken in real time by IP cameras (Internet Protocol system for a future internet connection).                                                
Besides this access to images and videos, people will receive useful information regarding the Natural Protected Area and how they can visit this place, they will also be able to visualize the experiences of others tourists (video below).                                                
 What are the steps to follow in order to achieve our goal?Step one: Prototype network. Installation of IP camera in Los Islotes, a rookery where you can find one of the most important California sea lion colony (See flow chart).Step two: Creation of a webpage and a mobile app. This will be used as a link to provide interactive and educative information about California sea lions, and additional information about tourist activities that take place in the area.Step three: Social surveillance network. Society will be able to learn and participate in the conservation of this species, through the use of electronic devices.      Your support will help us to accomplish 
the first step of this project!
 How your donation will help us?A surveillance system using an IP camera will be installed in Los Islotes; previously, we will determine the best location to place the devices. This non-invasive technique will promote the beginning of California sea lion surveillance network.         The budget presented below belongs to expenses related to the equipment needed to install the IP camera in the study site.

Material
Description

Support requested
(USD)



Solar Power System
Solar cell, aluminum frame, battery, connection accessories.
$1,650.53


IP Camera System
IP camera, NVR (video/images recording system), 2 Tb., connection accessories.
$1,830.24


Aluminum Mount Base
 Structure for mount camera system.
$575.00



Cost for travelling
(La Paz- Los Islotes)


$125 day-trip, per 7 days
 

$875.00


Total:
 
$4,931.00

 The installation of the surveillance system will allow short-term recording of the following information:-Natural behavior of sea lions with respect to tide changes, as well as presence and absence of tourists.        -Entangled (injuries caused by fishing nets) sea lions as well as other accidents that could be related to the tourist interactions. Such data will be recorded and reported to the authorities.        - The responsible interaction between tourists and sea lions and their environment.        *Recordings will be share with the community and authorities periodically in this first step; subsequently, with the project progress we will continue to push forward the second and third step to accomplish real time transmission. What are the benefits in the future?      
What are the retributions for donors?
*All rewards are in digital format (with excellent quality and design, we choose digital format to benefit the environment) with the logos of the organizations participating in the project. All of them will be sent via email. For 10 dollars:- Acknowledgements (Once the campaign is over we will post a list of acknowledgements). For 20 dollars:- Digital recognition certificate (.PDF format).                                                            For 50 dollars:- Certificate + 1 Digital photo of sea lion (.JPG format; 8.3 x 9.8 inches; 710 x 596 pixels).                                                            For 75 dollars:- Certificate + 1 photo (8.3 x 9.8 inches) + 1 digital page bookmark (.PDF format; 4 x 16 inches).                                                          For 100 dollars:- Certificate + 1 photo + 1 digital bookmark + 1 digital postcard (.PDF & .JPG format; 442 x 343 pixels).                                                   For 150 dollars:- Certificate + 1 photo + 1 digital bookmark + 1 postcard + 1 Sea lion poster (.JPG format; 17 x 11 inches; 5100 x 3300 pixels).                                           For 250 dollars:- Certificate + 3 photos (8.3 x 9.8 inches) + 1 digital bookmark + 2 postcards + 1 poster + 1 exclusive sea lion video (.MOV format; 2 mins duration).                                                       For 500 dollars:- Certificate + 3 photos + 1 digital bookmark + 1 postcard + 1 poster + 1 calendar 2017 (.PDF & .JPG format; 1021 x 683 pixels, each image per month).                                         Other ways to helpSpread our campaign in social networks sharing our link. It would only take you one minute and will help us a lot. Project Main TeamProject initiative: M.Sc. Ricardo Mirsha Mata Cruz and M.Sc. Marcia Valenzuela Molina, both specialized in Management of Marine Resources; Sea lions specialist: Dr. Fernando Elorriaga Verplancken (see photos below); Director of the Natural Protected Area: Biol. Irma González López; Surveillance cameras specialist: Eng. Daniel Soto; Web pages design specialist: Odin Rojas, B.Sc. in Computer System.                                                                      M.Sc. Ricardo Mirsha & Dr. Fernando Elorriaga                                                                                                    M.Sc.
