2 min. de duración).                                                        Por 500 dolares- Certificado + 3 foto + 1 separador de libros digital + 1 postal + 1 poster + 1 calendario 2017 (formato .PDF y .JPG; 1021 x 683 píxeles, de cada imagen por mes.                                            Otra forma de ayudaDifunde nuestra campaña en las redes sociales compartiendo el enlace, te toma menos de 1 minuto y nos ayudas mucho. Grupo principal del proyecto Idea del proyecto: M. en C. Ricardo Mirsha Mata Cruz y M. en C. Marcia Valenzuela Molina, Ambos con Maestría en manejo de recursos marinos; Especialista en lobos marinos: Dr. Fernando Elorriaga Verplancken; Directora del Área Natural Protegida: Biol. Irma González López; Especialista en cámaras de vigilancia: Ing. Daniel Soto; Especialista en creación de páginas web: Lic. en sistemas computacionales Odin Rojas.                                                          M. en C. Ricardo Mirsha y Dr. Fernando Elorriaga                                                                                                    M. en C. Marcia ValenzuelaAgradecimientos especialesDirección y producción audiovisual: Biol. Mar. Leonardo Luna, quien actualmente se encuentra desarrollando un proyecto llamado “El Color de la Memoria” que se enfoca en hacer difusión de la historia de las comunidades de Baja California Sur, México, a través de vídeos y murales que cuentan la historia local (ver otros de sus trabajos en: www.elcolordelamemoria.com/). Diseño gráfico de las recompensas: Lic. en diseño gráfico Carolina Guadalupe Martínez.
campaign_city: La Paz, Baja California Sur, Mexico

story:
UPDATE: Our campaign has ended but seeds and kits are still available on our website!  Click here to purchase a seed kit and start your medicine garden this season!!!

 

Medicinal Garden Seed Kit

A beautifully packaged kit containing 24 seed packets of commonly used medicinal herbs for you to start or expand your herb garden. This is a great way for herbalists and gardeners to take their relationship with plants to another level. The kit also makes a one of a kind gift for that plant lover in your life!  Kits will be mailed out during the first two weeks of April.

Included seed packets:

 

The Pretreated Seed Set

The seeds of many cold hardy plants need be in a cold/moist environment for 1-3 months to simulate the natural conditions of winter before they will break dormancy and germinate.   The Pretreated Seed Set contains seed that has already received this special treatment and will be ready to plant.   We know by experience that it is hard to plan ahead to pretreat seed in time to plant in the spring.  That is why we are doing some of the work for you!  

The seed in this set needs to be refrigerated until planting and cannot be mailed due to fluctuating temperatures during shipment.  The set will be available for pick up during the week of 4/3 at the following locations:  Grian Herbs in Montpelier, Railyard Apothecary in Burlington, Buffalo Mountain Coop in Hardwick and Willow Crossing Healing Arts & Botanicals in Jeffersonville.  You can choose your pick up location during checkout and a voucher and details will be emailed to you later.

Included Seed Packets:

Angelica, Black Cohosh, Russian Rhodiola, Tibetian Gentian, & Goldenseal

 

About Milkweed Medicinals

Milkweed Medicinals is owned and run by Jessica Manchester and is going into it's third year of operation.   For the first two seasons Jessica focused on live plant sales and learning how to harvest and clean seed crops.  This past summer she was honored to be able to work collaboratively with Melanie and Jeff Carpenter of Zack Woods Herb Farm to grow and harvest seed from their certified organic farm. 

Milkweed Medicinals' main mission is to form more collaborations with local herb growers in order to secure stock seed from the best genetics of their crops.  With our challenging weather patterns and changing climate here in the Northeast, it is going to be essential that we start using locally sourced and acclimated seed for cultivation.  

         

Our goal is to ensure healthy and well adapted plants in the future.  To this end, we will be  working closely with growers who experience significant crop loss due to weather, disease, or pests.   The seed from the surviving plants contain the strongest genetics for growing successfully in our region.  Saving seed from crops with exceptional potency and vigor will also be a focus because the best medicine starts with the seed.  This process was an important aspect of farming that has gone by the wayside due to the economic and time pressures that modern farmers experience.  We would love to help close that loop and assist local medicinal farmers in gaining control of their seed quality and supply.

         

We will be continuing this process with Kingsbury Market Garden in  Warren, VT and Zack Woods Farm in Hyde Park, VT.   Both farms will be using our seed for many of their crops this coming season and allowing us to harvest high quality seed from their farms.

Seeds are magical.  They literally hold the genetic material of our future.  To be able to hold that in your hand is quite empowering!

story:
Planet Healers is a non-profit that started in 2004. Over the last two years we have been researching carbon sequestration as a method of funding our ecological restoration projects in tropical areas. To begin, we have purchased 100 acres of highly impacted ranchland to set aside in a reserve and plan to restore tropical forest on that land. We are selling carbon credits to fund this and future habitat restoration projects. The more funds we raise the more area that we can plant!

 

We are in the Yucatan, which has the second largest tropical forest after the amazon. Mexico is also one of the top 5 countries for biodiversity. Here many areas of forest have been cleared and degraded for agriculture, wood and tourism.

 

In his nursery in Canada, Paul grew hundreds of thousands of native plants every year. For the last year and a half he has been learning how to grow tropical trees since his nursery in Canada grew temperate trees there is much to learn but his skills are easily transferable.

 

Tropical trees grow fast, much faster than in Canada.  On average each tropical tree will sequester 50 pounds of carbon a year.

 

In January, we will begin growing the trees needed to plant when the rains return in June.

 

The funds will be used to:

  • Purchase land to ensure that the restored habitat will be conserved in perpetuity,
  • Create a nursery to grow the plants for our projects: shade cloth, posts, irrigation, pots, coconut fiber, seed collection and processing equipment,
  • Grow and buy a diversity of native tropical trees,
  • Give local people a fair wage to plant the trees and manage the land,
  • Train local people to grow their own trees and do habitat restoration,
  • Help other groups get funding for their projects.

 

We are just starting out and need your support to get things rolling. We plan to be able to restore hundreds of acres of tropical forest each year as our project gets rolling.

 

The funds we raise will be used to help create a native tropical tree nursery for our project

 

Please help us to do this good work. By restoring degraded land we are increasing biodiversity, combating climate change, restoring the water cycle and helping to alleviating poverty.

 

We have destroyed so much of this planet. It’s time to give something back. Thank you.

 

The Impact

There are many reasons why we are doing this:

1st: Many Creatures are Declining and need our help!

"Habitat destruction and degradation are the leading threats"

Species loss worldwide is extremely high, not only that but the loss of genetic diversity within the remaining populations of creatures is also declining rapidly.

On the picture to the right you can see that large numbers of species in the world that are threatened. Recently World Wildlife Fund announced that we are on track to lose 2/3 of all wild species.

Amphibians are highly susceptible to environmental change and are declining rapidly worldwide. They are our canary in the coal mine! Will we listen?

Mammals -One in two mammal species on Earth are in decline and at least one in four are at risk of disappearing forever. Think about all the large mammals and predator species and what it would be like to not have any of them for our grandchildren.

Many birds are in decline, as they have to pass through large areas without habitat. Song birds being one of the ones hit hardest with their long migrations through areas deforested and converted to agriculture, cities and mining.

Pollinators (Bees, Butterflies…) are also in decline worldwide. In the past the native bees did the work of pollinating for us for free but with the size of farms increasing and the removal of all windrows there are not enough pollinators left to pollinate out crops. So we use the European Honeybee to do the job for us now. However they are in decline as well and are suffering what is called colony collapse disorder, some years losing half the colonies! Think for a minute about all the food you eat and how many of those fruits and vegetables you would not be able to eat without pollination.

2nd Global Warming.

Global warming will be a strong driver of global species loss as well and we are already seeing those losses. What has happened to the Great Barrier Reef in Australia is a tragedy that will not recover in our lifetimes. The loss of coral is happening all over the world and it is a direct result of warming oceans and the acidification of the oceans from carbon dioxide. There is no place in this world that will not be changed by global warming and I’m glad that people are finally standing up to do something about it.

The world desperately needs this and we are responding to that need.

Paul Morris, an expert in the fields of ecology, botany, ecosystem restoration and gardening with native plants, is an engaging speaker who has presented at a wide variety of venues, including the Royal Botanical Gardens, Society for Ecological Restoration and the Natural Habitat Conference. His depth of knowledge of native plants is inspiring and practical.

 

Paul spent time with his father and grandfather landscape painting in his youth, these times fostered a passion for the outdoors and natural history. Later he completed his undergraduate degree at Waterloo University in biology and then went on to complete his Masters at Acadia University in Nova Scotia. He was the owner of Acorus Restoration Native Plant Nursery for twenty years. Giving him extensive experience in wetland, forest and prairie restoration ecology and conservation biology making him a leader in the design and planting of restoration areas. Environment Canada also asked him to co-author a manual on prairie and meadow restoration. He restored sections of his 95-acre farm and has completed numerous projects across Ontario, including Eco-parks, wastewater and storm water ponds, and naturalization for private homeowners.

 

Please see my LinkedIn profile for more detailed information and support from my friends.

 

Sophia Ortiz graduated in Agricultural Sciences from the University of Veracruz, Mexico. From an early age, she lived in a rural village surrounded by mountains in one of the areas of greatest species diversity, cloud forest. Her family owned a farm, which allowed extensive interaction and knowledge of various farm animals as well as crops and medicinal plants. Her high sensitivity in the arts, found an inexhaustible source of inspiration in nature. Upon completion of his studies in agronomy, specializing in ornamental horticulture, she spent time in nature looking at alternatives to the growing demand in floriculture and her interest in research allowed her to specialize in the field of ​​biotechnology and plant micropropagation. After graduating, she was hired by a company that exported  ornamentals, which developed her skills to supervise, direct, and coordinate greenhouses, field areas and personnel. Following this, she created the concept of Green Point Applied Plant Biotechnology, a company dedicated to the development of technologies for micropropagation systems. At that time, she collaborated to direct the tissue culture lab and the area of ​​ecology for one company over 10 years. She developed all the research and protocols for rescue, propagation and management of wild species found. After that she decided to integrate Green Point area landscaping, vertical ecosystems and environmental technologies. This allowed her to simultaneously develop consultation and training in the biotechnology area and create artwork with vertical ecosystems.

What We Need & What You Get

Our target goal is $50,000 but if we get less money we will still be receiving the money so any donation is appreciated.

All money raised will be used to grow and buy the trees and plant the trees in the rainy season in June. Restoring as much habitat as we can is our primary goal.

Any money left over after planting will be used to:

  • Improve the tree nursery,
  • Improve our webpage,
  • Do outreach into the local Mayan villages,
  • Teach the Mayan villagers how to grow their own trees, do habitat restoration and the value of doing habitat restoration work,
  • Help other local groups get funding for their projects,
  • Purchase more land as eco-reserve.

If we get a lot of extra funding we can hire a local person for community outreach.

Your Donations:

Feel free to donate at different levels to get the correct level of carbon offsets for yourself! All Donors will be highlighted on our website's Donation page (PlanetHealers.org)

$1.00 Grow a Tree: With our gratitude one tropical tree will be grown in your name. You will be helping us grow the tropical trees needed for the habitat restoration projects.  We will be adding of your email to our mailing list so you can see how everything is growing!

 

$10.00 1 Tonne of Carbon

Thank you! We will be planting enough tropical forest to offset One Tonne of Carbon and we will send you a certificate to confirm your Carbon offset. In addition we will add your name to our email list and keep you informed about how our forests are growing. That’s enough habitat for a Melipona bee colony

 

$20.00 2 Tonnes of Carbon

Oh Joy! We will be planting enough tropical forest to offset One Tonne of Carbon and we will send you a certificate to confirm your Carbon offset. In addition we will add your name to our email list and keep you informed about how our forests are growing. That’s enough habitat for a tropical frog

 

$30.00 3 Tonnes of Carbon

Much Gratitude! We will be planting enough tropical forest to offset One Tonne of Carbon and we will send you a certificate to confirm your Carbon offset. In addition we will add your name to our email list and keep you informed about how our forests are growing. That’s enough habitat for a Tuza.

 

$50.00 5 Tonnes of Carbon

Excellent! We will be planting enough tropical forest to offset Five Tonnes of Carbon and we will send you a certificate to confirm your Carbon offset. In addition we will add your name to our email list and keep you informed about how our forests are growing. That’s enough habitat for a Ocelado Turkey

 

$180.00 Offset your Household Carbon for a Year!

Excellent! We will be planting enough tropical forest to offset Five Tonnes of Carbon and we will send you a certificate to confirm your Carbon offset. In addition we will add your name to our email list and keep you informed about how our forests are growing. That’s enough habitat for a Peccary

 

$15000.00 Offset a Lifetimes Carbon.

Hats off to you with a flourish and a bow! We will be planting enough tropical forest to offset a Lifetimes Carbon and we will send you a certificate to confirm your Carbon offset. We will also be sending you one of our coveted T-Shirts that says “From the Good in Me, For the Good of All” “I am a Planet Healer!”. In addition we will add your name to our email list and keep you informed about how our forests are growing. That’s enough habitat for a Toh, a beautiful Mayan bird!

Example T-Shirt...we are still designing it...

Average Carbon Usage Examples

Hybrid / Green Car                 2.7 Metric Tonnes / year

Campact / Midsized                 3.63 MT / year

Luxury / Full Sized                5.44 MT / Year

SUV / Truck                           9.07 MT / Year

 

Apartment     <1000 ft2       4.99 MT / Year

Small House <1500 ft2      7.48 MT / Year

Medium House <2500       12.47 MT / Year

Large House <4000 ft2      20.00 MT / Year

 

Flight – 20,000 miles          3.79 MT / Year

Flight to 100,000                  18.94 MT / Year

You can also calculate your own carbon footprint and select the Tonnes of Carbon you need to offset it. We used the average household numbers for Northern America.

Link to a list of carbon footprint calculators you can try! http://www.mnn.com/earth-matters/climate-weathe...

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks that we face include:

Living in a remote area items are difficult to find sometimes. Language, local customs, working with local governments in the villages can be an issue. Sophia is Mexican so she is able to navigate our way through though.

We currently have only a generator and rely on our windmill for water. It would be great to have some solar panels! So we have run into times where we are low on water and have to do minimal watering.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign as wildly as possible with your friend and family!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Anyone who has a keen interest can volunteer to help us at Earth Connection Center. Planet Healers is one of our projects. Planet Healers funds are collected and administered separately from the Center. If anyone wants to fund the center as well that would be outstanding!

Items Needed (some of which are shared with Earth Connection):

Solar Panels, batteries, charger and invertor

Roof and floor for the volunteer residence dinning area

Kitchen for the volunteer residence

Shade cloth, poles, pots, irrigation system for the nursery

Seed collection and processing equipment for the nursery

Potting station

Beds and hammocks for volunteers

Better composting toilet

Workshop

Lecture Hall

You can talk to us one on one if you want to go the extra mile!

Flight – 20,000 miles          3.79 MT / Year
Flight to 100,000                  18.94 MT / Year
You can also calculate your own carbon footprint and select the Tonnes of Carbon you need to offset it. We used the average household numbers for Northern America.
Link to a list of carbon footprint calculators you can try! http://www.mnn.com/earth-matters/climate-weathe...
Risks & Challenges
Some of the risks that we face include:
Living in a remote area items are difficult to find sometimes. Language, local customs, working with local governments in the villages can be an issue. Sophia is Mexican so she is able to navigate our way through though.
We currently have only a generator and rely on our windmill for water. It would be great to have some solar panels! So we have run into times where we are low on water and have to do minimal watering.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share our campaign as wildly as possible with your friend and family!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
Anyone who has a keen interest can volunteer to help us at Earth Connection Center. Planet Healers is one of our projects. Planet Healers funds are collected and administered separately from the Center. If anyone wants to fund the center as well that would be outstanding!
Items Needed (some of which are shared with Earth Connection):
Solar Panels, batteries, charger and invertor
Roof and floor for the volunteer residence dinning area
Kitchen for the volunteer residence
Shade cloth, poles, pots, irrigation system for the nursery
Seed collection and processing equipment for the nursery
Potting station
Beds and hammocks for volunteers
Better composting toilet
Workshop
Lecture Hall
You can talk to us one on one if you want to go the extra mile!

story:
Switching to a sustainable method of shipping allows us to more fully impact the chocolate making industry and forges a path for other like-minded businesses to choose sail cargo. Standard-use container ships are incredibly polluting, with heavy oil emissions that are toxic to air and water.

This shipment will also help us make delicious chocolate sourced from the Sierra Nevada region of Colombia, a unique mountain coastal region with a genetic variety of cacao considered the most sought-after in the world.  

We are seeking your support to help with the high cost to dock, offload cargo, and comply with US Customs regulations for this first shipment of cacao. Since we are part of only three first importers on this voyage, the price tag of pioneering this trip is high. BUT, if this works, and it will work... more small businesses like us will be willing to join in and import their products using sustainable trade. Having more importers on board (literally) with products on the boat, will spread the compliance costs and make financial sense as a viable emission-free alternative to conventional trade.  Shipping via sail cargo is not more expensive than conventional shipping, but the US import and Customs costs are oriented towards larger/container-ship operations.

 

What We Need

The price tag for cargo docking in the US is the highest in the world. We have worked very hard, contacted ports all up and down the East Coast and were able to find one that is the most economical and also excited about accepting our vessel.  Money raised during this campaign will be used to:

  • Pay fees at Morehead City Port NC. (dockage, security, wharfage): $1300
  • Stevedores: $1500
  • Shipping Agent & Bond: $2300
  • Tugs: $1600
  • Customs and Border Fees: $1300
  • ACE Provider: $500
  • Customs Broker: $800
  • Port to Factory Transportation: $400
  • Stretch Goal: Provide $3000 in grant funding to restore the Brigantes sail vessel, thereby expanding capacity for future eco-friendly trade routes for cacao and other native products.

River-Sea Chocolates needs your help! Support our campaign for the first US sustainable trade voyage, and we will provide you with a delicious reward. In exchange for contributions made to our campaign, we are offering a range of perks that will appeal to all chocolate lovers. Our campaign rewards include our handcrafted chocolate bars, private chocolate-making parties, a year of chocolate, or a custom chocolate line designed for you, your business, or to celebrate a loved one at a party or event.

 

Our Story

Owners Krissee and Mariano began their chocolate journey with their three kids when visiting family in Brazil. The kids (& Mariano) climbed a cacao tree in their cousin’s backyard, picked some cacao fruit and asked how to make chocolate. Through a process of experimentation and discovery, the entire family soon fell in love with the art and science of chocolate making, they even met a sloth along the way! 

Krissee and Mariano began exploring the possibility of creating an environmentally friendly product that could benefit farmers and their communities in developing countries. They decided to devote their future to it, and quickly distinguished River-Sea Chocolates from other bean-to-bar makers with a less refined taste, emphasizing the rustic aspects of cacao that through roasting and manual production methods convey layers of deep complexity.

After two years in business, River-Sea Chocolates is now seeking your support to enter our next phase of growth and increase the environmental sustainability of our supply chain by bringing our inaugural shipment of Colombian cacao beans via wind powered cargo ship! 

 

We are incredibly proud to be forging a path for businesses like ours to begin using more sustainable trade and shipping methods. Sail transport reduces carbon emissions by 99% over conventional cargo transport, while providing a more nimble and efficient sustainable solution for trade. With this project we hope to demonstrate sail transport as a viable emission-free option for the small business import/export sector. 

 

The Chocolate

These cacao beans are sourced from the Sierra Nevada region of Colombia, a unique coastal mountain range where snow-capped mountains overlook the Caribbean sea. The farms encompass a region known for the most sought-after variety of cacao; Criollo, which is characterized by low bitterness and heavy floral tasting notes. The beans are grown by indigenous farmers working in partnership with an international project established to eliminate cocaine trafficking. 

River-Sea owners Krissee and Mariano just returned from visiting Santa Marta Colombia where they were able to meet with the people who are making this emission-free cacao possible: local indigenous farmers, trade facilitators, suppliers, some of the sail ship crew and the ship captain, Remi Lavergne. 

 

 

Now we are seeking your support to bring our first 2,000lb shipment of sustainable supply-chain cacao using the most environmentally sustainable method of transport available. We hope that through our participation we can fund the restoration/construction of more sail vessels, increase sail trade routes and further grow this movement towards sustainable shipping. 

We hope you will join us in supporting our mission and stoking the Fair Transport revolution! Please share this campaign with any friends that share our love for chocolate, sustainability, fair trade, and respect for craft and traditional cultures.

 

The Impact

Currently around 90% of world trade is carried out by cargo ships that pollute oceans and contribute to global carbon emissions. The International Maritime Organization (IMO), estimates that 2.8% of global emissions were released via cargo ships in 2015. To quote the creators of Fair Transport, "if the shipping industry were a country, it would be between Japan and Germany as the seventh largest contributor to global CO2 emissions." The IMO has made a commitment to achieve 30% greater efficiency of maritime vessels by 2025, and reduce global emissions from container ships by 50% by 2050, but that is not soon enough. 

Together River-Sea Chocolates and Tres Hombres Shipping hope to educate and raise awareness about the importance of environmentally sustainable shipping methods, and enter an ongoing partnership that would reduce River-Sea’s cacao-sourcing to a near zero-emissions model. 

The first sail-cargo shipment of beans are on their last leg of the journey, arriving on Mainland US as early as mid-April, depending on the wind. Look for further emails and updates announcing our progress.

 

About Tres Hombres and Fair Transport:

Tres Hombres Shipping is the first modern day cargo ship with a 99% reduction in its carbon dioxide emissions. The company was founded with the mission to become the world’s first modern “emission free” shipping company. The ship Tres Hombres has been sailing since 2009, maintaining trade routes between Europe, islands in the Atlantic, the Caribbean, and South America. More information can be found on their website: https://www.treshombres.eu/

 

 

About River-Sea Chocolates:

River-Sea Chocolates creates delicious artisan chocolate using premium quality cacao sourced from small-scale sustainable farms around the world. Their chocolate contains less sugar that most other bar chocolates, and no soy, emulsifiers, or flavorings. River-Sea has a commitment to supporting developing communities through mutual partnerships and direct trade practices, creating products that bring communities revenue while maintaining healthy ecosystems, and also taste incredible. They have  dedicated their business to sustainability, from repurposing and building their own specialty equipment, to educating their community on the social and environmental benefits of their direct trade practices. More information on River-Sea Chocolates can be found here: https://www.riverseachocolates.com/

 

What People Write About Us

Chocolate Critic and Chocolate Blogger reviews of our chocolate:

  • C-Spot Review score 9.01  River-Sea, river-do...Understanding -- whether intellectually &/or intuitively &/or instagrammarly -- this barsmith does produce. 7/16/2019
  • C-Spot Review score 8.69 : Exemplar: River-Sea Chocolates. Off the beaten path yet well on their way. 1/29/2019
  • TimeCupSoul: River-Sea Chocolates: Local Vendor Provides Delicious Chocolate Escape  7/5/2019
  • Time To Eat Chocolate: River-Sea Chocolates 8/19/2018

Articles about our business:

  • Northern Virginia Magazine - If you're going to buy sweets for Valentine's Day, try Chantilly's River-Sea Chocolates 2/13/2019
  • Adventure Moms DC - Swimming in Chocolate at River-Sea Chocolate Factory 3/4/2019
  • Jennifer the Beholder - Guest Krissee D'Aguiar River-Sea Chocolates 7/20/2018

Articles about our Sustainable shipping project:

  • El Informador: Santa Marta is the Pioneer in Sustainable Export (in Spanish)  "In the facilities of the Port of Santa Marta, the Dutch-flagged sailboat Tres Hombres yesterday loaded 14 ton of cocoa and six of coffee harvested in the Sierra Nevada, products destined for the United States and Europe. With the operation, the capital of Magdalena is consolidated as the first city in the country that exports in a friendly way with the environment, at least during the modern era." 3/13/2019
  • Nice article on the scientific platform N+1: Colombia will export cacao and coffee using a CO2-free ship. (in Spanish) 3/4/2019

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word to anyone in your community that might connect with our mission to provide delicious, artisan, and environmentally and ethically sourced chocolate. Or to anyone you think might love our chocolate bars! We are so grateful to everything you have done to support our business, and look forward to making you only the very best chocolate in exchange.

Please share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram.

story:
Cliquez ici pour la version française...

ECO (Étudiants et Étudiantes Contre les Oléoducs) is a coalition of Quebec student associations with a single goal: stop the Energy East pipeline. Like any good student, when our scientists speak with one voice, we listen to them. Climate change is real, and it threatens our survival.

The United Nations, the nobel-prize-winning Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and 97% of climate scientists agree: we have a carbon budget. If we build Energy East, or any other mega-pipelines which service the tar sands, we cannot hope to respect that budget.

The latest research, in the journal Nature, confirms that we must leave 85% of the tar sands oil in the soil if we are to avoid catastrophic and irreversible climate change.

Powerful social movements have stalled proposed pipelines to the west and south, and now the stage is set for a showdown between the pipeline companies and the citizens of Quebec.

We need your help to fund the resistance.


2015 is an election year, but despite the fact that two-thirds of Quebecers, and half of Canadians, oppose Energy East, all three major federal parties support the pipeline. Maybe we missed a lesson, but the version of democracy we were taught involved at least one major party representing the views of half the population.

Energy East has both Justin Trudeau and Tom Mulcair twisting in the wind. Both publicly support the pipeline, but would like most of us to forget that they do. In Quebec, where over two-thirds of the population oppose Energy East, both of their parties have a lot to lose from a campaign which emphasizes their support for the pipeline.

Under the circumstances, we believe we can exert enough pressure to force the Liberals or the NDP, if not both, to change their position on Energy East before the election.

It’s time to demand better from the people we elect. It’s time to demand democracy.

If you donate today, and share this video with all your friends, we’ll use your money to make sure that no politician can campaign in Quebec without being confronted over their pipeline hypocrisy.

If we succeed in forcing even one party to change its position, it could change the future of our country, and even our planet.

So what are you waiting for?


We charge no membership fees, and any Quebec student association can join our coalition and vote in our meetings. We participate in any and all broader coalitions which share our values and work alongside First Nations, community groups, labour, Environmental NGOs and anyone else with an unequivocal position against Energy East.

Every dollar we raise in this campaign will go directly to fund the fight against Energy East:

  • We will use civil disobedience and nonviolent direct action to pressure political parties and candidates at all levels to sign a pledge committing to oppose Energy East;

  • We will mobilize students to participate in demonstrations, and towards mass climate mobilizations in April;

  • We will organize a national network of pipeline opponents on campuses, training students to execute autonomous direct actions in their communities;

  • We will promote the actions of our members, and ensure that the voice of Quebec students is well-represented in the media;

  • We will build a permanent institution capable of rapid-action student response to pipelines and other climate threats.


We need your money, but more than that we need your solidarity. If everyone who reads this far takes the time to share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, we’ll reach our goal with ease. So there’s just one question left: can we count on you to spread the word, and share this campaign on all your social networks? Can you email your parents, grandparents, friends and aunts and uncles?

One gesture is enough to start a chain-reaction, and this is that gesture.

All it takes to change the world is you.

                                                                 Full versions here. 



$5 - Mighty Mite - If you’re sold on the idea, the price-tag doesn’t matter. Your support nourishes our soul.


$25 - Gadfly - Alone we might be weak, but together we are unstoppable. “Funder of the resistance” certificate (electronic format).


$75 - Rabble-Rouser - You are the next generation, and this is your fight too.  A print of one of three original campaign illustrations, signed by the artist (Illustrations available in French or English. Free shipping in Quebec, add $10 outside. In that case donate $85 and select this perk).


$125 - Rainbow-Warrior - You might not have as much time to march in the street as you used to, but you put your money where your mouth is when it comes to fighting pipelines. Rainbow package includes: “Funder of the resistance” certificate, signed print of one of three original campaign illustrations and one of three limited-edition ECO t-shirts featuring original designs (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in French or English. Free shipping in Canada, add $15 international.)


$250 - Petro-Nemesis - You spend your money on resistance, not clothes - “Funder of the resistance” certificate, two of three signed illustrations and two of three limited-edition ECO t-shirts (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in both French and English. Free shipping in Canada, add $20 international).


$500 - Climate Action Hero - Captain Planet is your alter-ego - A telephone briefing between now and April where our strategists will fill you in on the state of the fight in Quebec and our plans for the future.

Plus get a “funder of the resistance” certificate, all three signed campaign illustrations and all three limited-edition ECO t-shirts (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in French or English. Free shipping in Canada, add $20 international).


$1,000 - Godsend - You use your money to create change, and we love you for it - All three original ECO t-shirts, all three signed campaign illustrations, a telephone briefing and an original piece of Energy-East-inspired artwork by a Quebec artist (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in French or English. Free shipping in North America, add $50 international).



Version française


ECO est une coalition d’associations étudiantes québécoises qui ont un objectif commun: bloquer l’oléoduc Énergie Est. En bon-ne-s étudiant-e-s, lorsque les scientifiques parlent d’une même voix, nous les écoutons. Les changements climatiques sont une réalité et menacent notre survie.

Les Nations Unies, le Panel intergouvernemental sur les changements climatiques (gagnant du Prix Nobel de la paix) et 97% des scientifiques s’entendent : nos émissions de carbone doivent avoir une limite. Si nous allons de l’avant avec Énergie Est - ou n’importe quel autre méga-oléoduc au service des sables bitumineux -, nous allons dépasser cette limite.

Les dernières recherches publiées dans la revue Nature confirment que nous devons laisser 85% du pétrole des sables bitumineux dans le sol si nous voulons éviter de déclencher un bouleversement climatique catastrophique et irréversible.

La puissance des mouvements sociaux, à l’Ouest et au Sud, a réussi à bloquer d’autres projets d’oléoducs, et c’est maintenant le temps de l’affrontement entre les compagnies d’oléoduc et la population du Québec.

Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour financer la résistance.


2015 est une année électorale, mais malgré le fait que les deux tiers de la population québécoise et la moitié de la population canadienne s’opposent à Énergie Est, les trois principaux partis fédéraux appuient le projet.

Y a-t-il quelque chose que nous n’avons pas compris? Car, ce qu’on nous a dit de la démocratie, c’est qu’il devrait y avoir au moins un parti pour représenter le point de vue de la moitié de la population.

Les libéraux aussi bien que le NPD ont changé plusieurs fois leur fusil d’épaule au sujet d’Énergie Est. De notre côté, nous croyons pouvoir exercer assez de pression sur l’un des partis, sinon les deux, pour lui faire changer de position avant la campagne électorale.

Il est temps de rehausser nos exigences à l’égard des gens que nous élisons. Il est temps d’exiger la démocratie.

Si vous faites un don dès aujourd’hui et en partageant ce vidéo autour de vous, nous allons utiliser cet argent pour nous assurer qu’aucun-e candidat-e ne pourra faire campagne au Québec sans être confronté-e à son hypocrisie au sujet des oléoducs.

En réussissant à faire changer la position ne serait-ce que d’un seul parti, cela pourrait transformer le futur de notre pays, voire de notre planète.

Alors, qu’attendez-vous?


Nous n’exigeons aucun frais d’adhésion, et plusieurs associations étudiantes québécoises peuvent se joindre à notre coalition et voter dans nos assemblées. Nous participons dans toute coalition plus large qui partage nos valeurs. Nous travaillons aux côtés des Premières Nations, de groupes communautaires, de syndicats, d’ONG environnementales et de n’importe qui d’autre qui partage une position claire contre Énergie Est.

Chaque dollar que nous recueillons au cours de cette campagne servira directement à la lutte contre Énergie Est :


  • Nous utiliserons la désobéissance civile et des actions directes non-violentes pour exercer une pression sur les partis politiques et leurs candidat-e-s à tous les niveaux. Nous exigerons qu’ils et elles signent une déclaration formelle d’opposition à Énergie Est;

  • Nous mobiliserons la population étudiante dans le cadre de manifestations, en particulier lors de la manifestation Action Climat à Québec en avril;

  • Nous mettrons sur pied un réseau pancanadien d’opposition aux oléoducs sur les campus, afin de former les étudiant-e-s aux rouages de l’action directe autonome dans leurs communautés;

  • Nous ferons la promotion des actions de nos membres et nous nous assurerons que la voix étudiante du Québec soit bien représentée dans les médias;

  • Nous construirons une organisation permanente capable d’offrir une réaction étudiante rapide contre les oléoducs et les autres menaces climatiques.




Énergie Est abandonne aussi bien Justin Trudeau que Thomas Mulcair au gré du vent. Les deux appuient publiquement l’oléoduc, mais ils voudraient bien passer cela sous silence. Au Québec, où près des deux tiers de la population s’opposent à Énergie Est, les deux chefs ont beaucoup à perdre d’une campagne qui met l’accent sur leur appui à l’oléoduc.

Dans ces circonstances, nous croyons que nous pouvons exercer assez de pression pour forcer le PLC, le NPD ou les deux à changer leur position au sujet d’Énergie Est avant la campagne électorale.

Nous avons aussi quelques surprises en réserve pour Stephen Harper et son équipe, mais nous ne nous attendons pas à les faire changer d’idée.


                                                                     Agrandir




Oui, nous avons besoin de votre argent, mais plus encore, nous avons besoin de votre solidarité. Si chaque personne qui a lu jusqu’ici prend le temps de partager cette campagne sur Facebook et Twitter, nous atteindrons notre objectif avec facilité. Alors, il ne reste qu’une seule question : pouvons-nous compter sur vous pour passer le mot et partager cette campagne dans vos réseaux? Pouvez-vous l’envoyer par courriel à vos parents, grand-parents, ami-e-s, oncles et tantes?

Un geste suffit pour provoquer une réaction en chaîne. Et le voici.

Tout ce qu’il faut pour changer le monde, c’est vous.




$5 Mighty Mite - Si vous êtes vendu-e à l’idée, le prix n’a pas d’importance. Votre appui nous réchauffe le coeur.


$25 - Gadfly - Seul-e, nous pouvons être faible, mais ensemble, personne ne peut nous arrêter. Certificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance» (en format électronique)


$75 - Rabble-Rouser - Vous faites partie de la prochaine génération, et ce combat est aussi le vôtre. Un tirage des trois illustrations originales de la campagne, signée par l’artiste (livraison gratuite au Québec, 10$ à l’extérieur. Dans ce cas, faites un don de 85$ et sélectionnez cet avantage)


$125 - Rainbow-Warrior - Peut-être n’avez-vous plus autant de temps pour prendre la rue comme auparavant, mais quand il s’agit de lutter contre les oléoducs, vous joignez l’acte à la parole. L’ensemble [Rainbow] inclut : le certificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance», une copie signée de l’une des trois illustrations originales de la campagne et l’un des trois t-shirts ECO d’édition limitée au un design original (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 15$ à l’international)


$250 - Pétro-Némésis - Vous dépensez votre argent pour la résistance, pas pour des vêtements. Certificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance», une copie signée de deux des trois illustrations originales de la campagne et deux des trois t-shirts ECO d’édition limitée (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 20$ à l’international)


$500 - Héro climatique - Capitaine Planète est votre alter-ego. Briefing téléphonique d’ici le mois d’avril, lors duquel nos stratèges vous mettront au parfum de l’état de la lutte au Québec et de nos plans pour l’avenir.

En plus du dertificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance», d’une copie signée des trois illustrations originales de la campagne et des trois t-shirts ECO d’édition limitée (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 20$ à l’international)


$1,000 - Cadeau des dieux - Avec votre argent, vous changez les choses… et nous vous aimons de tout notre coeur. Les trois t-shirts ECO, les trois illustrations de campagne signées, une briefing téléphonique et une oeuvre d’art originale inspirée par Énergie Est exécutée par un-e artiste du Québec. (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 50$ à l’international)

story_txt:
Cliquez ici pour la version française...ECO (Étudiants et Étudiantes Contre les Oléoducs) is a coalition of Quebec student associations with a single goal: stop the Energy East pipeline. Like any good student, when our scientists speak with one voice, we listen to them. Climate change is real, and it threatens our survival.The United Nations, the nobel-prize-winning Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and 97% of climate scientists agree: we have a carbon budget. If we build Energy East, or any other mega-pipelines which service the tar sands, we cannot hope to respect that budget.The latest research, in the journal Nature, confirms that we must leave 85% of the tar sands oil in the soil if we are to avoid catastrophic and irreversible climate change.Powerful social movements have stalled proposed pipelines to the west and south, and now the stage is set for a showdown between the pipeline companies and the citizens of Quebec.We need your help to fund the resistance. 2015 is an election year, but despite the fact that two-thirds of Quebecers, and half of Canadians, oppose Energy East, all three major federal parties support the pipeline. Maybe we missed a lesson, but the version of democracy we were taught involved at least one major party representing the views of half the population.Energy East has both Justin Trudeau and Tom Mulcair twisting in the wind. Both publicly support the pipeline, but would like most of us to forget that they do. In Quebec, where over two-thirds of the population oppose Energy East, both of their parties have a lot to lose from a campaign which emphasizes their support for the pipeline. Under the circumstances, we believe we can exert enough pressure to force the Liberals or the NDP, if not both, to change their position on Energy East before the election.It’s time to demand better from the people we elect. It’s time to demand democracy. If you donate today, and share this video with all your friends, we’ll use your money to make sure that no politician can campaign in Quebec without being confronted over their pipeline hypocrisy.If we succeed in forcing even one party to change its position, it could change the future of our country, and even our planet. So what are you waiting for?We charge no membership fees, and any Quebec student association can join our coalition and vote in our meetings. We participate in any and all broader coalitions which share our values and work alongside First Nations, community groups, labour, Environmental NGOs and anyone else with an unequivocal position against Energy East.Every dollar we raise in this campaign will go directly to fund the fight against Energy East:
We will use civil disobedience and nonviolent direct action to pressure political parties and candidates at all levels to sign a pledge committing to oppose Energy East;
We will mobilize students to participate in demonstrations, and towards mass climate mobilizations in April;
We will organize a national network of pipeline opponents on campuses, training students to execute autonomous direct actions in their communities;
We will promote the actions of our members, and ensure that the voice of Quebec students is well-represented in the media;
We will build a permanent institution capable of rapid-action student response to pipelines and other climate threats.


We need your money, but more than that we need your solidarity. If everyone who reads this far takes the time to share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, we’ll reach our goal with ease. So there’s just one question left: can we count on you to spread the word, and share this campaign on all your social networks? Can you email your parents, grandparents, friends and aunts and uncles?
One gesture is enough to start a chain-reaction, and this is that gesture.
All it takes to change the world is you.

                                                                 Full versions here. 




$5 - Mighty Mite - If you’re sold on the idea, the price-tag doesn’t matter. Your support nourishes our soul.

$25 - Gadfly - Alone we might be weak, but together we are unstoppable. “Funder of the resistance” certificate (electronic format).

$75 - Rabble-Rouser - You are the next generation, and this is your fight too.  A print of one of three original campaign illustrations, signed by the artist (Illustrations available in French or English. Free shipping in Quebec, add $10 outside. In that case donate $85 and select this perk).

$125 - Rainbow-Warrior - You might not have as much time to march in the street as you used to, but you put your money where your mouth is when it comes to fighting pipelines. Rainbow package includes: “Funder of the resistance” certificate, signed print of one of three original campaign illustrations and one of three limited-edition ECO t-shirts featuring original designs (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in French or English. Free shipping in Canada, add $15 international.)

$250 - Petro-Nemesis - You spend your money on resistance, not clothes - “Funder of the resistance” certificate, two of three signed illustrations and two of three limited-edition ECO t-shirts (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in both French and English. Free shipping in Canada, add $20 international).




$500 - Climate Action Hero - Captain Planet is your alter-ego - A telephone briefing between now and April where our strategists will fill you in on the state of the fight in Quebec and our plans for the future.
Plus get a “funder of the resistance” certificate, all three signed campaign illustrations and all three limited-edition ECO t-shirts (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in French or English. Free shipping in Canada, add $20 international).
$1,000 - Godsend - You use your money to create change, and we love you for it - All three original ECO t-shirts, all three signed campaign illustrations, a telephone briefing and an original piece of Energy-East-inspired artwork by a Quebec artist (T-shirts available in [S-M-L-XL]. Illustrations and t-shirts available in French or English. Free shipping in North America, add $50 international).



Version française



ECO est une coalition d’associations étudiantes québécoises qui ont un objectif commun: bloquer l’oléoduc Énergie Est. En bon-ne-s étudiant-e-s, lorsque les scientifiques parlent d’une même voix, nous les écoutons. Les changements climatiques sont une réalité et menacent notre survie.
Les Nations Unies, le Panel intergouvernemental sur les changements climatiques (gagnant du Prix Nobel de la paix) et 97% des scientifiques s’entendent : nos émissions de carbone doivent avoir une limite. Si nous allons de l’avant avec Énergie Est - ou n’importe quel autre méga-oléoduc au service des sables bitumineux -, nous allons dépasser cette limite.
Les dernières recherches publiées dans la revue Nature confirment que nous devons laisser 85% du pétrole des sables bitumineux dans le sol si nous voulons éviter de déclencher un bouleversement climatique catastrophique et irréversible.
La puissance des mouvements sociaux, à l’Ouest et au Sud, a réussi à bloquer d’autres projets d’oléoducs, et c’est maintenant le temps de l’affrontement entre les compagnies d’oléoduc et la population du Québec.
Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour financer la résistance.





2015 est une année électorale, mais malgré le fait que les deux tiers de la population québécoise et la moitié de la population canadienne s’opposent à Énergie Est, les trois principaux partis fédéraux appuient le projet.
Y a-t-il quelque chose que nous n’avons pas compris? Car, ce qu’on nous a dit de la démocratie, c’est qu’il devrait y avoir au moins un parti pour représenter le point de vue de la moitié de la population.
Les libéraux aussi bien que le NPD ont changé plusieurs fois leur fusil d’épaule au sujet d’Énergie Est. De notre côté, nous croyons pouvoir exercer assez de pression sur l’un des partis, sinon les deux, pour lui faire changer de position avant la campagne électorale.
Il est temps de rehausser nos exigences à l’égard des gens que nous élisons. Il est temps d’exiger la démocratie.
Si vous faites un don dès aujourd’hui et en partageant ce vidéo autour de vous, nous allons utiliser cet argent pour nous assurer qu’aucun-e candidat-e ne pourra faire campagne au Québec sans être confronté-e à son hypocrisie au sujet des oléoducs.
En réussissant à faire changer la position ne serait-ce que d’un seul parti, cela pourrait transformer le futur de notre pays, voire de notre planète.
Alors, qu’attendez-vous?


Nous n’exigeons aucun frais d’adhésion, et plusieurs associations étudiantes québécoises peuvent se joindre à notre coalition et voter dans nos assemblées. Nous participons dans toute coalition plus large qui partage nos valeurs. Nous travaillons aux côtés des Premières Nations, de groupes communautaires, de syndicats, d’ONG environnementales et de n’importe qui d’autre qui partage une position claire contre Énergie Est.
Chaque dollar que nous recueillons au cours de cette campagne servira directement à la lutte contre Énergie Est : 

Nous utiliserons la désobéissance civile et des actions directes non-violentes pour exercer une pression sur les partis politiques et leurs candidat-e-s à tous les niveaux. Nous exigerons qu’ils et elles signent une déclaration formelle d’opposition à Énergie Est;
Nous mobiliserons la population étudiante dans le cadre de manifestations, en particulier lors de la manifestation Action Climat à Québec en avril;
Nous mettrons sur pied un réseau pancanadien d’opposition aux oléoducs sur les campus, afin de former les étudiant-e-s aux rouages de l’action directe autonome dans leurs communautés;
Nous ferons la promotion des actions de nos membres et nous nous assurerons que la voix étudiante du Québec soit bien représentée dans les médias;
Nous construirons une organisation permanente capable d’offrir une réaction étudiante rapide contre les oléoducs et les autres menaces climatiques.









Énergie Est abandonne aussi bien Justin Trudeau que Thomas Mulcair au gré du vent. Les deux appuient publiquement l’oléoduc, mais ils voudraient bien passer cela sous silence. Au Québec, où près des deux tiers de la population s’opposent à Énergie Est, les deux chefs ont beaucoup à perdre d’une campagne qui met l’accent sur leur appui à l’oléoduc.
Dans ces circonstances, nous croyons que nous pouvons exercer assez de pression pour forcer le PLC, le NPD ou les deux à changer leur position au sujet d’Énergie Est avant la campagne électorale.
Nous avons aussi quelques surprises en réserve pour Stephen Harper et son équipe, mais nous ne nous attendons pas à les faire changer d’idée.



                                                                     Agrandir



Oui, nous avons besoin de votre argent, mais plus encore, nous avons besoin de votre solidarité. Si chaque personne qui a lu jusqu’ici prend le temps de partager cette campagne sur Facebook et Twitter, nous atteindrons notre objectif avec facilité. Alors, il ne reste qu’une seule question : pouvons-nous compter sur vous pour passer le mot et partager cette campagne dans vos réseaux? Pouvez-vous l’envoyer par courriel à vos parents, grand-parents, ami-e-s, oncles et tantes?
Un geste suffit pour provoquer une réaction en chaîne. Et le voici.
Tout ce qu’il faut pour changer le monde, c’est vous.


$5 Mighty Mite - Si vous êtes vendu-e à l’idée, le prix n’a pas d’importance. Votre appui nous réchauffe le coeur.
$25 - Gadfly - Seul-e, nous pouvons être faible, mais ensemble, personne ne peut nous arrêter. Certificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance» (en format électronique)
$75 - Rabble-Rouser - Vous faites partie de la prochaine génération, et ce combat est aussi le vôtre. Un tirage des trois illustrations originales de la campagne, signée par l’artiste (livraison gratuite au Québec, 10$ à l’extérieur. Dans ce cas, faites un don de 85$ et sélectionnez cet avantage)


$125 - Rainbow-Warrior - Peut-être n’avez-vous plus autant de temps pour prendre la rue comme auparavant, mais quand il s’agit de lutter contre les oléoducs, vous joignez l’acte à la parole. L’ensemble [Rainbow] inclut : le certificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance», une copie signée de l’une des trois illustrations originales de la campagne et l’un des trois t-shirts ECO d’édition limitée au un design original (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 15$ à l’international)



$250 - Pétro-Némésis - Vous dépensez votre argent pour la résistance, pas pour des vêtements. Certificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance», une copie signée de deux des trois illustrations originales de la campagne et deux des trois t-shirts ECO d’édition limitée (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 20$ à l’international)
$500 - Héro climatique - Capitaine Planète est votre alter-ego. Briefing téléphonique d’ici le mois d’avril, lors duquel nos stratèges vous mettront au parfum de l’état de la lutte au Québec et de nos plans pour l’avenir.
En plus du dertificat de «Bailleur de fonds de la résistance», d’une copie signée des trois illustrations originales de la campagne et des trois t-shirts ECO d’édition limitée (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 20$ à l’international)
$1,000 - Cadeau des dieux - Avec votre argent, vous changez les choses… et nous vous aimons de tout notre coeur. Les trois t-shirts ECO, les trois illustrations de campagne signées, une briefing téléphonique et une oeuvre d’art originale inspirée par Énergie Est exécutée par un-e artiste du Québec. (les t-shirts sont disponibles dans les tailles P-M-G-TG, en français ou en anglais. Livraison gratuite au Canada, 50$ à l’international)

story:
Please see the new campaign here.

Hello and Thank You for visiting our global crowdfunding page! This campaign supports the R&D of a pilot project to build a megawatt-class wind farm in North-western Sri Lanka. The project will be the very foundation of a series of sustainable wind and solar power projects to be carried out across the country.

The project initially came into light in August 2008, when we spoke to the Sustainable Energy Authority of Sri Lanka, in relation to the possibility of carrying out such a plan, and the probability of succeeding with it. Since then, it has all been about planning and saving funds for the initial R&D (research and development).

What makes this campaign quite unique is that it is the first of its kind ever to be undertaken in the country, both in terms of subject (clean energy) and scale (the first project alone can power well over 3,000 full-size Sri Lankan homes).

Sri Lanka is a tropical island-country in the Indian Ocean, located southwest of the Bay of Bengal, and is separated from the Indian subcontinent by the Palk Strait. The island has a total land area of 65,600 square kilometres, with a population of approximately 22 million people, from a diverse range of ethnicities and backgrounds. The island is extremely rich in wildlife, flora and fauna, including home to a number of endemic and endangered species, and is pockmarked with dense forests, large freshwater bodies, rivers, and mountains, surrounded by 1,340 kilometres of iconic coastlines.

The island has three potential sources of renewable energy, namely Wind, Solar, and Hydroelectricity, in order of country-wide resource availability. According to studies conducted by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (US) in 2003 and 2005, the country has nearly 20,000 megawatts (MW) of available wind resource (at a conservative assumption of 5MW per square kilometre, at favourable locations), and experiences 4.0–4.5 kWh/m2 of solar resource per day. Less than 0.1% of this is currently utilized.

A theoretical assumption of utilizing either of the resource to its maximum potential could cover the current national installed power capacity of nearly 4,000 MW, by over five times.

At present, 1,500-2,000 megawatts, or half of Sri Lanka’s installed electrical capacity, is from sustainable hydroelectricity via individual facilities ranging up to 210 MW. The hydroelectric resource in the country is now nearly depleted; a good indicator that the country is on track for a greener future, but nowhere close enough for a 100% renewable future.

The success of the very first project, called Project One, will enable our team to gain vital technical and financial backing to be capable of independently executing stand-alone solar and wind power projects across the country, where sadly, vast amounts of clean renewable energy resources are ignored over increasingly cheap coal and oil-fired power stations.

The first project will be commissioned in Kalpitiya (middle-left), with subsequent wind projects carried out in other regions of interest marked in blue. The orange cage represents an area of interest for solar power projects. This chart shows the wind resource of Sri Lanka.

 

Project One

 

The first project will consist of a 10-megawatt power grid-connected wind farm, comprising of 4-to-10 megawatt-class onshore wind turbines. The exact number and capacity of each turbine will be determined based on the outcome of the R&D study, which is further explained below.

Project One’s site is currently identified at a rural fishing village in the northern end of the Kalpitiya Peninsula, in the North-western Province of Sri Lanka.

In addition to capturing the optimal wind resource in the region, an alternative aim in selecting Project One’s site is to be able to position the wind turbines in a layout which enables the use of its access roads and additional project infrastructure by local fishermen and town residents, post-project.

‘Project One’ is the tentative name for our first project,
and will be renamed based on the community locale once the site is finalized.
The above picture was taken during a flight over the potential project site in 2012.

 

Based on similar projects of this nature worldwide, and pre-feasibility studies conducted between 2009 and 2015, the wind farm would reduce 16,000t of CO2 emissions annually. Some of the more localized benefits may be identified as follows:

 

  • To ensure the smooth operation of the wind project, regular expertise is required in various fields including legal, maintenance, security, logistics, and electrical engineering. This would create a number of new jobs in the region.

  • New machine-compacted access roads will be constructed to accommodate large equipment haulage. These new access roads, being at the heart of the village, will be a welcomed by-product of the project, left for the benefit of the local people.

  • A power grid extension would be required in the area to support the wind farm, and would be constructed upon the regional government approval. This would enable further electricity distribution deeper into the area, and would also be a key supporting factor in the development of future projects in the area.

  • And most importantly, Project One would lay the technical and financial stepping-stones for our team to initiate more project of this nature across the country, supporting the global movement to a fossil fuel-free world.

  • In appreciation to the crowdfunding community, once Project One is successfully commissioned, we plan to give back the entire amount raised by this campaign, to various other start-up projects worldwide.

 

 

Three of the nine wind farms we visited for research.
Ambewela (Sep 2012/May 2015), Puttalam (Dec 2012), Uppudaluwa (Apr 2014).
More original pictures and videos in the gallery.

 

Below is a true-colour satellite image of our primary area of interest for Project One.

 

 

Funding

 

As with any fresh and independent project of this nature, above-average development costs is a large and unavoidable hurdle. The lack of a parent organization means that the entire R&D cost needs to be pocketed out by the developers. Unfortunately, due to Project One's nature, this initial cost is too large to be borne privately. This is where we need your help.

The initial stepping-stones, such as entity legal fees, cost of feasibility studies, pre-development logistics, licensing costs, and any down-payments for further loans, needs to be dealt with, first.

Your contributions will be largely used for funding the Research and Development (R&D) phase and legal registrations of Project One, which includes the following key areas listed based on their cost significance (1 USD is approximately 133 LKR):

  • Setting-up of business entity via the Companies Registrar: $1,500

    Consultancy, AoA, Dir/Sec Consents, Paper notices, Venue costs.

  • SLSEA site assessment and Feasibility Study: $3,000

    Service cost, Logistics, Lodging.

  • SLSEA application fee: $5,000

    One-time application fee.

  • Environmental and Construction Clearance: $1,500

    One-time application fees.

  • Power Generation License with govt. royalties: $6,500

    One-time licencing fee, with royalties for 10MW.

  • SLSEA Energy Permit: $50,000

    Licence for commissioning a renewable energy project.

  • Sri Lanka Board of Investment approval: $3,000-$5,000

    BOI approval to be able to obtain tax incentives.

Some of these costs, such as the SLSEA Energy Permit, are negotiable and breakable into the project's lifespan (typically 20 years). If we are able to achieve such an agreement, the additional funds will be used as a reserve until construction of Project One is officially commenced. Procedural errors and unplanned delays is something that we try hard to avoid, but is inevitable and costly for a project like this.

Depending on how much excess (if any) survives by the time we receive the green light for construction, we hope to either double Project One's capacity to 20 megawatts, or use it to offset the final Project Finance loan

We are continuously contacting various pro-renewable organizations with regards to funding Project One. But unfortunately it is not something we can completely rely on. We hope that this campaign reaches enough people soon enough so as to finally put 7 years of planning, delays, and hope, into action.

Equipment funding for the wind turbines, logistics, construction, and labour, will be organized via separate project financing agreements by at least two other separate specialized financial institutions. These institutions will perform a thorough review of the Feasibility Study, Power Purchase Agreements (PPA), and other mandatory licences, to determine if they find this project secure and attractive enough to support with financing.

In the event that the fundraiser does not succeed, any funds raised will be held until the goal is met via alternative fundraisers and/or support from other organizations. This is because the risk of loosing what is already raised is much greater when running under-budget.

 

Technology

 

In the simplest of terms, wind power is the electrical power extracted from the total kinetic wind energy passing through the device used to convert kinetic energy to electrical energy. The device may be a wind turbine in a number of forms, with HAWT (horizontal-axis wind turbine) being the most widely used.

Unlike the past, wind turbines are now more advanced than most people could have ever imagined. Whole wind farms could be monitored and controlled remotely, with maintenance scheduled years apart. Gigantic turbines are now built with capacities of more than 7MW (megawatt) each; enough to power over 7,000 houses. These extreme machines are now quieter and much safer with integrated sensors capable of performing a wide range of automatic tasks ranging from self-maintenance to auto-shutdown.

Each turbine is split into a number of smaller parts for ease of logistics, among other reasons, and is commonly manufactured in different parts of the world for maximum production efficiency. This time-lapse video by OnSiteStudios demonstrates the delivery and assembly process of a wind turbine:

 

Moving Forward...

 

Obtaining and preparation of necessary documentation, establishing and maintaining key contacts, and collection of funding has been ongoing since 2009. So far, we have personally raised nearly US$ 3,500. If funding here is successful, it would take approximately two years from the first official application, to the first megawatt generated: Legal work would take about a year, construction about another half year, and up to 1 year of unforeseen delays are permitted by the Ministry of Power and Energy.

We sincerely hope you would consider supporting this project. Every dollar boosts this campaign's GoGo Factor (an algorithm that boost the campaign's ranking/visibility), and thus helps us reach more supporters.

Remember,
sharing this page helps just as much as contributing does.

A very heartfelt thank you if you are visiting this page after the message our team had sent to you.

The success of this fundraiser would be strong indicator that similar projects could be initiated anywhere in the world not just by big corporations, but by anyone with the vision and determination.

 

Support a fossil fuel-free world. One megawatt at a time.
story_txt:
Please see the new campaign here.Hello and Thank You for visiting our global crowdfunding page! This campaign supports the R&D of a pilot project to build a megawatt-class wind farm in North-western Sri Lanka. The project will be the very foundation of a series of sustainable wind and solar power projects to be carried out across the country.The project initially came into light in August 2008, when we spoke to the Sustainable Energy Authority of Sri Lanka, in relation to the possibility of carrying out such a plan, and the probability of succeeding with it. Since then, it has all been about planning and saving funds for the initial R&D (research and development).What makes this campaign quite unique is that it is the first of its kind ever to be undertaken in the country, both in terms of subject (clean energy) and scale (the first project alone can power well over 3,000 full-size Sri Lankan homes).Sri Lanka is a tropical island-country in the Indian Ocean, located southwest of the Bay of Bengal, and is separated from the Indian subcontinent by the Palk Strait. The island has a total land area of 65,600 square kilometres, with a population of approximately 22 million people, from a diverse range of ethnicities and backgrounds. The island is extremely rich in wildlife, flora and fauna, including home to a number of endemic and endangered species, and is pockmarked with dense forests, large freshwater bodies, rivers, and mountains, surrounded by 1,340 kilometres of iconic coastlines.The island has three potential sources of renewable energy, namely Wind, Solar, and Hydroelectricity, in order of country-wide resource availability. According to studies conducted by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (US) in 2003 and 2005, the country has nearly 20,000 megawatts (MW) of available wind resource (at a conservative assumption of 5MW per square kilometre, at favourable locations), and experiences 4.0–4.5 kWh/m2 of solar resource per day. Less than 0.1% of this is currently utilized.A theoretical assumption of utilizing either of the resource to its maximum potential could cover the current national installed power capacity of nearly 4,000 MW, by over five times.At present, 1,500-2,000 megawatts, or half of Sri Lanka’s installed electrical capacity, is from sustainable hydroelectricity via individual facilities ranging up to 210 MW. The hydroelectric resource in the country is now nearly depleted; a good indicator that the country is on track for a greener future, but nowhere close enough for a 100% renewable future.The success of the very first project, called Project One, will enable our team to gain vital technical and financial backing to be capable of independently executing stand-alone solar and wind power projects across the country, where sadly, vast amounts of clean renewable energy resources are ignored over increasingly cheap coal and oil-fired power stations.The first project will be commissioned in Kalpitiya (middle-left), with subsequent wind projects carried out in other regions of interest marked in blue. The orange cage represents an area of interest for solar power projects. This chart shows the wind resource of Sri Lanka. Project One The first project will consist of a 10-megawatt power grid-connected wind farm, comprising of 4-to-10 megawatt-class onshore wind turbines. The exact number and capacity of each turbine will be determined based on the outcome of the R&D study, which is further explained below.Project One’s site is currently identified at a rural fishing village in the northern end of the Kalpitiya Peninsula, in the North-western Province of Sri Lanka.In addition to capturing the optimal wind resource in the region, an alternative aim in selecting Project One’s site is to be able to position the wind turbines in a layout which enables the use of its access roads and additional project infrastructure by local fishermen and town residents, post-project.‘Project One’ is the tentative name for our first project,and will be renamed based on the community locale once the site is finalized.The above picture was taken during a flight over the potential project site in 2012. Based on similar projects of this nature worldwide, and pre-feasibility studies conducted between 2009 and 2015, the wind farm would reduce 16,000t of CO2 emissions annually. Some of the more localized benefits may be identified as follows: 
To ensure the smooth operation of the wind project, regular expertise is required in various fields including legal, maintenance, security, logistics, and electrical engineering. This would create a number of new jobs in the region.
New machine-compacted access roads will be constructed to accommodate large equipment haulage. These new access roads, being at the heart of the village, will be a welcomed by-product of the project, left for the benefit of the local people.
A power grid extension would be required in the area to support the wind farm, and would be constructed upon the regional government approval. This would enable further electricity distribution deeper into the area, and would also be a key supporting factor in the development of future projects in the area.
And most importantly, Project One would lay the technical and financial stepping-stones for our team to initiate more project of this nature across the country, supporting the global movement to a fossil fuel-free world.
In appreciation to the crowdfunding community, once Project One is successfully commissioned, we plan to give back the entire amount raised by this campaign, to various other start-up projects worldwide.
  Three of the nine wind farms we visited for research.Ambewela (Sep 2012/May 2015), Puttalam (Dec 2012), Uppudaluwa (Apr 2014).More original pictures and videos in the gallery. Below is a true-colour satellite image of our primary area of interest for Project One.  Funding As with any fresh and independent project of this nature, above-average development costs is a large and unavoidable hurdle. The lack of a parent organization means that the entire R&D cost needs to be pocketed out by the developers. Unfortunately, due to Project One's nature, this initial cost is too large to be borne privately. This is where we need your help.The initial stepping-stones, such as entity legal fees, cost of feasibility studies, pre-development logistics, licensing costs, and any down-payments for further loans, needs to be dealt with, first.Your contributions will be largely used for funding the Research and Development (R&D) phase and legal registrations of Project One, which includes the following key areas listed based on their cost significance (1 USD is approximately 133 LKR):
Setting-up of business entity via the Companies Registrar: $1,500Consultancy, AoA, Dir/Sec Consents, Paper notices, Venue costs.


SLSEA site assessment and Feasibility Study: $3,000Service cost, Logistics, Lodging.

SLSEA application fee: $5,000One-time application fee.

Environmental and Construction Clearance: $1,500One-time application fees.


Power Generation License with govt. royalties: $6,500One-time licencing fee, with royalties for 10MW.

SLSEA Energy Permit: $50,000Licence for commissioning a renewable energy project.


Sri Lanka Board of Investment approval: $3,000-$5,000BOI approval to be able to obtain tax incentives.

Some of these costs, such as the SLSEA Energy Permit, are negotiable and breakable into the project's lifespan (typically 20 years). If we are able to achieve such an agreement, the additional funds will be used as a reserve until construction of Project One is officially commenced. Procedural errors and unplanned delays is something that we try hard to avoid, but is inevitable and costly for a project like this.Depending on how much excess (if any) survives by the time we receive the green light for construction, we hope to either double Project One's capacity to 20 megawatts, or use it to offset the final Project Finance loanWe are continuously contacting various pro-renewable organizations with regards to funding Project One. But unfortunately it is not something we can completely rely on. We hope that this campaign reaches enough people soon enough so as to finally put 7 years of planning, delays, and hope, into action.Equipment funding for the wind turbines, logistics, construction, and labour, will be organized via separate project financing agreements by at least two other separate specialized financial institutions. These institutions will perform a thorough review of the Feasibility Study, Power Purchase Agreements (PPA), and other mandatory licences, to determine if they find this project secure and attractive enough to support with financing.In the event that the fundraiser does not succeed, any funds raised will be held until the goal is met via alternative fundraisers and/or support from other organizations. This is because the risk of loosing what is already raised is much greater when running under-budget. Technology In the simplest of terms, wind power is the electrical power extracted from the total kinetic wind energy passing through the device used to convert kinetic energy to electrical energy. The device may be a wind turbine in a number of forms, with HAWT (horizontal-axis wind turbine) being the most widely used.Unlike the past, wind turbines are now more advanced than most people could have ever imagined. Whole wind farms could be monitored and controlled remotely, with maintenance scheduled years apart.
