story:
I’m Carlos Martínez, Agronomic Engineer with a specialization in production of organic fertilizers  and Beatriz Jó, Agronomic engineer with a specialization in soil fertilization.  

We believe we are living in a moment in the history of planet Earth, in which we can not and must not be,  simply observers of the damage humans beings  are making it. The future of our children, grandchildren, etc.,  depends on the decisions we make now.

The problem.

The phenomenon known as the greenhouse effect, is the cause of global warming, which is causing so much damage to our planet and is the result of the emission of gases like carbon dioxide, nitrous oxide and methane, among others, trapping heat generated by the solar rays in the atmosphere. One of the main sources of emissions of these gases is due to decomposition, burning and waste treatment; which has grown into a real social problem.

We all know that our planet is in serious danger; nowadays, in many parts of the world we are suffering droughts, floods and extensive damage, caused by "greenhouse effect".

Another problematic issue, not less important is found in the field of agriculture and it is as follows: all farmers need and have to use fertilizers, fungicides, herbicides and insecticides but unfortunately, 90% of these are chemical type and it is an unfortunate proven fact that they cause serious damage not only to the environment but mainly to soils, because little by little, they make them infertile and even useless.  Besides, they also pollute water tables and water sources such as rivers and groundwater by leaching process and unfortunately, in many places these polluted waters are used.

Plants absorb these harmful chemicals and as a result, humans and animals consume contaminated food that progressively deteriorate our health. 

Very soon, if we all do not care and do nothing, in a few years, we will face a shortage of food.

Our proposal. 

Fortunately, there is a kind of worm, internationally known as the California red worm. This wonderful worm feeds on, all kinds of organic waste transforming it into the best organic fertilizer in the world. Raising these worms on a large scale, is an excellent alternative, to try to reverse and minimize problems caused by garbage, and should be a method replicated and used by many people, government entities and private companies in many places and countries around the world due to its high speed of reproduction, and large quantities of organic waste they eat.

It would take too long to enumerate the many benefits gained during this worm rearing, for different sectors,   however in internet we can find enough information in this regard.  In the field of agriculture, we obtained many huge benefits, by the constant use of these organic fertilizers, but it would take a lot of time to discuss about them,so we will only mention some of the most important, including:     

Ø  The restructuring of soils, even those declared unusable, turning them into high quality land, since they turn them to their optimal physicochemical natural structure.

Ø  Pollution of water tables, caused by overuse of chemical fertilizers and fungicides due to leaching process is avoided.

Ø  It helps farmers to have better and more profitable crops.

Ø  Gas emissions that cause the greenhouse effect are decreased. 


Our primary objective is to collaborate with the planet -even a little-, and start building the infrastructure needed to initiate a project of this type.  Your donation will be used for this purpose, start raising  250,000 California red worms, so we need to build a galley, with sheet metal roof, 6 beds of cement block where the worms will feed; an industrial waste crusher machine, a plastic tank 1,100 liters, all materials for the irrigation system and the electrical system and all the equipment necessary for the operation. Moreover, the salary of four months, of the first four workers are going to start in the operation. 

This initial amount of worms equivalent to 250 kilos, due to the high speed at which they reproduce, at the end of the first year will have become 5,500 kilos, for which 3 daily tons of organic waste to feed them will be processed, and at the end the second year, they will converted into 337,000 kilos of California red worms, for what will be processing 160 tons daily.

With your financial support, you will be the most important part thereof, because without it, we can not do it.

Please like us, you should not sit idly by doing nothing, watching how our planet is deteriorating day by day.  Any contribution will be very important.

Your help is very important, TAKE ACTION, this is the moment.

Rewards

Besides the huge satisfaction you will feel to be helping the environment,  as a reward for your donation,  you will  receive a beautiful oil painting of different Mayan artists that are part of the Mayan tribe Tzutujil from Guatemala, whose art is internationally known as the Maya naive art. These self-taught artists, paint using mainly an aerial perspective, which they call "birds eye view" with beautiful and vibrant colors in a costumbrist style. 

The size of the painting that we will send to you, will depend on the amount of your contribution.

If you can not collaborate economically with our project, please tell your friends about it. That way, you will be helping us and helping the environment.

Thanks a lot for your contribution.

story:
Our Vehicles Need a Revamp

In the past 13 years, Missouri River Relief has organized 133 river cleanups from Yankton, South Dakota, to St. Louis, Missouri, relieving the Missouri River of more than 801 tons of trash. We get it done with a little help from our friends:

  • Our trucks haul boats, transport life jackets, and have safely escorted volunteers to more than 200 events.
  • By donating to our Refurbish Our Fleet campaign, you're investing in the future health of North America's longest river system as well as supporting new opportunities to introduce people to the Big Muddy.

(That's our director, introducing people to the Big Muddy.
Or the "Big Foggy," as this photo might suggest.)

What We Need: $45,000

Our five trucks have driven more than 1.5 million miles. They’ve been good to us, and it’s time to retire these guys to peaceful pastures. We need $100,000 to replace them.

  • $20,000 to replace two 15-passenger vans
  • $10,000 to replace a pick-up truck
  • Additional funds to go toward a seed fund for a regular equipment replacement rotation. It would be set aside in a capital fund and not touched for operations. Our goal is $15,000.
  • $35,000 to replace a box truck.  Donated by the Hulston Family Foundation!
  • $15,000 to replace a heavy-duty pick-up truck. Donated by Living Lands & Waters!
  • $5,000 toward seed fund. Donated by Pat Jones!
Generous donors have already committed $55,000 to the cause. With your help, we can meet our goal by the middle of our 2015 cleanup season.

What You Get: Sponsorship Benefits

We're offering traditional sponsor benefits that we give to donors AND exclusive perks just for IndieGoGo donors!

  • $10 and up - Personal thank-you email. 
  • $25 and up - We'll send IGG donors a personalized post-card from a cleanup location and put your name on the Refurbish Our Fleet webpage!
  • $50 - For IGG donors only: CD, coloring book and a postcard. (Only 25 available!)
  • $75 - For IGG donors only: Get your face on our fall season t-shirt and a postcard. (Only 25 spots available!)
  • $100 - IGG donors get a 2015 Missouri River Relief T-shirt, our new sticker, and a personalized post-card. We'll also honor you with your name listed on our sponsors webpage and annual report, AND give you a well-deserved shout out to our 1,800 Facebook fans.
  • $125 - IGG donors only: The first 10 to claim this perk will get a JiffyLube oil change & a filter, fluid fill, inspection and cleaning.
  • $150 - Your coffee table is looking a little bit bare, my friend. Why not spruce it up with one of the most scenic sights around? Missouri River Country is a visual delight, full of gorgeous photos and fascinating history about the lower stretch of the Missouri River. We'll mail you this and our sticker pack for just $150. (10 available)
  • $200 and up - Hundreds of volunteers will see your name on our sponsors banner at events, in press releases, and other media. Plus you get all the perks of a $100 donation.
  • $300- Get a signed, 10" x 15" paper print of "Dug Out" by Bryan Haynes, who we think is one of the Missouri River's finest artists ever. ((Preview here)) That comes with all the perks of a $200 donation, which includes the perks of a $100 donation. A deal? My friend, us river folk call that a STEAL.  (5 available)
  • $500 - Get your own limited edition, IGG-donor-only Missouri River gift card set of 12 original photos from the banks of the Big Muddy, a T-shirt, our new sticker, and a personalized post-card.
  • $750 - For IGG donors only: Come have dinner and drinks with us while we're at a cleanup. We'll pull up a seat for you around our fire. And give you the benefits of a $500 donation. (Only 5 available!)
  • $1,000 - The most affordable VIP status around. We'll invite you to speak at one of our events, AND give you a boat ride! As well as all the $500 and below benefits.
  • $3,000 - IGG-only opportunity: For up to five days, you and a friend can ride on a Mississippi River towboat. (Only one available!)
  • $10,000 - Your name on one of our vans! Plus everything you get for the $500 level.
All sponsors will be recognized on a thank-you email once the campaign is over. A tax-deductible letter and personalized card acknowledging your gift will be mailed to you, along with any of the additional perks we promise.

Bonus: All donations are tax deductible!

The Impact

Here's what's special about your contribution:

  • We all live downstream; Maybe your drinking water comes from the Missouri River (if you live in Missouri, there's a 40% chance it does), maybe you love fishing, or maybe you recreate in the Gulf of Mexico. The trash we clean up won't make it to where you are. We think that's a good thing. Don't you?
  • We do well at local fundraisers; An art auction last year raised more than $5,000, and our annual Wild & Scenic Film Festival garnered more than $7,000. But that's all general funds. This campaign is unique and urgent, and you'll know exactly where the money's going.

What If We Don't Make It?

There's a chance we won't be able to replace every vehicle. Here's our Plan B to overcome any hurdles:

  • Our trusty mechanic and indefatigable fleet manager will keep our trucks and vans safely running for as long as possible.
  • We can put new vehicles on a payment plan. Our monthly budget is tight, but every piece of equipment is necessary for our cleanups, so we'll have to cut out funds elsewhere to make sure these basics are covered.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're lacking funds, that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Do you know someone in the auto sales industry who could donate a vehicle, gift cards for perks or just cash? Send them our way!
  • Come join us on a cleanup when we come to your area. Sign up here.
  • Use IndieGoGo’s social sharing tools to keep the excitement going in your own network. And please tell your friends!

get all the perks of a $100 donation.

$300- Get a signed, 10" x 15" paper print of "Dug Out"
 by Bryan Haynes, who we think is one of the Missouri River's finest 
artists ever. ((Preview here)) That comes with 
all the perks of a $200 donation, which includes the perks of a $100 
donation. A deal? My friend, us river folk call that a STEAL.  (5 
available)


$500 - Get your own limited edition, IGG-donor-only Missouri River gift card set of 12 original photos from the banks of the Big Muddy, a T-shirt, our new sticker, and a personalized post-card.

$750 - For IGG donors only: Come have dinner and drinks with us while we're at a cleanup. We'll pull up a seat for you around our fire. And give you the benefits of a $500 donation. (Only 5 available!)


$1,000 - The most affordable VIP status around. We'll 
invite you to speak at one of our events, AND give you a boat ride! As 
well as all the $500 and below benefits.

$3,000 - IGG-only opportunity: For up to five days, you and a friend can ride on a Mississippi River towboat. (Only one available!)


$10,000 - Your name on one of our vans! Plus everything you get for the $500 level.
All sponsors will be recognized on a thank-you email once
the campaign is over. A tax-deductible letter and personalized
card acknowledging your gift will be mailed to you, along with any of the additional perks we promise. 

Bonus: All donations are tax deductible!
  The Impact Here's what's special about your contribution:


  We all live downstream; Maybe your drinking water comes from the Missouri River (if you live in Missouri, there's a 40% chance it does), maybe you love fishing, or maybe you recreate in the Gulf of Mexico. The trash we clean up won't make it to where you are. We think that's a good thing. Don't you?
 We do well at local fundraisers; An art auction last year raised more than $5,000, and our annual Wild & Scenic Film Festival garnered more than $7,000. But that's all general funds. This campaign is unique and urgent, and you'll know exactly where the money's going. 
    What If We Don't Make It?
There's a chance we won't be able to replace every vehicle. Here's our Plan B to overcome any hurdles:  Our trusty mechanic and indefatigable fleet manager will keep our trucks and vans safely running for as long as possible. We can put new vehicles on a payment plan. Our monthly budget is tight, but every piece of equipment is necessary for our cleanups, so we'll have to cut out funds elsewhere to make sure these basics are covered.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you're lacking funds, that doesn't mean you can't help!  Do you know someone in the
     auto sales industry who could donate a vehicle, gift cards for perks or
     just cash? Send them our way!


Come join us on a cleanup when we come to your area. Sign up here.
 Use IndieGoGo’s social sharing
     tools to keep the excitement going in your own network. And please tell
     your friends!

story:
Pollinators in Crisis

Join us in the search for answers!

Pollinators are critical to our food supply, and the current pollinator crisis could potentially have devastating impacts on humanity. Without adequate pollination by honey bees and other pollinators, the quantity and quality of the  fruits, vegetables, and seed crops we depend on will be severely compromised. Although there have been numerous studies done on managed  honey bee colonies, no single problem can be implicated in their decline.

The Secrets of Bee Trees

Honey bees have been around for more than 25 million years.  Over that time they have developed unique relationships with many flowering plants.  They lived in tree hollows and other natural cavities, and appear to have preferred relatively small spaces of about ten gallons in volume. The colonies were quite dispersed over wide areas, with only about six colonies per square mile.

Modern beekeeping practices are convenient and efficient for humans, but they create conditions unlike those that shaped the evolution of the honey bee. Some of the differences have consequences that are yet to be fully measured. For example:

  • We keep colonies in large boxes that are placed only a foot or so above the ground, where predators like yellow jackets and skunks have easy access to the colony entrance. During wet weather, the colonies are exposed to the damp air near the ground. This may increase fungal infections in the colony.
  • We place many colonies close together, with limited access to forage. Because honey bees can only forage in a limited radius around their home colony, local nectar and pollen sources can be quickly exhausted when too many colonies are forced to share the same space.
  • In an effort to keep colonies clean, we have prevented the accumulation of debris that naturally occurs underneath the honey bee nest. The debris may contain beneficial microorganisms and other critters. Recent research suggests that these things may be an important component of honey bee health.

What is a tree hive?

We have made a prototype hive that can be hung in trees.  Our goal is to make this hive match a tree hollow as closely as possible.  At the same time we want to be able to monitor the tree hive colonies, take samples and record our progress.  Therefore the tree hive is a stack of wooden boxes with wooden frames hung inside much like standard beekeeping equipment.  The frames contain the bees' comb and can be removed, examined and replaced so that samples can be taken without breaking the comb.  The size of each box is about 1/3 of a standard beekeeping box so that a stack of three boxes for comb equals one standard box.  Beekeepers traditionally give their colonies two boxes therefore a tree hive is about half the size of a traditional beekeeping box.  A fourth box is placed under the boxes of comb, this is a box for wooden debris that may contain organisms.  Most colonies in a natural tree hollow have wood debris beneath the cavity that houses the bees. We expect these organisms and the honey bee colony make up a natural community.  
We recently collaborated with Dr. Jay Yoder from Wittenberg University to conduct a study on fungi in honey bee colonies. (See the March 2015 issue of Bee Culture for details.) The initial results suggest that tree hives host twice the level of beneficial fungi as traditional managed colonies. One of these fungi slowed or inhibited the growth of chalkbrood, a harmful fungus that infects and kills honey bee larvae. These results are encouraging! Further study is warranted.

About Our Project

It is absolutely critical that researchers, beekeepers, and the public work together to uncover the factors that are compromising honey bee health. Long-lived tree hive colonies are a possible source of promising, unrealized solutions. Precious little research has been done on the differences between tree hollow bees and those living in managed colonies. If such differences came to light, they could be used to improve modern beekeeping methods and perhaps help to reduce the severity of the pollinator crisis.

Our goal is to verify the results of the preliminary fungal study. We are poised to begin conducting this much-needed research, and you can participate! Working together, we can pursue solutions through research on bee trees.

A good research sample should include a minimum of 30 colonies in trees and 30 on the ground. Money received will be used to:

  • Build 30 tree hives. 
  • Build 30 comparison colonies.
  • Fund research assistants and educational materials. 
  • Obtain supplies for sampling, data collection and recording. 
  • Cover business administration and insurance costs.
Total project costs $50,000.

Additional Benefits

Our Tree Hives will be dispersed over a wide area, providing pollination for local flora. The Tree Hives also lend natural beauty in both rural and urban settings. We will be collaborating with Master Beekeeping students to further education and interest in honey bee conservation.

Be a partner in this important research!
Your contribution to our project has the potential to make a positive change for people all over the world! With reduced pollinator populations, nutritious food can only become more expensive, beyond the reach of many families. There is hope. Please participate, and join us in the pursuit of answers.

story:
Short Summary

Since 1978 Joyce Ferder Rankin has covered some of our planets most dangerous conflicts.  She has now set her sights on what could be the final battle for humanity; the effects of climate change. 

Our planet is in a precarious state. Daily we hear of new tipping points in the disaster that is climate change.

Our team is traveling to the most remote parts of Antarctica to document the GREAT MELT which is estimated to ultimately raise sea levels by 10 meters/over 30 feet.

Fewer than 1000 people have ever been to some of the places that we are attempting to get to.

5 years ago Joyce set out on a journey to the ends of the earth. She felt a compulsion to find out what was happening in our planet’s polar circles – and to inform people about the truth of our global situation. She has been sharing her findings from her travels in Antarctica and the Arctic through multi-media exhibitions, speaking engagements (most recently TEDx), and a photographic book. 

Now we need to finish the journey.  We are going to the ends of our earth, places where human beings rarely go to bring back the truth of what is happening to our planet and the catastrophic disaster we face if we don't act now.

  • What We Need & What You Get

We need $325,000 which breakdown as follows:

$90,000 is for 3 people to travel to Bluff, New Zealand from the US and UK , 4 nights hotel  in New Zealand, 32 days on the icebreaker and then flights back to US from Ushuaia, Argentina

$20000 is for ancillary equipment including backup 4k camera, back up go pro camera, accessories,  batteries, media cards and cold weather gear

Ancillary travel costs include filming solutions talking to experts and organizations that show how we can survive the challenges we face:

Factor in 5 shooting days and travel  $20000

$170,000 goes towards post-production costs (i.e. editing, graphics, etc)

$25,000 marketing 

  • Rewards include:

    Download of photos of wildlife and landscape from the area

    Posters

    Unsigned and signed Books  DEGREESº

    Thank you credits on documentary

    IMDB Credit as Associate Producer or Executive Producer

 If we don't reach our goal..every penny will still  go toward finishing the project.  At the very least Joyce  will be traveling on the ship shooting video and doing live voice reports, for release on the web, where she is able.  The documentary will be finished and then released.  Your donations will help our team make this documentary a powerful statement of our current dilemma.

The Impact

Degreesº to Extinction

The reality is, each year gets warmer, with record-setting temperatures.  On December 28, 2015, the temperature at the North Pole was 50F warmer than normal, due to a “freak” storm.

The 10,000-year-old Larsen Ice shelf has collapsed, and there are signs that Western Antarctica is also collapsing. This would raise sea levels by more than 30 feet.

Many climate scientists, including the renowned socio-biologist E.O. Wilson, say a mass extinction crisis -- on the order of the dinosaur’s demise 65 million ago -- is upon us. The late Professor Frank Fenner, MBE, has gone so far as to say that human beings maybe evolving themselves to extinction by 2100, due simply to over consumption, over population and climate change.

Climate scientists are in complete agreement: the tipping point for CO2 has been reached and exceeded, never to fall back to safe levels -- unless we take immediate and drastic action.

According to the Pentagon, there is no other situation on the planet as far reaching and dire to the USA than climate change.

In February 2017, Joyce Ferder-Rankin and our production team will journey to Antarctica to see first-hand if the Ross Ice Shelf and Western Antarctica are indeed experiencing the GREAT MELT.

Is this the new normal?  Will 70% of wildlife really disappear by 2020? Can we fix it or is it too late? Are we heading for the mass extinction -- including ourselves?

Through video, stills and interviews, Joyce will document her journey, in a quest to understand the state of our planet. With live reports (conditions allowing) to bring the reality of Antarctic conditions and climate change directly to the viewer.

With the election of climate change denier Donald Trump as President it is even more urgent that this project be finished and released to show people what is really happening NOW!  It is not just words to say that the survival of the human race depends on major action  taken now to curb the worst effects of climate change that are to come.

Help us finish our project. Be part of the solution!

Risks & Challenges

  • Antarctica poses many challenges but having been there before we are confident we can overcome most of these.  The most complex challenge we face is  getting and keeping signals with satellites to do live broadcast. Coverage there can spotty at best. We do know of 2 locations: McMurdo Dry Valleys and Port Lockroy where signals are available for live reports.
  • Temperatures and atmospheric conditions are the other main hurdle.  With proper gear and also additional equipment with well followed technical practices we will be able to function in this most unforgiving environment
  • The final hurdle is where you come in: FUNDING..with out your help our team will not be able to accompany Joyce and this momentous opportunity will not be fulfilled.  We will be the first crew to be going into areas that less than 1000 people have EVER been.  Please help us bring the world the  reality of the GREAT MELT. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ok..so you don't have any money..YOU CAN STILL HELP
  • Tweet, Facebook, Instagram..tell all your friends, family and colleagues about our campaign
  • Repost the video..help it go viral!
  • Get involved with an environmental organization 
  • Vote to force the world's elected representatives to work together to save the human race from the ravages of climate change.
  • Be a responsible inhabitant of our planet :  Reduce, Reuse ReCycle

Let Donald Trump and all climate change deniers know that they cannot ignore us any longer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ok..so you don't have any money..YOU CAN STILL HELP
Tweet, Facebook, Instagram..tell all your friends, family and colleagues about our campaign
Repost the video..help it go viral!
Get involved with an environmental organization 
Vote to force the world's elected representatives to work together to save the human race from the ravages of climate change.
Be a responsible inhabitant of our planet :  Reduce, Reuse ReCycle

Let Donald Trump and all climate change deniers know that they cannot ignore us any longer.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We're the farmers and founders of Apis Apotheca! 

​Aviva Tilson has been farming since 2012 in New York and Vermont, on farms ranging from small diverse vegetables to a sheep dairy to a large biodynamic CSA and raw milk dairy.  She has struggled with health issues most of her life and started farming as a way to work through those challenges.  Her interest in medicinal herbs grew during her experience working at Hawthorne Valley Farm, and she decided to return to school at Arbor Vitae School for Traditional Herbalism in NYC to become certified as a Community Herbalist.  She and Ryan managed an intensively planted quarter acre medicinal herb farm and founded their herbal product company Apis Apotheca in 2016,and are excited to grow on a larger scale this season.  Her passion is growing plants that help heal people, as they have done for her.  

Ryan Surrano has had a life long love affair with plants since he was first introduced to his grandfathers garden, but has been farming professionally since 2013. He worked at a Wild Simulated Ginseng operation in the Catskill mountains for two seasons where he helped plant thousands of Ginseng seeds. There, he became interested in medicinal mushrooms and medicinal agroforestry.  He wants to grow high quality mushrooms and create spaces for endangered woodland medicinals to thrive.

Annabel Roberts-McMichael is an artist, farmer and activist who graduated from Cooper Union and has worked on numerous farms in the Hudson Valley learning vegetable and herb production as well as biodynamic meat and dairy management.  She is avidly interested in agroforestry, forest based food systems, and traditional ecological knowledge.

 

Aviva, Annabel and Ryan are partnering with the beautiful people at GatherWild Ranch to grow good medicine on their fertile land. 

WHY DO HERBS MATTER?

  • We are living in uncertain times.  Our healthcare and our environment are daily threatened under the new administration, leaving people wondering what they can do to defend their health and the wellbeing of their communities.  We believe the answer lies in radical self-empowerment through learning how to use herbal medicine for basic preventative healthcare.  
  •  Herbs are the oldest, safest form of medicine.  They carry with them centuries of traditions that span cultures all over the world demonstrating their safety and efficacy. Peer reviewed scientific studies are now helping us understand the mechanisms behind herbs and their uses. The World Health Organization recently released a global strategy to incorporate traditional herbal medicine based healing modalities into member nation's plans for keeping their citizens healthy.  You can read about it here: http://who.int/medicines/publications/tradition...
  • Herbs are the people's medicine. Large pharmaceutical companies have profited greatly by the loss of traditional herbal memory in our culture, and it is time to reclaim our health from multinational conglomerates that profit from keeping us sick and dependent on them.

HOW WILL OUR FARM HELP YOU?

  • We plan on offering affordable APIS ELIXIR BOXES that will contain: 1. A certain number of freshly dried seasonal, locally grown herbs, 2. Empty vials, 3. labels, and 4. beautifully hand illustrated, collectible instructions on how to create YOUR OWN home apothecary to treat conditions including but not limited to: colds, insomnia, infections, a broken heart, skincare, and digestive complaints (all of which can be related!).  We want to grow high quality plants, and give you every tool you need to learn how to use them-- because to know how to heal yourself and your loved ones is an act of radical defiance and activism  in today's world.

​

  • We want our boxes to be accessible to anyone who needs one and is willing to get their kitchen witch on, and we plan on implementing a sliding scale policy for our medicine boxes as well as partnering with local CSA's whose missions are to serve low income communities.  Health shouldn't have a price tag that people can't afford.
  • We plan on starting small and growing sustainably, with the goal of supplying retail and wholesale customers in the Hudson Valley and New York City metro area with fresh, local, vibrant medicinals that contain the life force needed to heal.
  • Last but not least, we are using land to grow plants which will sequester carbon, which needs to happen on a much larger scale if we are going to save our environment. We are environmental activists and farming is how we protest the destruction of our ecosystems and use our every breath to help preserve them.

WHAT WE NEED TO GET STARTED

We are asking for $15,500 for start up costs which will go towards funding:

  • Packaging and printing costs for Apis Elixir Boxes

  • Fencing (there's a lotta deer up here)

  • Irrigation 

  • Handtools

  • A small greenhouse

  • A temperature controlled herb drying shed

  • A tractor mounted mulch layer

  • Mulch

  • Seeds

  • Seed Starter Soil

  • Compost

  • Row Cover

  • Seed Trays

What do you get?

These are some of our offerings to thank you for your support and commitment to ensuring the health of our communities:

  • Seeds! : "They wanted to bury us- they didn't know we were seeds".  This proverb is more important than ever, and our medicinal herb seed packets will help you start growing your own medicine!
  • Apis Apotheca Skincare trio: Get the original line of high quality herbal skincare that we launched our company with! Includes a Whole Plant Infused moisturizer, exfoliant, and toner mist to help transform your skin for the better.  
  • Apis Elixir Box: An innovative complete wellness kit filled with herbs, bottles, and collectible artist-illustrated instructions so you can get started on your own journey as a medicine maker
  • A Personal Herbal Consultation: Have a talk with community Herbalist Aviva in person or over skype to discuss your health goals and how to achieve them with plant allies. You'll receive a customized Apis Elixir Box.
  • A Wild Medicinals Foraging Walk and Workshop: We'll go for a walk and learn how to identify some of the best, most common wild medicinals to use for food and skincare, and craft a meal and medicine from them together!  A great small group or one-on-one learning experience! 

Impact

By helping us get started, you will be helping yourself and your communities to become more self sufficient and self reliant.  

Your support will enable us to preserve and enrich our local ecology and sequester carbon in the atmosphere.  Every small step counts towards preserving our planet, and our farm will be a living example of how we all might work together to preserve our water, soil, and air from further industrial contamination.  

We already have in depth experience in organic farming, agroforestry and small business management, and are part of a close network of young farmers in the Hudson Valley that share knowledge and help each other succeed. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come volunteer/intern with us! We will need all the help we can get come spring time, and we are more than happy to offer a rich educational experience to anyone who wants to get their hands dirty and learn seed to bottle medicine making and witness a small farm starting up! Camping opportunities available in summer.
  • Spread the word!! If you can't afford to contribute, send this to someone who you think can and is interested! Let us know you got someone else to help out, and we'll send you a small token of our gratitude in return. 
  • Join our mailing list! Go to apisapotheca.com and scroll down. Get shop updates, DIY recipes and herbal wisdom delivered to your inbox!

Ryan Surrano has had a life long love affair with plants since he was first introduced to his grandfathers garden, but has been farming professionally since 2013. He worked at a Wild Simulated Ginseng operation in the Catskill mountains for two seasons where he helped plant thousands of Ginseng seeds. There, he became interested in medicinal mushrooms and medicinal agroforestry.  He wants to grow high quality mushrooms and create spaces for endangered woodland medicinals to thrive.

Annabel Roberts-McMichael is an artist, farmer and activist who graduated from Cooper Union and has worked on numerous farms in the Hudson Valley learning vegetable and herb production as well as biodynamic meat and dairy management.  She is avidly interested in agroforestry, forest based food systems, and traditional ecological knowledge.
 
Aviva, Annabel and Ryan are partnering with the beautiful people at GatherWild Ranch to grow good medicine on their fertile land. 
WHY DO HERBS MATTER?


We are living in uncertain times.  Our healthcare and our environment are daily threatened under the new administration, leaving people wondering what they can do to defend their health and the wellbeing of their communities.  We believe the answer lies in radical self-empowerment through learning how to use herbal medicine for basic preventative healthcare.  

 Herbs are the oldest, safest form of medicine.  They carry with them centuries of traditions that span cultures all over the world demonstrating their safety and efficacy. Peer reviewed scientific studies are now helping us understand the mechanisms behind herbs and their uses. The World Health Organization recently released a global strategy to incorporate traditional herbal medicine based healing modalities into member nation's plans for keeping their citizens healthy.  You can read about it here: http://who.int/medicines/publications/tradition...


Herbs are the people's medicine. Large pharmaceutical companies have profited greatly by the loss of traditional herbal memory in our culture, and it is time to reclaim our health from multinational conglomerates that profit from keeping us sick and dependent on them.


HOW WILL OUR FARM HELP YOU?
We plan on offering affordable APIS ELIXIR BOXES that will contain: 1. A certain number of freshly dried seasonal, locally grown herbs, 2. Empty vials, 3. labels, and 4. beautifully hand illustrated, collectible instructions on how to create YOUR OWN home apothecary to treat conditions including but not limited to: colds, insomnia, infections, a broken heart, skincare, and digestive complaints (all of which can be related!).  We want to grow high quality plants, and give you every tool you need to learn how to use them-- because to know how to heal yourself and your loved ones is an act of radical defiance and activism  in today's world.

​

We want our boxes to be accessible to anyone who needs one and is willing to get their kitchen witch on, and we plan on implementing a sliding scale policy for our medicine boxes as well as partnering with local CSA's whose missions are to serve low income communities.  Health shouldn't have a price tag that people can't afford.

We plan on starting small and growing sustainably, with the goal of supplying retail and wholesale customers in the Hudson Valley and New York City metro area with fresh, local, vibrant medicinals that contain the life force needed to heal.
Last but not least, we are using land to grow plants which will sequester carbon, which needs to happen on a much larger scale if we are going to save our environment. We are environmental activists and farming is how we protest the destruction of our ecosystems and use our every breath to help preserve them.


WHAT WE NEED TO GET STARTED
We are asking for $15,500 for start up costs which will go towards funding:

Packaging and printing costs for Apis Elixir Boxes
Fencing (there's a lotta deer up here)
Irrigation 
Handtools
A small greenhouse
A temperature controlled herb drying shed
A tractor mounted mulch layer
Mulch
Seeds
Seed Starter Soil
Compost
Row Cover
Seed Trays


What do you get?
These are some of our offerings to thank you for your support and commitment to ensuring the health of our communities:


Seeds! : "They wanted to bury us- they didn't know we were seeds".  This proverb is more important than ever, and our medicinal herb seed packets will help you start growing your own medicine!

Apis Apotheca Skincare trio: Get the original line of high quality herbal skincare that we launched our company with! Includes a Whole Plant Infused moisturizer, exfoliant, and toner mist to help transform your skin for the better.  

Apis Elixir Box: An innovative complete wellness kit filled with herbs, bottles, and collectible artist-illustrated instructions so you can get started on your own journey as a medicine maker

A Personal Herbal Consultation: Have a talk with community Herbalist Aviva in person or over skype to discuss your health goals and how to achieve them with plant allies. You'll receive a customized Apis Elixir Box.

A Wild Medicinals Foraging Walk and Workshop: We'll go for a walk and learn how to identify some of the best, most common wild medicinals to use for food and skincare, and craft a meal and medicine from them together!  A great small group or one-on-one learning experience! 

Impact

By helping us get started, you will be helping yourself and your communities to become more self sufficient and self reliant.  
Your support will enable us to preserve and enrich our local ecology and sequester carbon in the atmosphere.  Every small step counts towards preserving our planet, and our farm will be a living example of how we all might work together to preserve our water, soil, and air from further industrial contamination.  
We already have in depth experience in organic farming, agroforestry and small business management, and are part of a close network of young farmers in the Hudson Valley that share knowledge and help each other succeed. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help


Come volunteer/intern with us! We will need all the help we can get come spring time, and we are more than happy to offer a rich educational experience to anyone who wants to get their hands dirty and learn seed to bottle medicine making and witness a small farm starting up! Camping opportunities available in summer.

Spread the word!! If you can't afford to contribute, send this to someone who you think can and is interested! Let us know you got someone else to help out, and we'll send you a small token of our gratitude in return. 

Join our mailing list! Go to apisapotheca.com and scroll down. Get shop updates, DIY recipes and herbal wisdom delivered to your inbox!

story:
The Problem

In 2014 and now 2015 record numbers of baby Ca. Sea Lions 'pups' are being washed ashore malnourished and abandoned by their mothers. While there are always some abandoned pups each year, this year’s 1,200 or more along Southern California beaches from Laguna Beach down to San Diego is 2-3 times the expected number, and they started months earlier this year. 

The real reasons are not fully understood yet. it appears partially due to the warming trends caused by the El Nino, causing the normal schools of fish Sea Lions feed on to stay further out to sea and causing the mothers to abandon the pups in search of food. Whatever the reason, these emaciated pups need our support and medical attention. The number of pups being rescued is very manageable given the number of people that can contribute a small amount.

Who are we? We are you!

We are part of the millions of life long residents of Southern California just like you. We are beach lovers, outdoor fitness enthusiasts, and business people, old and young.

We cannot sit idly by and watch these beautiful creatures of the sea suffer and die needlessly. As business people with means and resources, we are called upon to help coordinate the effort and direct the resources. As protectors and honorees of all the earth’s creatures and life giving systems, it is our calling to ensure we give what we can to our fellow creatures. This campaign will provide much needed public awareness to make everyone more aware of the problem and solutions. It will provide initial funding for a public awareness campaign to get the word out, and begin the process of proving better and bigger resources to assist the cash and resource strapped state wildlife agencies and Sea World. We hope to work hand in hand with these rich advisory resources to gain greater knowledge and direction on the best use of resources to help those sea lions in immediate danger. With your help, we can be a life-saving force!

What We Need & What You Get

Here’s how it breaks down:

The funds will be used to build news media presence, designs and sell public awareness signs and banners, stickers, and t-shirts to get our message out to as many people as possible and as quickly as possible. In fact, if you would like to help spread the message, we are looking for people who can volunteer their time and resources to spread the word and perhaps offer information and merchandise to the public in various formats.

We will be giving gifts “perks” to each and every valued donor depending on the level of your donation. Not that you need that to get excited, but we appreciate you!

The Impact
The impact on the sea lion pup population is immeasurable. We can never know of course natures intended purpose for allowing these pups to be abandoned, we hope our efforts are for the overall good of the whole sea lion population.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

The risk to you is the contribution you make and the joy you will feel for participating.

The risk to us, is we get involved and are unable to raise enough money to really make a difference. But we have raised money successfully before for other business ventures and truly believe with your help, we will be successful here as well.

Along with our well thought out business plan for employing the funds raised (yes we are a little boastful :), we intend to arrange liaisons between this non-profit and Sea World and other marine mammal experts to advise and guide our efforts and media actions to achieve the most benefit to the sea lions we can get.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. If you can’t donate, please consider posting and forwarding our funds raising message to as many people as you can. You can do this by posting us on Facebook, liking our FB page, sending emails.
  • In addition, if you want to get involved, we welcome you efforts in promoting our fund raining t-shirts, banners, signs, and bumper stickers. Every dollar helps!
  • For the benefit of our fund raising support systems on IndieGoGo, please use their links and share tools to help promote their effort too.

Please help us help the California Sea Lion Pups. Thank you.

story:
15 Million Ghanaians Still Need Access to Safe Sanitation

There are millions of Ghanaians who are in dire need of access to safe sanitation. At Loo Works our business is centered around providing safe sanitation for all. Safe sanitation for the low income population must also be off-grid as most of the areas they live in are not connected to water. We offer an off-grid solution that is appealing to the population we aim to serve. Our Superstructures are then connected to an odor-free digester, a biological waste management system, which does not need to be dislodged often. This pairing offers a quick and sustainable solution to the neediest in our population. 

  • Our models use stainless steel, aluminum and or cement fiber board to create a toilet housing.
  • Each model contains a full flush toilet along with a handwash basin. We will offer micro-flush options for highwater areas (mid 2018).
  • These models are ideal for areas with limited space but not suitable for high traffic areas. Our public toilets will be specifically designed for public use
  • Our toilets come preassembled and can be installed in a few hours on site.
  • When paired with a digester, this household toilet system is odor-free and is completely off-grid. 

Why do we need $500K?

Sourcing sustainable raw materials for our structures in Ghana is our goal, but for now we must import our product. We are raising money to push our production further, this first round push towards #1000Toiletsin1Y will simply be a foundation on which we can build a sustainable model. We have already made a name for ourselves as a provider of choice in this market, but we want to improve our impact. That means $250,000 will go towards our supply of the 1000 toilets while $100,000 will be used to develop the foundation of our first local manufacturing facility, including machinery, training, and marketing materials. In addition, we need $75,000 to move our team of 5 to a team of 60 who will be our sanitation care specialists for our households. As with any new technology, we need training, so these care specialists will assist households with user sensitization, use instructions, smooth installation, troubleshooting and maintenance and overall service as they move from open defecation to safe sanitation practices. $40,000 will be used to develop a prototype for the upcoming locally developed toilet model so we can provide a sustainable low-cost option for those most in need within our population. $25,000 will be used to incorporate a financing mechanism that will allow members of the low-income population to utilize a micro-lending or small scale savings plan towards their future sanitation needs well after this first 1000 has been delivered.  In the case that our goal is not met, we will work to get our local factory up and running so we can provide a long-term sustainable toilet option.

Our Loo Works Story

Four years ago, after spending a majority of her life in the United States, our Founder, Samlara moved back to Ghana to be closer to her family. She was shocked to find out how deplorable the sanitation conditions were throughout the country but most especially in extremely populated areas. She discovered that open defecation was still quite prevalent and that most public toilets were completely unsanitary pay-per-use toilets that the bottom of the pyramid were using daily as their home toilets! 

This set her on a quest to find a solution, locally she discovered that Biofilcom, had an off-grid digester that could be used virtually anywhere. After two years of research and working within the sanitation sector, Loo Works had a toilet housing on the market that could be easily assembled and provide a dignified toilet to those in need. 

After six months of installations Loo Works is now in 75 households in Greater Accra but in order to make a real impact, we need your help! The demand is extremely high but we must be able to find a way to get the toilets in households while allowing households a lengthy amount of time (years in some cases) to pay. #1000Toiletsin1Y will be a foundation upon which we can build. 

Rewards

As your contributions are offering a subsidy to households, we are engaging you with the households! Thank you cards, Video footage of the installations and Ghanaian memorabilia are among our rewards. Since indiegogo says you must get your own plane ticket, if you can make your way here we will host you in the Gold Coast!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please post our link to every social media site you subscribe to and help us get the word out, our goal is to help the masses starting with 1000 households, help us by making us viral, your fingers are much more valuable than you know.

Loo Works Future

You are helping us build a firm foundation. We are changing sanitation offerings in Ghana first and then working on improving sanitation throughout the developing world. Help us to set our firm foundation and get to our goal of #1000Toiletsin1Y.

Thank you in advance for all you do to assist us in reaching our goal!

story:
Our campaign with US tax deductability is at
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/climate-matters--2/x/10920720#/

I Am An Eco-Social Strategist

My name is Stuart Scott.  I have committed my life to altering civilization's catastrophic trajectory in terms of climate and ecology.  Over my professional career I was Wall Street's first environmentalist stockbroker in the 1970s, an IT consultant to New York City's largest banks and IBM in the 1980s, then went from tech to teaching in the 1990s.  I literally quit my day job as a university instructor in 2008 to focus full-time on fixing the climate problem, and went to where I thought change was most likely to come from, the UN-sponsored climate negotiations, known as the COP, or Conference of Parties to the Kyoto Protocols.

What I found was simultaneously hopeful and discouraging, inspiring and depressing.  The negotiations were a diplomatic battle between those who want to protect the future of humanity and life on Earth, and those intent upon making money at all cost, and preserving Business-As-Usual.  It was a modern day tragedy in the making. 

Since then I have focus intensely upon the systemic contradictions within society and the individual human psyche that are hurtling us toward a collision with Nature.  My work is now to catalyze an understanding of the epic battle for the future of civilization and life on Earth that is called 'the COP.'

Fixing the Climate Crisis from Hollywood

Christian Meoli is our Producer.  His company, Voltaire Media, specializes in strategic marketing concepts, digital engagement, social media and brand identity development for entertainment companies.  

Christian also operates Arena Cinema Hollywood, one of the top indie movie theaters in Los Angeles.  Previously, as Vice President of Marketing for Bigfoot Entertainment, he directed numerous domestic and international theatrical and home entertainment campaigns, notably the award-winning "9000 Needles."  Christian has been featured in the Los Angeles Business Journal and LA Weekly for industry insight,  He also has an established career as a working actor, appearing in over 100 film/TV programs, most recently NCIS:LA and Ray Donovan.  He has had the good fortune to work with the top echelon of producers and directors in TV/Film.

To support CLIMATE MATTERS, charitable donations can be accepted through our fiscal sponsor The Film Collaborative.

We are collaborating with Green Planet Films (greenplanetfilms.org), founded in 2003 in Northern California, a non-profit distributor created to promote environmental education through the artistic power of film.  Green Planet Films connects environmental filmmakers documenting the relationship between nature and humanity for an evolving global movement seeking greater knowledge about the natural world we inhabit and depend upon.

The Backdrop - COP-21 (Conference of Parties)

The conference objective is to achieve a universal agreement on climate, from all the nations of the world. This campaign will raise the funds to film inside of COP-21 in Paris this year, an effort to reveal the elephant in the room.  The footage will be crafted into a documentary that lays out in plain, understandable terms the tug of war between nations and  governments and economic forces and 'civil society '(the people). 

Our future is being bartered for short term economic gain.  But the consequences are already lapping at our doorstep with a real an present danger of the collapse of civilization by mid-century.  Governments know of this, but must downplay their knowledge because of that elephant in the room.  This is both shocking and enraging.  How could we as a species be so selfish and blind?

The Cast

We will have participation from , but not be limited to the following individuals:

Stuart Scott

Stuart is the host of Climate Matters, a series of panel discussions in a talk show format that take place at the UN climate negotiation.  He is the central unifying character in this documentary, and will bring together the other notable people who comprise our cast.  He will conduct our interviews provide the narrative for events taking place in Paris during this year's COP-21 climate negotiations. 

Dr. James Hansen

James Hansen is the world’s most famous climate scientist. As Director of NASA’s Goddard Institute in New York City for 42 years, Dr. Hansen has been sounding the alarm on climate change for 3 decades, through a series of US presidential administrations. A separate page entitled Who Is James Hansen is submitted as Appendix A. to this proposal.

Dr. Hansen will be attending the UN climate negotiations for the first time since they began at the invitation of Stuart Scott. He has heretofore avoided the negotiations believing that policy makers are not discussing real solutions there but rather merely engaging in face-saving rhetoric.

Christiana Figueres

Ms. Figueres has been the Executive Secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) since July 2010. She has presided over five Conferences of the Parties (COPs), and is now faced with the difficult task of delivering a strong agreement on climate change in Paris.  She has a long history in the field of global climate change, having been a member of the Costa Rican negotiating team 1995-2009, and having played a number of key roles in the governance of the UNFCCC before joining the secretariat. (To Be Confirmed)

Dr. Katharine Hayhoe

Katharine Hayhoe is an atmospheric scientist and associate professor of political science at Texas Tech University, where she is director of the Climate Science Center. She co-authored the book A Climate for Change: Global Warming Facts for Faith-Based Decisions together with her husband, Andrew Farley, and Evangelical Minister.  She also co-authored reports for the US Global Change Research Program, as well as National Academy of Sciences reports, including the 3rd National Climate Assessment, released on May 6, 2014.  Shortly after the report was released, she stated, "Climate change is here and now, and not in some distant time or place," adding "The choices we're making today will have a significant impact on our future."  She has served as an expert reviewer for the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's (IPCC) 4th Assessment Report. Time Magazine listed her among the 100 most influential people on Earth in 2014 for her skill as a climate communicator.

Archbishop Emeritus of Canterbury Rowan Williams Rowan Douglas Williams, Baron Williams of Oystermouth is an Anglican bishop, theologian and poet.  Rev. Williams was the 104th Archbishop of Canterbury, from 2002 until 2012. During and since his tenure as the leading cleric in the Church of England he has been very outspoken on climate change, the human cause and our responsibility for action. He has been a leading voice from the faith community and is a strong orator with a powerful personal presence.

Rev. Richard Cizik

Richard Cizik was the Vice President for Governmental Affairs of the National Association of Evangelicals (NAE) and one of the most prominent Evangelical lobbyists in the United States. In his position with the NAE, Cizik's primary responsibilities were setting the organization's policy on issues and lobbying the White House, Congress, and the Supreme Court. Cizik also served as NAE's national spokesman and edited a monthly magazine, NAE Washington Insight. Since 2003, he has been active in a type of environmentalism known as "creation care"; his stance on global warming has drawn both support and criticism from fellow Evangelicals. He serves on the Board of Advisors of the Nicholas Institute for Environmental Policy Solutions.

Dr. Peter Wadhams (Polar Ice Scientist)

Dr. Wadhams is professor of Ocean Physics, and Head of the Polar Ocean Physics Group in the Department of Applied Mathematics and Theoretical Physics, University of Cambridge. He is best known for his work on sea ice. He is the president of the International Association for the Physical Sciences of the Oceans Commission on Sea Ice and Coordinator for the International Programme for Antarctic Buoys. Wadhams has been the leader of 40 polar field expeditions. He is considered an expert on the impacts that the disappearance of Arctic sea ice will have on climate change, pointing to the high likelihood of the collapse of civilization as early as the middle of this century due to the expected inability of a warming planet to produce enough food for its human inhabitants.

Dr. Wadhams will be coming to the UN climate negotiations for his first time at the invitation of Stuart Scott to participate in a panel discussion on the conditions in the Arctic and what they bode for our future.

Dr. Saleem Huq (Climate Scientist, Adaptation Specialization)

Dr. Huq is a Senior Fellow in the Climate Change Group at the International Institute for Environment and Development in the UK.  Saleemul Huq is an expert on the links between climate change and sustainable development, particularly from the perspective of developing countries. He is also currently Director of the International Centre for Climate Change & Development. Dr. Huq has been a Lead Author in the IPCC’s 3rd, 4th, and 5th Assessment Reports.

Archbishop Serafim Kykkotis (Eastern Orthodox Church)

Archbishop Kykotis is a member of the Central Committee of the World Council of Churches, member of the Southern Africa Faith Communities Environment Institute, and director of the Office on Climate Change for the Patriarchate of Alexandria. Since 2002, he has participated at the United Nations COP conferences. He has authored Church and Environment (Athens, 2012) and participates in the Orthodox-Anglican International Theological Dialogue. He is outspoken on the matter of climate change.


Connecting the Dots

This film will be a wake up call on a grand scale.  It aims to empower viewers with knowledge and inspire in them a commitment to create change while there may still be time.  We will go behind the scenes, spotlighting this critical moment in human history when we are facing our own possible extinction, but choosing to look the other way.Your contribution to the film will help bring about the social tipping point by which we might avert the worst that would lie in store for us in a world of runaway climate change.

Even the economists fear that in a world of runaway climate change we may not be able to muster the financial resources to do what must be done. Please look inside yourself, and support this project, while money still has meaning. 

Our Usual Habits

The vast majority of investment in Western Society goes into activities that make money but degrade or destroy the natural world either directly or indirectly.  We are asking you to be among the .1% of people who will spend their money to restore Nature.  You are used to justifying your expenditures by 'what's in it for me' criteria.  That is what we are taught from childhood.  Here you are being asked to spend according to a criteria of 'what's in it for others', including your children, their children, and all of present and future life on Earth.

Needs
The goal of this campaign is $50,000 to film and document COP-21 and what goes on in and around it.  We have a pool of videographers, sound technicians, editors, producers, and are networked with distributors in Hollywood.  Who can make it to this year's COP-21 to help us film will depend upon your generosity.   That amount will pay for expenses of a crew for the two weeks from November 30-December 11.  Some will come from the US.  Some will already be in Europe.  Many will volunteer time and work for less than 'union scale'.  All will believe in the urgency of this project.

Perks

Visit Our Perks to See Great Items Available With Your Generous Donation

The Impact

This movie will help create the 'social tipping point'  that is needed to speed our response to climate change, over the interference of forces that currently impede that response.

We are much more likely to 'fix' the climate problem out of Hollywood than out of Washington, D.C.

Risks & Challenges 

Time is short.  We must raise money sufficient for transportation, lodging and food for the tight crew.  The risk here is that a small response will blunt the tip of our arrow, by constraining the amount of footage we can shoot at the COP in our effort to 'reveal to humanity the elephant hiding in the room'.

The challenges will be many.  But I have risen above challenges at the annual COPs since 2008 when I began in Poznan, Poland at COP-14.  I am a climate warrior.

Spread the Word

Thank you so much from the entire CLIMATE MATTERS team for your financial support, which will help to raise awareness of what is interfering with needed environmental change.

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU!  PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS ON SOCIAL MEDIA TO HELP SAVE CIVILIZATION.
story_txt:
Our campaign with US tax deductability is athttps://www.indiegogo.com/projects/climate-matters--2/x/10920720#/I Am An Eco-Social StrategistMy name is Stuart Scott.
  I have committed my life to altering civilization's catastrophic 
trajectory in terms of climate and ecology.  Over my professional career
 I was Wall Street's first environmentalist stockbroker in the 1970s, an
 IT consultant to New York City's largest banks and IBM in the 1980s, 
then went from tech to teaching in the 1990s.  I literally quit my day 
job as a university instructor in 2008 to focus full-time on fixing the 
climate problem, and went to where I thought change was most likely to 
come from, the UN-sponsored climate negotiations, known as the COP, or 
Conference of Parties to the Kyoto Protocols.What
 I found was simultaneously hopeful and discouraging, inspiring and 
depressing.  The negotiations were a diplomatic battle between those who
 want to protect the future of humanity and life on Earth, and those 
intent upon making money at all cost, and preserving Business-As-Usual.  It was a modern day tragedy in the making. Since
 then I have focus intensely upon the systemic contradictions within 
society and the individual human psyche that are hurtling us toward a 
collision with Nature.  My work is now to catalyze an understanding of 
the epic battle for the future of civilization and life on Earth that is
 called 'the COP.'Fixing the Climate Crisis from HollywoodChristian Meoli is our Producer.  His company, Voltaire Media, specializes
 in strategic marketing concepts, digital engagement, social media and 
brand identity development for entertainment companies.  Christian also operates Arena Cinema Hollywood,
 one of the top indie movie theaters in Los Angeles.  Previously, as 
Vice President of Marketing for Bigfoot Entertainment, he directed 
numerous domestic and international theatrical and home entertainment 
campaigns, notably the award-winning "9000 Needles."  Christian has been
 featured in the Los Angeles Business Journal and LA Weekly for industry
 insight,  He also has an established career as a working actor, 
appearing in over 100 film/TV programs, most recently NCIS:LA and Ray Donovan.  He has had the good fortune to work with the top echelon of producers and directors in TV/Film.To support CLIMATE MATTERS, charitable donations can be accepted through our fiscal sponsor The Film Collaborative. We are collaborating with Green Planet Films (greenplanetfilms.org),
 founded in 2003 in Northern California, a non-profit distributor 
created to promote environmental education through the artistic power of
 film.  Green Planet Films connects environmental filmmakers 
documenting the relationship between nature and humanity for an evolving
 global movement seeking greater knowledge about the natural world we 
inhabit and depend upon.The Backdrop - COP-21 (Conference of Parties)The
 conference objective is to achieve a universal agreement on climate, 
from all the nations of the world. This campaign will raise the funds to
 film inside of COP-21 in Paris this year, an effort to reveal the elephant in the room. 
 The footage will be crafted into a documentary that lays out in plain, 
understandable terms the tug of war between nations and  governments and
 economic forces and 'civil society '(the people). Our future is being bartered for short term economic gain.  But the consequences are already lapping at our doorstep
 with a real an present danger of the collapse of civilization by 
mid-century.  Governments know of this, but must downplay their 
knowledge because of that elephant in the room.  This is both shocking and enraging.  How could we as a species be so selfish and blind? The Cast 

We will have participation from , but not be limited to the following individuals: 

Stuart ScottStuart is the host of Climate Matters, a series of 
panel discussions in a talk show format that take place at the UN 
climate negotiation.  He is the central unifying character in this 
documentary, and will bring together the other notable people who 
comprise our cast.  He will conduct our interviews provide the narrative
 for events taking place in Paris during this year's COP-21 climate 
negotiations.  Dr. James Hansen


James Hansen is the world’s most famous climate scientist. As Director of NASA’s Goddard Institute
in New York City for 42 years, Dr. Hansen has been sounding the alarm on climate change for 3
decades, through a series of US presidential administrations. A separate page entitled Who Is
James Hansen is submitted as Appendix A. to this proposal.

Dr. Hansen will be attending the UN climate negotiations for the first time since they began at the
invitation of Stuart Scott. He has heretofore avoided the negotiations believing that policy makers
are not discussing real solutions there but rather merely engaging in face-saving rhetoric.



Christiana Figueres

Ms. Figueres has been the Executive Secretary of the United Nations 
Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) since July 2010. She has
 presided over five 
Conferences of the Parties (COPs), and is now faced with the difficult 
task of delivering a strong agreement on climate
 change in Paris.  She has a long history in the field of global climate
 change, 
having been a member of the Costa Rican negotiating team 1995-2009, and
 having played a number of key roles in the governance of the UNFCCC 
before joining the secretariat. (To Be Confirmed)

Dr. Katharine Hayhoe

	
		
		
	
	
		




Katharine Hayhoe is an atmospheric scientist and associate professor of political science at Texas
Tech University, where she is director of the Climate Science Center. She co-authored the book A Climate for Change: Global Warming Facts for
Faith-Based Decisions together with her husband, Andrew Farley, and 
Evangelical Minister.  She also co-authored reports for the US Global 
Change Research Program, as well as National Academy
of Sciences reports, including the 3rd National Climate Assessment, 
released on May 6, 2014. 
Shortly after the report was released, she stated, "Climate change is here and now, and not in some
distant time or place," adding "The choices we're making today will have a significant impact on our
future."  She has served as an expert reviewer for the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's
(IPCC) 4th Assessment Report. Time Magazine listed her among the 100 most influential people
on Earth in 2014 for her skill as a climate communicator.



Archbishop Emeritus of Canterbury Rowan Williams
Rowan Douglas Williams, Baron Williams of Oystermouth is an 
Anglican bishop, theologian and poet.  Rev. Williams was the 104th 
Archbishop of Canterbury, from 2002 until 2012. During and since his
tenure as the leading cleric in the Church of England he has been very 
outspoken on climate
change, the human cause and our responsibility for action. He has been a
 leading voice from the
faith community and is a strong orator with a powerful personal 
presence.

				
	


Rev. Richard Cizik

	
		
		
	
	
		




Richard Cizik was the Vice President for Governmental Affairs of the National Association of
Evangelicals (NAE) and one of the most prominent Evangelical lobbyists in the United States. In his
position with the NAE, Cizik's primary responsibilities were setting the organization's policy on issues
and lobbying the White House, Congress, and the Supreme Court. Cizik also served as NAE's
national spokesman and edited a monthly magazine, NAE Washington Insight. Since 2003, he has
been active in a type of environmentalism known as "creation care"; his stance on global warming
has drawn both support and criticism from fellow Evangelicals. He serves on the Board of Advisors
of the Nicholas Institute for Environmental Policy Solutions.



Dr. Peter Wadhams (Polar Ice Scientist)

	
		
		
	
	
		




Dr. Wadhams is professor of Ocean Physics, and Head of the Polar Ocean Physics Group in the
Department of Applied Mathematics and Theoretical Physics, University of Cambridge. He is best
known for his work on sea ice. He is the president of the International Association for the Physical
Sciences of the Oceans Commission on Sea Ice and Coordinator for the International Programme
for Antarctic Buoys. Wadhams has been the leader of 40 polar field expeditions. He is considered
an expert on the impacts that the disappearance of Arctic sea ice will have on climate change,
pointing to the high likelihood of the collapse of civilization as early as the middle of this century due
to the expected inability of a warming planet to produce enough food for its human inhabitants.

Dr. Wadhams will be coming to the UN climate negotiations for his first time at the invitation of Stuart
Scott to participate in a panel discussion on the conditions in the Arctic and what they bode for our
future.



Dr. Saleem Huq (Climate Scientist, Adaptation Specialization)

	
		
		
	
	
		




Dr. Huq is a Senior Fellow in the Climate Change Group at the International Institute for Environment
and Development in the UK.  Saleemul Huq is an expert on the links between climate change and
sustainable development, particularly from the perspective of developing countries. He is also
currently Director of the International Centre for Climate Change & Development. Dr. Huq has been
a Lead Author in the IPCC’s 3rd, 4th, and 5th Assessment Reports.



Archbishop Serafim Kykkotis (Eastern Orthodox Church)

	
		
		
	
	
		




Archbishop Kykotis is a member of the Central Committee of the World Council of Churches,
member of the Southern Africa Faith Communities Environment Institute, and director of the Office
on Climate Change for the Patriarchate of Alexandria. Since 2002, he has participated at the United
Nations COP conferences. He has authored Church and Environment (Athens, 2012) and
participates in the Orthodox-Anglican International Theological Dialogue. He is outspoken on the
matter of climate change.

grand scale.  It aims to empower viewers with knowledge and inspire in 
them a commitment to create change while there may still be time.  We 
will go behind the scenes, spotlighting this critical moment in human

for us in a world of runaway climate change.Even

That amount will pay for expenses of a crew for the two weeks from

story:
Hey, I have one thing that makes me lie sleepless at nights and that is that our earth is going in to the six mass extinction in its history. That is a trend that I want to change, so I went to Southeast Asia one of the most species rich areas in the world and the area where species are the most threatened, to do something.

In my search in Southeast Asia I found a company Tianzi that is working on a completely different way to use agriculture, it´s called agroforestry. When I came to Tianzi 2012 in Xishuangbanna , south of China they have undergone tragic events, since the co-creator Josef Margraf had passed away and there been a huge forest fire that destroyed much of theirs agroforestry, but Tianzi survived and is keeping up the battle to save species. This is done in one of the most biodiversity rich areas in the world where you could find Tiger, Gibbons, Clouded Leopard, Rhinos, Dhole and many more and if nothing is done it can also lose Elephants, Leopard and Gaur. They work close to Laos and Myanmar, where many species still live so its a high probability for those species to come back if we do something now.

The method Tianzi use agroforestry you search for a way to mimic the natural ecosystem or now rainforest and still produce food.  Then it hit me that this is what I want to dedicate my life to. Because agriculture is one of the crucial reasons of why species are dying out, since it often in monoculture that are one of the largest releases of greenhouse gas (30% of the global emissions), take around 70 % of all freshwater, biggest emissions of nitrogen and phosphor, soil degradation and destroying ecosystem since it cover around 40 % of the earth lands. So instead of monoculture if our agriculture would be like agroforestry it would help store greenhouse gases and freshwater, as well as clean the freshwater, no nitrogen or phosphor emission that cause eutrophication and it would works as a ecosystem that many species can live in harmony with the communities.

So now I wonder how I can support them and then I realized one methods that I study on in my environmental Bachelor and that is biochar. Biochar is an ancient method that was used by the indigenous people of the Amazon for several thousand years ago. It has been rediscovered for several year and scientist are amazed of its qualities. It´s starting to get used now, but only in small scale since its hard to compete with fertilizer, that not takes responsibility for it´s consequences on the nature as eutrophication. Biochar is often even much better but a higher first time cost. Compare to none treated soil it shows 2-3 times higher nitrogen and 4-5 times higher phosphor levels, increase the soil water storage capacities, the nutrient are more easily accessible to plants and it is able to store large amount of carbondioxxid around 450 tons/ hectare. Since the soil often is low on nutrition in rainforest this is very important.

So I thought that this would be a great way to solve many of our earth problem, to name a few loss of biodiversity, degradation of ecosystem, development for poor communities and tackle climate change. To help save species this could work as spreading corridor and buffer zone for national parks, in an addition as agroforestry create habitat for wildlife. Would I use this combination to convert all rubber plantation in Southeast Asia then I would store around 3 % of 2010 CO2 global emissions.

So with your help I want to start a company the store large amount of carbon with biochar and agroforestry, as well save species like Tiger, Rhinos, Gibbon and many more and also develop rural poor areas for start in Southeast Asia and continue too other rainforest around the world.

My budget for expenditure: Total - 100 000$
Carbonization owen:                              15 000$
Chip Boiler                                                   7 000$
Biomass to biochar/mulch                  13 500$
Wages                                                         25 000$
Cost of living                                             16 000$
Marketing                                                     9 500$
Expand Tianzi landarea                         14 000$

Timetable:
1 - 3 month: Inventory of the species in project area.
1 - 6 month: Construct and develope biochar production unit.
4 - 12 month: Producing 150 tons of biochar.
4 - 12 month: Start marketing to expand the project area and protection of the remaining wildlife and rainforest.
13 - 24 month: Applying biochar to soil.
13 - 24 month: Negotiate with local villages of expanding the biochar and agroforestry project.
21 - 24 month: New inventory of the species in the area to see any change, from the first inventory.
