story:
BarkEm’s™ To Go - Portable Pet Meals A pre-packaged meal suited just for your pet. 

Contained in separate compartments inside a recyclable, single use container is one serving of premium select neutral dog food, a compartment of filtered water, and a separately sealed treat for dessert. Conveniently located under the container is your doggy waste bag for later. 

         Endless Uses:
  • Leave in your RV, car trunk or SUV, take Barkem’s to outdoor athletic events, picnics, day trips, camping trips, keep for emergency situations. Great pet gifts for birthdays, holidays, housewarmings, travel bags, and so much more. 
  • 3 sizes to suit all dog breeds. For the Indie GoGo Campaign, we are only producing the Medium Sized BarkEm’s. For small dogs we recommend opening the food compartment half way to the perforation. For large dogs we recommend 2 Medium Sized BarkEm’s. 
  • Individually sealed compartments maximize shelf life.
  • BarkEm’s has been created by a husband and wife team: Jamie St.Clair has 7 years experience in the veterinary industry. Blake St.Clair has 10 years experience in manufacturing and design. Together, Jamie and Blake have combined their creative expertise to bring you the innovative product that you see here. 

What are you doing this weekend? Grab your pooch, a BarkEm's, and Lets go!

1. Place container flat on the ground, 2. Open desired compartments, 3. Your dog does the fun part! 4. Recycle the package and remove any dog waste when with the provided baggie. 

Help Keep Parks and Public Places Clean by using BarkEm's at public Events, Fund Raisers, or Pet Adoption Meetups. 

BarkEm’s™ where food, water, and treat unite!

The concept is simple: Food, water, and a treat all sealed in a recyclable, one-time use package. An added bonus is the attached waste bag that helps keep the community clean and keeps public pet friendly places alive. 

The technical portion and limitations are attached to the cost of the custom sealing machine, and the initial fulfillment of product orders. Originally this new product was launched on a national television program. Reviews, and follow-up post airing convinced us that we should never give up on this product.

In the past few years, we have fully developed the crude prototype into a fully refined ready for shelf product, however we still lack the fulfillment and custom machine to make BarkEm's "GO" per say, 

After lots of hard work, we have fulfilled and executed the following:

  • Fully developed and successful computer aided drafting design. 
  • Small production run to test design, manufacturing process, and sealing possibilities. 
  • Printed and applied heat seal graphic lid.
  • Semi-Automated hand filled tray sealing system. 
  • Intellectual Property Protection: Patented and Trademarked 
  • Full sourcing package that includes manufacturing, fulfillment, packaging, shipping, taxes, logistics, and distribution channels (we know exactly how many BarkEm's™ will make a case, how many cases make a pallet, and how many pallets fit on a shipping container which leaves out all the possible unknown sourcing factors). 

Below are the Logistics for the breakdown of 6x per cellophane set and 6 sets per case = 36 units per case. Then 17 cases fit on a standard shipping pallet which would hold 1224 BarkEm's™ Pet Meals.

When you are traveling with your pet; Which scenario fits your current habits?

Scenario #1:

Large bag of food, bottle of water, bowl for the water, treats, waste bags, and towels for cleanup. As you can on the left below, you need a box to carry it all! 

Scenario #2:

Baggies of food and treats, bottle of water, waste bags. Shown in the middle photo, you could fit all of this in a back pack or large purse. Most dog owners carry at least this much in their car at all times. 

Scenario#3:

BarkEm's™ Portable Pet Meals - one compact sealed package. And if you should forget to take your BarkEm’s with you, they can be found at convenience and pet stores, thus saving the need to buy an entire bag of food.

U.S. pet-ownership estimates from the last census from APPA for 2012 - Dogs: 

  • 83.3 million—Number of owned dogs in the US
  • 47%—Percentage of households that own at least one dog
  • 70%—Percentage of owners with one dog
  • 20%t—Percentage of owners with two dogs
  • 10%—Percentage of owners with three or more dogs
  • 1.47—Average number of dogs per household
  • 20%—Percentage of dogs adopted from animal shelters
  • $231—Average annual amount spent by dog owners on routine veterinary visits
  • 83%—Percentage of dogs who are spayed or neutered

The Funding...

We are asking for $25,000 to fully fund our project. The funding will be primarily used for the custom mold required of the 3 sizes of bowls to be available. Once the molds are complete, there are set-up fees and minimum order quantities to fulfill. We have calculated all of the numbers using current plastic costs and quotes for manufacturing the molds. The remaining funds will go to working with a co-op food packaging facility to retrofit their existing machines to accommodate our products.

In the past, Barkem’s Portable Pet Meals™ required a much higher investment amount to be able to purchase the packing, fulfillment and sealing machines required to produce our product. Owning the machines would have also required us to operate and manage a packaging company and factory. Purchasing these machines to a tune of $100,000 was not a reasonable business model for the Company. 

Blink Blink... the light bulb upstairs turned on! We can use a "commissary Kitchen" (locations that allow rental by the hour, or by the day providing kitchens, packaging machines, and more all with a FDA certification).We decided it only made sense to let the pro’s handle the manufacturing and packaging of our product. Our BarkEm’s team will focus on promotion, fulfillment and company operations. The co-op packaging facility will have in place the certifications required to package pet food, such as FDA and AAFCO, thus saving our Company time, money and resources. 

A Stack of 3 BarkEm's™ Portable Pet Meals Ready for an overnight camping trip.

Risks & Challenges

We have been working on the final development of  BarkEm's™ Portable Pet Meals for over 2 years. It has been 10 years since the BarkEm's™ solution to portable pet feeding was conceived. The molds, dies, prints, graphics, tests, checks, and approvals have all been finalized. We do not, however, have the custom machinery to seal the water compartment properly. With the funds received, we will contract with a pet food packaging co-op to fulfill the packaging segment of our production process. We will supply the co-op with our BarkEm's™ patented and trademarked trays, food and pouches of filtered water, and our pre-printed lids to be sealed. Because we are so far along in the manufacturing process, you, as a contributor, will see product very quickly.

We are almost there, and you can help!

Some More Pet Facts

Over $20 Billion is spent annually on pet food alone. BarkEm's™ is not only food, but water, treats and a waste Bag.

If you do not have a dog, consider your friends and family that do. Give a contribution in honor of your pet loving loved ones!

Statistics show that 47% of Americans own a dog, If you are one of the 53% that isn't a dog owner, we know you have a sister, aunt, or cousin that does. Share our product and our goal with them personally, via e-mail, Twitter, or Facebook. Also consider buying the 4 legged friend a gift that will be new and unique!

If you think our product is awesome, share it on Facebook, E-mail, and/or Twitter. 

Always Thanks, Blake & Jamie St.Clair, and Team BarkEm's™!

         Endless Uses:
Leave in your RV, car trunk or SUV, take Barkem’s to outdoor athletic events, picnics, day trips, camping trips, keep for emergency situations. Great pet gifts for birthdays, holidays, housewarmings, travel bags, and so much more. 
3 sizes to suit all dog breeds. For the Indie GoGo Campaign, we are only producing the Medium Sized BarkEm’s. For small dogs we recommend opening the food compartment half way to the perforation. For large dogs we recommend 2 Medium Sized BarkEm’s. 
Individually sealed compartments maximize shelf life.
BarkEm’s has been created by a husband and wife team: Jamie St.Clair has 7 years experience in the veterinary industry. Blake St.Clair has 10 years experience in manufacturing and design. Together, Jamie and Blake have combined their creative expertise to bring you the innovative product that you see here. 

What are you doing this weekend? Grab your pooch, a BarkEm's, and Lets go!
1. Place container flat on the ground, 2. Open desired compartments, 3. Your dog does the fun part! 4. Recycle the package and remove any dog waste when with the provided baggie. 
Help Keep Parks and Public Places Clean by using BarkEm's at public Events, Fund Raisers, or Pet Adoption Meetups. 
BarkEm’s™ where food, water, and treat unite!



The concept is simple: Food, water, and a treat all sealed in a recyclable, one-time use package. An added bonus is the attached waste bag that helps keep the community clean and keeps public pet friendly places alive. 
The technical portion and limitations are attached to the cost of the custom sealing machine, and the initial fulfillment of product orders. Originally this new product was launched on a national television program. Reviews, and follow-up post airing convinced us that we should never give up on this product.
In the past few years, we have fully developed the crude prototype into a fully refined ready for shelf product, however we still lack the fulfillment and custom machine to make BarkEm's "GO" per say, 
After lots of hard work, we have fulfilled and executed the following:

Fully developed and successful computer aided drafting design. 
Small production run to test design, manufacturing process, and sealing possibilities. 
Printed and applied heat seal graphic lid.
Semi-Automated hand filled tray sealing system. 
Intellectual Property Protection: Patented and Trademarked 
Full sourcing package that includes manufacturing, fulfillment, packaging, shipping, taxes, logistics, and distribution channels (we know exactly how many BarkEm's™ will make a case, how many cases make a pallet, and how many pallets fit on a shipping container which leaves out all the possible unknown sourcing factors). 

Below are the Logistics for the breakdown of 6x per cellophane set and 6 sets per case = 36 units per case. Then 17 cases fit on a standard shipping pallet which would hold 1224 BarkEm's™ Pet Meals.


When you are traveling with your pet; Which scenario fits your current habits?
Scenario #1:

Large bag of food, bottle of water, bowl for the water, treats, waste bags, and towels for cleanup. As you can on the left below, you need a box to carry it all! 
Scenario #2:
Baggies of food and treats, bottle of water, waste bags. Shown in the middle photo, you could fit all of this in a back pack or large purse. Most dog owners carry at least this much in their car at all times. 
Scenario#3:
BarkEm's™ Portable Pet Meals - one compact sealed package. And if you should forget to take your BarkEm’s with you, they can be found at convenience and pet stores, thus saving the need to buy an entire bag of food.

U.S. pet-ownership estimates from the last census from APPA for 2012 - Dogs: 

83.3 million—Number of owned dogs in the US
47%—Percentage of households that own at least one dog
70%—Percentage of owners with one dog
20%t—Percentage of owners with two dogs
10%—Percentage of owners with three or more dogs
1.47—Average number of dogs per household
20%—Percentage of dogs adopted from animal shelters
$231—Average annual amount spent by dog owners on routine veterinary visits
83%—Percentage of dogs who are spayed or neutered




The Funding...
We are asking for $25,000 to fully fund our project. The funding will be primarily used for the custom mold required of the 3 sizes of bowls to be available. Once the molds are complete, there are set-up fees and minimum order quantities to fulfill. We have calculated all of the numbers using current plastic costs and quotes for manufacturing the molds. The remaining funds will go to working with a co-op food packaging facility to retrofit their existing machines to accommodate our products.
In the past, Barkem’s Portable Pet Meals™ required a much higher investment amount to be able to purchase the packing, fulfillment and sealing machines required to produce our product. Owning the machines would have also required us to operate and manage a packaging company and factory. Purchasing these machines to a tune of $100,000 was not a reasonable business model for the Company. 
Blink Blink... the light bulb upstairs turned on! We can use a "commissary Kitchen" (locations that allow rental by the hour, or by the day providing kitchens, packaging machines, and more all with a FDA certification).We decided it only made sense to let the pro’s handle the manufacturing and packaging of our product. Our BarkEm’s team will focus on promotion, fulfillment and company operations. The co-op packaging facility will have in place the certifications required to package pet food, such as FDA and AAFCO, thus saving our Company time, money and resources. 
A Stack of 3 BarkEm's™ Portable Pet Meals Ready for an overnight camping trip.

Risks & Challenges

We have been working on the final development of  BarkEm's™ Portable Pet Meals for over 2 years. It has been 10 years since the BarkEm's™ solution to portable pet feeding was conceived. The molds, dies, prints, graphics, tests, checks, and approvals have all been finalized. We do not, however, have the custom machinery to seal the water compartment properly. With the funds received, we will contract with a pet food packaging co-op to fulfill the packaging segment of our production process. We will supply the co-op with our BarkEm's™ patented and trademarked trays, food and pouches of filtered water, and our pre-printed lids to be sealed. Because we are so far along in the manufacturing process, you, as a contributor, will see product very quickly.
We are almost there, and you can help!
Some More Pet Facts

Over $20 Billion is spent annually on pet food alone. BarkEm's™ is not only food, but water, treats and a waste Bag.

If you do not have a dog, consider your friends and family that do. Give a contribution in honor of your pet loving loved ones!

Statistics show that 47% of Americans own a dog, If you are one of the 53% that isn't a dog owner, we know you have a sister, aunt, or cousin that does. Share our product and our goal with them personally, via e-mail, Twitter, or Facebook. Also consider buying the 4 legged friend a gift that will be new and unique!
If you think our product is awesome, share it on Facebook, E-mail, and/or Twitter. 
Always Thanks, Blake & Jamie St.Clair, and Team BarkEm's™!

story:
What Is The Woody Guthrie?

Since 1978, the sloop Woody Guthrie has given thousands of people their first experience on a sailboat and their first experience of the beauties of the Hudson River and the surrounding mountains from the vantage point of her deck completely free. All they have to do was call for a reservation or come aboard at one of our riverside festivals or community events.

The Woody Guthrie is a 46 foot gaff-rigged, traditional wooden sailboat similar in vintage to the sloop Clearwater (which is a replica of the 18th and 19th century sailboats that carried passengers and goods up and down the river from NYC to Albany and all points in between). The Woody is an open cockpit friendship sloop, capable of carrying a full crew and 12 guests comfortably.  Smaller than the sloops that sailed up and down the river, the Woody is a replica of a Hudson River Ferry Sloop, that ferried folks and cargo from one side of the river to the other.

What Does The Woody Do?

The Woody Guthrie is the flagship of the Beacon Sloop Club, which is an all-volunteer, non-profit organization formed in 1969 to support and promote the mission of the Hudson River Sloop Clearwater and make the river accessable to everyone. We try to focus on local concerns and activities while maintaining a view of how we are part of the larger world. In order to do this we have adopted the following as our mission:

* To Preserve. restore and celebrate the Hudson River and surrounding waterways.

* To promote and encourage interest in sound ecological practices affecting the Hudson River and its environs.

* To organize and arrange associated recreational activities such as concerts, festivals and other community gatherings on the waterfront of Beacon, New York.

* To promote interest in sailing and foster good fellowship and safety in boating: to encourage the sport of boating: to promote the science of seamanship and navigation, and provide access to information and training in the skills and techniques thereof: and to provide and maintain a suitable clubhouse and anchorage for the use and recreation of its members.

The Beacon Sloop Club owns and operates several sailboats and offers both on-the-water training and “Learn to Sail” classes. Our largest boat is the Hudson River Ferry Sloop Woody Guthrie.

Since the launch in 1978 the “Woody Guthrie”, has carried approximately 1,500 guests each season! It is sailed by an all-volunteer captain and crew, and every guest rides for free.

In the fall of 2013, after over 35 years of providing a secure, safe, free Hudson River sailing experience to tens of thousands of guests, we had the boat professionally surveyed and determined that in order to maintain our high standards  of safety for our guests and our volunteers, our beloved boat would need to undergo major repairs.

It has taken our organization (the Beacon Sloop Club) over a year to determine the extent of the work necessary and the proper course of action to get that work done.

35 years of sailing on the Hudson River (and beyond), sometimes in salt water, but mostly in fresh water, and spending every winter on the hard (hauled out on land), has taken a heavy toll on our fair boat.

In fresh water, wood rots, cracks, warps, and just plain ages. Exposed to salt water, iron and steel components and fasteners corrode and weaken.

For its entire lifespan, the ‘Woody Guthrie” has been maintained, repaired, and refreshed mostly by volunteers, using funds provided by the Beacon Sloop Club, but the scope of this undertaking is too large for this approach.

WHAT we need now, is help!  In the form of contributions, large and small, by folks such as yourself who want to see the good work of this fine vessel continue.  Please help us reach our goal of a fully restored “Woody Guthrie".

Where's The Woody?

The Beacon Sloop Club is in the home stretch of a multi-year fundraising effort to replace the original ribs and many planks to allow the Woody to continue to sail and take guests out onto the river for another 35 or more years.

One of the main inspirations for Pete Seeger to have the Woody Guthrie built was his idea that a beautiful, wooden sailboat, such as the ones often depicted in many Hudson River School paintings and prints, if it belonged to the community, would bring together a very diverse group of folks that would be willing to work together in order to sail her, and keep her going, (He once referred to the Woody as the “cheese in the trap”) and that is exactly what has been the 37 year history of this boat. By working together, and sailing together, very different segments of the local population have become a “community” and we are all the richer for it.

If you contribute to this effort, you will be investing in the future…..of this boat, this community, and the health of the Hudson River. You will be investing in yourselves.

Please contribute what you can to help keep providing free sails on the Hudson river! Your donation is tax-deductible since we are registered non-profit. 

What Does The Woody Need Now?

In the fall of 2013, after over 35 years of providing a secure, safe, free Hudson River sailing experience to tens of thousands of guests, we had the boat professionally surveyed and determined that in order to maintain our high standards  of safety for our guests and our volunteers, our beloved boat would need to undergo major repairs.

It has taken our organization (the Beacon Sloop Club) over a year to determine the extent of the work necessary and the proper course of action to get that work done.

We are looking to raise $400,000 to do a complete restoration on the boat. As of summer 2015, the Beacon Sloop Club has raised over $200,000 and needs your help in reaching the rest.

What Will You Get?

We has arranged for a set of unique perks to show the support we have for all donors.

$ 10.00 Supporter: Beacon Sloop Club bumper sticker

$ 20.00 Crew: Beacon Sloop Club bumper sticker & Broad Old River 2  music CD by The Hudson River Sloop Singers

$ 50.00 Shipwright: Beacon Sloop Club bumper sticker, Where is the Woody? - Hat & Broad Old River 2  music CD by The Hudson River Sloop Singers

$ 100.00 Mate: Plank Plaque (sent to you)

$ 250.00 Captain: Plank Plaque + Name on donor wall in BSC Clubhouse

$ 500.00 Patron: Plank plaque, name on wall, 2 tickets to Woody Dinner

$1,000.00 1st Sail: Plank plaque, name on wall, 6 tickets to Woody Dinner

$5,000 Full Table: Plank plaque, name on wall, 10 tickets to Woody Dinner, hat, bumper sticker, cd, special tour of boat restoration

$10,000 Private Sail: Plank plaque, name on wall, 10 tickets to Woody Dinner, hat, bumper sticker, cd, special tour of boat restoration, guest of honor at boat launch, special private sailing concert

How Can We Keep The Woody Sailing?

Currently the Woody Guthrie is at the Hudson Maritime Museum in Kingston, NY. This is where the majority of the restoration will take place over the next year or so. The project has already started, and the amount of work and money needed exceeds what the Beacon Sloop Club has. We need your help to continue the work, and get the Woody Guthrie back in the water and sailing again. 

How Can You Help?

You can help by contributing to the effort to get the Woody Guthrie back in the water, and back to giving free sails to everyone.

You can give a tax deductible cash contribution. (We have and will provide proper forms). No amount is too small. Every dollar helps!

You can write a check for the restoration project and mail to

BEACON SLOOP CLUB INC
PO BOX 527
BEACON, NY 12508

Come Aboard!

You can join the Beacon Sloop Club for $20 and help with this and all of our other volunteer community programs. We need all the help we can get!

Join at : http://www.beaconsloopclub.org

You can volunteer to work on the Woody Guthrie restoration project, and once the project is completed you can help us sail her as a volunteer crew.

You can help us with fundraising activities, such as hosting fundraiser parties, donating goods or services that can be sold or auctioned off, or come up with creative ideas to bring in contributions.

story:
**Para leer en Español, desplácese hacia abajo**

 

 

Welcome to Green Goat Guides 

Climbing and Eco-Adventure Guidebooks

                          

 

 

                                     

Green Goat Guides are a unique series of adventure travel and rock climbing eco-guidebooks that help build awareness around sustainability and holistic living practices.

 

 

 

                                                               

                                               

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                

 

The Green Goat Guide to Portugal

The Green Goat Guide to Portugal will be the first of an international series of eco-adventure travel and climbing guidebooks based upon a holistic perspective. What does this mean? It means that instead of simply gathering information about the climbing areas, camping options, where to eat, etc., readers will find a more inclusive and spatial approach in regards to travel; taking health, eco-tourism and sustainable living methods into consideration with the intention of raising environmental awareness. 

 

                        

 

                                              

Here's what you will find in a Green Goat Guidebook:

 

  1. Climbing and Outdoor Adventure Activities
  2. Beautiful Photos 
  3. Annual Weather Map
  4. Camping/Lodging Options
  5. Local Water Sources
  6. Wild Food Sources/Foraging Options
  7. Wild Medicinal Herb Guide/Foraging Options for First Aid and Emergencies
  8. Delicious Recipes for Health and Fitness Created with Local Ingredients
  9. Medicinal Recipes Created with Indigenous Herbs
  10. Local Wildlife Guides, Animal Rescue Centers and Shelters
  11. Nearby Yoga Studios 
  12. Wellness Centers and Local Retreats
  13. Nearby Meditation, Qigong or Tai Chi Classes
  14. Local Organic and Sustainably Grown Food Options (Farmer's Markets, Health Food Shops, etc.)
  15. Holistic Health Care Options (Chiropractic Care, Massage, Acupuncture, Herbalism, etc.)
  16. Re-Used and Recycled Clothing Shops
  17. Local Volunteer Opportunities 
  18. A list of all Local Eco-Friendly, "Green"  Businesses  and more!
 
 

 

                                                                 

 

 

                                                         

 

 

This is no ordinary travel guide. The Green Goat is a mindful creation meant to help educate and build awareness around sustainable living and holistic health practices, planting seeds of wellness for our future generations and this beautiful planet we all inhabit. Your contribution will help transform this vision into a reality. 

 

 

 

 

                                                          

 

                                                                                                  
Cost Breakdown
 

1. Transportation: 500 

2. Lodging: 1000

3. Food: 1000 

4. GoPro Camera: 300 (re-furbished)

5. Mac Book Computer: 900 (re-furbished)

* This ancient PC travel laptop that I'm typing from is not going to cut it. I will be using iAuthor to create this book series, and need an Apple computer to use the program. 

6. Miscellaneous: 200 

* For the little odds and ends that tend to pop up along the way...visits to local sites, replacing gear, etc.

                                                                                

                                                              

The Impact

By contributing to The Green Goat project you are not only supporting a creative dream, you are helping to plant seeds for a better world by shining a light on sustainable living and holistic health. 

Green Goat Guidebooks are written for everyone from outdoor enthusiasts and adventurists, climbers, budget travelers and backpackers, yogis, alternative healers, herbalists, vegetarians and health-conscious eaters, environmental activists, artists, and all those who live outside the box and believe in creating a more harmonious world.

Be the Change.

 

                                                             

 

 

 

     Bienvenidos a Green Goat Guides 

          Escalar y Eco-Adventura Guías de Viajar

 

                                                         
Green Goat Guides son una serie única de escalada en roca y viajes de aventura guías que ayudan a crear conciencia en torno a la sostenibilidad y la vida holística. 

 

 

 

                                                                                                                               

 

 

                                                  

 

 

'The Green Goat' es una guía de escalada en roca en base a una perspectiva holística. ¿Qué significa esto? Esto significa que en lugar de limitarse a la recopilación de información acerca de las zonas de escalada, grados, rutas, opciones de camping, etc., usando un enfoque más inclusivo y espacial en lo que respecta a la escalada en roca y los viajes; teniendo salud, el turismo ecológico y los métodos de vida sostenibles en consideración con la intención de elevar la conciencia ambiental.

 

                                                       

                                             

He aquí un resumen de lo que será cubierto en cada región:

  1. Escalar y Adventura Guias
  2. Fotos Hermosos 
  3. Anual Mapa Tiempo
  4. Opciones de Cabañas y Alojamiento
  5. Agua Potable
  6. Alimentos Silvestres/Opciones Forraje
  7. Medicinales Silvestres de la Hierba/Guía del Forraje Opciones para Primeros Auxilios y Emergencias
  8. Recetas Deliciosas para la Salud y Aptidud Creado con Ingredientes Locales
  9. Recetas Medicinales Creado con Hierbas Indígenas
  10. Guía Local de Flora y Fauna
  11. Caminatas Regionales y Actividades al Aire Libre
  12. Estudios de Yoga
  13. Clases de Meditación de Qigong o Tai Chi
  14. Orgánica Local y Cultivados de Manera Sostenible Opciones de Comida (Mercados de Agricultores, Salud Tiendas de Alimentación, etc.)
  15. Saludo Integral Opciones (Atención Quiropráctica, Masaje, Acupuntura, Herbolaria, etc.)
  16. Reutilizado y Reciclado Tiendas de Ropa
  17. Oportunidades para Voluntarios Locales
  18. Una Lista de Todos las Empresas "Verdes" Locales
                                    

                                                             

 

Esta no es una guía común. La 'Green Goat' es una creación consciente intención de ayudar a educar y crear conciencia en torno a la vida sostenible y las prácticas de salud integral, la plantación de semillas de bienestar para nuestras futuras generaciones y este hermoso planeta que todos habitamos. Su contribución ayudará a transformar esta visión en una realidad.
                             

Costo del Proyecto

 

1. Transporte: 500

2. Alojamiento: 1000

3. Comida: 1000

4. GoPro Cámara: 300 (remodelada)

* GoPro es perfecto para todo lo que tengo que hacer para este proyecto. Toma fotografías excelentes, es pequeño y ligero, y es perfecto para vídeos de deportes/acción.

5. Mac Book Computadora: 900 (remodelada)

* Voy a usar iAuthor para crear esta serie de libros, y la necesidad de un computadora Apple para hacerlo.

6. Otros: 200

* Para los más pequeños cachivaches que tienden a aparecer en el camino...visitas a sitios locales, equipo de sustitución, etc.

 

 

                                                                                  

El Impacto

Al participar en el Proyecto 'Green Goat' a que no sólo está apoyando un sueño creativo, usted está ayudando a plantar las semillas de un mundo mejor. Estoy dedicado a una vida sostenible, la educación, la limpieza del medio ambiente, la salud integral y el bienestar.

Las guías están escritas para a todos, desde amantes del aire libre, escaladores, los viajeros de presupuesto y mochileros, yoguis, sanadores alternativos, herbolarios, vegetarianos y para los consumidores conscientes de la salud, activistas ambientales, artistas y todos los que viven fuera de la caja y creen en la creación de un mundo más hermoso.
story_txt:
**Para leer en Español, desplácese hacia abajo**
 
 

Welcome to Green Goat Guides 

Climbing and Eco-Adventure Guidebooks
                          
 

 


                                     


Green Goat Guides are a unique series of adventure travel and rock climbing eco-guidebooks that help build awareness around sustainability and holistic living practices.
 
 
 

                                                               


                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
 
The Green Goat Guide to Portugal
The Green Goat Guide to Portugal will be the first of an international series of eco-adventure travel and climbing guidebooks based upon a holistic perspective. What does this mean? It means that instead of simply gathering information about the climbing areas, camping options, where to eat, etc., readers will find a more inclusive and spatial approach in regards to travel; taking health, eco-tourism and sustainable living methods into consideration with the intention of raising environmental awareness. 
 


                        

 

                                              

Here's what you will find in a Green Goat Guidebook:
 

Climbing and Outdoor Adventure Activities
Beautiful Photos 
Annual Weather Map
Camping/Lodging Options
Local Water Sources
Wild Food Sources/Foraging Options
Wild Medicinal Herb Guide/Foraging Options for First Aid and Emergencies
Delicious Recipes for Health and Fitness Created with Local Ingredients
Medicinal Recipes Created with Indigenous Herbs
Local Wildlife Guides, Animal Rescue Centers and Shelters
Nearby Yoga Studios 
Wellness Centers and Local Retreats
Nearby Meditation, Qigong or Tai Chi Classes
Local Organic and Sustainably Grown Food Options (Farmer's Markets, Health Food Shops, etc.)
Holistic Health Care Options (Chiropractic Care, Massage, Acupuncture, Herbalism, etc.)
Re-Used and Recycled Clothing Shops
Local Volunteer Opportunities 
A list of all Local Eco-Friendly, "Green"  Businesses  and more!

 
 
 

                                                                 
 
 

                                                         

 
 

This is no ordinary travel guide. The Green Goat is a mindful creation meant to help educate and build awareness around sustainable living and holistic health practices, planting seeds of wellness for our future generations and this beautiful planet we all inhabit. Your contribution will help transform this vision into a reality. 

 
 
 
 

                                                          
 

                                                                                                  

Cost Breakdown 
1. Transportation: 500 
2. Lodging: 1000
3. Food: 1000 
4. GoPro Camera: 300 (re-furbished)
5. Mac Book Computer: 900 (re-furbished)
* This ancient PC travel laptop that I'm typing from is not going to cut it. I will be using iAuthor to create this book series, and need an Apple computer to use the program. 
6. Miscellaneous: 200 
* For the little odds and ends that tend to pop up along the way...visits to local sites, replacing gear, etc.
                                                                                


                                                              
The Impact
By contributing to The Green Goat project you are not only supporting a creative dream, you are helping to plant seeds for a better world by shining a light on sustainable living and holistic health. 
Green Goat Guidebooks are written for everyone from outdoor enthusiasts and adventurists, climbers, budget travelers and backpackers, yogis, alternative healers, herbalists, vegetarians and health-conscious eaters, environmental activists, artists, and all those who live outside the box and believe in creating a more harmonious world.
Be the Change.
 

                                                             
   


     Bienvenidos a Green Goat Guides 
          Escalar y Eco-Adventura Guías de Viajar
 


                                                         

Green Goat Guides son una serie única de escalada en roca y viajes de aventura guías que ayudan a crear conciencia en torno a la sostenibilidad y la vida holística. 
 
 

 

                                                                                                                               

 
 

                                                  

 
 
'The Green Goat' es una guía de escalada en roca en base a una perspectiva holística. ¿Qué significa esto? Esto significa que en lugar de limitarse a la recopilación de información acerca de las zonas de escalada, grados, rutas, opciones de camping, etc., usando un enfoque más inclusivo y espacial en lo que respecta a la escalada en roca y los viajes; teniendo salud, el turismo ecológico y los métodos de vida sostenibles en consideración con la intención de elevar la conciencia ambiental.
 
                                                       


                                             
He aquí un resumen de lo que será cubierto en cada región:

Escalar y Adventura Guias
Fotos Hermosos 
Anual Mapa Tiempo
Opciones de Cabañas y Alojamiento
Agua Potable
Alimentos Silvestres/Opciones Forraje
Medicinales Silvestres de la Hierba/Guía del Forraje Opciones para Primeros Auxilios y Emergencias
Recetas Deliciosas para la Salud y Aptidud Creado con Ingredientes Locales
Recetas Medicinales Creado con Hierbas Indígenas
Guía Local de Flora y Fauna
Caminatas Regionales y Actividades al Aire Libre
Estudios de Yoga
Clases de Meditación de Qigong o Tai Chi
Orgánica Local y Cultivados de Manera Sostenible Opciones de Comida (Mercados de Agricultores, Salud Tiendas de Alimentación, etc.)
Saludo Integral Opciones (Atención Quiropráctica, Masaje, Acupuntura, Herbolaria, etc.)
Reutilizado y Reciclado Tiendas de Ropa
Oportunidades para Voluntarios Locales
Una Lista de Todos las Empresas "Verdes" Locales

                                    


                                                             
 

Esta no es una guía común. La 'Green Goat' es una creación consciente intención de ayudar a educar y crear conciencia en torno a la vida sostenible y las prácticas de salud integral, la plantación de semillas de bienestar para nuestras futuras generaciones y este hermoso planeta que todos habitamos. Su contribución ayudará a transformar esta visión en una realidad.
                             

Costo del Proyecto
 
1. Transporte: 500
2. Alojamiento: 1000
3. Comida: 1000
4. GoPro Cámara: 300 (remodelada)
* GoPro es perfecto para todo lo que tengo que hacer para este proyecto. Toma fotografías excelentes, es pequeño y ligero, y es perfecto para vídeos de deportes/acción.
5. Mac Book Computadora: 900 (remodelada)
* Voy a usar iAuthor para crear esta serie de libros, y la necesidad de un computadora Apple para hacerlo.
6. Otros: 200
* Para los más pequeños cachivaches que tienden a aparecer en el camino...visitas a sitios locales, equipo de sustitución, etc.
 
 

                                                                                  
El Impacto
Al participar en el Proyecto 'Green Goat' a que no sólo está apoyando un sueño creativo, usted está ayudando a plantar las semillas de un mundo mejor. Estoy dedicado a una vida sostenible, la educación, la limpieza del medio ambiente, la salud integral y el bienestar.
Las guías están escritas para a todos, desde amantes del aire libre, escaladores, los viajeros de presupuesto y mochileros, yoguis, sanadores alternativos, herbolarios, vegetarianos y para los consumidores conscientes de la salud, activistas ambientales, artistas y todos los que viven fuera de la caja y creen en la creación de un mundo más hermoso.

story:
All Aboard - Help Us Get on the Ferry!

For 25 years the Watershed Sentinel has been the environmental news magazine in Canada. We write about the things Harper doesn't want you to know.
With very little ads and no government or institutional funding,  we are truly a grassroots publication and keep afloat via subscriptions and donations.

We may not have a circulation team to garner new subscribers like some of the larger magazines, but we have YOU - our friends. And for this we are thankful!

So, we've decided to raise money via this online fundraising campaign to bring us to the magazine stand on BC Ferries.

That's right , we're going on the ferry!

We will be on the Horseshoe Bay-Langdale ferry that travels to the sunshine coast of British Columbia for 6 months, beginning this summer. 

We want to reach a new audience, because let's face it, not everyone has heard of what a great magazine we are. And we need subscribers to keep us afloat.

Contributing to the campaign will pay for the placement fee on the ferry and the additional print run.

Please consider donating to help bring the Watershed Sentinel to new readers on the high seas - and check out our fabulous perks!

How It Works

1. Choose how much you would like to donate and if you would like, choose a perk.

2. Fill in your credit card or PayPal information

It's that easy!

Some of our Perks:

               


You can also contribute by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with your friends via email, Facebook or Twitter. Just copy and paste the  Indiegogo URL link

Keeping Media Independent

Over the years we've reported, not only on issues that are now reaching the mainstream - oil and gas pipelines, trade deals, muzzled scientists, water, food security and First Nations - but dig behind the scenes to uncover the who, why and how of it .

Our articles come from environmental organizations and community folks who need an avenue to tell their story, as well as high profile people such as David Suzuki, Maude Barlow, and Elizabeth May, and our award-winning investigative reporter, Joyce Nelson.

It is Canadian media that WE the people create. 


Not a Subscriber Yet? Join Us!

$25 for one year, $40 for two years,  or a take advantage of our bundle bargain.
Click HERE to subscribe and help grow Canadian independent media.

Why Support Us?

We report about and advocate for environmental issues so you know what’s really happening to the world around you. In an increasingly digital world – print is struggling, and media conglomerates who are tied to their advertisers don't spend money on investigative journalism. 

The Watershed Sentinel provides a forum for intelligent discussion about environmental issues and their broader social implications. Our articles have been featured and/or referenced by the Globe and Mail, The Guardian, rabble.ca, The Tyee, Vancouver Observer, Huffington Post, MiningWatch, Council of Canadians and Oxfam.

The Watershed Sentinel is more than just a magazine.

We have been the voice of the grassroots environmental movement in Canada. When Canadian environmental community groups and thinkers want to have their story heard, they contact us and we share their story via our magazine, website or our Facebook page. We are connected to many environmental and activist organizations and people, so are able to glean the press releases and action alerts that come across our desk and get the word out quickly to you.

Our website is a hub for the latest environmental news stories from our colleagues and from other news sources. We also sponsor and are involved in community events here in our Vancouver Island home.

If you haven't checked out our website to get the latest updates on environmental news do so HERE


Our History

The Watershed Sentinel has come a long way from its beginnings 25 years ago as a community newsletter on Cortes Island, BC. Throughout the years, Editrix, Delores Broten, has remained at the helm, using her investigative journalist skills and a network of activist colleagues to provide articles that meet a high standard of writing.

story:
Red Wagon Goats

We are Red Wagon Goats, a goat rental for land remediation business owned and operated by Decatur residents Megan Kibby and Jason Lewis. Jason is the goat expert, along with being a craftsman, climber, slack liner and animal enthusiast. Megan is a graphic designer and marketer, who also teaches yoga and performs burlesque. 

So many people have been coming to us, ready to rent some goats, but there are a few ducks we need to get in a row before we can help Atlanta get OFF chemicals and ON goats: that's where YOU come in. You can donate any amount you want to contribute to a chemical free community, but we've offered some perks we think you'll love to say thank you for your support.

(You may opt out of perks if you'd like your entire donation to go to the fundraiser. ANY donation of $50 or more, whether for a perk or not is invited to join us for our Meet & Greet Launch Party.)

 

What We Need

We've got goats, but there's a LOT we need in order to bring these guys to the community:

  • More Goats. Bobby McGee and family are a great start, but if we are going to meet our customers' needs, we will need to grow the herd!  
  • Transport. While crates in the back of a pick up truck may be fine for just a few goats, we are growing and our transportation needs to grow too. The biggest, most expensive item we need is a live stock trailer. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still be going into business, but we might be making LOTS of trips to get the whole heard from place to place. If we exceed our goal, we would like to invest in an electric or hybrid vehicle for towing our transportation, so that we can be as sustainable as possible. 
  • Fencing & Dwelling. We need portable electric fencing so that we can keep these guys safe from predators and escape when they do their traveling. If we reach our goal, we will be able to not only give them electric fencing, but portable covered shelter to stay dry and happy.
  • Guardian/Herd Dogs. We need trained dogs to protect the herd from predators and help us manage the goats during transportation. 
  • Equipment. We want the finished results to be great—we assist the goats in their landscaping duties. They clear the big stuff, and we do the fine tuning. We also need to be able to clear undesirable, toxic plants before the goats can come. 
  • Vet Care. Goats require pretty minimal veterinary care as pets, but once they start "working" they tend to need more care, and we'd like to be able to get them certified.
  • Start Up Costs. Name reservation. Insurance. Operations. Website. Marketing: it's going to take a lot to get our name out there and spread the word, so we will need advertising and paid social media campaigns.

 

Mission Statement

Red Wagon Goats is a company made up of fun-loving (but hard-working) goats and the humans that love them. We offer a sustainable and rewarding approach to clearing and managing overgrown landscapes. Our promise is to provide excellent care to our goats; quality service and affordable solutions to our community; to do our part in leaving a healthy environment for future generations to inherit; and to be good stewards of our planet. 

 

Who is a good candidate for land clearing?

  • Residential, commercial and rural land that is overgrown
  • Land that is covered in unwanted brush, tall grass, weeds, leaves, invasive species, english ivy, poison ivy, poison sumac and kudzu
  • Land that has not recently been sprayed with chemical pesticides, herbicides or fertilizers 
  • Land that is not abundant with azaleas, rhododendrons, nandina or other toxic species (although we can remove prior to the goats arrival, or build electric fencing around it as a workaround) 
  • As goats will eat almost anything in sight, highly landscaped areas where desirable plants are abundant may not be appropriate 
  • A fence is great but not required. For anyone with a fence shorter than 5 feet, we will install electric fencing
  • People looking to keep themselves, their children, pets and gardens safe from harmful chemicals
     

How does it work?

  1. Visit our website (coming soon!) and fill out the application. 
  2. We'll be in touch soon to set up a consultation. The $50 consultation fee is applied to the cost of service. 
  3. We will come out and check out your land and talk through your needs so that we can provide you with a custom estimate. 
  4. We will do any prep work required – any landscaping that needs to be done by hand ahead of time, such as removing unwanted toxic plants like nandina. We will set up electric fencing if you have no fence or a short fence, or plants you would like protected. 
  5. We will bring the goats to you! Trip time for a typical yard is 1–2 weeks. 
  6. While they're there, we will come out and check on them regularly. You can save money by opting to provide water and food daily. 
  7. Once your land is clear, we will bring the goats home and do any finishing touches needed, and we'll provide you with a survey to let us know what we did well and what we can improve. 
  8. With continued use of the goats, ivy and other undesirable plants will experience "shock" with no available photosynthesis and growth will eventually subside. 

 

Environmental & Health Impact

We don't want to alarm you, but there is a large community of scientists studying the effects of lawn and agricultural chemicals. Here are some studies we found that inspired us to help people get OFF chemicals: 

  • Cancer in Humans. A review of 44 scientific studies found that exposure to glysphosate (the main ingredient in herbicides like RoundUp) doubles farmers' risk of developing non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. The study authors theorize that Roundup disrupts the normal functioning of white blood cells, throwing an immune system into a sickened, dysfunctional state (source: www.rodalesorganiclife.com)
     
  • Pet Cancer. 

    An article in Abstract of Environmental Health 112(1): 171-6 (Jan. 2012), shows a link between lawn chemicals and cancer in dogs.  Scientists found that dogs with malignant lymphoma were 70% more likely to live in a home where professionally applied lawn pesticides had been used. Dogs with serious malignancy were also 170% more likely to come from homes where owners used chemical insecticides.

  • It's in the air. Each year, nonorganic farmers dump millions of pounds of Roundup on food crops. The levels are so excessive, that the federal scientists recently detected the weed killer in the air and rain.
     
  • Health issues. Exposure to Roundup could potentially alter your hormones, leading to obesity, heart problems, and diabetes, according to Warren Porter, PhD, professor of environmental toxicology and zoology at the University of Wisconsin–Madison, based on data collected by the United States Geological Survey.
     
  • Your garden. Run off of herbicides into your garden can affect the fruit and vegetables you grow, which can in turn affect your gut health. Glyphosate is registered as an antimicrobial agent in the U.S. because it can wipe out a wide variety of pathogenic organisms, including protective microorganisms in the gut. These are needed to fight off harmful pathogens like Clostridium botulinum, Salmonella, and E. coli, to combat "leaky gut," where the protective gut lining is compromised, allowing bacteria and toxins to escape into your bloodstream, and for proper absorption of nutrients (key in brain development). 
     
  • Butterflies. Researchers at Iowa State University found that the heavy use of glyphosate has resulted in an 81 percent decrease in the monarch butterfly population. Traditionally, milkweed—the plants monarchs need to reproduce and survive as a species (not butterfly bush)—would rebound after farmers used cultivation to kill weeds, but chemical interventions wipe the plant out.
     
  • Honeybees. The National Agriculture Statistics Service has reported a drop in numbers from more than 5 million to less than 2.5 million honeybees, but pesticides are not the only culprit. A new study shows that glyphosate, the active ingredient in Monsanto's Roundup herbicide, can disrupt learning behaviors in honeybees and severely impair long-term colony performance.
     
  • Toxicity for unborn. In 2009, French researchers published a scientific paper in the journal Chemical Research in Toxicology showing that low levels of four glyphosate formulations used in Roundup—levels far below what's allowed in agriculture; levels on par with what's in our food—all kill human umbilical, embryonic, and placental cells within 24 hours.
     
  • Roundup Isn't Effective. Abusing Roundup has fueled the emergence of nearly impossible-to-kill superweeds.Genetically engineering crop seeds to live through herbicide sprayings that would normally kill the crop is a failed technology and a losing battle. Just as overusing antibiotics led to hard-to-kill, antibiotic-resistant supergerms. 

(Sources: www.dogsnaturallymagazine.com, gmwatch.org, rodalesorganiclife.com)

 

Goats are incredible animals

Here are some fun facts about goats.

  • Goats were one of the first animals to be tamed by humans.
  • Goats are herd animals and will become depressed and feel unsafe if kept without any goat companions. 
  • Goats’ pupils are rectangular and horizontal. This gives them vision for 320 to 340 degrees (compared to humans with 160-210) around them without having to move and they are thought to have excellent night vision. 
  • Goats are browsers, NOT grazers. They don't stay in one spot for too long, they move around looking for new and exciting vegetation to try. 
  • Goats have four “stomachs.” Their food moves first into the rumen (from which it is periodically regurgitated for more “cud chewing”), then to the reticulum, later to the omasum, and finally to the abomasum.
     

Looking forward

We have big dreams for this company. Our goals for the shape this business takes include:

  • Rentals. Our primary goal for rentals is land clearing, but we also see potential for people to rent baby goats to aid in treating depression, or even our smaller ones for parties (like a petting zoo!)

  • Responsible breeding. Our plan is to primarily source Spanish goats which are endangered (and great brush clearers). When we have the size herd we need, we see potential profit in breeding hardy, disease-free goats, and helping more people become goat owners.
     
  • Dairy. We plan on keeping new moms and their babies at the homestead, and eventually want to get set up to milk them: goat milk, yogurt, kefir, cheese, lotion, soap... the sky's the limit.
     
  • Goat Yoga. Megan is a certified yoga instructor and plans to offer goat yoga in kidding season. 
     
  • Education & Consultation. We would like to help people who wish to become goat owners set up their own homestead, identifying toxic plants on the land, fence security and setting up the ideal shelter for their needs. Also, potentially donating our time to schools and children' programs to help spread the love of goats and sustainable practices. 
     
  • Gardening & Outdoor Construction. The whole reason we got goats was to have a safe, enjoyable outdoor space and an organic garden. We eventually want to help other people with their outdoor spaces – from beautiful fencing, to garden construction and consultation—even tree houses and ponds, the long term goal is that we are a team with the goats to create great outdoor spaces. 

Thank you so much for your time in learning about our vision. We hope that you'll consider making a donation, whether it is for a perk, or just to contribute to a business with what we believe is a great cause.

More Goats. Bobby McGee and family are a great start, but if we are going to meet our customers' needs, we will need to grow the herd!  

Transport. While crates in the back of a pick up truck may be fine for just a few goats, we are growing and our transportation needs to grow too. The biggest, most expensive item we need is a live stock trailer. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still be going into business, but we might be making LOTS of trips to get the whole heard from place to place. If we exceed our goal, we would like to invest in an electric or hybrid vehicle for towing our transportation, so that we can be as sustainable as possible. 

Fencing & Dwelling. We need portable electric fencing so that we can keep these guys safe from predators and escape when they do their traveling. If we reach our goal, we will be able to not only give them electric fencing, but portable covered shelter to stay dry and happy.

Guardian/Herd Dogs. We need trained dogs to protect the herd from predators and help us manage the goats during transportation. 

Equipment. We want the finished results to be great—we assist the goats in their landscaping duties. They clear the big stuff, and we do the fine tuning. We also need to be able to clear undesirable, toxic plants before the goats can come. 

Vet Care. Goats require pretty minimal veterinary care as pets, but once they start "working" they tend to need more care, and we'd like to be able to get them certified.

Start Up Costs. Name reservation. Insurance. Operations. Website. Marketing: it's going to take a lot to get our name out there and spread the word, so we will need advertising and paid social media campaigns.

 
Mission Statement
Red Wagon Goats is a company made up of fun-loving (but hard-working) goats and the humans that love them. We offer a sustainable and rewarding approach to clearing and managing overgrown landscapes. Our promise is to provide excellent care to our goats; quality service and affordable solutions to our community; to do our part in leaving a healthy environment for future generations to inherit; and to be good stewards of our planet. 
 

Who is a good candidate for land clearing?

Residential, commercial and rural land that is overgrown
Land that is covered in unwanted brush, tall grass, weeds, leaves, invasive species, english ivy, poison ivy, poison sumac and kudzu
Land that has not recently been sprayed with chemical pesticides, herbicides or fertilizers 
Land that is not abundant with azaleas, rhododendrons, nandina or other toxic species (although we can remove prior to the goats arrival, or build electric fencing around it as a workaround) 
As goats will eat almost anything in sight, highly landscaped areas where desirable plants are abundant may not be appropriate 
A fence is great but not required. For anyone with a fence shorter than 5 feet, we will install electric fencing
People looking to keep themselves, their children, pets and gardens safe from harmful chemicals 

How does it work?

Visit our website (coming soon!) and fill out the application. 
We'll be in touch soon to set up a consultation. The $50 consultation fee is applied to the cost of service. 
We will come out and check out your land and talk through your needs so that we can provide you with a custom estimate. 
We will do any prep work required – any landscaping that needs to be done by hand ahead of time, such as removing unwanted toxic plants like nandina. We will set up electric fencing if you have no fence or a short fence, or plants you would like protected. 
We will bring the goats to you! Trip time for a typical yard is 1–2 weeks. 
While they're there, we will come out and check on them regularly. You can save money by opting to provide water and food daily. 
Once your land is clear, we will bring the goats home and do any finishing touches needed, and we'll provide you with a survey to let us know what we did well and what we can improve. 
With continued use of the goats, ivy and other undesirable plants will experience "shock" with no available photosynthesis and growth will eventually subside. 

 
Environmental & Health Impact
We don't want to alarm you, but there is a large community of scientists studying the effects of lawn and agricultural chemicals. Here are some studies we found that inspired us to help people get OFF chemicals: 


Cancer in Humans. A review of 44 scientific studies found that exposure to glysphosate (the main ingredient in herbicides like RoundUp) doubles farmers' risk of developing non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. The study authors theorize that Roundup disrupts the normal functioning of white blood cells, throwing an immune system into a sickened, dysfunctional state (source: www.rodalesorganiclife.com) 

Pet Cancer. An article in Abstract of Environmental Health 112(1): 171-6 (Jan. 2012), shows a link between lawn chemicals and cancer in dogs.  Scientists found that dogs with malignant lymphoma were 70% more likely to live in a home where professionally applied lawn pesticides had been used. Dogs with serious malignancy were also 170% more likely to come from homes where owners used chemical insecticides.


It's in the air. Each year, nonorganic farmers dump millions of pounds of Roundup on food crops. The levels are so excessive, that the federal scientists recently detected the weed killer in the air and rain. 

Health issues. Exposure to Roundup could potentially alter your hormones, leading to obesity, heart problems, and diabetes, according to Warren Porter, PhD, professor of environmental toxicology and zoology at the University of Wisconsin–Madison, based on data collected by the United States Geological Survey. 

Your garden. Run off of herbicides into your garden can affect the fruit and vegetables you grow, which can in turn affect your gut health. Glyphosate is registered as an antimicrobial agent in the U.S. because it can wipe out a wide variety of pathogenic organisms, including protective microorganisms in the gut. These are needed to fight off harmful pathogens like Clostridium botulinum, Salmonella, and E. coli, to combat "leaky gut," where the protective gut lining is compromised, allowing bacteria and toxins to escape into your bloodstream, and for proper absorption of nutrients (key in brain development).  

Butterflies. Researchers at Iowa State University found that the heavy use of glyphosate has resulted in an 81 percent decrease in the monarch butterfly population. Traditionally, milkweed—the plants monarchs need to reproduce and survive as a species (not butterfly bush)—would rebound after farmers used cultivation to kill weeds, but chemical interventions wipe the plant out. 

Honeybees. The National Agriculture Statistics Service has reported a drop in numbers from more than 5 million to less than 2.5 million honeybees, but pesticides are not the only culprit. A new study shows that glyphosate, the active ingredient in Monsanto's Roundup herbicide, can disrupt learning behaviors in honeybees and severely impair long-term colony performance. 

Toxicity for unborn. In 2009, French researchers published a scientific paper in the journal Chemical Research in Toxicology showing that low levels of four glyphosate formulations used in Roundup—levels far below what's allowed in agriculture; levels on par with what's in our food—all kill human umbilical, embryonic, and placental cells within 24 hours. 

Roundup Isn't Effective. Abusing Roundup has fueled the emergence of nearly impossible-to-kill superweeds.Genetically engineering crop seeds to live through herbicide sprayings that would normally kill the crop is a failed technology and a losing battle. Just as overusing antibiotics led to hard-to-kill, antibiotic-resistant supergerms. 

(Sources: www.dogsnaturallymagazine.com, gmwatch.org, rodalesorganiclife.com)
 

Goats are incredible animals
Here are some fun facts about goats.

Goats were one of the first animals to be tamed by humans.
Goats are herd animals and will become depressed and feel unsafe if kept without any goat companions. 
Goats’ pupils are rectangular and horizontal. This gives them vision for 320 to 340 degrees (compared to humans with 160-210) around them without having to move and they are thought to have excellent night vision. 
Goats are browsers, NOT grazers. They don't stay in one spot for too long, they move around looking for new and exciting vegetation to try. 
Goats have four “stomachs.” Their food moves first into the rumen (from which it is periodically regurgitated for more “cud chewing”), then to the reticulum, later to the omasum, and finally to the abomasum. 

Looking forward
We have big dreams for this company. Our goals for the shape this business takes include: 

Rentals. Our primary goal for rentals is land clearing, but we also see potential for people to rent baby goats to aid in treating depression, or even our smaller ones for parties (like a petting zoo!)

Responsible breeding. Our plan is to primarily source Spanish goats which are endangered (and great brush clearers). When we have the size herd we need, we see potential profit in breeding hardy, disease-free goats, and helping more people become goat owners. 

Dairy. We plan on keeping new moms and their babies at the homestead, and eventually want to get set up to milk them: goat milk, yogurt, kefir, cheese, lotion, soap... the sky's the limit. 

Goat Yoga. Megan is a certified yoga instructor and plans to offer goat yoga in kidding season.  

Education & Consultation. We would like to help people who wish to become goat owners set up their own homestead, identifying toxic plants on the land, fence security and setting up the ideal shelter for their needs. Also, potentially donating our time to schools and children' programs to help spread the love of goats and sustainable practices.  

Gardening & Outdoor Construction. The whole reason we got goats was to have a safe, enjoyable outdoor space and an organic garden. We eventually want to help other people with their outdoor spaces – from beautiful fencing, to garden construction and consultation—even tree houses and ponds, the long term goal is that we are a team with the goats to create great outdoor spaces. 

Thank you so much for your time in learning about our vision. We hope that you'll consider making a donation, whether it is for a perk, or just to contribute to a business with what we believe is a great cause.

story:
Home - Kids - Pets - Commercial Uses

Giant Sized 21" x 15"

Under 1/4 " Thickness

 

(Packaged 10 Per Box)

More Designs At TidyMat.com

 

OUR STORY

Tidy Mat is a USA start-up corporation based out of Saint Petersburg, Florida. Our company was formed to bring to market a disposable product, simple in design with a wide variety of applications for both household and commercial use.
 
Everyone on the team has a vested interest in the success of the company. Our first run prototype of Tidy Mats have been tested and used by our family and friends for over a year.  This is how we came up with the 101 uses and counting. 
 
Our company’s mission is to provide a product line that promotes cleanliness and protection while being environmental conscious.  Tidy Mats are reusable, recyclable and is a replenishable resource.   
 
We invite you to be a part of the adventure in building a company that makes a simple, unexpected product that you soon will realize you can’t live without.
 

    

OUR TEAM 

The Tidy Mat team is dedicated to building a startup business  that wildly exceeds public expectations by offering the best quality customer support services and creating a household name for our brand.  Each team member has a vested interest in the company and is an expert in their field.  We invite you to view our Bio's on our website TidyMat.com and please take the time out to view our product designs.

 

Over 101 Uses & Discovering New Ways Everyday                    

Use Tidy Mat On...

  • Refrigerator Shelves
  • Coffee and cup area 
  • Protect kitchen counter tops
  • Food prep & rinse mat
  • Dish & glass drying
  • Bar, party drink and buffet areas
  • Kitchen garbage pail liner & floor mat
  • Umbrella and boot drip mat
  • Car & truck fluid leaks
  • Kids placemat for breakfasts, lunches, dinners and snacks
  • Kids paint, draw and chalk canvass
  • School project poster
  • Family room table tops to protect furniture
  • Under toilet & potty trainer to catch mishaps
  • Food & water dish mat for cats & dogs
  • Under bedding in cages for mice, hamsters, gerbils and rabbits
  • Portable cage liner for transporting pets‏
  • Litter box mat to catch mishaps & control odors

See More Uses At TidyMat.com

 

Coming Soon

That's right, Tidy Mat can double as a air freshener.  After our first product run we will be offering a choice of natural scents that can be added for an additional cost.  Since Tidy Mat is made from natural compressed pulpwood it absorbs and retains scented oils to continually freshen the air.

 

Commercial Tidy Mats

Tidy Mat was originally designed as an effective solution to capture urine & control odors due to the perpetual mess in front of urinals & toilets.  It also helps to prevent slip and tracking in restrooms of commercial establishments.  

     

Tidy Mat for the bathroom will come with a light peel & stick backing to hold the mat in place. The mats are treated to help prevent bacterial growth that can cause odors and staining of floors. Tidy Mat can keep floors clean and dry, decreasing chances of slip and falls plus shows patrons the business runs a clean establishment.  

​Product Testing

An initial production run of Tidy Mats prototypes were created for market research and real life testing.  Over the last year, these mats were tested in the homes and workplaces of our team’s family, friends and co-workers. The feedback was extremely positive. Word of mouth expanded the market research which led to some modifications in size, boarders and adding scenting to the mats.

 

Production Ready

Tidy Mat is ready for it's first inventory production run.  Our line of absorbent mats are made from compressed pulpwood obtained from eco-friendly timber companies that practice sustainable agriculture. This ensures that our products are made from a renewable resource that does not negatively affect the environment.

 

 

Our product line features ongoing designs and proprietary specialized manufacturing technologies in an eco-friendly environment.  

All Tidy Mat production, packaging and shipping is done at the facility which establishes easy distribution to both retail distributors and direct to consumer online sales.

                     

                                                 40%  Recycled Content

 

             Eco-Friendly Production Process With Excess Material Recycled          

               Mats Are Sized 21' x 15" And Are Less Then A Quarter Inch Thickness

 

Funding

Funding is needed for initial manufacturing, marketing and distribution.  All tool dies and necessary work to roll out Tidy Mats and start branding our name is already complete, making start-up costs lower than most new business ventures.   Marketing material & display pictures for our convention booth are in the works and social media ads are being created by our team.

Campaign Funds Will Be Used For:

  •  Initial Inventory for all 22 Tidy Mat designs
  •  Social Media Advertising For Consumer Online Sales
  •  Commercial Tidy Mat Samples For Convention Shows
  •  Trade Shows Convention Booth Placement

 

With Your Generous Help

Please consider promoting and/or sharing our campaign with your friends, family, and co-workers so our team can finally achieve our goal of making Tidy Mats available for sale to the public. We appreciate everything you are able to do to help make our campaign a success.
