story:
WHAT ARE WE CROWD FUNDING FOR?


FOR OCEANS CARE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BLUEWATER CRUISES, TO BRING A HYDRO-SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL TO INDONESIA - FOR LOMBOK'S JANGKUK RIVER IN AMPENAN.


The Jangkuk River in Ampenan, filled with trash. Image courtesy of Zia Helmi. 


WHAT IS A TRASH WHEEL?


MEET CLEARWATER MILL'S HYDRO-SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL SITUATED IN JONES FALLS RIVER, LOCATED IN BALTIMORE, MARYLAND. 



The trash wheel in Baltimore, Maryland. Photo courtesy of Waterfront Partnership of Baltimore. 


INSTALLED NEAR THE RIVER'S MOUTH, THE WHEEL HAS INTERCEPTED OVER 345 TONS OF TRASH FROM FLOWING INTO THE ATLANTIC OCEAN- IN OVER A YEAR A HALF. 


Image of the Trash Wheel intercepting trash from flowing into the Atlantic Ocean. Image courtesy of the Waterfront Partnership of Baltimore. 

Image of the spokes the gather the trash. Image courtesy of Inhabitat. 

A DIAGRAM OF THE WHEEL, COURTESY OF THE WATERFRONT PARTNERSHIP OF BALTIMORE. 


Aerial View of the Trash Wheel Installed in Baltimore's Jones Falls River. 

WHY LOMBOK, INDONESIA?



THE JANGKUK RIVER IS THE LARGEST RIVER IN LOMBOK, WHERE UP TO 15 TONS OF TRASH FLOWS PER DAY INTO THE INDIAN OCEAN. 

Aerial Google Map of Mataram, where Ampenan River Park is located. 

Trash backed up at the existing net in the Jangkuk River - all of this waste was released into the sea after a major rainstorm. Image courtesy of Zia Helmi. 

THIS TRASH FLOWS FROM THE RIVER INTO THE OCEAN, LITTERING OTHER ISLANDS AND WATERS. TOGETHER, WE CAN STOP THE ACCUMULATION AND PREVENT FURTHER POLLUTION. 



Plastic waste washed up on the beach. Image courtesy of Britta Slippens. 

Children in the trash dump in Lombok. Image courtesy of Slam Jam Productions.

AMPENAN'S JANGKUK RIVERBED IS THE PERFECT SPOT FOR A TRASH WHEEL. 


The stage created by SAMPAN & Sound of the River, at the proposed site for installation of the trash wheel. Image courtesy of Zia Helmi. 


THE INVENTORS OF THE TRASH WHEEL, CLEARWATER MILLS,  CAME TO LOMBOK FOR A SITE VISIT - THEY DEEMED THE LOCATION IDEAL TO INSTALL A HYDRO-SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL. 


Clearwater Mills performing a site visit in Ampenan at the Jangkuk River, pictured (from left) Daniel Chase, Zia Helmi, and Tyler Gearhart. Image courtesy of Slam Jam Productions. 

Site visit with Oceans Care Ampenan River Project Manager, Zia Helmi, also leader of the SAMPAN and Sound of the River Activists, and with Daniel Chase and Tyler Gearhart of Baltimore's Clearwater Mills.  Private Image. 

Daniel Chase of Clearwater Mills motioning towards the future placement of the Ampenan's trash wheel for the Jangkuk River. Private Image. 

OUR TEAM, OCEANS CARE, IS WORKING WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT TO CLEAN THE JANGKUK RIVER. 


Photograph of the Oceans Care team behind the Ampenan River Project, (from left) Zia Helmi, Aubrey Roemer, Ebu under the bridge, and Britta Slippens - the old woman pictured lives with her family under the bridge. Private Image. 


WE MET WITH THE GOVERNMENT TO SECURE PERMITS FOR THE LOCATION. 


Britta Slippens, CEO of Bluewater Cruises and Director of Oceans Care, with Zia Helmi, meeting with the government in Mataram, Lombok - the regional district of the Ampenan River Park and Trash Wheel. Private Image. 


THE LOCAL POLICE  ARE PARTICIPATING IN CLEANING UP THE RIVER AND ARE EXCITED TO HAVE A TRASH WHEEL IN THE JANGKUK RIVER. 


The local police cleaning the river together - getting excited for the trash wheel! Image courtesy of Kick News. 

Aerial shot of the police and community cleaning the Ampenan River together. Private Image. 


THIS IS NOT JUST ABOUT ONE RIVER - IT'S ABOUT CLEANING AND PROTECTING ALL OF OUR WATERS. 


WE ARE STARTING WITH THE JANGKUK RIVER IN INDONESIA, JUST LIKE CLEARWATER MILLS STARTED WITH ONE HYDRO SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL IN BALTIMORE'S JONES FALLS RIVER. 


The Oceans Care team in Lombok, pictured in the top row (from the left) Trev Chee-A-Tow, Morgan Harris, Dustin Chee-A-Tow, Zul Hakeem, Daniel Chase, Tyler Gearhart, Kyle Chee-A-Tow, and the bottom row - Aubrey Roemer, Zia Helmi, Britta Slippens, and Lia Zakiyyah.


THIS IS A SOLUTION TO THE POLLUTION RUINING OUR BEAUTIFUL, LIFE-SUSTAINING WATERS. 


Image of the front view of the trash wheel in Baltimore. Image courtesy of Inhabitat, 


PLEASE HELP CONTRIBUTE TO THIS AMAZING PROJECT - LET'S MAKE SURE OUR CHILDREN AND CHILDREN'S CHILDREN HAVE HEALTHY, POLLUTION FREE WATERWAYS TO ENJOY. 


PRESS FOR OUR PROJECT! 

Kölner Gtadt Unzeiger

Lombok Post

Regional Compas

Kick News


PRESS FOR THE HYDRO SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL!

Discovery
Popular Mechanics
Eco Watch
Inhabitat

HERE'S THE FINE PRINT:


In Indonesia, Oceans Care and Bluewater Cruises are bringing a hydro-solar powered trash wheel to the Jangkuk River in Lombok- the island's largest river located 200 meters from the Indian Ocean. The trash wheel was created by U.S. company Clearwater Mills and has proven to be a resounding success in Baltimore, Maryland - where it has intercepted over 354 tons of trash flowing in Jones Falls River from emptying into the Atlantic Ocean. 

Our aim is to revitalize the riverbed in Ampenan, Lombok, into a natural river park - creating a community hub of recreation and business, using the sustainable technology of the waterwheel trash interceptor to clean the river and keep the trash from flowing into the ocean. We are modeling our vision off of the proven success in Baltimore, where their Inner Harbor has been revitalized as a place of community and tourism, while providing education, awareness, and stewardship of their waterways. 

In addition to the implementation of a trash wheel, we will also be working to educate the local community in Lombok about the devastation of our oceans and working together to promote a working system of waste management. The wheel will collect the trash, in the most volume during storm surges, emptying it into a large dumpster. There is already a road at the projected site of Jangkuk River's future trash wheel, which will allow for easy access of transporting the trash. Each container will be brought to a dump in Lombok, where it will be sorted and studied, just like in Baltimore. 

We hope to take this project one step further by partnering with companies and artisans, who are focused on re-purposing this waste into raw materials for production of goods - fabrics, baskets, bags, lamps, etc. Although this project in based in a solitary river and town on a single island, we believe that this model can inspire the rest of Southeast Asia and the world to incorporate this system of technology and education to begin cleaning our collective waterways - deterring littering and catching the waste before it goes into the ocean. 


WHAT'S THE $100,000 FOR EXACTLY?


We are using the money raised on Indiegogo for the developmental costs of the project. These expenses include vehicles for transporting the trash, land for the dump / recycling center, permits, research, web development, copy and design plans for the project, travel, video production, etc. 

Although centered on the trash wheel, this is a multi-faceted project with a business infrastructure that includes  an online store, boutique advertisement spaces, music and art festivals, and a repurposed plastics center, all supporting the costs of purchasing and maintaining the wheel.  

The wheel itself is projected to cost us $750,000 on it's own, we have secured initial investors and continue to field great interest in this endeavor. Up until this point, we have funded all of the work and all of the business overhead for development on our own - we need your help to see this through.


RISKS & CHALLENGES:


The risks we run in this project are minimized, because we are modeling our Ampenan River Project around Baltimore's proven success. The hydro solar powered trash wheel has already proven it's effectiveness in cleaning waterways. 

We have already met with the necessary contingents to make sure we can install a trash wheel in the Jangkuk River and cleared it with the government - we are ready to go!

We know that there will be all kinds of challenges to this project, the installation, transport, and creation of our own waterwheel is sure to have a curveball or two, but we are dedicated to seeing this project through. 

**If you would like to support us by PayPal you can donate here:

bluewatercruisesbali@gmail.com


THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP! 

WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT 

YOU. 


Bahasa Indonesia:
LATAR BELAKANG Kami adalah tim yang terdiri dari : seniman, pembuat film, guru, pengusaha yang menginisiasi sebuah pergerakan untuk mencegah dan berupaya membersihkan samudera kita yang sangat berharga dari polusi plastik. Kami akan menempatkan satu unit alat bertenaga air dan cahaya matahari yang akan menghadang dan mengangkut plastik dan sampah dari salah satu sungai yang paling tercemar di daerah timur NTB – Indonesia. Indonesia, china dan India disebut bertanggung jawab atas 30% dari total produksi keseluruhan sampah secara global. SUPPORTED BY: BALTIMORE HARBOUR INITIATIVE, BLUEWATERCRUISES, GILIECO TRUST, SEABINS PROJECT TAMAN SUNGAI AMPENAN Di Indonesia, sebuah tim yang diketuai warga lokal akan mendatangkan sebuah mesin (trash wheel) bertenaga air dan surya ke sungai terbesar di pulau Lombok bernama sungai Jangkuk, mesin tersebut akan ditempatkan pada 200 meter dari muara sungai yang bersinggungan langsung dengan Samudera Hindia. Mesin trash wheel tersebut diproduksi oleh perusahaan Amerika bernama Clearwater Mills yang telah membuktikan keberhasilannya di Baltimore, Maryland. Dilokasi itu mesin ini telah menghadang dan mengangkut lebih dari 354 ton sampah yang hanyut terbawa oleh aliran sungai Jones Falls dan mencegah sampah tersebut terbuang ke Samudera Atlantik. Tujuan kami adalah merevitalisasi daerah aliran sungai Jangkuk di Ampenan-Lombok, menjadi taman sungai alami, yaitu membuatnya menjadi pusat area rekreasi dan usaha, diantaranya adalah dengan menggunakan teknologi yang bekerja tanpa henti menghalau dan mengangkut sampah bernama waterwheel. Alat inilah yang akan membersihkan sungai dan mencegah sampah mengalir ke samudera. Apa yang akan kami laksanakan ini mengacu pada kesuksesan yang telah terbukti terjadi di Baltimore, dimana sebuah pelabuhan yang ada di lokasi tersebut telah berhasil direvitalisasi menjadi lokasi pusat kegiatan masyarakat dan menjadi destinasi pariwisata, sekaligus memberikan edukasi, menumbuhkan kesadaran, dan menjaga tata kelola aliran air mereka. Sebagai bagian dari program ini, kami juga akan berupaya mengedukasi warga lokal di Pulau Lombok tentang kondisi kerusakan samudera kita saat ini, setelahnya kami akan mengajak untuk bekerjasama mengenalkan pola penanganan sampah yang baik. Mesin tersebut akan mengumpulkan sampah yang jumlahnya akan sangat banyak pada musim penghujan, dan sampah itu akan diangkut ke suatu lokasi pembuangan yang sangat luas. Di area lokasi akan ditempatkannya Waterwhells untuk Sungai Jangkuk ini, telah tersedia ruas jalan yang akan sangat memudahkan akses transportasi untuk pengangkutan sampah tersebut. Setiap kontainer yang telah terisi sampah akan dibawa ke lokasi pembuangan, dimana dilokasi itu sampah akan disortir sembari dilakukan penelitian seperti yang dilaksanakan di Baltimore. Salah satu langkah maju yang telah kami programkan dalam project ini adalah menjalin kerjasama dengan beberapa perusahaan dan para pengrajin yang memang telah fokus pada daur ulang sampah. Mereka mampu merubah sampah menjadi bahan mentah untuk pembuatan barang yang berguna seperti kantong, lampu, keranjang dan sebaginya. Meskipun project ini akan dilaksanakan di sungai dalam Kota di sebuah Pulau tertentu. Kami sangat yakin ini akan bisa menjadi percontohan yang akan menginspirasi seluruh Asia Tanggara bahkan seluruh Dunia, tentang cara menggabungkan edukasi dan sistem teknologi untuk memulai pembersihan saluran air kita secara menyeluruh. Mencegah kebiasaan membuang sampah sembarangan sekaligus menghalau sampah sebelum mengalir sampai ke Samudera.
story_txt:
WHAT ARE WE CROWD FUNDING FOR?
FOR OCEANS CARE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BLUEWATER CRUISES, TO BRING A HYDRO-SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL TO INDONESIA - FOR LOMBOK'S JANGKUK RIVER IN AMPENAN.
The Jangkuk River in Ampenan, filled with trash. Image courtesy of Zia Helmi. WHAT IS A TRASH WHEEL?MEET CLEARWATER MILL'S HYDRO-SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL SITUATED IN JONES FALLS RIVER, LOCATED IN BALTIMORE, MARYLAND. The trash wheel in Baltimore, Maryland. Photo courtesy of Waterfront Partnership of Baltimore. 

INSTALLED NEAR THE RIVER'S MOUTH, THE WHEEL HAS INTERCEPTED OVER 345 TONS OF TRASH FROM FLOWING INTO THE ATLANTIC OCEAN- IN OVER A YEAR A HALF. 


Image of the Trash Wheel intercepting trash from flowing into the Atlantic Ocean. Image courtesy of the Waterfront Partnership of Baltimore. 

Image of the spokes the gather the trash. Image courtesy of Inhabitat. 

A DIAGRAM OF THE WHEEL, COURTESY OF THE WATERFRONT PARTNERSHIP OF BALTIMORE. Aerial View of the Trash Wheel Installed in Baltimore's Jones Falls River. 
WHY LOMBOK, INDONESIA?



THE JANGKUK RIVER IS THE LARGEST RIVER IN LOMBOK, WHERE UP TO 15 TONS OF TRASH FLOWS PER DAY INTO THE INDIAN OCEAN. 

Aerial Google Map of Mataram, where Ampenan River Park is located. 




Trash backed up at the existing net in the Jangkuk River - all of this waste was released into the sea after a major rainstorm. Image courtesy of Zia Helmi. 



THIS TRASH FLOWS FROM THE RIVER INTO THE OCEAN, LITTERING OTHER ISLANDS AND WATERS. TOGETHER, WE CAN STOP THE ACCUMULATION AND PREVENT FURTHER POLLUTION. 


Plastic waste washed up on the beach. Image courtesy of Britta Slippens. 



Children in the trash dump in Lombok. Image courtesy of Slam Jam Productions.




AMPENAN'S JANGKUK RIVERBED IS THE PERFECT SPOT FOR A TRASH WHEEL. 




The stage created by SAMPAN & Sound of the River, at the proposed site for installation of the trash wheel. Image courtesy of Zia Helmi. 

THE INVENTORS OF THE TRASH WHEEL, CLEARWATER MILLS,  CAME TO LOMBOK FOR A SITE VISIT - THEY DEEMED THE LOCATION IDEAL TO INSTALL A HYDRO-SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL. 



Clearwater Mills performing a site visit in Ampenan at the Jangkuk River, pictured (from left) Daniel Chase, Zia Helmi, and Tyler Gearhart. Image courtesy of Slam Jam Productions. 

Site visit with Oceans Care Ampenan River Project Manager, Zia Helmi, also leader of the SAMPAN and Sound of the River Activists, and with Daniel Chase and Tyler Gearhart of Baltimore's Clearwater Mills.  Private Image. 

Daniel Chase of Clearwater Mills motioning towards the future placement of the Ampenan's trash wheel for the Jangkuk River. Private Image. 

OUR TEAM, OCEANS CARE, IS WORKING WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT TO CLEAN THE JANGKUK RIVER. 





Photograph of the Oceans Care team behind the Ampenan River Project, (from left) Zia Helmi, Aubrey Roemer, Ebu under the bridge, and Britta Slippens - the old woman pictured lives with her family under the bridge. Private Image. 


WE MET WITH THE GOVERNMENT TO SECURE PERMITS FOR THE LOCATION. 


Britta Slippens, CEO of Bluewater Cruises and Director of Oceans Care, with Zia Helmi, meeting with the government in Mataram, Lombok - the regional district of the Ampenan River Park and Trash Wheel. Private Image. 

THE LOCAL POLICE  ARE PARTICIPATING IN CLEANING UP THE RIVER AND ARE EXCITED TO HAVE A TRASH WHEEL IN THE JANGKUK RIVER. 


The local police cleaning the river together - getting excited for the trash wheel! Image courtesy of Kick News. 

Aerial shot of the police and community cleaning the Ampenan River together. Private Image. 

THIS IS NOT JUST ABOUT ONE RIVER - IT'S ABOUT CLEANING AND PROTECTING ALL OF OUR WATERS. 

WE ARE STARTING WITH THE JANGKUK RIVER IN INDONESIA, JUST LIKE CLEARWATER MILLS STARTED WITH ONE HYDRO SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL IN BALTIMORE'S JONES FALLS RIVER. 


The Oceans Care team in Lombok, pictured in the top row (from the left) Trev Chee-A-Tow, Morgan Harris, Dustin Chee-A-Tow, Zul Hakeem, Daniel Chase, Tyler Gearhart, Kyle Chee-A-Tow, and the bottom row - Aubrey Roemer, Zia Helmi, Britta Slippens, and Lia Zakiyyah.

THIS IS A SOLUTION TO THE POLLUTION RUINING OUR BEAUTIFUL, LIFE-SUSTAINING WATERS. 


Image of the front view of the trash wheel in Baltimore. Image courtesy of Inhabitat, 

PLEASE HELP CONTRIBUTE TO THIS AMAZING PROJECT - LET'S MAKE SURE OUR CHILDREN AND CHILDREN'S CHILDREN HAVE HEALTHY, POLLUTION FREE WATERWAYS TO ENJOY. 



PRESS FOR OUR PROJECT! 
Kölner Gtadt Unzeiger
Lombok Post
Regional Compas
Kick News

PRESS FOR THE HYDRO SOLAR POWERED TRASH WHEEL!
Discovery
Popular Mechanics
Eco Watch
Inhabitat


HERE'S THE FINE PRINT:



In Indonesia, Oceans Care and Bluewater Cruises are bringing a hydro-solar powered trash wheel to the Jangkuk River in Lombok- the island's largest river located 200 meters from the Indian Ocean. The trash wheel was created by U.S. company Clearwater Mills and has proven to be a resounding success in Baltimore, Maryland - where it has intercepted over 354 tons of trash flowing in Jones Falls River from emptying into the Atlantic Ocean. 
Our aim is to revitalize the riverbed in Ampenan, Lombok, into a natural river park - creating a community hub of recreation and business, using the sustainable technology of the waterwheel trash interceptor to clean the river and keep the trash from flowing into the ocean. We are modeling our vision off of the proven success in Baltimore, where their Inner Harbor has been revitalized as a place of community and tourism, while providing education, awareness, and stewardship of their waterways. 
In addition to the implementation of a trash wheel, we will also be working to educate the local community in Lombok about the devastation of our oceans and working together to promote a working system of waste management. 

The wheel will collect the trash, in the most volume during storm surges, emptying it into a large dumpster. There is already a road at the projected site of Jangkuk River's future trash wheel, which will allow for easy access of transporting the trash. Each container will be brought to a dump in Lombok, where it will be sorted and studied, just like in Baltimore. 
We hope to take this project  one step further by partnering with companies and artisans, who are focused on re-purposing this waste into raw materials for production of goods - fabrics, baskets, bags, lamps, etc. 

Although this project in based in a solitary river and town on a single island, we believe that this model can inspire the rest of Southeast Asia and the world to incorporate this system of technology and education to begin cleaning our collective waterways - deterring littering and catching the waste before it goes into the ocean. 

WHAT'S THE $100,000 FOR EXACTLY?

We are using the money raised on Indiegogo for the developmental costs of the project. These expenses include vehicles for transporting the trash, land for the dump / recycling center, permits, research, web development, copy and design plans for the project, travel, video production, etc. 
Although centered on the trash wheel, this is a multi-faceted project with a business infrastructure that includes  an online store, boutique advertisement spaces, music and art festivals, and a repurposed plastics center, all supporting the costs of purchasing and maintaining the wheel.  
The wheel itself is projected to cost us $750,000 on it's own, we have secured initial investors and continue to field great interest in this endeavor. Up until this point, we have funded all of the work and all of the business overhead for development on our own - we need your help to see this through.

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

The risks we run in this project are minimized, because we are modeling our Ampenan River Project around Baltimore's proven success. The hydro solar powered trash wheel has already proven it's effectiveness in cleaning waterways. 
We have already met with the necessary contingents to make sure we can install a trash wheel in the Jangkuk River and cleared it with the government - we are ready to go!
We know that there will be all kinds of challenges to this project, the installation, transport, and creation of our own waterwheel is sure to have a curveball or two, but we are dedicated to seeing this project through. 
**If you would like to support us by PayPal you can donate here:
bluewatercruisesbali@gmail.com

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP! 
WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT 
YOU. 

Bahasa Indonesia:
LATAR BELAKANG
Kami adalah tim yang terdiri dari : seniman, pembuat film, guru, pengusaha yang menginisiasi sebuah pergerakan untuk mencegah dan berupaya membersihkan samudera kita yang sangat berharga dari polusi plastik.
Kami akan menempatkan satu unit alat bertenaga air dan cahaya matahari yang akan menghadang dan mengangkut plastik dan sampah dari salah satu sungai yang paling tercemar di daerah timur NTB – Indonesia.
Indonesia, china dan India disebut bertanggung jawab atas 30% dari total produksi keseluruhan sampah secara global.
SUPPORTED BY: BALTIMORE HARBOUR INITIATIVE, BLUEWATERCRUISES, GILIECO TRUST, SEABINS PROJECT
TAMAN SUNGAI AMPENAN
Di Indonesia, sebuah tim yang diketuai warga lokal akan mendatangkan sebuah mesin (trash wheel) bertenaga air dan surya ke sungai terbesar di pulau Lombok bernama sungai Jangkuk, mesin tersebut akan ditempatkan pada 200 meter dari muara sungai yang bersinggungan langsung dengan Samudera Hindia. Mesin trash wheel tersebut diproduksi oleh perusahaan Amerika bernama Clearwater Mills yang telah membuktikan keberhasilannya di Baltimore, Maryland. Dilokasi itu mesin ini telah menghadang dan mengangkut lebih dari 354 ton sampah yang hanyut terbawa oleh aliran sungai Jones Falls dan mencegah sampah tersebut terbuang ke Samudera Atlantik.
Tujuan kami adalah merevitalisasi daerah aliran sungai Jangkuk di Ampenan-Lombok, menjadi taman sungai alami, yaitu membuatnya menjadi pusat area rekreasi dan usaha, diantaranya adalah dengan menggunakan teknologi yang bekerja tanpa henti menghalau dan mengangkut sampah bernama waterwheel. Alat inilah yang akan membersihkan sungai dan mencegah sampah mengalir ke samudera. Apa yang akan kami laksanakan ini mengacu pada kesuksesan yang telah terbukti terjadi di Baltimore, dimana sebuah pelabuhan yang ada di lokasi tersebut telah berhasil direvitalisasi menjadi lokasi pusat kegiatan masyarakat dan menjadi destinasi pariwisata, sekaligus memberikan edukasi, menumbuhkan kesadaran, dan menjaga tata kelola aliran air mereka.
Sebagai bagian dari program ini, kami juga akan berupaya mengedukasi warga lokal di Pulau Lombok tentang kondisi kerusakan samudera kita saat ini, setelahnya kami akan mengajak untuk bekerjasama mengenalkan pola penanganan sampah yang baik. 
Mesin tersebut akan mengumpulkan sampah yang jumlahnya akan sangat banyak pada musim penghujan, dan sampah itu akan diangkut ke suatu lokasi pembuangan yang sangat luas. Di area lokasi akan ditempatkannya Waterwhells untuk Sungai Jangkuk ini, telah tersedia ruas jalan yang akan sangat memudahkan akses transportasi untuk pengangkutan sampah tersebut. Setiap kontainer yang telah terisi sampah akan dibawa ke lokasi pembuangan, dimana dilokasi itu sampah akan disortir sembari dilakukan penelitian seperti yang dilaksanakan di Baltimore.
Salah satu langkah maju yang telah kami programkan dalam project ini adalah menjalin kerjasama dengan beberapa perusahaan dan para pengrajin yang memang telah fokus pada daur ulang sampah. Mereka mampu merubah sampah menjadi bahan mentah untuk pembuatan barang yang berguna seperti kantong, lampu, keranjang dan sebaginya. Meskipun project ini akan dilaksanakan di sungai dalam Kota di sebuah Pulau tertentu. Kami sangat yakin ini akan bisa menjadi percontohan yang akan menginspirasi seluruh Asia Tanggara bahkan seluruh Dunia, tentang cara menggabungkan edukasi dan sistem teknologi untuk memulai pembersihan saluran air kita secara menyeluruh. Mencegah kebiasaan membuang sampah sembarangan sekaligus menghalau sampah sebelum mengalir sampai ke Samudera.

story:
Le piante creano ambienti belli e piacevoli nelle nostre case e città. Esse però possono ammalarsi,  soprattutto a causa di carenze o eccessi nutrizionali, che vanno monitorati.Tale controllo può essere complicato, specie a livello amatoriale ma anche per gli esperti del settore quali fiorai o agronomi.

Solo le grandi aziende agricole possono ricorrere a costose analisi di laboratorio. 

Manca quindi un mezzo di analisi diretta valido sia per gli hobbisti che per gli esperti del settore.

Phytoness risolve questo problema con il suo kit chimico di analisi fogliare.

Esso permetterà una analisi sul campo, facile e veloce, degli eventuali scompensi dei micro e macro nutrienti. Basterà osservare la colorazione assunta dalla foglia a contatto con uno specifico reagente e confrontarla con la legenda. L’analisi dei risultati ottenuti permetterà una correzione dell'apporto di nutrienti, attraverso una concimazione mirata, e curare così la nostra pianta o le nostre colture.


Chi siamo, quanto chiediamo e come lo utilizzeremo?

Il nostro team è composto da 5 ragazzi universitari che hanno il sogno di migliorare l'ambiente intorno a noi. Ci siamo incontrati durante il Contamination Lab, un percorso interdisciplinare organizzato in collaborazione con l'Università degli Studi di Cagliari, che ha l'obiettivo di sensibilizzare i giovani studenti all'attività di impresa. 
Come primo step di donazioni chiediamo € 1.000. I fondi raccolti saranno utilizzati per poter validare e migliorare il nostro prototipo.


L'Importanza di Phytoness

Phytoness è un progetto valido in quanto permette di realizzare sul campo, in modo semplice e veloce, le analisi fogliari. Esse, se effettuate precocemente, possono essere predittive e consentono di predisporre per tempo eventuali operazioni mirate di cura agronomica e concimazione.  
Noi semplifichiamo il processo di individuazione degli eccessi o delle carenze dei macro e micronutrienti, per ora in modo qualitativo. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di arrivare ad un'analisi semi-quantitativa, i cui risultati potranno coprire le esigenze di tutti i tipi di colture.  
I vantaggi di Phytoness sono: 
- utilizzo semplificato per i meno esperti; 

- valore aggiunto per le attività ( floricolture, consorzi, fiorai) o i liberi professionisti (agronomi o giardinieri).

- minore prezzo rispetto alle analisi di laboratorio; 

Altri modi per aiutarci

Qualora non possiate aiutarci tramite le donazioni, siamo pronti ad ascoltare qualsiasi consiglio da tutti voi. 

Seguiteci sulla nostra pagina Facebook Phytoness o su Twitter Phytoness_

story:
What is Tree-Nation? 

Tree-Nation is an open, collaborative platform where citizens and planting projects from around the world can gather and work together to reforest the world.

So far we planted 800.000 trees, compensating more than 200 million Kilos of CO2, we are receiving the support of 100.000 citizens and 200 of the best companies in the world are teaming up with us.

We are losing 18,000 trees every minute.

We are losing trees at an incredibly high rate. In just a minute, about 18,000 trees are cut, which is the equivalent area of 36 football fields. So every day, when you wake up, there are 27,000,000 trees less on the planet than the day before. Deforestation obviously happens far away from our cities yet it has a direct impact on our lives. Deforestation is one of the main causes of Climate Change, and because Climate Change is the worst problem of our time, we need to take action as soon as possible.

Let’s have a look at how big this issue is:


Deforestation is causing Climate Change. Wait... but how? 

It’s very simple. Climate Change is caused by greenhouse gas emissions, of which CO2 is by far the most important one. And we all know that trees absorb CO2, this is good! But when we cut trees, the opposite happens: all the CO2 the trees had absorbed is released into the atmosphere. 



When a tree dies, some CO2 is released into the air but this is compensated by new baby trees that start growing soon after. In fact most forest (and especially tropical forests) keep expanding naturally so more CO2 is stored over time. However when it’s a whole forest which disappears, a massive amount of CO2 is released. CO2 that was stored for centuries. And this represents 17% of Climate Change.


A citizen solution to climate change and deforestation

We are using technology to create a platform that enables everyone to join our efforts to stop deforestation and start reforesting the world. Because no company, NGO or government can solve this problem by itself, we believe the solution must come from collaboration at a massive scale, and for that, we need the right tool.


Tree-Nation helps planting projects to get the funds needed to start reforesting the world.

Tree-Nation makes it easy for any planting project in the world to get the funds it needs to start planting trees. What is special and at the same time revolutionary in Tree-Nation is how we cut the middle-men and allow you the most direct contact with the planters in the field. We give you the tools to help those planters achieve their goals.


Any planting project in the world can join Tree-Nation freely. We provide them a very easy, step-by-step tool to digitalize their project. Each planter has a personalized section to record all the important information about their project. That includes it’s exact location, the species planted, the planting team, partners and much more... And most importantly, they get a chance to tell their stories through an updates page where they can post pictures, videos and articles. Tree planting is never dull and rosy... it's a tough job that requires sweat and dedication, but it’s incredibly gratifying to see a devastated land turn into a green forest. 



Get to know the planting teams behind the projects, follow their stories and help them achieve their goals.

You will be able to discover these projects, follow their stories and talk with the planters as simply as you would do it with your friends on Facebook. This direct connection between you and the planters will enable a flow of feedback that will allow projects to improve and qualify their work. And once you've found a nice project, you then select the species you like and with just a few clicks you'll be able to plant real trees and start reforesting the world.


Where are we now? 

Tree-Nation was founded in 2006. Along these years we've learned a lot and achieved milestones that some believed were impossible. We planted more than 800.000 trees, compensating more than 200 million Kilos of CO2.  And we are already working with 11 planting projects around the world. 

This first phase was our real-life pilot to proof and fine-tune our concept. Strong of this success we are now ready to switch gears, go full scale and provide a tool for all planting projects in the world. That’s why we have been redesigning our platform from scratch and refining it with all the knowledge we got from these past years working side by side with planters. We have already completed all the designs and we firmly believe this has all the needed potential to become what we dreamed of, but for that to happen... we need you!


How will the money be used? 

If we reach our fundraising goal, we are going to spend 100% of the money on the development of the new Tree-Nation website. We already have the designs but the programming of a site as big and complex as Tree-Nation is very expensive. 

  • The first 25.000 € raised will allow us to create the projects section, as described above and in the video. This is the backbone of our platform. This means we’ll be able to welcome thousands of planting projects!
  • With the next 15.000 €, we’ll be able to integrate the virtual trees in our new format. A virtual tree is the virtual companion of a real tree, so that you can add content to it and even offer it as a gift; much better than giving flowers! You will also be able to create virtual forests and join other users forests, kind of a meeting point where users can share their passions and ideas. And all this will obviously require you to have your own profile, where you’ll find all your trees, forests and personalized counters so that you can keep track of the impact of your tree planting experience at Tree-Nation, and also check your CO2 balance. The virtual trees plus the virtual forests plus the personal profiles are the foundations of a uber friendly user community! Today in Tree-Nation we have a prehistoric version of all this and it has been enough for us to proof the concept, but not enough to make it fun and enjoyable to use.

  • With the next 10.000 €, we will introduce gamification mechanics that will allow you to plant trees at no cost! Yes. We call it the seed system. It’s simple. Plant a seed and add to it some nice content, other users will start to water it and if the seed reaches 100 water drops in less than 5 days, a tree will be planted and you'll get a new seed! This is possible thanks to companies that want to sponsor trees as they recognize the fight against Climate Change as one of the most positive influence they can generate for their community. This tool is very important because if we create the system for our users to plant trees for free, it will generate millions of new trees.

If we reach more than 50.000€ we have a revolutionary idea, it’s called the Planter App, but we will let you know more about it as soon as we pass the 40.000€ milestone  ;)


Join our project at http://www.tree-nation.com/login

Please keep an eye on the updates section during the course of our fundraising. 

We’ll be explaining a lot of important things, like our revolutionary strategy to handle thousands of planting projects at the same time, more design screenshots of the website, more details on some interesting sections like our gamification strategy… so stay tuned!


The Tree-Nation team: Max, Willi, Audrey, Ampi, Philippe, Xavi, Vedran, Darko 

…and all our planters: Dexter, Kochurani, Dilmun, Oscar, Ru, Alex, Seini, Boukari, Jennifer, Erick, Carmen, Marie, Marlène, Kahlil, Brooke, Isidro...

… would like to say a huge thanks for your help!

We think this project can be a game changer, but not without you!

What is Tree-Nation? Tree-Nation is an open, collaborative platform where citizens and planting projects from around the world can gather and work together to reforest the world.So far we planted 800.000 trees, compensating more than 200 million Kilos of CO2, we are receiving the support of 100.000 citizens and 200 of the best companies in the world are teaming up with us.We are losing 18,000 trees every minute.We are losing trees at an incredibly high rate. In just a minute, about 18,000 trees are cut, which is the equivalent area of 36 football fields. So every day, when you wake up, there are 27,000,000 trees less on the planet than the day before. Deforestation obviously happens far away from our cities yet it has a direct impact on our lives. Deforestation is one of the main causes of Climate Change, and because Climate Change is the worst problem of our time, we need to take action as soon as possible.Let’s have a look at how big this issue is:
Source www3.epa.govDeforestation is causing Climate Change. Wait... but how? It’s very simple. Climate Change is caused by greenhouse gas emissions, of which CO2 is by far the most important one. And we all know that trees absorb CO2, this is good! But when we cut trees, the opposite happens: all the CO2 the trees had absorbed is released into the atmosphere. When a tree dies, some CO2 is released into the air but this is compensated by new baby trees that start growing soon after. In fact most forest (and especially tropical forests) keep expanding naturally so more CO2 is stored over time. However when it’s a whole forest which disappears, a massive amount of CO2 is released. CO2 that was stored for centuries. And this represents 17% of Climate Change.A citizen solution to climate change and deforestationWe are using technology to create a platform that enables everyone to join our efforts to stop deforestation and start reforesting the world. Because no company, NGO or government can solve this problem by itself, we believe the solution must come from collaboration at a massive scale, and for that, we need the right tool.Tree-Nation helps planting projects to get the funds needed to start reforesting the world.Tree-Nation makes it easy for any planting project in the world to get the funds it needs to start planting trees. What is special and at the same time revolutionary in Tree-Nation is how we cut the middle-men and allow you the most direct contact with the planters in the field. We give you the tools to help those planters achieve their goals.This is what we are building!Any planting project in the world can join Tree-Nation freely. We provide them a very easy, step-by-step tool to digitalize their project. Each planter has a personalized section to record all the important information about their project. That includes it’s exact location, the species planted, the planting team, partners and much more... And most importantly, they get a chance to tell their stories through an updates page where they can post pictures, videos and articles. Tree planting is never dull and rosy... it's a tough job that requires sweat and dedication, but it’s incredibly gratifying to see a devastated land turn into a green forest. This is one of our plating projects in Costa RicaGet to know the planting teams behind the projects, follow their stories and help them achieve their goals.You will be able to discover these projects, follow their stories and talk with the planters as simply as you would do it with your friends on Facebook. This direct connection between you and the planters will enable a flow of feedback that will allow projects to improve and qualify their work. And once you've found a nice project, you then select the species you like and with just a few clicks you'll be able to plant real trees and start reforesting the world.Select a species and just plant it!Where are we now? Tree-Nation was founded in 2006. Along these years we've learned a lot and achieved milestones that some believed were impossible. We planted more than 800.000 trees, compensating more than 200 million Kilos of CO2.  And we are already working with 11 planting projects around the world. Our planting project in MadagascarThis first phase was our real-life pilot to proof and fine-tune our concept. Strong of this success we are now ready to switch gears, go full scale and provide a tool for all planting projects in the world. That’s why we have been redesigning our platform from scratch and refining it with all the knowledge we got from these past years working side by side with planters. We have already completed all the designs and we firmly believe this has all the needed potential to become what we dreamed of, but for that to happen... we need you!How will the money be used? If we reach our fundraising goal, we are going to spend 100% of the money on the development of the new Tree-Nation website. We already have the designs but the programming of a site as big and complex as Tree-Nation is very expensive. The first 25.000 € raised will allow us to create the projects section, as described above and in the video. This is the backbone of our platform. This means we’ll be able to welcome thousands of planting projects!
With the next 15.000 €, we’ll be able to integrate the virtual trees in our new format. A virtual tree is the virtual companion of a real tree, so that you can add content to it and even offer it as a gift; much better than giving flowers! You will also be able to create virtual forests and join other users forests, kind of a meeting point where users can share their passions and ideas. And all this will obviously require you to have your own profile, where you’ll find all your trees, forests and personalized counters so that you can keep track of the impact of your tree planting experience at Tree-Nation, and also check your CO2 balance. The virtual trees plus the virtual forests plus the personal profiles are the foundations of a uber friendly user community! Today in Tree-Nation we have a prehistoric version of all this and it has been enough for us to proof the concept, but not enough to make it fun and enjoyable to use.
Keep track of your impact
With the next 10.000 €, we will introduce gamification mechanics that will allow you to plant trees at no cost! Yes. We call it the seed system. It’s simple. Plant a seed and add to it some nice content, other users will start to water it and if the seed reaches 100 water drops in less than 5 days, a tree will be planted and you'll get a new seed! This is possible thanks to companies that want to sponsor trees as they recognize the fight against Climate Change as one of the most positive influence they can generate for their community. This tool is very important because if we create the system for our users to plant trees for free, it will generate millions of new trees.If we reach more than 50.000€ we have a revolutionary idea, it’s called the Planter App, but we will let you know more about it as soon as we pass the 40.000€ milestone  ;)Join our project at http://www.tree-nation.com/loginPlease keep an eye on the updates section during the course of our fundraising. We’ll be explaining a lot of important things, like our revolutionary strategy to handle thousands of planting projects at the same time, more design screenshots of the website, more details on some interesting sections like our gamification strategy… so stay tuned!The Tree-Nation team: Max, Willi, Audrey, Ampi, Philippe, Xavi, Vedran, Darko …and all our planters: Dexter, Kochurani, Dilmun, Oscar, Ru, Alex, Seini, Boukari, Jennifer, Erick, Carmen, Marie, Marlène, Kahlil, Brooke, Isidro...… would like to say a huge thanks for your help!We think this project can be a game changer, but not without you!

story:
Clean Ocean has developed a prototype that REMOVES OCEAN PLASTIC. The device collects trash, not only at the SEA-SURFACE but also UNDERWATER.

 

Rick-Ernest Bonnier- Inventor of the Ocean Cleaner Device

Rick-Ernest has invented a revolutionary machine to collect underwater and sea-surface plastic from the ocean, without hurting marine life. 

 

About the Project:
Internationally the device will be an enormous help in cleaning the planet, and will benefit many countries around the world. This project will create jobs, improve tourism, protect livelihoods, and at the same time clean our beautiful oceans, giving marine life a second chance to live peacefully again. The project will educate governments, organizations, and schools, about the dangers of plastic pollution -and promote recycling instead of dumping. Everyone loves being in a clean ocean to snorkel, dive, and swim. If we do not protect our oceans from pollution, not only will animals suffer, but we will lose our tourists, and negatively impact local communities, livelihoods, and future generations around the world.




Where Are We Now?
The project is at prototype level and, by reproducing ocean conditions in an aquarium, we can prove that the device works. To date the device has taken 100% of plastic in less than 2 minutes, both on the surface and underwater. We are currently adjusting the device to work in a pool containing 14400 liters of water, and it is working well.

Rick-Ernest has been self-funding the project so far -but now he needs your help! 
"The funds will help us to finalize the device and begin cleaning the ocean. We would really like more resources, more equipment, and more consistent funding, to help save our oceans!"


Methodology: 
The Ocean Cleaner Device works in two ways: on the surface and under water 

On the surface
The device uses a combination of magnetic force and water movement. We have found a way to create a magnetic force that, when exposed to water movement (tide, current, waves), will attract plastic only. The Plastic Attraction Unit attracts that expel this source of energy will attract the plastic floating on the ocean surface. Once there is a large amount of plastic concentrated around the boat platform, it is collected using a elevation system -trash will then be directed to a large container on the boat. 




Underwater
The second part of the Ocean Cleaner Device uses the same sources of energy. The Plastic Attraction Unit attracts plastic underwater. Once the plastic has been moved to the surface, it can be collected by the same elevation system to the boat.




Neither method hurts marine life.

A Quick Tour of the Workshop:

 

 
How Will the Project be Carried Out?
There are two possible executions for this project: moving and stationary. 

Moving 
We visit particular sites for cleaning. We use secondary data from studies and reports investigating marine debris sites, and identify the worst plastic pollution locations.


Stationary 
We anchor the device at a specific site, where it will continuously collect plastic. This is suitable for areas in which water movement is strong.


What Will You Get in Return?
As well as knowing you have done something amazing for the ocean and the planet, you will receive a specially numbered contributor certificate, signed personally by the inventor and founder of Clean Ocean, Rick-Ernest Bonnier.

There's also a chance for a few of our lucky contributors to visit us on site and witness the live cleaning of the ocean!



Did You Know?

-The ocean covers around 72% of the planet's surface and contains 97% of Earth's water.

-It is believed that less than 5% of the world's oceans have been explored.

-The oceans are a significant source of oxygen for our planet, and are vital in the capture and storage of carbon dioxide.

-Marine life provides food, medicine, and supports livelihoods.

-In 2014, the ocean economy contributed more than $352 billion to the U.S. GDP alone, and supported 3.1 million jobs (National Ocean Service).

-Tourism and recreation account for 72 percent of the ocean economy's total employment (National Ocean Service).

-80% of our land pollution ends up in the ocean and if we don’t do anything, it will lead to scarcity of ocean food and mass unemployment.

-In 1975, it was estimated that cargo ships and cruise ships had dumped 14 billion pounds of garbage into the ocean (National Academy of Sciences).

-Over 1 million seabirds and 100,000 sea mammals are killed by pollution every year.

 

Please don’t hesitate to share this to your friends and family, and don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

Thank you for helping us to save the ocean!


Rick-Ernest Bonnier and the Clean Ocean team

story:
Dear Souls

My name is Žiga Miklavc. I was born in the land where beauty surrounds us, sLOVEenia, and still live here. After I finished primary school I went to a secondary mechanical school. It turned out this didn’t fit me, but I finished it nevertheless. Afterwards I went to a college of environmental protection, which was perfect for me, but the sun outside was too strong to keep me inside. One day I will finish it. Ever since I was a child my love for nature was very strong. I owe this to my grandmothers, grandfathers, mom and dad. I remember how special the moments fishing with grandfather were and how I enjoyed hiking with dad. I felt peace and patience, enjoyed the beauty, and had fun. Some of the really special memories I have are how we walked with my grandfather through the city where we lived – Velenje. Every time we crossed the bridge over Paka river we stopped in the middle and played a game of who would be the first to spot a fish. For me, just a little kid, this was amazing, and it still is. After a while when this little Žiga grew up, I was walking with my friends across one of this bridges in Velenje. Of course, I stopped to play the game, and what I saw was waste and no fish. “Oh boy”, I thought, took my shoes off and went to pick the waste. My friends went too. Since that day it is hard for me to see waste in the Water, so I clean them. I always have a range of feelings about this – I feel a lot of sadness and anger, but in the end, I am always happy and joyful to see the Water clean.

The question, why it is like that, is strong, and after a while I realized that, only through action I can achieve what I wish for. And this is what most of us want. To take care for each other, ourselves and also for this magical planet Mother Earth. To see the beauties in ourselves and in everything around us. To live this journey called Life in harmony, peace, love, respect and unity. But as we all know beautiful things wouldn't be as beautiful without the ugly ones beside them. With this project and your help we will get a little bit closer to our Dreams.

The goal I imagined is $2222. This means 222,2 hours of cleaning waters around the world, including food and drink for everyone who will help. 

In 1 hour I usually fill a 100 litre garbage bag, depending on how dirty the Water or beach is.

If we don’t reach the goal, your donations will be spent for cleaning the Water nevertheless. But the more resources we have, the more we can clean.

The idea for this campaign was born four years ago in Sri Lanka, while I was walking on the beach of Hikkaduwa and picking waste. I wanted to travel the world, see its beauties, play the music, connect with family, get challenged by life, put the pieces of my soul back together, heal the wounds, become a man, and just enjoy life. It takes so much courage for me to write these words and make the first step. This campaign is a part of the journey and also the first step. I would like to share this journey with you, and at the same time do something nice for everything and everyone of us…

project Clean Spirit of Silent Water will contribute on many levels to all of us:

- giving and receiving unconditional Love we all deserve

- encouraging us to follow our hearts

- raising awareness about taking care for our Home and at the same time our inner Water

- reminding us of our ancestors who lived here before and sharing their knowledge how to treat ourselves and the Planet Earth

- sharing the gifts that we all carry within our souls

- building the "bridges" and balance between modern and ancient world

- showing respect and gratitude to the Water, Air, Fire, Earth, People, Ancestors, Animals, Plants, Spirits, Gods, Angels, Guides, all four direction ( east, south, west and north), elfs, mermaids and everything that exists.

The Earth is providing us everything we need so we can survive, live happily on our visit here. In exchange she just needs from us, our care,gratitude and respect. It is our responsibility to treat her well during this visit. The way we treat the nature is a reflection of how we treat ourselves. I am a great believer, I believe that everything is made precisely by the magnificent force which created us, our entire Universe is in a perfect divine order. So all the worries are therefore needless, when we surrender in trust to divinity in belief.

But I also believe that if we will not change our attitude, sooner or later we’ll have to. It is so  simple and clear for me to feel this. Perhaps this is just my view of life, but I am sure that you can feel it too, this is a collective call and it does concern us all. So with this campaign I would like to contribute and call you, to be a part of it, too. We can all make a change in a sense, that each and everyone of us puts a little piece of him - herself to it, just by following the heart and the call from it. This is an invitation for you, to be a part of something beautiful and educational. To start a journey into a New Paradigm of coexistence. It is important to make risks in except challenges of our heart, soul calls. If we don't risk, we'll probably never know how is on the other side, out of our comfort zone.

The only problem I see in advance is that I will often not have internet connection on the road. Therefore you will probably see videos, photos and a journal about what is going on, with a little delay. We are already working, taking pics and videos, writing down working hours and weight of saved trashes. Challenges and risks we will hug and accept, and as well I will let you know, how it will all go, as soon as possible.

In Decembrer 2017, we cleaned Italian Water, next destination is Bosnia and Herzegovina in April.

As I mentioned in the video, if this made you smile just a little bit, or if it moved you in any way, made you feel good, it is a lot already enough. If you will do something for the Nature, you'll soon see the magic of the loving exchange. Nature is so generous in showing and giving us her Love and Care back.

If you have a spare minute, please share this campaign. Also fell free to share your actions and reflections on a Facebook and Instagram page Clean Spirit Of Silent Water.  

Thank You

With Love & Joy

Žiga

story:
A Better Way to Live

The world can seem a pretty depressing place nowadays. Everything seems to be rising; global temperatures, sea levels, population figures, unemployment, poverty… the list goes on. You might be tempted to think that there’s nothing you can do about it, after all you’re just one person.

But at Love Grows, based in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountains in Colombia, we’re doing things a little bit differently.

By working with people from across the globe, and with locals, we spend each and every day showing people how they can harness the power of themselves and of Mother Nature to change the reality they live in.


How do we do it?


The way we work depends very much on the individuals we see and their needs, but are based around overarching principles and techniques of coaching and permaculture
 

Coaching for empowerment

 

Sandrine uses music, dance, speech and contact in her unique programme ‘Heartcall Intuition’ to help people unlock their inner potential, to find happiness and their purpose in life. Our school is based on our beautiful 26-acre farm and participants can relax and revive themselves in this peaceful environment.

to have more information about HEARTCALL INTUITION retreat Perks  look at

https://www.permaculturecolombia.com/loving-art

 

Permaculture


 

Russell, a qualified permaculture trainer, gives each person the knowledge
and tools they need to use this sustainable agriculture method to build a permanent and self-sufficient way of living. Focusing on the development of a sustainable food chain rather than the modern industrial monoculture food production system, students learn how to design sustainable food production systems, wherever in the world they want to.

to have more information about all Permaculture Perks look at

https://www.permaculturecolombia.com/permaculture

 

Why do we need you?

Our family; Russell, Sandrine and Lili bought the land nearly three years ago having lived on different eco farms and permaculture projects across the world. Having seen first-hand what can be achieved, we knew we wanted to pass on the knowledge we had gained. We have been  actively teaching for around 18 months as well as building, farming and continuing our own education. We’ve employed local people to build houses on the site as well as storage areas and a geo dome, and we’ve had tremendous support from volunteers across the globe; 27 nations in fact!

Each person we work with takes with them the knowledge and understanding of how to build a more sustainable future. Each person we work with can help preserve this amazing planet for generations to come. Each person whom attends one of our self-development courses leaves a more informed happier person that can have an amazing impact on those around them, the domino effect.

But we need your support to move forward and complete the school so that we can work with more  people.

We need your support to finish building the school classroom and accommodation for students staying with us. We also need to buy a vehicle to transport goods and people up and down the mountain.

 

How much do we need?

  • School building, two geodesic domes joined to offer a large classroom and activity center. 5,000 Dollars
  • Accommodations, three 2 person huts and a 5 person dorm 5,000 Dollars
  • Toilet block based on compost toilet system 1,000 Dollars
  • Vehicle, to be able to transport guests and equipment up the mountain which is a 7km dirt track we need a 4x4 all-terrain vehicle. 3,000 Dollars

If we do not receive all the funding that we need, then we will prioritize the school building and toilet block over accommodation and vehicle as tents can be used as temporary accommodation and can be built later as we generate income organically from the fees the courses will generate

1000 Dollars is equal to 880 Euros or 770 GBP .

Total 14,000 Dollars 

 

What do you get in return?




We’re hugely grateful for any support, no matter how big or small.
If you only have 10 Dollars to donate, that’s absolutely fine and we thank you so much for contributing and hopefully sharing our video and campain to your friends.
If you would like to donate more, we are happy to give something back in return please see our perks.


 

 

Our Vision

 

We believe that the future can be sustainable. But people across the world need to have  the knowledge, understanding and tools to make the changes that are needed. The result will be a sustainable future for generations to come where everyone has access to healthy, locally grown food and each person leaves with a sense of worth, joy and hope.
Thank you so much for reading and please do follow our Facebook page to see what difference your donation makes. If you want to talk about a larger donation, and coming to Colombia to learn Permaculture,please do get in touch if you have any questions about how this would work  or what you would learn.

Our team

 

Sandrine Girardeau

Cofounder and manager of Love Grows SAS

Founder and Manager of Heart Call Intuition

Life Coach and NLP Practitioner

Sandrine was born and raised in Paris, France and moved to Spain in her early 20s. She found success as an artist and was the co-founder of Espace Terre, an art gallery and design centre. When she experienced a long period of depression and an unusual experience, she started to research self-reflection and looked insider herself to question the nature of life. She was able to reframe herself and began to savour and enjoy life once more.

In the last 15 years she has been working as a life coach and has studied reflexology, Reiki, Thai massage, Jen Shen Dao and Neurolinguistic Programming (NLP). 

However, it was Jean François Beny: analyst of human systems, cofounder of ‘Hug Me’, whom was her principal guide in her practice of elevation of consciousness, which today is her main tool to guide a variety of professionals in the field of self-development and any person with the desire to live their full potential.

After travelling the globe for four years, she settled in Colombia two years ago to set up Love Grows.

 

 

Russell Manning

Co-founder and Manager of Love Grows SAS

Permaculture Trainer

Born and raised in Southampton, England, Russell studied Biology at University, focussing on plant sciences. After moving to Spain in his early 20s, Russell focussed on his career in corporate environments but used his degree to continue cultivating his love of plants outside of work.

In 2012, after becoming disillusioned with life in the office, and wanting to find a more natural place to put down roots, he travelled to India, Asia, Australia and finally South America, learning from host eco-farmers about different farming methods and became fascinated with permaculture. He completed a professional Permaculture Design Certificate under Geoff Lawton of the Permaculture Research Institute in 2017 and began teaching immediately. Over 300 students have already attended one of his courses.

 

Contact us

 

Web:  https://www.permaculturecolombia.com/

Facbook: https://web.facebook.com/Permaculturetraveller

E-mail: lovegrowseden@gmail.com
story_txt:
A Better Way to LiveThe world can seem a pretty depressing place nowadays. Everything seems to be rising; global temperatures, sea levels, population figures, unemployment, poverty… the list goes on. You might be tempted to think that there’s nothing you can do about it, after all you’re just one person.But at Love Grows, based in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountains in Colombia, we’re doing things a little bit differently.By working with people from across the globe, and with locals, we spend each and every day showing people how they can harness the power of themselves and of Mother Nature to change the reality they live in.How do we do it?The way we work depends very much on the individuals we see and their needs, but are based around overarching principles and techniques of coaching and permaculture Coaching for empowerment Sandrine uses music, dance, speech and contact in her unique programme ‘Heartcall Intuition’ to help people unlock their inner potential, to find happiness and their purpose in life. Our school is based on our beautiful 26-acre farm and participants can relax and revive themselves in this peaceful environment.to have more information about HEARTCALL INTUITION retreat Perks  look athttps://www.permaculturecolombia.com/loving-art Permaculture Russell, a qualified permaculture trainer, gives each person the knowledgeand tools they need to use this sustainable agriculture method to build a permanent and self-sufficient way of living. Focusing on the development of a sustainable food chain rather than the modern industrial monoculture food production system, students learn how to design sustainable food production systems, wherever in the world they want to.to have more information about all Permaculture Perks look athttps://www.permaculturecolombia.com/permaculture Why do we need you?Our family; Russell, Sandrine and Lili bought the land nearly three years ago having lived on different eco farms and permaculture projects across the world. Having seen first-hand what can be achieved, we knew we wanted to pass on the knowledge we had gained. We have been  actively teaching for around 18 months as well as building, farming and continuing our own education. We’ve employed local people to build houses on the site as well as storage areas and a geo dome, and we’ve had tremendous support from volunteers across the globe; 27 nations in fact!Each person we work with takes with them the knowledge and understanding of how to build a more sustainable future. Each person we work with can help preserve this amazing planet for generations to come. Each person whom attends one of our self-development courses leaves a more informed happier person that can have an amazing impact on those around them, the domino effect.But we need your support to move forward and complete the school so that we can work with more  people.We need your support to finish building the school classroom and accommodation for students staying with us. We also need to buy a vehicle to transport goods and people up and down the mountain. How much do we need?
School building, two geodesic domes joined to offer a large classroom and activity center. 5,000 Dollars
Accommodations, three 2 person huts and a 5 person dorm 5,000 Dollars
Toilet block based on compost toilet system 1,000 Dollars
Vehicle, to be able to transport guests and equipment up the mountain which is a 7km dirt track we need a 4x4 all-terrain vehicle. 3,000 Dollars
If we do not receive all the funding that we need, then we will prioritize the school building and toilet block over accommodation and vehicle as tents can be used as temporary accommodation and can be built later as we generate income organically from the fees the courses will generate1000 Dollars is equal to 880 Euros or 770 GBP .Total 14,000 Dollars  What do you get in return?We’re hugely grateful for any support, no matter how big or small.If you only have 10 Dollars to donate, that’s absolutely fine and we thank you so much for contributing and hopefully sharing our video and campain to your friends.If you would like to donate more, we are happy to give something back in return please see our perks.  Our Vision We believe that the future can be sustainable. But people across the world need to have  the knowledge, understanding and tools to make the changes that are needed. The result will be a sustainable future for generations to come where everyone has access to healthy, locally grown food and each person leaves with a sense of worth, joy and hope.Thank you so much for reading and please do follow our Facebook page to see what difference your donation makes. She found success as an artist and was the co-founder of Espace Terre, an art gallery and design centre. When she experienced a long period of depression and an unusual experience, she started to research self-reflection and looked insider herself to question the nature of life. She was able to reframe herself and began to savour and enjoy life once more.In the last 15 years she has been working as a life coach and has studied reflexology, Reiki, Thai massage, Jen Shen Dao and Neurolinguistic Programming (NLP). However, it was Jean François Beny: analyst of human systems, cofounder of ‘Hug Me’, whom was her principal guide in her practice of elevation of consciousness, which today is her main tool to guide a variety of professionals in the field of self-development and any person with the desire to live their full potential.After travelling the globe for four years, she settled in Colombia two years ago to set up Love Grows.  Russell ManningCo-founder and Manager of Love Grows SASPermaculture TrainerBorn and raised in Southampton, England, Russell studied Biology at University, focussing on plant sciences. story:
Hello friends! My name is Morgan Caraway and I am a natural builder, homesteader, intentional community co-founder and author. In 2009 my wife, Mary Jane, and I moved on to a piece of undeveloped land in the Blue Ridge Mountains and began a homesteading adventure. We built a yurt, earthbag house and a cordwood bath house. Since then we joined a small, private intentional community and have helped build a pole barn and an earthbag house using earthship principles. My first exposure to natural building was through the original earthship book by Mike Reynolds. He's still a hero of mine to this day.

Our first earthbag house.

In our 7 years of living off-grid, we've learned a lot and we will put all of this knowledge and more into our most ambitious project yet - a fossil fuel-free house that uses passive solar design, thermal mass and hydronics (heated floors) to stay comfortable year-round without burning ANY fossil-fuels. We will also use biogas for cooking, solar electricity and solar water heating. We'll collect rainwater for utility use and have a spring for drinking water. We also use the humanure composting system. This house will be extremely affordable, incredibly strong, safe and comfortable, with many modern luxuries, even a hot tub! It may end up looking different than our drawing but, regardless, it will have the same systems and basic features. 


Over a lifetime, conventionally built modern houses use an extreme amount of energy to heat and cool them. If you're on grid, most of this energy is likely supplied by coal or nuclear. Both of these are devastating and dangerous to the environment and living things. This Winter (Dec 2015), those of us living on the East coast and folks in the Midwest have been experiencing climate chaos directly, with Summer-like temperatures and massive flooding. By building intelligently and thoughtfully and keeping natural cycles in mind, we can build a house that doesn't hemorrhage energy and money just to be livable, nor do we fight nature and pollute the atmosphere. We want to prove to the world that this can be done and show how. 

This will be a do-it-yourself, owner-built home and we plan to share what we've learned with other builders and permaculture enthusiasts. By funding this project, you will help it become a reality and also help to share these ideas and techniques with the rest of the world. 

Some of the techniques we'll use:

  • Earthbags - earthbag building is one of the lesser known natural building methods and one of the most versatile. A typical bag is clay and sand in a sandbag. The clay acts as a binder and the sand stabilizes the bags so the mix won't shrink too much as they dry. Earthbag walls are bullet-proof, fire-proof, bug-proof, flood-proof, impact-proof - you get the point, they're very strong! 
  • Solar electric - we already have 1 kW of panels and 8 Trojan L-16 deep cycle batteries. Our electrical needs are pretty minimal, our biggest draw is a DC fridge. We use LED lights (which are extremely efficient and long lasting) and modern tablets and laptops use very little energy.
  • Solar hot water - to free ourselves of having to use propane, we'll install a solar hot water system. This will include a well-insulated holding tank to keep the water warm for prolonged periods. We may also wrap a coil around our wood stove for hot water during long, cloudy periods.
  • Biogas - biogas is mostly methane and is produced when organic matter decays. This can be collected and used to power stoves or other gas appliances. This will be used mostly for cooking and will help us become totally propane free.
  • Hydronics - by piping hot water through pex in our floor, we will heat our house from the ground up.
  • Rainwater harvesting - we have used rainwater for almost 7 years. We will also collect rain at this house.
  • Passive solar and thermal mass - by having lots of South-facing windows we will maximize Winter solar gain. All of those windows you see at the bottom of the house are actually super-insulated freezer doors. By having the back of the house bermed (back-filled) we help regulate the inside temperature. These are the same principles that earthships use to stay comfortable. By using earthbags instead of rammed-earth tires, we save an extreme amount of labor.
  • The humanure system - an easy, effective and inexpensive composting method.
  • Bottle wall - a beautiful natural building method where bottles are placed in an earthen wall. The tree design you see on the front of the fossil fuel-free house will be bottle wall. From the inside it has an effect like stained glass.

A picture of the bottle wall before the sun room was added.

We will have a wood stove but I think it will mostly be for those times when we want to sit by the fire. We may later build a rocket or a masonry stove - we haven't decided which yet. There will likely be a fairly short transitional phase where we are still using some amount of propane for cooking and water heating. We may be able to reduce or avoid this entirely by cooking and heating water with a diversion load. 

Needs and Perks

Our campaign has a goal of $5,000. This money will cover part of the cost of the materials for the house. We will attempt to scrounge the rest of what we need together as we go unless the campaign gets overfunded, in which case it will all go towards building materials.

$1500 land clearing and leveling.

$500 for 2000 sandbags

$6000 lumber/flooring/hardware

$2000 windows and doors

$1600 fixtures/electrical/plumbing

$500 loads of dirt for plaster, bag fill and backfilling

$1800 insulation 

$2000 solar hot water system

$800 gravel

---------------------------------------

Total - $16,700


Everyone who donates at the level of $10 or above will get a first-release download link to the professionally produced, exclusive documentary about the building of this house (upon completion of the house and documentary, of course!) and all tiers above that will get a physical copy (DVD or USB flash memory) and our deep gratitude. All donors will be thanked in the credits of our documentary. 

Higher tiers will include the book "A Sustainable Life" (projected release date - late 2017) a how-to book that details in step-by-step instructions our building projects, including this new house and/or "Ecological Awakening" - an educational book that points out our inseparable connection to the environment in an attempt to wake humanity up (it should be done by late 2016). The highest levels will get skype consultations with me (Morgan) or even direct physical help for someone who lives close enough. 

For some examples of my writing. you can look at another project of mine: The Church of Nature.

I want to make my time and energy available to people who are trying to transition to a sustainable way of living. I'm also part of a successful, land-owning intentional community and have years of experience making it work. I'm happy to help up-and-coming communities as well. 

The Impact

Our first earthbag house has gone viral. Since Ross Lukeman did a write up on our house a few years ago, I've seen several knockoffs with dubious information. Here's the original article. We have a page at earthbagbuilding.com. Dr. Owen Geiger has shared our house twice on his Natural Building Blog. Mother Earth News shared a write-up about our house on facebook with their almost 2.2 million subscribers. We are convinced that this new house will get even more exposure and we look forward to sharing what we learn with the world. These techniques will be most applicable to areas without building codes. This information is intended for the owner builder and not someone who must go through a rigorous coding process. That being said, many of these techniques and principles can be used wherever you are in the world. I saw an ad for an "inexpensive," pre-fab, "zero-carbon" house that costs almost $250,000. Our house will end up costing less than a third of the price of a double wide trailer.

All of the economic reasons aside, what we really want is to live in a way that has no negative impact on the environment. Using permaculture principles and intelligent waste management systems like humanure, I know it's possible to make your surroundings even more lush and fertile than they would be without you. We see it as absolutely crucial that humanity reduces the amount of greenhouse gasses and other pollutants that we're putting into the atmosphere. This house and homes like it are a step in that direction.

By helping to fund this house, you will also be helping our community move forward towards its goals. We eventually want to produce all of our own food and have ongoing educational programs for those who seek to live a sustainable life.

Risks & Challenges

In my experience, every building project will face unexpected challenges but we have a good team working on this house, including experienced carpenters to help make sure we get everything right. I am no stranger to finishing big projects. I have written 4 books ("Blessed Disillusionment" [published], "The Unliving"  [self-published] and "Myth of the Ego" [not yet published]) and and am working on the 5th ("Ecological Awakening"). As I said before, I have built and finished many structures. I even made a video game and published it (quite an undertaking - let me assure you!). We plan for the main part of the house to be done by the end of July 2016. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't invest money but would like to help in other ways, feel free to contact me via the email in this campaign. Also please share this campaign on facebook, twitter and through other social media with anyone else you think might want to be part of it. If you'd like to come take part in the build, let me know. We will have multiple workshops  while we're building, each focusing on a particular aspect of the construction. Thanks!
