story:
Saving Bees and Texas Wildlife with Irrigation

CrownFox Farms is an Organic 20 acre Bee farm, and Nationally Certified Wildlife Habitat on the East side of Austin . This land desperately needs irrigation in order to exist and continue our mission to Save Bees and Wildlife. 

Our farm humanely raises Honey Bees, we humanely harvest small batches of the Bee's honey and we rehabilitate aggressive Bee hives. We organically grow native wildflowers and herbs for the Bees and have dedicated 9 of the 20 acres to becoming a Certified Wildlife Habitat through the National Wildlife Federation. This means we provide untouched land for wildlife to thrive: food, water, cover and places to raise young. Something DESPERATELY needed as Austin continues to over-develop.


Ironically, this farm is a quarter mile from the Colorado river and the farm is sitting on top of an enormous aquifer. The University of Texas has measured a massive well just 45ft down. 

If we can just get this land properly irrigated it will be a thriving habitat and organic farm dedicated to raising and rehabilitating HoneyBees.

The 20 acres has dozens of 100 year old pecan trees. Some 80-90 ft tall. This area East of Austin was some of the first area settled for farming when Austin formed.

If properly irrigated it would be a lush, multi-faceted space for not just animals but the public to enjoy. If funded we plan to grow thinner rows of wildflowers. Once the Bees and other pollinators use them we will allow the public to come out and easily pick fresh, beautiful Texas wildflowers and experience this beautiful farm. We plant Zinnias, Cosmos, Petunias, Blue Sage and many others.

Our goal is to create a haven to raise huge, healthy hives that don't need to forage far for food. We also plan on rearing Queen Bees to help combat the savage Bee problem in Texas. 

We work closely with and have always been mentored by a member of the Texas Master Beekeeping Program and recently appointed Travis County “Bee Expert”, Mr. David Stalker. David has shown us and continues to teach us how to humanely raise Bees, humanely harvest honey and how to farm chemically free . The goal is and always will be about creating more healthy hives and building the endangered Bee population.



Our Goal

We know this may sound like a lot to ask for. But honestly, with 20 acres, and the multiple goals we have for the use of this land, this is the just what it will take to get us going. We have a nice graphic that shows how the money would be spent. Most of these numbers were actual estimates from vendors.

The Impact

We are surrounded by large scale industrial farms and an ever encroaching cookie-cutter housing development. There is scarce resources for Honeybees as well as the Wildlife driven off the construction and neighboring farms.

We can make a HUGE impact with irrigation. This last year we started with a couple hives and hand watered 2 acres of Wildflowers for 3 hours every night. There are now 6 healthy hives and a few new, struggling. We can easily house 25 hives AND create a shop to rear productive Queens to rehabilitate the savage, "Hot" hives that we take in.

The Wildlife Habitat is undeniably already growing too. We see Coyotes, Foxes, Deer, Raccoons, Skunks, Rattlesnakes... you name it, they're coming here.


Risks & Challenges

There's always risks with farming and Beekeeping. But we plan to devote 100% of our efforts to maintaining this entire project. We've already spent a year priming this land and with irrigation and the proper tools we can quadruple our impact.

Spreading the word and Sharing!

We realize not everyone can give financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help in just as an important way. SHARE. Help spread the word that we are working at keeping a small part of Austin... of Texas, totally intact and need all the awareness possible.



For those able to donate we have an fun bunch of rewards we've put together!

If properly irrigated it would be a lush, multi-faceted space for not just animals but the public to enjoy. If funded we plan to grow thinner rows of wildflowers. Once the Bees and other pollinators use them we will allow the public to come out and easily pick fresh, beautiful Texas wildflowers and experience this beautiful farm. We plant Zinnias, Cosmos, Petunias, Blue Sage and many others.
Our goal is to create a haven to raise huge, healthy hives that don't need to forage far for food. We also plan on rearing Queen Bees to help combat the savage Bee problem in Texas. 
We work closely with and have always been mentored by a member of the Texas Master Beekeeping Program and recently appointed Travis County “Bee Expert”, Mr. David Stalker. David has shown us and continues to teach us how to humanely raise Bees, humanely harvest honey and how to farm chemically free . The goal is and always will be about creating more healthy hives and building the endangered Bee population.




   Our Goal We know this may sound like a lot to ask for. But honestly, with 20 acres, and the multiple goals we have for the use of this land, this is the just what it will take to get us going. We have a nice graphic that shows how the money would be spent. Most of these numbers were actual estimates from vendors.
  

    The Impact We are surrounded by large scale industrial farms and an ever encroaching cookie-cutter housing development. There is scarce resources for Honeybees as well as the Wildlife driven off the construction and neighboring farms.
We can make a HUGE impact with irrigation. This last year we started with a couple hives and hand watered 2 acres of Wildflowers for 3 hours every night. There are now 6 healthy hives and a few new, struggling. We can easily house 25 hives AND create a shop to rear productive Queens to rehabilitate the savage, "Hot" hives that we take in.
The Wildlife Habitat is undeniably already growing too. We see Coyotes, Foxes, Deer, Raccoons, Skunks, Rattlesnakes... you name it, they're coming here.

Risks & Challenges
 There's always risks with farming and Beekeeping. But we plan to devote 100% of our efforts to maintaining this entire project. We've already spent a year priming this land and with irrigation and the proper tools we can quadruple our impact.
    Spreading the word and Sharing! We realize not everyone can give financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help in just as an important way. SHARE. Help spread the word that we are working at keeping a small part of Austin... of Texas, totally intact and need all the awareness possible.





For those able to donate we have an fun bunch of rewards we've put together!

story:
The campaign "Help us saving endangered spider monkeys" has finished without success.
We thank the 16 contributors of Ecuador, Colombia, United States, Indonesia, Germany, UK, Canada and Venezuela.
With the money we raised, less the percentage Indiegogo charges and after they transfer us, we will make an educational activity in the community living near the forest fragment, we will be informing you.
If any visitor wants to collaborate can access our website and donate through Paypal, thanks

http://spidermonkeyproject.org

La campaña "Help us saving endangered spider monkeys" ha finalizado sin exito.
Agradecemos a los 16 colaboradores de Ecuador, Colombia, Estados Unidos, Indonesia, Alemania, Reino Unido, Canada y Venezuela.
Con el dinero que se logro recaudar, menos el porcentaje que Indiegogo cobra y luego que nos transfiera, haremos una jornada educativa en la comunidad que vive cerca de ese fragmento de bosque, les estaremos informando.
Si cualquier visitante desea colaborar puede ingresar a nuestra pagina web y donar a traves de Paypal, gracias

http://spidermonkeyproject.org

------------------------------------------------------------------
The Brown Spider Monkey Ateles hybridus was included in the list of 25 most endangered primate in the world 2014-2016 by (IUCN/SSC). This species of primate, distributed in Colombia and Venezuela is Critically Endangered according to the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN, 2008), primarily due to habitat loss and hunting.  In Libro Rojo de la Fauna Venezolana, a book listing Venezuelan animals and their conservation status, consideres A. hybridus as endangered (Rodríguez and Rojas-Suarez. 1999).

The Caparo Forest Reserve is located at the western plains of Venezuela. In this reserve there are remains of seasonal forests that occupied the plains of Venezuela and Colombia. This is one of the few locations on earth where this species of monkey is distributed and it is located in the area that is considered the most threatened for the species. It is important to note that in Venezuela, a “forest reserve” is not a protected area as you might imagine, on the contrary it is considered a place with precious wood that it is being saved for future extraction.The area we are trying to save is a privately owned neighboring the reserve where the monkeys live. 
The original area of the Caparo Forest Reserve was of over 184,000 ha of continuous forest, which in the last 30 years have been reduced to mere 7,000 ha plus several small isolated forest fragments of up to 150 ha. So the area where they live has been severely reduced, so you can imagine how alarming the situation for the spider monkeys living there is. On top of that, those forest fragments  are surrounded by 1,200 encroaching farms that use the land essentially for livestock.  Groups of spider monkeys have been found in some of these forest fragments. In the maps below you’ll be able to see just how much forest was and continues to be lost.

The encroachment threats, logging in natural forests and plantations for illegal timber extraction and forest firesare seriously affecting the survival of the spider monkeys population inhabiting Caparo.

In this satellite image below, Spot 2007, you can observed the forest fragments and the remaining 7000 hectares


Urgency:

There is a group of 20 spider monkeys living in one of these forest fragments, they are in danger because every year, a portion of the forest disappears. 


This forest fragment has an area of 20 hectares within a plot of 30 hectares, in a locality known as "Palma Pintada", on edge of the forest largest, the owner plans to deforest this year, but also is open the option of selling the whole 30 hectares plot.

Impact

How the money will be spent:

With your collaboration we want to buy 30 hectares of land that contains the forest fragment and to save a group of spider monkeys of 20 individuals, establish the based for the Spider Monkey Project, where there can be students, volunteers and researchers for a future management plan for this group.


If the goal is not reached or surpassed, the money can be used in many other activities that we need to carry out such as: environmental education, research, conservation actions, costs of volunteers, students, field assistants and equipment.
You can follow our progress and see how we use the money with the updates we make on our facebook and website

Who we are:

We are the Spider Monkey Project a non-governmental, non-profit association of a small group of researchers, individuals and local community , worried about the protection of the last forest of the western plains of Venenzuela and spider monkeys that live there

We started in 2013 with 3 research projects with the support of Mohamed bin Zayed Species Conservation Fund,  see case study here, in 2014 conducted a program of environmental education with the support of Conservatoire Primates, they also support us this year with a project to distribution of spider monkey in Venezuela, in 2015 we received a visit from a zoo keepers st Paignton Zoo,  you can see her experience in their blog entry: A visit to Proyecto Mono Araña, and more recently we started with other projects supported by Auckland Zoo this year.

The aim of Spider Monkey Project is the long-term conservation of the spider monkey (Ateles hybridus) and its habitat in the Caparo Forest Reserve

Project specific objectives

Conduct scientific research that will let us know diverse aspects of the ecology of the species, its threats, habitat status and effects of fragmentation in the local population.

Train young researchers and local youth in the community on issues of ecology, environmental education and conservation.

Implement actions to conserve the spider monkey populations and its habitat in the Caparo Forest Reserve.

Implement an environmental education program to raise awareness among the local community about the importance of preserving this species and its habitat in the Caparo Forest Reserve.

Incorporate the local community in projects involving sustainable practices for the maintenance of forests and biodiversity.

Meet the monkeys (at least some of them)

These are some of the individuals who make up the group of monkeys that are in danger in the fragment and you can help us save them!
They were identified through research conducted by the Peruvian biologist Alisa Aliaga


The Perks!

Any type of contribution will be very significant for us, your greatest reward will be part of this project for forest and spider monkeys conservation in caparo, owning a piece of forest home to a group of spider monkeys.
The only thing we can offer is this great poster with a photo of a spider monkey used in our educational campaign and choose professional nature photographs that have been taken by the author Diana Duque along some years in Caparo.



Together we can do it !
Thank you very much for your help !

Risks & Challenges

Venezuela is going through one of the major economic crisis in its history, the prices of everything increase every week, our greatest risk is that by the time we can raise the funds, the price has changed or the owner changes his mind and does not want to sell the forest.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that some of you just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some other ways that you can help us achieve our goals:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family.
  • Visit us for research or volunteering
  • Like us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/spidermonkeyconservati...)
  • Check out our website to learn more (http://spidermonkeyproject.org).

story:
WHAT IS THE PROJECT?

The goal of the project is to provide solution in electricity issues in the rural areas to protect the nature, to continue the traditional lifestyle and to ensure that the land is looked after.


WHY ELECTRICITY?

The traditional nomadic way of life of Mongols is an environmentally friendly way of living.  They move around from one area to another ensuring minimal damage and pollution to the land. 

Unfortunately the downside of this lifestyle is no access to permanent electricity due to constant moving around. 

Solar powered energy resource has been used in the recent times but it does not generate sufficient amount of electricity to meet modern day needs.  Such needs include use of television, refrigerator, freezer (especially dairy and meat produce that are hard to keep fresh in the warmer season), cell phone charge and use of heaters in the colder season to reduce coal and wood burning to warm the ger. 

 

WHO WE ARE?

We are “ILCHDIIN GAL” NGO, a group of likeminded people who have come together to protect the green environment of our country and have volunteered to do so by initiating this project.


WHERE IS IT?

We plan to implement the project in 4 aimags that calls Bayanhongor, Zavhan, Arhangai and Hovsgol and theirs  10 soums of the western region of Mongolia by installing, monitoring and providing repair service to the families taking part in the project.


WHY THIS PROJECT?

After many years of active participation in environmental protection activities it was clear that those who live and know the area are the best protectors and savors of the land.  Therefore we chose native herders for this project.   

Upon research conducted on challenges these herders face we found that majority of them identified “desire to have electricity, hot and cold water like the big city and be able to use cellphones, computer, television  and be in tune with the rest of the world” as the primary need.

These herders send their children to the city for education but once children get the taste of comfortable lifestyle in the city they have no desire to return to the countryside and go through the hardships of nomadic way of life.  This has affected the decrease in number of young herders and today most of the herders are those who are in their 40s, 50s and 60s.  Even though, the purpose of our project is geared towards environmental protection it also has a much broader spectrum of maintaining traditional nomadic way of life from fading away and continuing our heritage to the next generation.


IMPACT TO ENVIRONMENT

·  Re-using animal dung and manure to produce energy would reduce greenhouse gas and dissemination of CH4 compounds in the atmosphere.  

·  The fertilizer produced from the machine can be used to feed the livestock as Mongolia is facing shortage in pasture land.  This ensures to keep the environment pristine as well as managing the traditional way of herding without damaging the land. 

·  Abandoned and neglected part of the country will have inhabitants who will look after the land and protect it. 

IMPACT TO WAY OF LIFE

·  Each and every family will have ability generate their own electricity and be self -sufficient. 

IMPACT TO SOCIAL AND ECONOMY

·  Continuing the traditional way of living and prepare the next generation to inherit the heritage. 

·  Increasing the number of young herders that are rapidly in decline.

·  Reducing the unemployment level


WHY US?


We have 10 years of experience in working in the area of environmental protection  in the country.  The wisdom of nomadic Mongols have always lied on effective consumerism on day to day life rather than over consumption which western developed countries are now striving to achieve. 

Advancing the nomadic way of life, a lifestyle that has least negative impact on the environment, and inheriting it to the next generation is the goal of our many years of hard work and experience.  Environment protection does not fall on one particular individual but rather a way of living consciously on how we impact the environment through our everyday life and be a role mode to our young generation and teach them on how to reduce negative impact on the environment.

The most effective way to organize this project and to reach public and the higher leadership in the government is to establish a model soum and sub soums.  The important aspect of it is to make the government see and understand our goals and thus make them find alternate and better ways to develop our country without damaging the homeland and to hand it to our next generation in one piece.  We are the representatives of the new generation who are united in protecting our nature and homeland and we made it our mission to make the change happen through our dedication and hard work above everything else. 


WHY NOW?

Mongolia has a tremendous amount of natural resources and actively taking actions to put these resources into economic circulations.  This has resulted environmental degradation in such fast pace that we’re facing the danger of extinction of pristine nature in our country.  So it is of vital importance to start the project in the nearest future.


USE OF FUNDS

The unit cost of the equipment is 150,000USD and it is very expensive for an average nomadic family to procure one.  We propose to implement initial phase of our project as a grant, supplying, installing and providing repair work free of charge to the families.  This ensures quick outreach to the public in short period of time.   

The equipment is specifically designed for the conditions of Mongolia and being made as a special order. 

For more details of the equipment:

http://www.biolectric.be/

We will be responsible for costs of installation, repair, transportation, training and monitoring. 


Attention: 

The video in this presentation Made by Tavka Zurgaanjin


You can enjoy the other photos and videos uploaded

https://youtu.be/BGzkcESnwYM?list=PL74hkj0EVOGq73mmYtrK6qehkVwildXOu
https://youtu.be/Yl_vMZIH87k?list=PL74hkj0EVOGq73mmYtrK6qehkVwildXOu

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone is in a position to make a financial contribution, and we can empathize! 

Spread the word about the #LAST NOMADS SAVING LAND BY WAY OF LIFE on Facebook or Twitter.

Contributions make a huge difference, but so does community support. Please share our campaign with your friends, family, colleagues & strangers alike through email, text, word of mouth, phone conversations, carrier pigeon, baseball signs and ESPECIALLY SOCIAL MEDIA!

story:
The funding collected will be directly used to scale the impact of the venture by doubling the capacity, which will help us move towards our mission of providing recycled footwear to every feet in the World!

                               www.greensole.in   

                                 

                                  The Problem

  More than 350 million pairs of shoes are discarded each year and an          average pair upon incineration generates 30 lbs of emissions  


                       

          

     On the other hand as per the WHO & UNESCO report, 1.5 billion      people are infected by disease contracted through unprotected feet  


                                       Solution

            

                

At Greensole we refurbish discarded shoes to comfortable footwear               and provide them to the neediest, thus bridging the gap 

         We save carbon emissions per pair that we refurbish and also                                           give employment in the process

 
                                   Milestones so far..

     Appreciation letter by President Barack Obama & the First Lady

                                                       Remarks by Sir Ratan Tata

                      

                                                   Greensoles in Vogue Magazine

Read further: Vogue, YourStory, Hindu Business Line, BBC, DNA and Jugaad Magazine

                                                                                                  

                                          Perks

                                                 Donate a pair



                                          Greensoles for personal use


             

                                     Donate Greensoles to a village


                                        Timeline

2014

April: Concieved Idea
November: Received two industrial design patents

2015

Jan: Seed capital through B-plan competitions
June: Registered company
August: Started Manufacturing

2016

Jan: Donated 3,000th pair

April: Indiegogo Campaign & launch of market range

June: Moving towards our target of impacting 50,000 needy in 2016

  

                                       Gallery

                                                                           The idea!

                                                           Prototyping

                                                              Donating footwear

                                                                Greensoles now
story_txt:
The funding collected will be directly used to scale the impact of the venture by doubling the capacity, which will help us move towards our mission of providing recycled footwear to every feet in the World!
                               www.greensole.in   
                                                                   The Problem  More than 350 million pairs of shoes are discarded each year and an          average pair upon incineration generates 30 lbs of emissions                                        On the other hand as per the WHO & UNESCO report, 1.5 billion      people are infected by disease contracted through unprotected feet                                         Solution                            At Greensole we refurbish discarded shoes to comfortable footwear               and provide them to the neediest, thus bridging the gap          We save carbon emissions per pair that we refurbish and also                                           give employment in the process                                    Milestones so far..     Appreciation letter by President Barack Obama & the First Lady                                                       Remarks by Sir Ratan Tata                      
                                                   Greensoles in Vogue MagazineRead further: Vogue, YourStory, Hindu Business Line, BBC, DNA and Jugaad Magazine                                                                                                                                            Perks

                                                 Donate a pair


                                          Greensoles for personal use

             

                                     Donate Greensoles to a village

                                        Timeline
2014

April: Concieved IdeaNovember: Received two industrial design patents

2015

Jan: Seed capital through B-plan competitionsJune: Registered companyAugust: Started Manufacturing

2016
Jan: Donated 3,000th pair


April: Indiegogo Campaign & launch of market range


June: Moving towards our target of impacting 50,000 needy in 2016

story:
UPDATE: 

Thank you for visiting and to everyone who backed the campaign so far... but there is still a chance to buy one of these prints and support the campaign. Visit the Urban Good shop.

 

The London National Park City is well on its way to being established. 

We need to build tools to help everyone explore the London National Park City and get the most from it. Connecting children and adults to nature, experiencing the benefits of green and blue space, finding the play spaces, seeking out the trails and cycle paths, learning about biodiversity and where to look for all the above is why we are making this map. It will be a large-format, folded map – similar in shape and feel to the old, paper Ordnance Survey Explorer maps, but custom drawn to highlight places to explore.

Plus ... We have space on the reverse of the map for a beautiful atlas: showing the geology, watercourses, densities, contours, transport networks and many other layers of information that make up London National Park City. An engaging way to learn more about the complex systems that structure the park.

We want to know what everyone wants to see on the map: the cycle routes, the quiet spaces, the best vistas and so on. We will run a public campaign to reach out and ask Londoners what they want on their map.

Then, once we have printed it, we want to be sure that everyone who needs one can get one. We are aiming to print 10,000 in the first run, but will gauge interest and demand in the run up. Our pitch is to use surplus funding to send free copies to groups who would usually not get one and to make sure they go far and wide.

To achieve this, Charlie Peel from The New Civic has partnered with the London National Park City Initiative to make and sell some fine art prints as rewards to generate enough funding to commission, design and produce a master map of the park. We hope you like them and will want some. Thanks for taking the time to get this far.

 

NOW... THE REWARDS!

 

What will you get?

  • Every backer will be sent a copy of our final National Park City map.
  • Every backer will be a named supporter of the map, printed on the reverse. 

However, we hope you might want one of the BIGGER rewards below (all sent to you in time for Christmas, just saying!)

Huge hand printed London maps

GOLD

  • A very limited edition of 5, printed with the water layer of London in GOLD - and be a named super-supporter of the folded map this crowdfunder is supporting.
  • Designed by Charlie Peel and printed with the award winning textile and surface designer Daniel Heath Studio.
  • Plus - we will send you one of the A2 Giclee Prints (see reward below)
  • Plus - we will send you two copies of our folded map.

COPPER

  • A numbered, limited edition of the screen print in COPPER, impossible to create with any ordinary printer, this metallic acrylic mix looks amazing. 
  • Plus - we will send you the A2 Fine Art Giclee Print (see reward below)
  • Plus - we will send you two copies of the folded map, and you will be a named supporter.

BLUE

  • A giant, A0 hand screen-print of London's buildings and waterways designed by Charlie Peel and printed with the award winning textile and surface designer Daniel Heath Studio.
  • Printed in the, more traditional, BLUE!
  • Plus - we will send you two copies of the folded map, and you will be a named supporter.

​

 

A2 Giclee prints of London's Open Spaces

  • A fine art print of the original proposal map drawn by Charlie Peel with Ordnance Survey and Open Street Map. This has been re-worked and re-coloured for giclee printing with vivid colours on archival textured paper, [Hahnemühle German Etching 310gsm]
  • Printed locally in London by the amazing Printer of Dreams.
  • There will be a beautiful key as well on the final version, that is also signed and stamped.

 

 

The folded National Park City map

  • Or simply buy your copy in advance.
  • Be a named supporter on the reverse of the map.
  • This map will be an Ordnance Survey style explorer map, custom drawn for London's Great Outdoors - showing how all our parkland is connected and in much more detail that our Open Spaces map.

 

The Impact

Our London National Park City map will give ideas to parents, help teachers teach, inspire young children to explore London's nature, and be stuck to many walls and held in many hands, including the Mayor of London's. 

We hope you want one or more of the prints, and can support the creation of something great. Thank you, and share at will!

 

Where does the money go?

We need to pay for some mapping data, a cartographer, a designer, a printer, and then for distribution. 100% of the proceeds from this crowdfunder are committed to creating the most beautiful and exciting map we can, and getting it out there. Any surplus funds will be spent finding the harder-to-reach and getting them a copy, and making it as public as possible with public posters and a digital campaign. There will be full transparency and project accounts made available on request.

100% of the money raised will be spent on the cause.

This is a joint, not-for-profit project by:

London National Park City Initiative and The New Civic.

HOW DOES THIS MAP NOT ALREADY EXIST?!

story:
Short Summary

Bees decline is paining every one. Why ? 

It affects in every way in our day to day life. It limits and restricts our food supply, our cloths, our water and our air. All these can cost more and more when the bees decline go grave and the bees number is reduced.  Our money value goes down. We end up paying more.

Our pocket gets affected. Our life style itself gets changed. 

Below video is just to tell you about what is happening to bees all around the world.

Bees' are declining continuously. It is attributed to bee diseases and insecticides among bee stresses as also converging lesser forage areas for bees.  But will the blame game do any good to save bees?

I find it is not at all helping and on the other hand it is getting from bad to worse. I strongly feel the need to act  and be responsible. If we don't take responsibility who else will?

Who am I?

I am VG, a farmer by birth and have great passion for bees and nature. My research on bees during the seventies and eighties gave me more insight into bee values. Ever since  I have acted on several occasions to spread bee values and have contributed a lot in creating awareness on bees and bee products. Today I feel the need to take up the bees decline as a global issue and feels it is time to act and show my responsibility to the world.   

  • This is not the beginning of my social work nor is it aimed for any personal benefit. I have been involved in many  social responsibility  projects in and around my village, including propagating beekeeping and training the public and school children on bees and its importance in nature. It has been there for several years.
  • In my journey I have initiated honey processing center/bee breeding/beekeeping of added income/bees in agriculture etc in my village with dedication to educate people on bee values and bee products.
  • My findings that mining bee products like royal jelly, pollen, propolis, bee venom etc., all of which has high commercial value in wellness, pharmaceutical and cosmetic industries should make beekeeping a sustainable entrepreneurial choice did find slow results. Again it is disheartening to find people drifting from agriculture.  
  • A time has now come that bees are declining to the extent of extinct and the global scenario is worse than ever.  Bees are needed not just by one country and bees fly beyond geographical boundaries defying political limits and frames. 
  • As a first step of my global activity, I founded Global Bee Village, a platform for all the bee enthusiasts and bee experts to join and share their opinion.    

The global reach was made much more practical with the social platforms and with my interest in quest for knowledge on bees of the world. The support from the bee experts from all over the world was overwhelming and many serious discussions over a period made me to enter the 2nd stage of my global operation of breeding more bees to fight against bees decline.

Bees For Us Project 

Bees for us project is born to simply breed more bees involving people and making a system to spontaneously work into and within the people. It is a self sustaining project that goes by its own, once initiated.  

Infographic on the project is here. Click to see

  • Bees for us project is an on the field practical deployment of bees reaching out the pupils, public and farmers .  It is a self-sustaining system. 
  • Why should it be such an elaborate one with apiary, education, awareness and also deployment of bees in rural and urban areas?  

The simple reason is they are connected to each other. If all those aspects are not handled at a time, the project can fail or drag and there is less time with us. Bees are fast disappearing. 

  • What is my back ground?

Looking  years back, I have successfully implemented  several co-operative level agricultural operations like forming milk society, agricultural society, educational libraries, and schools . That gives me a pragmatic approach to evolve a system that works continuously and on sustainable basis. It is several years experience and exposure that is its backbone.

The base and core strength of the system is forming an Apiculture Incubation Farm that will have :      

  1.  Apiary for show casing,research and sustainability.
  2.  Breeding center for producing more 'resistant' bees. 
  3.  Education facility for imparting knowledge in young generation on bee values.
  4.  Propagation and bee awareness creation in public.
  5.  Support farmers for bee keeping by total bee keeping solution.
  6.  Servicing the urban bee enthusiasts, encouraging and supporting their needs.

An apiary shall give a strong back up in educating, creating awareness, and sustainability and in providing total solution for bee keeping to one and all. There is very few or less professional set up at present in most of the countries that gives a 'total bee keeping solution' under one umbrella. The apiculture incubation farm takes such an initiative.

The above said six programs of the incubation farm are most essential to make it work fool proof. In other words, an apiary alone will not make it work; an education system alone cannot break the ice, a farmer approach alone shall not meet the need, a simple urban approach alone cannot solve the issues of bee decline and the strong need to breed more bees.

Location:

I know that location makes a lot of difference when handling a global issue like that of bees.  It is after days and months of thought that we finally decided to start the incubation farm in Dubai.

It is a location to make the message reach the maximum people at minimum time,  Dubai is a country of possibilities and has many firsts in its crown. Dubai has more than 200 nationalities living and working and is a commercial hub to Asian and European markets. Any system can easily percolate down the world from Dubai at ease.

It is also important to have the Apiculture Incubation Farm for sustainability and income generation as it involves the need for  cash for practical implementation of breeding more bees and deploying them in the field while mitigating bee decline paving way for unlimited job opportunities  and also showing direction to entrepreneurs connected with bees and agriculture.

With my back ground as a chemical engineer, as certified NLP coach and having trained more than 30000 entrepreneurs on different fields with the exceptional motivational skill and drive, the support of people around me gives me great strength to move and work towards this goal and of making it possible to have one bee colony for every 10 person on earth by 2030. Project 'Bees for us' of my concept and plan is one that will make far reaching positive results in  quality agricultural development in every nook and corner.

I am sure with people cooperation and drive, the project would take shape soon. Your cooperation and support is essential for that to happen as you are the people, you are my friend and you are my supporter.

Every contribution to this novel project, first of its kind, shall show the depth of love for sustaining bees on earth. It Is a need and necessity of every one of us as bee decline is indirectly making every person spend more than what he/she should have due to increase in cost of food, clothing and also in maintaining our vulnerable environment including air and water.

Your contribution may be sacrificing a tea, a movie, a gadget that you want to acquire; it may be just giving an unwanted thing off in your house, it may be a day’s earnings or a month’s salary.  It sure is an involvement that you make in keeping the world sustain with bees, for your own food and existence upon this earth. 

Think of your children. Today, if what you make is for your children,  think of bees decline destroying their future!!  Bees help us to create abundance. They do it just by pollination and maintaining the ecosystem. 

If it is not you who else will build it? It is not my project; it is our project and I just take the lead. 

There are several perks and chances to win more than you contribute.  You can contribute even a small amount you decide with the inner feeling of a 'generous giving' for a great cause.

Remember, the project is for you; for each one of us. 

All contributions shall be acknowledged promptly.

The System that will continue to work.

The Apiculture Incubation Farm is continuously supported by the bee experts from the world (Global Bee Village as the platform) with the bee technologies and best of the bee management practices shall be implemented.

Along with the incubation farm, local entrepreneurs are  encouraged to form independent entrepreneurial cells called 'Bee Cells' in hundreds and that further encourages "BeeVs".

The Apiculture Incubation Farm shall remain as the  mother of all Bee Cells and BeeVs.

Infographics for you. Click on.

The Impact

The public contributions are going to change the bees volume in this world. It will sure generate job opportunities and more of our food crop while promoting entrepreneurs. 

This initiative is expected to make every country tell each farmer in the agricultural sector to have a minimum number of bee colonies for enjoying any government support and subsidies.

It will change the bee awareness of people around, as more and more people will start talking about it and know importance of bees.

The fundamental education about bees for children will make them learn about the bees as an institution that has many things of value to teach and learn. It will bring more discipline in children and cohesiveness in working together for any project they do. A better citizen with bees education is not far off.

Total bee keeping solution will make people own bees and learn more about bee products. It will change their life style and they shall be more healthy and free from sickness. 

Bees will bring abundance everywhere. There will be more of water and food. Air will be cleaner. Atmosphere will be cooler.

 With the increased bees, our food will become poison free, our water will get less contaminated.

Your contribution is going to make a long term impact in the ecosystem and it is vital.

Bringing more of nature in our daily life with bees supporting us all the way and we supporting them to survive, 

How much fund is required and why? 

To build an Apiculture Incubation Farm in Dubai,  it needs to have an appropriate agricultural land not far off from cities, hundreds of bee colonies, thousands of bee hives, bee handling tools, bee product processing machinery, bee breeding facilities, bee feeding for lean period, lots of bee keepers to have bee management, bee expertise for training and mining bee products, servicing facility, making a self-learning educational observational bee hive with servicing back up, awareness campaign arrangements with transport facility, on field training and so on.  It all really needs a huge amount.

Within the best limitations and for all the things to bring into operation and as per my worked out business plan it shall need  at best  $ 600,000 ; less expenses for this campaign.   

  • Educational models of self-imparting and 'any time learning' system development is expected to take time and effort as also financial commitment while taking a great responsibility.   
  • Setting up of an awareness training center and farmers involvement needs a lot of local  interactions and effort.
  • Urban bee keeping might involve a  collaborative arrangement and ready service facility that needs dealing with emergency situations and risk.

The joy of contribution:

The joy of contribution is that cannot be explained in words. You love the bees and  it is a love that you share for the well being of your own children.

Each contribution comes with a wonderful opportunity in terms of your giving to society and to   make you proud.  

Several perks are  set to get back more than what you pay such as the life membership cards in the apiary. 

We have made exceptional payment models even taking the spirit of giving off what you don't use so that we value every bit of the spirit.

The perk models that we would like to highlight are

a) Featured perk encouraging you to share your love :

It is a golden gift that you can give to anyone with love and care. To see details click here 

Bee represents care; bee represents togetherness; bee represents love.  A pure gold and unique gift to your dear one is of value to you, the person who receive it and to us.

b) 20 second tea:  It is a gift to yourself with a royal treat. This recipe is a test and trial of many years and a perfect blessing in disguise for all those who love tea. The bee touch in that would make you love it for life time. Get it today.

Carefully crafted to see that each penny you spend is going for a definite purpose that simply finds its way to multiply in our incubation farm.

Each penny goes for breeding more bees and in the making of the Apiculture Incubation Farm. I am sure of reaching the goal and my target of generating the required fund.

This project is born.  It takes its wings.  

I am totally dedicated to make it happen.The closer I am to the target funding,  the faster I reach my goal.   I take pride to spread it with great passion.

Risks & Challenges

The project is not free from risks and challenges. Every step forward is with caution and to make it work and perform the best.

What risks and challenges are anticipated and how am I going to face them?

1.  Hot climate: The extreme hot climate of Dubai in summer can be a challenge to keep the bees survive.  Apis Mellifera (European bee) may not be able to stand it unless proper care is given. Failure in the initial stage itself might make people deter and not propagate the program. 

 For this reason, we are going for more of acclimatized local bees - Apis Cerana in our apiary at initial stages,  This should bring better confidence in the farmers as they need less care too.

2. Penetrating the farming community and make them say "yes"

Penetrating the farming community for encouraging bee keeping can be a challenge as they will not be able to assess the pollination benefit. The palm trees being the main crop in Dubai, it might lead to lot of resistance from farmers unless they get a substantial income from bee products.

Our bee experts have suggested ways and means of overcoming this challenge by propagating to have special honey and value addition using the latest technological advances in beekeeping.

Some of them can definitely make a break through in beekeeping history.

3. Acceptance of bee as a friend as against prevailing fear of bee.

There is a general bee fear and bee hatred in people more in cities compared to villages. The mental block need to be cleared for accepting bees by the people.

Expecting this we are moving with two simultaneous programs - the educational program in schools and second the awareness programs combined with urban bee promoting.

4. Educational program - how they will take it?

Will the schools accept to have bees? Will fear of bees make students not to attend class?

My research tells it need not bother them and I could conduct a bee class in one of the schools where there are more than 10,000 students. It was a real experience and that gives me more confidence.  We can start the project though a different level if need be.

​The bee experts from all over the world just standing to support my work gives me enough courage to overcome any challenge that might come in implementing the project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 There are many ways to contribute and sometimes it can be more than direct funding.  

A good heart can influence others and you may not know your power.  Feel free to tell your friends. Pass it on through your communities and social circles - face book, LinkedIn, twitter, instagram, YouTube, G+     and where ever you are present and you have couple of friends.

It really works when you tell your friends. There are so many good people out there.

Talk ....talk...talk and make noise around you that convey the message to save bees and this project that works for it. Use the Indiegogo share tool.

As a contributor you can see yourself from Indiegogo how much you influence in contributing

And yes, "if there is a will, there is a way" is true in helping the world to have more bees.

Supports:

The supports and co-operation I get from different parts of the world are great and gives me enough fuel to move ahead strongly.

The global reach was made much more practical with the social platforms and with my interest in quest for knowledge on bees of the world. The support from the bee experts from all over the world was overwhelming and many serious discussions over a period made me to enter the 2nd stage of my global operation of breeding more bees to fight against bees decline.Bees For Us Project Bees for us project is born to simply breed more bees involving people and making a system to spontaneously work into and within the people. It is a self sustaining project that goes by its own, once initiated.  Infographic on the project is here. Click to see
Bees for us project is an on the field practical deployment of bees reaching out the pupils, public and farmers .  It is a self-sustaining system. 
Why should it be such an elaborate one with apiary, education, awareness and also deployment of bees in rural and urban areas?  
The simple reason is they are connected to each other. If all those aspects are not handled at a time, the project can fail or drag and there is less time with us. Bees are fast disappearing. What is my back ground?Looking  years back, I have successfully implemented  several co-operative level agricultural operations like forming milk society, agricultural society, educational libraries, and schools . That gives me a pragmatic approach to evolve a system that works continuously and on sustainable basis. It is several years experience and exposure that is its backbone.The base and core strength of the system is forming an Apiculture Incubation Farm that will have :      
 Apiary for show casing,research and sustainability.
 Breeding center for producing more 'resistant' bees. 
 Education facility for imparting knowledge in young generation on bee values.
 Propagation and bee awareness creation in public.
 Support farmers for bee keeping by total bee keeping solution.
 Servicing the urban bee enthusiasts, encouraging and supporting their needs.
An apiary shall give a strong back up in educating, creating awareness, and sustainability and in providing total solution for bee keeping to one and all. There is very few or less professional set up at present in most of the countries that gives a 'total bee keeping solution' under one umbrella. The apiculture incubation farm takes such an initiative.The above said six programs of the incubation farm are most essential to make it work fool proof. In other words, an apiary alone will not make it work; an education system alone cannot break the ice, a farmer approach alone shall not meet the need, a simple urban approach alone cannot solve the issues of bee decline and the strong need to breed more bees.Location:I know that location makes a lot of difference when handling a global issue like that of bees.  It is after days and months of thought that we finally decided to start the incubation farm in Dubai.It is a location to make the message reach the maximum people at minimum time,  Dubai is a country of possibilities and has many firsts in its crown. Dubai has more than 200 nationalities living and working and is a commercial hub to Asian and European markets. Any system can easily percolate down the world from Dubai at ease.It is also important to have the Apiculture Incubation Farm for sustainability and income generation as it involves the need for  cash for practical implementation of breeding more bees and deploying them in the field while mitigating bee decline paving way for unlimited job opportunities  and also showing direction to entrepreneurs connected with bees and agriculture.With my back ground as a chemical engineer, as certified NLP coach and having trained more than 30000 entrepreneurs on different fields with the exceptional motivational skill and drive, the support of people around me gives me great strength to move and work towards this goal and of making it possible to have one bee colony for every 10 person on earth by 2030. Project 'Bees for us' of my concept and plan is one that will make far reaching positive results in  quality agricultural development in every nook and corner.I am sure with people cooperation and drive, the project would take shape soon. Your cooperation and support is essential for that to happen as you are the people, you are my friend and you are my supporter.Every contribution to this novel project, first of its kind, shall show the depth of love for sustaining bees on earth. It Is a need and necessity of every one of us as bee decline is indirectly making every person spend more than what he/she should have due to increase in cost of food, clothing and also in maintaining our vulnerable environment including air and water.Your contribution may be sacrificing a tea, a movie, a gadget that you want to acquire; it may be just giving an unwanted thing off in your house, it may be a day’s earnings or a month’s salary.  It sure is an involvement that you make in keeping the world sustain with bees, for your own food and existence upon this earth. Think of your children. Today, if what you make is for your children,  think of bees decline destroying their future!!  Bees help us to create abundance. They do it just by pollination and maintaining the ecosystem. If it is not you who else will build it? It is not my project; it is our project and I just take the lead. There are several perks and chances to win more than you contribute.  You can contribute even a small amount you decide with the inner feeling of a 'generous giving' for a great cause.Remember, the project is for you; for each one of us. All contributions shall be acknowledged promptly.The System that will continue to work.The Apiculture Incubation Farm is continuously supported by the bee experts from the world (Global Bee Village as the platform) with the bee technologies and best of the bee management practices shall be implemented.Along with the incubation farm, local entrepreneurs are  encouraged to form independent entrepreneurial cells called 'Bee Cells' in hundreds and that further encourages "BeeVs".The Apiculture Incubation Farm shall remain as the  mother of all Bee Cells and BeeVs.Infographics for you. Click on.The ImpactThe public contributions are going to change the bees volume in this world. It will sure generate job opportunities and more of our food crop while promoting entrepreneurs. This initiative is expected to make every country tell each farmer in the agricultural sector to have a minimum number of bee colonies for enjoying any government support and subsidies.It will change the bee awareness of people around, as more and more people will start talking about it and know importance of bees.The fundamental education about bees for children will make them learn about the bees as an institution that has many things of value to teach and learn. It will bring more discipline in children and cohesiveness in working together for any project they do. A better citizen with bees education is not far off.Total bee keeping solution will make people own bees and learn more about bee products. It will change their life style and they shall be more healthy and free from sickness. Bees will bring abundance everywhere. There will be more of water and food. Air will be cleaner. Atmosphere will be cooler. With the increased bees, our food will become poison free, our water will get less contaminated.Your contribution is going to make a long term impact in the ecosystem and it is vital.Bringing more of nature in our daily life with bees supporting us all the way and we supporting them to survive, How much fund is required and why? To build an Apiculture Incubation Farm in Dubai,  it needs to have an appropriate agricultural land not far off from cities, hundreds of bee colonies, thousands of bee hives, bee handling tools, bee product processing machinery, bee breeding facilities, bee feeding for lean period, lots of bee keepers to have bee management, bee expertise for training and mining bee products, servicing facility, making a self-learning educational observational bee hive with servicing back up, awareness campaign arrangements with transport facility, on field training and so on.  It all really needs a huge amount.Within the best limitations and for all the things to bring into operation and as per my worked out business plan it shall need  at best  $ 600,000 ; less expenses for this campaign.   
Educational models of self-imparting and 'any time learning' system development is expected to take time and effort as also financial commitment while taking a great responsibility.   
Setting up of an awareness training center and farmers involvement needs a lot of local  interactions and effort.
Urban bee keeping might involve a  collaborative arrangement and ready service facility that needs dealing with emergency situations and risk.
The joy of contribution:The joy of contribution is that cannot be explained in words. You love the bees and  it is a love that you share for the well being of your own children.Each contribution comes with a wonderful opportunity in terms of your giving to society and to   make you proud.  Several perks are  set to get back more than what you pay such as the life membership cards in the apiary. We have made exceptional payment models even taking the spirit of giving off what you don't use so that we value every bit of the spirit.The perk models that we would like to highlight area) Featured perk encouraging you to share your love :It is a golden gift that you can give to anyone with love and care. To see details click here Bee represents care; bee represents togetherness; bee represents love.  A pure gold and unique gift to your dear one is of value to you, the person who receive it and to us.b) 20 second tea:  It is a gift to yourself with a royal treat. This recipe is a test and trial of many years and a perfect blessing in disguise for all those who love tea. The bee touch in that would make you love it for life time. Get it today.Carefully crafted to see that each penny you spend is going for a definite purpose that simply finds its way to multiply in our incubation farm.Each penny goes for breeding more bees and in the making of the Apiculture Incubation Farm. I am sure of reaching the goal and my target of generating the required fund.This project is born.  It takes its wings.  I am totally dedicated to make it happen.The closer I am to the target funding,  the faster I reach my goal.   I take pride to spread it with great passion.Risks & ChallengesThe project is not free from risks and challenges. Every step forward is with caution and to make it work and perform the best.What risks and challenges are anticipated and how am I going to face them?1.  Hot climate: The extreme hot climate of Dubai in summer can be a challenge to keep the bees survive.  Apis Mellifera (European bee) may not be able to stand it unless proper care is given. Failure in the initial stage itself might make people deter and not propagate the program.  For this reason, we are going for more of acclimatized local bees - Apis Cerana in our apiary at initial stages,  This should bring better confidence in the farmers as they need less care too.2. Penetrating the farming community and make them say "yes"Penetrating the farming community for encouraging bee keeping can be a challenge as they will not be able to assess the pollination benefit. The palm trees being the main crop in Dubai, it might lead to lot of resistance from farmers unless they get a substantial income from bee products.Our bee experts have suggested ways and means of overcoming this challenge by propagating to have special honey and value addition using the latest technological advances in beekeeping.Some of them can definitely make a break through in beekeeping history.3. Acceptance of bee as a friend as against prevailing fear of bee.There is a general bee fear and bee hatred in people more in cities compared to villages. The mental block need to be cleared for accepting bees by the people.Expecting this we are moving with two simultaneous programs - the educational program in schools and second the awareness programs combined with urban bee promoting.4. Educational program - how they will take it?Will the schools accept to have bees? Will fear of bees make students not to attend class?My research tells it need not bother them and I could conduct a bee class in one of the schools where there are more than 10,000 students. It was a real experience and that gives me more confidence.  We can start the project though a different level if need be.​The bee experts from all over the world just standing to support my work gives me enough courage to overcome any challenge that might come in implementing the project. Other Ways You Can Help There are many ways to contribute and sometimes it can be more than direct funding.  A good heart can influence others and you may not know your power.  Feel free to tell your friends. Pass it on through your communities and social circles - face book, LinkedIn, twitter, instagram, YouTube, G+     and where ever you are present and you have couple of friends.It really works when you tell your friends. There are so many good people out there.Talk ....talk...talk and make noise around you that convey the message to save bees and this project that works for it. Use the Indiegogo share tool.As a contributor you can see yourself from Indiegogo how much you influence in contributingAnd yes, "if there is a will, there is a way" is true in helping the world to have more bees.Supports:The supports and co-operation I get from different parts of the world are great and gives me enough fuel to move ahead strongly.

story:
Our Story

Lighting of Tomorrow started as a dream! Day by day, adventure after adventure our love for Earth grew, and we became impatient and desperate to help save our planet. We grew tired of reading and hearing about the problem but yet again we are part of the problem, so we decided to take ACTION!

After an intense retreat out in nature Andersen had a light bulb spark inside! Literally!  we already knew we wanted to be a positive influence in our community, and volunteering occasionally was just not enough.  So after intensive research on our current global problems and connecting with other passionate Earth lovers we ran into a solution that has started years ago but not enough people are aware of, which is reducing our carbon foot print by using solar panels and smart lighting among other new technologies. After driving to our local cities we decided to bring smart lighting and help change one light fixture and city at a time.

The Environmental Problem

Unfortunately, as we all know the widely consumption of fossil fuels in last few decades has contributed considerably to the degradation of our environment. According to Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) reports, the Earth’s temperature has increased by 33.44 degrees Fahrenheit over the past century. More than half of this increase has happened in the last 25 years. Temperature is rising at a rate faster than ever before and human activities like burning of fossil fuels, deforestation, industrialization and pollution are considered as few of the factors responsible for global warming. Some of the problems from which our environment is suffering are: climate change, extinction of wildlife species, depletion of ozone layer and increase in air pollution.

The Solution

We understand that inefficient lighting is one of the causes of the rising global consumption of fossil fuels and we simply want to reduce our environmental foot print. We partnered up with experts in the lighting industry and have come up with a solution to the rising global problem. Lighting of Tomorrow LLC (L.O.T.) is an innovative global green solution company that will facilitate the switch from inefficient lighting fixtures to new state of the art LED lighting technology. Our goal is to achieve significant energy cost reductions through the installation of energy-efficient lighting. We will provide lighting fixture options, installation and finance options to our customers by partnering up with electrical and lighting experts. We help our customers find available government incentives and the best loan programs to facilitate the upgrade.


Our Goal

The Company’s primary goal is to provide our customers with the best known brand products and latest technology in the industry. All of our products utilize green technologies that provide superior lighting quality and significant cost savings.  By offering many options we allow our customers to choose the products that best fit their budget. L.O.T. will tailor a lighting solution based on the customer’s environment and objectives. Whether our clients want to include light fixtures that offer infrastructure sensors or want to include light fixtures that detect how much traffic is walking through their doors or streets we have the solution.

How can you help?

We have started the process of partnering up with the right people and now is time for execution but in order for us to take this to the next level we need some kickstart funding. Our goal is to raise $25,000. This money will go towards inventory, a website, office supplies and a store where we will make this dream become a reality. 

The Perks!

story:
Using Carbon Credits instead of Logging

The resources of these islands have belonged to these people for centuries.  It is time for businesses to stop exploiting the landowners and to find creative ways for the people to benefit more directly and still provide a sound business model for investment and profit for the investors.  Charities don’t work as they don’t have the mentality to provide a structure that will work for the long term as the cash flow requirements are tied to contributions and not to productive, marketplace realities.  The opportunity that we believe we provide is a structure that will allow the resource owners, the people themselves through awareness and education, to direct how their resources are to be used and to benefit directly from their decisions.

The people of New Ireland have never clear cut their land.  They have kept it pristine, beautiful and natural.  It would be a crime for a big multi-national or outside influence to bring the development mentality of the west to projects in this region.  

We have instituted a plan so that the majority of the rain forest doesn't have to be cut and the resource owners, the people of New Ireland will get the maximum benefit.  The process is part of the REDD plus program, whereby countries and companies that have a high carbon usage can purchase carbon credits to offset their carbon footprint.

The typical rainforest offsets 250 tons per hectare of carbon emissions.  We are working towards certifying close to 50,000 hectares of mostly virgin rainforest so that the resource owners receive the maximum benefit.  Once the forest is certified as to the validity of the their carbon offset, then those carbon credits can be sold anywhere from $2.00 to $6.00 a ton.  The close to 100,000 landowners will receive  80% of the value of these funds directly through their land association.

Specifically we need the funds to get the certification of the forests completed by a company called the Gold Standard (they were formed from funding from the UN).  We are having the Forest Survey completed through our local partners and the landowners association in Papua New Guinea.  We paid for consultants from New Zealand to design and monitor the Forest Survey which is going on the last two weeks of July.  The Survey is being done by the Forest Authority of Papua New Guinea according to the standards that were determined under the REDD Plus program.   These expenses we have covered.

The photos that you see on this site are of New Ireland and the concession we are discussing and were taken on July 14th 2016 on a fly-over of the island by the New Zealand consultants.  The purpose of the fund is to pay for the costs associated with the Gold Standard certification.  The certification will increase the value of the carbon credits from the low of $2.00 to around $6.00, makes the selling of the credits easier and more reliable and provides the guarantee of the value that the credits need.

The program could become a pilot program for all of the rainforest in PNG.  PNG is home to one of the last great expanses of tropical rainforests in the world.  We could end up creating an O2 haven  to combat global warming and offset the carbon pollution that is going on world wide.

We are heavily involved in the process, we didn't anticipate the need or the costs of getting a third party certification to be able to market the carbon credits effectively.    

What We Need & What You Get

 So if you contribute to our fund, you will be doing the following;

  1. Saving a minimum of 70% of the rain forest on the southern half of New Ireland.
  2. Creating through the program, a direct benefit to close to 100,000 native landowners
  3. Fighting global warming in a real way that still provides an economic benefit for the landowners.  Here in Oxford, MS, in the past three years, there have been malls, office complexes, apartment complexes and residential areas all clear cut to make way for the "progress".  No one here thinks about the environmental impact because its part of the economic development.   People of New Ireland deserve to have the same economic opportunity.  If instead of cutting their forests, they can keep the forests and still get an economic value, its win for them financially, its a win for the environment and its a win for the fight against global warming.
  4. The program creates a template for other regions of Papua New Guinea to emulate.  The entire forest is over 200,000 hectares.  The credits only apply to areas that can be logged economically today.  The diminishing resources of exotic hardwood timber and the population growth could mean in 10 or 15 years that the entire area could be logged using techniques like helicopter logging.  Currently it would be too expensive but in the future it may not.  This program would discourage that land utilization and would provide an ongoing opportunity.

The use of proceeds for the $75,000 is the following;

  1. The cost of preparing and proving the application
  2. Consultants that will be needed to assist with the verification process
  3. Travel to PNG as needed.

If funds aren't raised totally, whatever is raised will go towards the goal of getting the validation on the forest content, the amount of carbon offsets that can be verified and the completion of this aspect of the project.

If we are successful in this process and are able to sell the carbon credits, NIHT Incorporated will return your donation and will return an additional 20% for you as thank you for your assistance in this endeavor. 

Risks & Challenges

 There are risks in everything that you undertake, especially when working in a third world country.  We have done the following to mitigate the risks;

  1. Started the project with the landowners over two and a half years ago.
  2. We have worked to mitigate the risks by working first with the landowners, then the chiefs and heads of the clan, then the local level government, then the provincial government and lastly with the Forestry Authority, the official branch of the Papua New Guinea government.  We have documented support from all of these entities.
  3. Papua New Guinea is new to the REDD Plus credits and the use of Carbon Credits.  Having an NGO like us perform the work and develop the process saves them money, provides a blue print for other areas of the country and moves the process along by more than 2 years.  The PNG government target for REDD credits is 2019.
  4. More information about the exact process, copies of approvals, contracts etc. are explained on our website, www.NIHTInc.com

Consultants that will be needed to assist with the verification process
Travel to PNG as needed.

Risks & Challenges

Started the project with the landowners over two and a half years ago.
We have worked to mitigate the risks by working first with the landowners, then the chiefs and heads of the clan, then the local level government, then the provincial government and lastly with the Forestry Authority, the official branch of the Papua New Guinea government.  We have documented support from all of these entities.
