story:
Hello from La Belle Verte, Georgia


    Do you know Caucasus  and lovely country Georgia?

    In  South part there is a National Park Mtirala. Deserted  subtropical jungles with lakes and waterfalls,  unique flora,  many animals and birds.
    Here we are creating an eco camp.  
We provide our space for events and  for groups. Like yoga, sport, social, volunteers, children camp, bird-watching, scouting, art-craft camp, festivals, music and dancing events, trekking, eco-tourism, farm tourism, team-building, etc. We organize everything, including program, accommodation,  foot, infrastructure, friendly atmosphere, guides, transfer and all the travelings in Georgia. 
   This way we are developing Mtirala Park for international tourists. We did infrastructure,  build the road, making new hiking routs for few days trips.  In plans to restore injured lake. 


    Eco camp is located near Batumi, by the entrance of Park Mtirala. It has tree-houses and bungalow,  fruit garden, relax space and infrastructure. It is right place to enjoy eco life, nature, different activities and start to explore Caucasus mountains  on eco trails (from Mtirala Park you can hike  to Machahela Park or Kintrishi reserve - adventure for a few days in wild nature). 

   We have built  a half of camp already and it is working for the third season.  
http://la-belle-verte.jimdo.com/english/ 



   What is left to do -  system of independent energy with no harm to nature,tree houses and hobbit houses. 


   Now we invite you to help us with building a tree house (in attached video). The budget is 10 000 $ 


                                    Story

   Georgia is a small country in Caucasus region. It has perfect nature - green mountains, pure rivers, lakes and Black Sea cost. It is great to discover and enjoy plenty of wild nature. And eco tourism here are just started. 

   Georgia mostly covered with forests, has absolutely no industry. That's why it is so pure here! Mostly people do agriculture.  Food and wine is  natural and tasty. Here we make small eco farm for fruits and vegs,  сheese, honey. With eco tourism growth we can support and help local farmers and craftspeople.

    In mountains we collect healing herbs according old wisdom how to use nature help for health. Because in our forrest nature has specific endemic flora, some of plants are  growing only here.  

   Beside that Georgia has very old history and temples. People here are very friendly and open. Cousine and wine are  so tasty!  It is worthy to visit and enjoy. 


                           Our reputation

   We are working for 3-d year. About us:

http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g297576-d8638830-r350191491-La_Belle_Verte-Batumi_Adjara_Region.html
http://www.waystogeorgia.com/#!eco-camping/u3neh
https://www.airbnb.ru/rooms/8429374?bev_ref=145...
http://www.booking.com/hotel/ge/la-belle-verte.ru.html?label=gen173nr-1DCAsoUkIObGEtYmVsbGUtdmVydGVIM2IFbm9yZWZoUogBAZgBIcIBA2FibsgBDdgBA-gBAagCBA;sid=a0e278893a9f3828a041ec7e0f46f7d3;dcid=1;dist=0&sb_price_type=total&type=total&

There is also a volunteers international work camp.  


                  Sound Good to You?

   Great. We’re not asking for a lot.   Whatever you can contribute makes a difference. It’s inspiring what we’ve been able to accomplish already, despite very limited funds, thanks to the help of friends and volunteers from all over the world.. Now, we are inviting you to be a part of it, in whatever way you can.  Or even share on social media for support or welcome to come.


                       Stay In Touch!

Share our story on social media to make Mtirala Park the next great ecotourist destination!
story_txt:
Hello from La Belle Verte, Georgia

    Do you know Caucasus  and lovely country Georgia?

    In  South part there is a National Park Mtirala. Deserted  subtropical jungles with lakes and waterfalls,  unique flora,  many animals and birds.
    Here we are creating an eco camp.  
We provide our space for events and  for groups. Like yoga, sport, social, volunteers, children camp, bird-watching, scouting, art-craft camp, festivals, music and dancing events, trekking, eco-tourism, farm tourism, team-building, etc. We organize everything, including program, accommodation,  foot, infrastructure, friendly atmosphere, guides, transfer and all the travelings in Georgia. 

   This way we are developing Mtirala Park for international tourists. We did infrastructure,  build the road, making new hiking routs for few days trips.  In plans to restore injured lake. 







    Eco camp is located near Batumi, by the entrance of Park Mtirala. It has tree-houses and bungalow,  fruit garden, relax space and infrastructure. It is right place to enjoy eco life, nature, different activities and start to explore Caucasus mountains  on eco trails (from Mtirala Park you can hike  to Machahela Park or Kintrishi reserve - adventure for a few days in wild nature). 
   We have built  a half of camp already and it is working for the third season.  

http://la-belle-verte.jimdo.com/english/ 






   What is left to do -  system of independent energy with no harm to nature,tree houses and hobbit houses. 



   Now we invite you to help us with building a tree house (in attached video). The budget is 10 000 $ 


                                       Story    Georgia is a small country in Caucasus region. It has perfect nature - green mountains, pure rivers, lakes and Black Sea cost. It is great to discover and enjoy plenty of wild nature. And eco tourism here are just started. 
   Georgia mostly covered with forests, has absolutely no industry. That's why it is so pure here! Mostly people do agriculture.  Food and wine is  natural and tasty. Here we make small eco farm for fruits and vegs,  сheese, honey. With eco tourism growth we can support and help local farmers and craftspeople.

    In mountains we collect healing herbs according old wisdom how to use nature help for health. Because in our forrest nature has specific endemic flora, some of plants are  growing only here.  
   Beside that Georgia has very old history and temples. People here are very friendly and open. Cousine and wine are  so tasty!  It is worthy to visit and enjoy.                               Our reputation    We are working for 3-d year. About us:

Now, we are inviting you to be a part of it, in whatever way you can.  Or even share on social media for support or welcome to come.

story:
Dear Friends,

Do you believe that aware and responsible children can help us change the world for the better? Do you care about water as a precious but scarce resource? If you do then please help Ecoloodi continue its mission to educate more children about water!

Ecoloodi (ecoloodi.org) is a bilingual non-profit organization working with children to raise awareness about water and its responsible use. Two years ago, after moving to Canada from France, Ludiwine Clouzot, also called “Loodi”, founded Ecoloodi. As a water scientist, she has the knowledge, as an educator, the passion, and as a creative person, many ideas. She is truly the “Water Woman”.

What started as a one woman’s journey is now a focused expedition of a group of 20 passionate volunteers who empower children to take educated decisions now.

What have we done so far?

In the last two years, Ecoloodi has reached over 12,000 children in Canada, 6,000 in Benin (French-speaking country in West Africa) and 500 in France.

Our tools and services are designed to engage children aged 3-12 years through play-based learning. Combining science, education and art, we have developed different games, videos, workshops and interactive shows. Our last creation is an illustrated and interactive book based on an adorable video about the Water Cycle.

Watch our video – H2O: The Story of a Little Drop


We have worked with great organizations including Ryerson University, the Royal Ontario Museum, Engineers Without Borders, the Public French School Board Viamonde, the Toronto Public Library, Alliance Française, Ecologos (Water Docs film festival), and the French Consulate in Toronto. We have also been extensively featured by media outlets - in print (Metro Toronto, Métropolitain, Express), on television (CBC) and on radio (CBC, Choq FM and Pot Pourri).

What are our next steps?

Last year, the World Economic Forum ranked water as the Top Global Risk for the first time. Action is needed now and Ecoloodi is working very hard to turn water education into action.

We have many great projects waiting to be implemented! Our current big one is our inaugural Toronto Walk4Water ­– a symbolic walk down Yonge Street – organized to create awareness about the lack of access to clean water in developing countries in comparison to Canada.

Did you know that the average distance a person in Africa and Asia travels each day to collect water is six kilometres? Can you imagine walking that distance every day, several times per day? On World Water Day, March 22, 2016, you can have the unique experience of walking in other people’s shoes and supporting a cause that needs our attention.

For more details on Walk4Water, click here.

How can you support water education?

Good intentions and powerful ideas are not enough to kick-start an organization like Ecoloodi and make it sustainable. We are definitely pushed forward by many people and encouraged to keep on our work with many shows and workshops already booked but the reality is that we need as much help as we can get to continue with this beautiful project.

We are seeking $15,000 to keep growing Ecoloodi and empowering children with knowledge and understanding of water resources. The money will be used for creating more tools such as games, books, interactive shows and class workshops, as well as hosting events similar to the Walk4Water.

If you believe in what Ecoloodi is doing and want to support us with a donation, please choose one of our great perks!

You can also help us spread the word about this campaign by sharing it with your friends and network.

Every drop counts! Thank you for your support!

story:
TAGHAZOUT ZERO WASTE FUNDRAISING PROJECT

This is a collaborative project between Roots Surf Fest and Surf Rider Maroc

WHO ARE WE?

Roots Surf Fest is an international celebration of surf in its third year of existence.
As-well as a place of surf the festival showcases independent music & provides a place for workshops and interactive entertainment.
At the heart of each fest is ‘Ocean Conservation’ which takes form using beach cleans, tree planting, forums, chats and school visits.
Each festival seeks to be a catalyst for positive environmental change in the locality whilst at the same time inspiring ticket holders to take up the challenge when back home. 

Over the course of our three festivals we have had many environmental based successes -including helping to set up a recycling system two surf schools and a beach resort, press coverage of the pollution facing a local area, beach cleans collecting over 1000 kilos, tree -planting & awareness raising at a local school. Through all this we have forged a strong relationship with Surf Rider Foundation first in Spain and now in Morocco.

Surfrider Foundation Maroc is a Moroccan association acting on the protection, development and sustainable management of the coast and its users. Their ways of acting are: 

By raising awareness in schools, installing bins and signs in coastal villages, organizing beach cleanups, encouraging local actions organizing events and   conferences to inform people.

Our first collaboration with Surf Rider Maroc took place over the new year week of 2015 & 2016 in Taghazout  a fishing village in South Morocco,North Africa. Due to the nature of its great waves and pretty location, over the past few years it has become a popular surfing destination

As part of the 'Roots Surf Fest' week, on new years eve the the festival goers visited a local school and in-front of local councilors made a presentation to the children about plastic pollution and then followed up with Tree planting in the school grounds and a beach clean.

OCEAN CONSERVATION:

Whilst cleaning the beach in Taghazout all festival goers were struck by the huge environmental problem facing the area. Not only were vast amounts of plastic blowing around and littering the area. The plastic had become so ingrained in the earth that in some areas you could see it embedded in the different strata of rocks, amongst the roots of trees and plants and choking rivers.

Also on the tidal line of the coast evidence of micro plastic was rife and considering this was only what we were seeing with the naked eye on the beach it is obvious the ocean is seriously contaminated with plastic debris large and small. A local person who spoke to us during the beach clean up stated that the amount of plastic washed up on the coastline after a storm was ‘shocking’.
The rise of surf culture in the area has clearly had a deep effect with careless, throw away tourism putting the ocean and its many species in danger.

THE PROBLEM IS SO BAD ACTION IS NEEDED IMMEDIATELY - STATISTICS FROM SURF RIDER BACK THIS UP

Each summer Surfrider Foundation Maroc organize one of its most important projects “I LOVE MY BEACH”, it is to set up as a team who clean the beach and raise awareness to summer visitors about marine pollution. In 2015, 163 trash bins were spread on beaches, and about 12 000 bags were collected this year, the equivalent to 117 tons of waste (against 56 tons in 2014 and 58 tons in 2013).

Water samplings of the sea has been done with the objective to estimate the microbiological quality around Agadir. The results of water analysis found the most worrying area was around Taghazout .

Roots Surf Fest's one afternoon with Surf Rider Maroc left us with no doubt that we could not just help for those hours and walk away from the problem – hence this campaign which has two angles.

                                                           

OUR CAMPAIGN:

  1. WASTE BINS Currently on Taghazout seafront there are no bins we aim to raise enough money to install 100 fixed beach bins. The implications for this will be great – reducing environmental waste, keeping the beaches clean and helping the seas to be cleaner. 
  2. A FEATURE LENGTH DOCUMENTARY With the help of two professional filmmakers we aim to create an awareness raising documentary about the environmental problems facing Taghazout. What is fascinating in Taghazout is that the area is clearly a microcosm of environmental problems facing the the world in general. The thread of the documentary will follow the threat of pollution to the area, the attitudes of surfers, fisherman and locals to the problem. We will take a look at the impact of development in Taghazout – good & bad.  We will also document things people are doing to combat the problems facing the area.  Through wider ocean based facts, research and a marine biology test of the ocean around Taghazout : we aim for the documentary to inspire and empower others to take up the challenge of helping to keep the oceans alive.

FINANCE:

Our financial projection for this project is clear:

Rubbish Bins 

13 bins 240L...76€ each = 988€

24 bins 360L...114€ each = 2.736€

13 bins 660L...286€ each = 3.718€ 

50 wall bins  / pole 50L...78€ each = 4.680

100 Stickers A3 adhesive...1,4€ each = 140€

Total of 50 large bins + 50 wallbins + 100 stickers = 12.262€

Bin Set Up

140€ / day of awareness raising in locality x 3 = 420 €

20€ / banner x 4 = 80 €
Total= 500€

Documentary Film Costs include:
Travel, car rental, food (Accommodation is provided for free by Adventure keys hostel)
Total: 2356€

We have also added 1000€ of Miscellaneous expenditure as there are bound to be extra costs for all parties.
Please note the research, editing, production of the film is being provided for free.
TOTAL COSTS: 
16,118€

TEAM:

We believe the combined organization, communication & implementation expertise of The Roots Surf Fest & Surfrider Maroc teams will see the project through.
Documentary making is provided by professional filmmakers Thomas Kulik & Hannes Schmidt, both of whom have a strong background in video production and are passionate about Ocean Conservation.
Please refer to the links for further information about the filmmakers:

www.arcadia-film.de

www.hanneschmidt.de

They will be supported by the ‘Roots’ crew who will provide research, interviews, photography and a narrative for the documentary.  Surf Rider Maroc will be providing ground support and an invaluable source of local contacts.

IMPACT:
We believe the project will have a great and lasting impact.
The beach waste bins will reduce environmental waste in Taghazout and help make steps to a more environmentally conscious surf culture in the area.
This will help affect positively the lives of the 6000 people who live in Taghazout, the many thousands who visit and most importantly the many species in ocean and locality.

The film will help bring factions of the community together to discuss the problem whilst inspiring others in the wider world to protect the oceans and environment in general.
Upon completion we will screen it in Taghazout and it will be distributed online via PAY PER VIEW by DONATION – the funds created from the video will be distributed equally between Surf Rider Maroc & a forest replanting project.
The documentary will also be submitted to film festivals and television across different languages.
Our initial estimates for the documentary audience related to the profiles & reach of all parties involved in the project are 100,000 with the chances for further growth very strong as it will be made to the highest quality.

PLEASE HELP THIS PROJECT!
All contributors to the project will receive a 'Project Perk'.

Our assembled team has all the relevant skill sets and experience to this project through and we no obstacles to the projects completion.
Your help however great or small will be deeply appreciated.

Human activity is having deep and profound impact on the health of the oceans, Keeping the oceans alive is essential to the well being of the planet and all its species. 

Lets turn this around!

LITTLE RIPPLES MAKE WAVES

story:
EasiOyYa – Possibly the most efficient irrigation system in the world

In a society where we are always busy, busy, busy, our gardens tend to fall a bit short. This is a common problem and we have a simple solution.  Welcome to the new and improved way to get the garden of your dreams with “EasiOyYa”.  We have developed a simple piece designed to make gardening a breeze, and you may be wondering how.

No more up turned plastic bottles, hosepipe bans or relying on the neighbours or the rain while you’re away. No more thinking that the idea of having a garden is too hard, time consuming and sometimes not worth the hassle. We're out to change that, one EasiOyYa at a time! EasiOyYa makes home gardening easy.


EasiOyYa is a watering system that is based on the Olla (pronounced Oy-Yah) which is a sub surface irrigation technique thought to have originated in Northern Africa or ancient China over 4000 years ago. 

Olla’s are traditionally unglazed terracotta/clay pots that are buried almost fully into the earth and then having water poured into them, thereby using gravity to allow the water to flow in to the surrounding earth to be absorbed by the plant roots.


EasiOyYa has been adapted for today’s gardener from a highly effective ancient method of sub surface irrigation, making the system even more efficient and easy to use – hence the name EasiOyYa!


Before presenting EasiOyYa as a product for gardeners I carried out extensive research, and found the increase in gardening in all of its many guises created an even greater need for a product such as EasiOyYa than first imagined.

In recent years there has been a dramatic rise in the number of households in the US that are now turning to home gardening as more than just a hobby, but a way of growing organic food for the family and even to sell at local farmers markets.

Up to 1 in 3 households are now growing food - the highest overall participation and spending levels seen in a decade.



EasiOyYa is a flexible below surface irrigation system that works for a variety of gardening scenarios. Whether you are an urban home gardener with a series of pots, a few raised beds or the proud owner of a large allotment, EasiOyYa will provide an excellent watering system for your crops and plants.

EasiOyYa is suitable for the following types of gardens:

  • Gardens including raised beds and planters
  • Herb and vegetable gardens
  • Small and large allotments
  • Community gardens
  • Hydroponic gardens
  • Small farms
  • Green house plants
  • Balcony or patio gardens
  • High rise apartments


When you purchase EasiOyYa you receive the following components in your kit:

8 EasiOyYa’s – the clay, unglazed olla watering spikes

10 meters of tubing

Fittings to connect to most tanks/water barrels/reservoirs.


We need to make it clear that you will need to source your own tank/water barrel/reservoir locally, due to shipping restraints - it is not part of the kit.

Once you have your kit, simply decide on the pots or section of garden you want to irrigate, and bury your EasiOyYa’s up to the lid, reasonably spaced to allow planting in between.

You will need to have a water tank, storage or barrel set up for your water supply, then simply connect the 10-meter tubing to your reservoir and attach to the top of each EasiOyYa.

Once you have planted your plants or seedlings, simply fill the reservoir and sit back and let the EasiOyYa’s do the work.

Perfect for dry and arid climates, or for those long periods away from home, EasiOyYa will water your plants constantly and efficiently.


So now for the science bit… the EasiOyYa irrigation system works due to the micro porous (unglazed) walls of the clay pots that do not allow water to flow freely from the pot, but guides water seepage from it in the direction where capillary suction develops.


To use EasiOyYa’s in the garden, simply bury the EasiOyYa’s in the soil leaving just the top slightly protruding. 

   


The EasiOyYa is constantly kept full of water via the connecting tubing from the water tank or reservoir.


Once the EasiOyYa’s are positioned in the soil and the crops planted adjacent to it, the EasiOyYa clay pot effects sub-surface irrigation as water oozes out of it due to the suction force, which attracts water molecules to the plant roots.


The suction force is created by a combination of the soil moisture tension and the plant roots pulling the moisture themselves. It can actually be called a “Plant Controlled” watering system.

This cut away section in my test tank shows how the plant roots eventually grow around the pots and only “pull” moisture when needed, never wasting a single drop.  

EasiOyYa’s virtually eliminate the runoff and evaporation common in modern irrigation systems, allowing the plant to absorb nearly 100 percent of the water, helping to look after your plants, preserve water and provide a sustainable gardening solution.

     

This is how simple food growing can be. You can follow the principles of square foot gardening, whether that be in a raised garden or pots like these. Plant around each EasiOyYa so many plants have access to the moisture and just connect to a water barrel.



The benefits of using EasiOyYa include:

  • Natural watering through terracotta – no pumps or electricity required
  • Water delivered below ground, exactly where the plants need it
  • Attractive, nearly invisible design – no ugly upside down drink bottles
  • Plants have constant access to moisture – less stress
  • Ordinary ollas need filling every few days – EasiOyYa’s do it themselves
  • You can leave your plants for weeks or months at a time without having to worry about the plants getting watered
  • EasiOyYa is simple and safe to set up, everything you need (except for a reservoir) comes in the kit, just add water and let gravity do its thing!

The Features of EasiOyYa include:

  • A simple and effective design that you can set up in almost the time it takes to make a cup of coffee!
  • Proven, effective sub surface watering system
  • Everything you need in one kit to start your very own naturally sustainable irrigation system, ready to connect to your water source
  • Cost effective gravity feed watering system that you can purchase at a special early bird cost when you support the development and production of EasiOyYa through this crowdfunding campaign

So far we have secured the trademarks and patents needed to produce EasiOyYa, and we are now ready to go into full production once we have the funds to cover tooling and the MOQ (Minimum Order Quantity).

We have recently had a small trial batch manufactured which will be made available to early backers of the EasiOyYa as soon as possible. 

The goal is to raise A$23000 to cover these initial costs.  Once the funds are in they will be distributed as follows:

  • $1100 for molds and samples
  • $2400 Quality assurance and inspections
  • $1000 Basic website and graphic design
  • $4500 Patents and Trademarks
  • $11500 Production of initial batch
  • $2500 Shipping for initial batch
Then we will be able to embark on a full production run to make EasiOyYa's available to gardeners everywhere.
The Time Line


The story is simple and I'm not going to load this up with fluffy filler perks. The EasiOyYa kits only come in a single sized pack and this is how I will present them to you. There will be options to select multiple packs. 

Limited Stock Arriving Soon in First Batch for Early Bird Special in Australia


Limited Stock on its way as First Batch for Early Bird Special in the United States.



EasiOyYa is the creation of David Borthwick whose exceptional consumer products have been developed through necessity.  And the EasiOyYa is no different.  It solves a simple daily problem we all have, forgetting or not being there to water the plants. 

                                       


Australia is the driest inhabited continent on earth and David has spent a lot of his life not far from Eromanga, which is reputed to be the furthest town from the sea. In an area that receives minimal rainfall it is essential to conserve water and ensure the little available can go a long way.

David had been experimenting with various forms of gravity feed irrigation for over 30 years, but it wasn’t until he travelled to the village of Dehua in the foothills of eastern China that he fully understood the method of Olla clay pot irrigation used by Chinese farmers for thousands of years.

This was the "missing piece" of the puzzle that David had been looking for, and he finally had the insight and expertise that would form the foundation for EasiOyYa.

As an experienced horticulturist and business man with an existing online edible garden supply business for the last 10 years, David has developed an in-depth understanding of the problems people face with regard to keeping plants and crops watered.

With the potential of helping gardeners across Australia and the US, especially in areas with a dry climate, and for those gardeners who face obstacles like water bans and restricted water availability, EasiOyYa with your support could be a real game changer.


When you support our campaign you can pre-order your very own EasiOyYa, and even help us out by posting reviews, emailing your friends and family, and sending us messages or comments on this page.

We know how tight the gardening community can be, so remember to share our campaign with others via social media and let everyone know when you support the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

Final Thank You and Links

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and to those who contributed what they could in helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us to achieve. You are part of our “EasiOyYa” family.

We look forward to answering any questions and reading your comments.
story_txt:
EasiOyYa
– Possibly the most efficient irrigation system
in the world

In
a society where we are always busy, busy, busy, our gardens tend to fall a bit
short. This is a common problem and we have a simple solution.  Welcome to the new and
improved way to get the garden of your dreams with “EasiOyYa”.  We have developed a simple piece designed to make gardening
a breeze, and you may be wondering how.No more up turned plastic bottles, hosepipe bans or
relying on the neighbours or the rain while you’re away. No more thinking that the
idea of having a garden is too hard, time consuming and
sometimes not worth the hassle. We're out to change that, one EasiOyYa at a time! EasiOyYa makes home gardening easy.

EasiOyYa is a watering system that is based
on the Olla (pronounced Oy-Yah) which is a sub surface irrigation technique
thought to have originated in Northern Africa or ancient China over 4000 years
ago. Olla’s are traditionally unglazed
terracotta/clay pots that are buried almost fully into the earth and then having water poured into them, thereby using gravity to allow the water to flow in to
the surrounding earth to be absorbed by the plant roots.EasiOyYa has been adapted for today’s gardener from a highly effective
ancient method of sub surface irrigation, making the system even more efficient and easy to use – hence the
name EasiOyYa!

Before presenting EasiOyYa as a product for gardeners I carried out extensive research, and found the increase in gardening in all of its many guises created an even greater need for a product such as EasiOyYa than first imagined.In recent years there has been a dramatic
rise in the number of households in the US that are now turning to home
gardening as more than just a hobby, but a way of growing organic food for the
family and even to sell at local farmers markets.
Up to 1 in 3 households are now growing food - the highest overall participation and spending levels seen in a decade.
EasiOyYa is a flexible below surface
irrigation system that works for a variety of gardening scenarios. Whether you
are an urban home gardener with a series of pots, a few raised beds or the
proud owner of a large allotment, EasiOyYa will provide an excellent watering
system for your crops and plants.EasiOyYa is suitable for the following types
of gardens:

Gardens including
raised beds and planters

Herb and vegetable gardens

Small and large allotments


Community gardens


Hydroponic gardens


Small farms


Green house plants


Balcony or patio gardens


High rise apartments




When you purchase EasiOyYa you receive the
following components in your kit:
8 EasiOyYa’s – the clay, unglazed olla watering spikes
10 meters of tubing 
Fittings to connect to most tanks/water barrels/reservoirs.
We need to
make it clear that you will need to source your own tank/water barrel/reservoir
locally, due to shipping restraints - it is not part of the kit. 
Once you have your kit, simply decide on the pots or section of
garden you want to irrigate, and bury your EasiOyYa’s up to the lid, reasonably
spaced to allow planting in between. 
You will need to have a water tank, storage or barrel set up
for your water supply, then simply connect the 10-meter tubing to your reservoir
and attach to the top of each EasiOyYa. 
Once you have planted your plants or seedlings, simply fill
the reservoir and sit back and let the EasiOyYa’s do the work. 
Perfect for dry and arid climates, or for those long periods
away from home, EasiOyYa will water your plants constantly
and efficiently.
So now for the science bit… the EasiOyYa irrigation system works due to the micro porous (unglazed) walls of the clay pots that do not allow water to flow freely from the pot, but guides water seepage from it in the direction where capillary suction develops.To use EasiOyYa’s in the garden, simply
bury the EasiOyYa’s in the soil leaving just the top slightly protruding.    The EasiOyYa is constantly kept full of water via the
connecting tubing from the water tank or reservoir.

attracts water molecules to the plant roots.

combination of the soil moisture tension and the plant roots pulling the
moisture themselves. It can actually be called a “Plant Controlled” watering
system.
This cut away section in my test tank shows how the plant roots eventually grow around the
pots and only “pull” moisture when needed, never wasting a single drop.  EasiOyYa’s virtually eliminate the runoff and
evaporation common in modern irrigation systems, allowing the plant to absorb
nearly 100 percent of the water, helping to look after your plants, preserve water and provide a sustainable gardening solution.      This is how simple food growing can be. You can follow the principles of square foot gardening, whether that be in a raised garden or pots like these. Plant around each EasiOyYa so many plants have access to the moisture and just connect to a water barrel.

Natural watering through terracotta – no
pumps or electricity required


Water delivered below ground, exactly where
the plants need it


Attractive, nearly invisible design – no
ugly upside down drink bottles


Plants have constant access to moisture –
less stress


Ordinary ollas need filling every few days
– EasiOyYa’s do it themselves


You can leave your plants for weeks
or months at a time without having to worry about the plants getting watered


EasiOyYa is simple and safe to
set up, everything you need (except for a reservoir) comes in the kit, just add water and let gravity do its thing!


The Features of EasiOyYa include:


A simple and effective design
that you can set up in almost the time it takes to make a cup of coffee!


Proven, effective sub surface
watering system


Everything you need in one kit
to start your very own naturally sustainable irrigation system, ready to connect
to your water source

watering system that you can purchase at a special early bird cost when you
support the development and production of EasiOyYa through this crowdfunding
campaign



So far we have secured the trademarks and
patents needed to produce EasiOyYa, and we are now ready to go into full
production once we have the funds to cover tooling and the MOQ (Minimum Order
Quantity). We have recently had a small trial batch manufactured which will be made available to early backers of the EasiOyYa as soon as possible.

story:
Breaking News: Your Gift Matched!

Your life-saving gift will be matched dollar for dollar, so you can DOUBLE YOUR IMPACT! (From July 18 through Friday, July 22, 2016, up to $5,000).

We Need a Truck!

Running lean with only two staff and many incredible volunteers, Ke Kai Ola, our Hawaiian monk seal hospital, has only one vehicle which has reached the end of its natural life.  With your support for a new truck, we can transport emaciated, ill, and injured monk seals to Ke Kai Ola, as well as supporting all aspects of this vital conservation program, including volunteer response, and transporting veterinarians and equipment.


How You Can Help!

Our response range in Hawaii spans 4,000 miles of diverse terrain.  Our heavy-duty trucks are often driven in extreme conditions along the winding, hilly coastline.

The vehicles need to be sturdy enough to carry one or more monk seals weighing up to 500 pounds, and their crates.

Please help us make sure every Hawaiian monk seal can get the help it needs by helping us buy a new truck!  Each truck costs approximately $40,000, and all donations will directly benefit the Hawaiian monk seals at Ke Kai Ola hospital.  


Survival of a Species   

The Hawaiian monk seal ("ilioholoikauaua" or "dog running in the rough seas") has lived in Hawaiian waters since before the Big Island of Hawai'i emerged.  

The seal is one of only two mammal species endemic to Hawaii and was subject to rapid local extinctions upon the arrival of the first humans, similar to what happened to many bird species.  Records from old Hawaiian newspapers reveal that up to 15,000 monk seals may have lived in the Hawaiian Islands prior to western contact in 1778.  By the mid-1800s they were hunted nearly to extinction.   


Hawaiian Monk Seals at Risk of Extinction

The Hawaiian monk seal population has declined at a rate of 3 to 4% per year over the past decade, recently reaching a low of 1,100 Hawaiian monk seals left in existence, due to past hunting, habitat loss, overfishing, marine debris, and other negative human interactions.

Moreover, a newborn monk seal has only a one-in-five chance of surviving to adulthood.  This is dismal news for a species found only in Hawaii that has been in existence for approximately 15 million years!


It's clear what's at stake here--we hope you can help us make a profound difference!


Climate Change, Pollution, Overfishing

Hawaii is known as the 'extinction capital of the world,' because of the decimation of many of its living species, which includes many indigenous plants and coral life.

Human-caused hazards like net and fishing line entanglements, gun shots, and boat strikes impact these helpless animals, and enhancing monk seal response is a vital component  of strengthening our monk seal conservation effort. 


Who We Are

Established in 1975 in California, The Marine Mammal Center rescues and rehabilitates more sick, injured, and orphaned marine mammals every year than any other marine mammal organization in the world.

With more than 21,000 animals rescued, everything we have learned about marine mammals in our 41-year history has helped us become experts in how to care for species that are at risk of extinction.

The Center is the only organization authorized by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Association (NOAA) to rescue sick and injured animals that strand along 600 miles of California coast and rehabilitate Hawaiian monk seals in the Hawaiian archipelago.

At The Marine Mammal Center, we are guided and inspired by a shared vision of a healthy ocean for marine mammals and humans alike.  We learn from patients in our care and contribute to scientific understanding of the changing health of our ocean, taking action to address ocean threats and save endangered species.

Our work in Hawaii would not be possible without people like you!


Other Ways You Can Help

It is critical that we fund a new rescue truck to continue this important work. Please help spread the word. Share on social media, and share again!

It’s easy using the Indiegogo share tools.


You may contact us or mail donations to:

Attn: Elysha Kensinger

The Marine Mammal Center

2000 Bunker Rd.

Sausalito, CA 94965

www.TheMarineMammalCenter.org

T: 415-754-4057


Every healthy animal is crucial to the species' survival and long-term recovery -- thank you for your support!

story:
Crop disease is devastating. It can take many forms and affects millions of lives around the globe every year. With your help, we can start to track it down. 

What if we could build a global surveillance system which tells us where crop disease might strike in the near future? Well, that's what we are working on - for a type of crop disease called wheat stem rust. As you might have guessed, it affects wheat - one of the most important crops grown across the world today. It's found in bread, pies, pasta, cakes, cereals and even beer! 

The Cereal Killer

Cereal rusts are a devastating plant disease also known as the “polio of agriculture”. Rusts are parasitic fungi associated with many crop failures and famine throughout history.


Between the 1930s and late 1960s, the Green Revolution increased agricultural production worldwide, saving over a billion people from starvation.

Part of the success of the Green Revolution was breeding crops resistant to commonly occurring plant diseases like cereal rusts.

In 1999, a new epidemic caused by an aggressive form of stem rust called Ug99 emerged and is currently spreading across Africa, Asia and the Middle East. It is imperative that we establish the likely global migration routes of this new stem rust and characterize its future threat to be prepared.

Scientists to the Rescue

We are based at the Norwich Research Park, and developed a cutting edge technology to track cereal rusts: “Field Pathogenomics” – a genomics-driven surveillance method to obtain a genetic fingerprint from samples collected in the field. 

It provides a very accurate and fast way to analyze fungal diseases from where and when it happens – out in local wheat fields – accelerating the response time of scientists and farmers to this disease


This information is vital for detecting changes in the rust disease, ensuring breeders, farmers and agronomists have access to the best possible information. 

We initially developed this method for yellow rust disease but are now, under this crowdfunding campaign, testing the method for another closely related rust pathogen, wheat stem rust. 


The Perks




Budget

This project represents the first stage in an effort to find out how the stem rust epidemic is spreading. In involves two steps: (1) sample collection and preparation followed by (2) sequencing and analysis.

By comparing the newly generated sequence data (genetic fingerprints) to already available data from previous years, we will be able to assess the diversity of stem rust and gather information on the latest geographical spread of stem rust.


Meet the Team

Scientists leading this important project are Dr Diane Saunders from The Genome Analysis Centre (TGAC) and John Innes Centre (JIC), Dr Brande Wulff of JIC and Dr Daniel Swan from TGAC in partnership with Drs Jane Thomas and Sarah Holdgate from the National Institute of Agricultural Botany (NIAB).



“There are only nine meals between mankind and anarchy.” - Alfred Henry Lewis, American investigative journalist and writer

“Rust is a shifty, changing, constantly evolving enemy; we can never lower our guard. We must fight rust by all means open to science.” - Elvin C. Stakman, American plant pathologist and inspiration to Norman Borlaug, Father of the Green Revolution



Video image supplied by Shutterstock/photolona

story:
"Prevention is better than cure". A strong saying that we can follow as a way of life. People all over the world strive their survival and what helps them to survive. Long ago, a lot of famines had happened around the world, which motivated people to look for food sources to provide enormous amounts of food, even if they used may cause deadly fertilizers. They might be poisonous sometimes, and a reason for many problems and diseases. Such people didn’t think of such a simple solution for this enormous problem. I have decided to offer a simple solution to this problem throughout my project which is expected to help people to avoid fatal consequences of using pesticides or chemicals in food production. People who live in highly populated areas face a lot of obstacles and difficulties. These people have to live in these places with some harsh conditions. 
        For example, they cannot afford living in a good environment or place due to their economic situation. How can we help these people? We have offered a social action project to the people of Al-Amari refugee’s camp, which is considered as a high populated area. This project is to help them exploit their roofs for planting useful plants. This idea is very important because it offers clean air .It limits the climate change, it can sometimes offer economic benefits if people want to sell the products; it also offers a clear and beautiful space for little children. This project also helped the awareness level raise significantly along with how it opened the opportunity for people to use this method on their own, which basically created a platform to recreate and develop their roof tops. The idea this project offers can be just a seed to many over time developed huge project with unlimited benefits creating an environment friendly network. 


       Another major purpose of this project is to activate women’s role in society. Because women face a lot of discrimination and ignorance especially in these kind of societies. We consider women the chief leaders of this project. For that reason, there were many workshops offered by our volunteer’s team to women in the Camp. Will definitely make them feel proud of themselves as hard working citizens. In fact we have given the management of this project to women. We have been also supported by the women’s center in Al-Amari Camp. This project is very successful and effective. It cost little, but it has offered great benefits to families in Al-Amari Camp I hope this experience will be widely spread because it is really effective and successful.
story_txt:
"Prevention is better than cure". A strong saying that we can follow as a way of life. People all over the world strive their survival and what helps them to survive. Long ago, a lot of famines had happened around the world, which motivated people to look for food sources to provide enormous amounts of food, even if they used may cause deadly fertilizers. They might be poisonous sometimes, and a reason for many problems and diseases. Such people didn’t think of such a simple solution for this enormous problem. I have decided to offer a simple solution to this problem throughout my project which is expected to help people to avoid fatal consequences of using pesticides or chemicals in food production. People who live in highly populated areas face a lot of obstacles and difficulties. These people have to live in these places with some harsh conditions.         For example, they cannot afford living in a good environment or place due to their economic situation. How can we help these people? We have offered a social action project to the people of Al-Amari refugee’s camp, which is considered as a high populated area. This project is to help them exploit their roofs for planting useful plants. This idea is very important because it offers clean air .It limits the climate change, it can sometimes offer economic benefits if people want to sell the products; it also offers a clear and beautiful space for little children. This project also helped the awareness level raise significantly along with how it opened the opportunity for people to use this method on their own, which basically created a platform to recreate and develop their roof tops. The idea this project offers can be just a seed to many over time developed huge project with unlimited benefits creating an environment friendly network. 
       Another major purpose of this project is to activate women’s role in society. Because women face a lot of discrimination and ignorance especially in these kind of societies. We consider women the chief leaders of this project. For that reason, there were many workshops offered by our volunteer’s team to women in the Camp. Will definitely make them feel proud of themselves as hard working citizens. In fact we have given the management of this project to women. We have been also supported by the women’s center in Al-Amari Camp. This project is very successful and effective. It cost little, but it has offered great benefits to families in Al-Amari Camp I hope this experience will be widely spread because it is really effective and successful.

story:
Featured in:

What currently is the best option for personal urban transportation? 

Despite the colorful array of emissions free electric vehicles on the market today, the fundamental limitations of travelling on four wheels or two have not yet been addressed.  Drivers still find that owning a car can be costly, sitting in traffic is stressful, and looking for parking can be time-consuming.  Cyclists have it easier in many ways, but have discovered that hauling loads can be tricky; they're exposed to the elements even when it's inconvenient; and safety is an ever-present concern.  For these reasons and many others, neither really optimally meets the everyday needs of city dwellers.

What the world has long embraced but the U.S. has hardly considered is the usefulness of a 3-wheeled vehicle. While tricycles are in general use in cities across Europe, Asia and Central/South America, they are rarely seen here doing anything but keeping ice cream cold or transporting tourists around the block.

Introducing the Frankentrike, a human-powered, electric-assist all-purpose tricycle.  A Frankentrike makes for an ideal personal vehicle solution to meet most urban transport needs. In the U.S. 73% of all vehicle trips are under 10 miles in distance. This is a range within which this vehicle can often transport you door to door faster than on 2 or 4 wheels. 

This opportunity comes at a pivotal time of rapid urbanization, climate instability and an epidemic of personal health crises. With the Frankentrikes, you have an opportunity to switch to a clean ecological form of transport without sacrificing a lot of the benefits of owning a larger vehicle. A Frankentrike gets over 900MPGe, making them 18x more energy-efficient than a Prius. This means that no matter how your electricity is being generated, your carbon imprint is infinitessimally small. Being essentially an overgrown bicycle, you also have the option to PEDAL. This empowerment allows you to exercise while getting from one place to the next. It also means you're never stuck. No matter how low your 'fuel tank' is, you can always get to where you need to go. It also means that in places where motorized vehicles are viewed poorly by others---like sidewalks and plazas-- you can move without motors and exhibit a gentler, quieter side to your rather large bicycle.

Driving this tricycle has completely removed my desire to ever own a car again. What I've discovered, living in Vancouver, B.C., Seattle, WA and Oakland, CA, is that, now that I drive a Frankentrike, I no longer need to own a car. Internet-based car sharing services and app-based taxi services meet all my larger vehicle needs while my bicycle in combination with trains, metros, and planes meets other needs.

Why add all this complexity to your life? Two answers: Enjoyment and savings. I spend about 1/6 of what the average car owner spends on transportation yearly, including Frankentrike maintenance, vehicle rentals, taxi services and transit.

And I have more fun. I absolutely love being on a bicycle rather than being cooped up in a car. I love to experience the fabric of the city that I live in and to not miss what's happening around me. I love the wind in my hair, but I also love arriving to a party feeling fresh and energized, not smelly, exhausted, and drenched.  Most of all, I love being seen by the other large vehicles and being treated like a car by other cars. I love being able to trigger the under-pavement sensors for the lights at intersections, and to open the gates of parking garages, which I'm never able to do on a bike. I love never having to look for parking. I love racing my friends to bars and parties. They are always astounded to discover that I've beaten them. They don't factor in just how long it takes for them to walk to their parked car, wait to get onto the freeway, and to look for parking at their destination and then to walk from there to the front door. Under 10 miles, the Frankentrike is always in the running.

Even better, I love being able to travel with my friends as a pod, but to have them in front of me where I can see them and talk to them and still keep my eyes on the road. I love driving kids around in this because for them, it feels like being at Disneyland on a ride. I love being able to go anywhere that a bicycle can go. I love being able to use the bike lanes and the sidewalks, but also not to be shunned from the car lanes. It helps that i'm moving nearly as fast as the other motorized vehicles, so they are not bothered by the speed differential. I think I've only ever been honked at once in the past 10 years out of driver annoyance, yet dozens of times by people showing their support and appreciation for my choice of 'car.'   I love feeling the love from others too. 

I hope that in the near future, that you will be able to share with me this experience. 

Frankentrikes simply started as a personal search for an ideal personal city vehicle, but immediately after creating my own, people started to ask me if I could build one for them.  At first, flattered, I agreed. After 3 however, each of increasing complexity and for a higher price, I was feeling overworked, frail, and extremely burned out.  I realized that--even at the highest price--I wasn't asking for enough to meet my most basic needs, but at the same time, didn't want to ask more than people could afford.  I experimented with jig making and determined that the path forward to both financial sustainability and to maintaining a reasonable price was to stop doing custom builds and to go into manufacturing.

I explored several funding options such as competing in the CleanTech Open, grants, loans, V.C.'s and Angel Investors, and concluded that NONE of them were a good fit for the project at this stage of development.

In 2010, I crashed along with the economy and took a long sabbatical from the project.  It was during this time that I first heard about the world of crowdfunding.

In 2012, I settled in the Bay Area, determined to attempt one last time to raise the seed capital that was needed to move towards final product development and manufacturing.

The goal of this fundraising effort is to make these vehicles available to all the people who still ask me at least once a week (and often more) if I can build them one.  The enterprise simply *must* make what it spends to be sustainable.  That includes the workers getting paid a fair wage (my friend and i calculated that he was making 1¢/hr helping with fabrication on the blue trike build).

Help us to go into manufacturing so that the vehicles can be available to your community for a reasonable price and so that everyone who helps to build them can be paid a fair wage.

While they look and drive like large bicycles, in complexity they are really more like small cars. For this reason, we want to iron out any potential weaknesses in the design before we go into manufacturing. This will provide you with a safer more comfortable and more durable ride in the longterm.  After 15 years of research and development, the design for our first production model is 90% completed and only about 10% remains.

If our minimum funding goal is reached, we will spend the next two years from campaign close refining our product design so that by May of 2018, we have a complete production model ready for small batch manufacture and are ready to take orders.  The amount requested does not include the $1-2K that the founder invests (and continues to invest) in the project every month.  Crowdfunding contributors who choose a Sponsor option will be the first to be invited to place an order.

More info here

June–July 2016 Lease working space and set up existing tools and equipment.

August 2016–May 2018 How we spend this time will depend upon how much support we receive, but our highest priorities are listed above in Campaign Goals.

June–August 2018...  Manufacture and deliver Pioneer Batch One, then continue to the next Batch and manufacturing round, and so on.

This is not a final list, because the vehicle is still in-development. However, most features and specifications are determined at this point because we've already discovered most of what works best for everyday use and have established relationships with our suppliers.

The size and proportions will be akin to the red tricycle and the look will be more akin to the blue tricycle.  Meaning that sidewall mesh is no longer available.

Built-in Anti-Theft
48" wide fits in bike lanes and between bollards on bike paths
Dual drive hub motors at 36V
Dual redundant hydraulic disc brakes
Sophisticated onboard computer
Regenerative braking
4 battery bays under the cargobox to accomodate any of 7 battery chemistries
Design load: 500lbs cargo plus 200lb driver
Design speed: 25mph max.
over 500% gear ratio, manual shifting (automatic shifting being explored)
12G spokes, robust wheels and fenders.
Classic head and tail lights
Horn
12V port for Accessories
Your choice of color

For more details go here


WHAT don't we know?

We don't know the details of the frame construction, but the reality is that the production model won't look much different from what you see in the video in terms of form and function. The only significant visual difference is that there will be no mesh and the production model won't be rusty ;)

We don't yet know if there will be suspension beyond what the suspension seat and fat tires offer. We will add it if it does not compromise driver safety or frame longevity (and we have enough funding to engage in suspension design and testing).

Risks and challenges

We have already built several working models and have figured out where to source nearly all of our components and principal accessories, so THIS isn't the challenge. The biggest challenge is in sourcing the metal, because to-date, we've been repurposing bicycle frames. Well, this works for custom builds but not for manufacturing. So this is our biggest unknown as far as materials costs.

In addition, no one has ever tried to optimize the cargotrike archetype before for electric-assist. We face the unique challenge of wanting to make the trike strong where it needs to be strong, and light where we can get away with it. We're doing something that's never exactly been done before and are asking for the luxury of doing it right the first time and quickly, in service to the community and our world.

More info here

"We" is mainly the passion and dedication of founder, Segue Fischlin, with the generous assistance of countless individuals who share the vision of how this project can ultimately serve communities and move us as people to a higher quality of life.  She has literally 10s of 1000s of hours of development into this project. Click here to see the Project History and learn more about her and the origins of this project. 


Guess what?! If you contribute...

  • $20 or more, you will be invited to the Bay Area Victory Party.
  • $150 or more, you will be invited to the Bay Area Victory Party and receive VIP benefits

See details below in "Rewards Details" section

We accept Bitcoin!  Go to www.bitcoinstarter.com to contribute by Bitcoin.


Sponsor Tiers

Sponsors: $600–$10,000

*NOTE:  Test drives available if you are seriously considering a Sponsor Tier. Please visit us at Maker Faire on May 20-22 or by appointment in Oakland.*


$10,000  Game Changer

     You are one of the few who recognize that this vehicle acts as a systemic solution to the systemic problems that we face in modern society.  

Not only do you have the opportunity to come into first possession of our tested and proven first model, but you will receive recognition as a major contributor on our website, along with receiving many nifty gifts as listed below.

This contribution will be discounted in full from the retail purchase price if you choose to order a Frankentrike.  A 2-tiered canopy will be included in your choice of fabric color free of charge, and the vehicle itself will come in your choice of frame and panel color along with a mounted engraved plate bearing the purchaser's name.

  •   Top-Tier Priority Ordering for One Special Campaign Edition Frankentrike with choice of frame and panel color.  2-tiered canopy included with your choice of fabric color. Non-transferable
   •   Rickshaw Bagworks Mini-Zero Messenger Bag
   •   Naomi Vinbury T-shirt or Print
   •   Pair of slap anklets or two pens/stickers
   •   Recognition as major contributor (on website)
   •   $500 Experience (transferable)


$1,200   Pioneer 

    You would like to support the development of this transformative technology and be one of the first with access to it.

Not only do you have the opportunity to come into early possession of our tested and proven first model, but you will receive a nifty gift as listed below.

This contribution will be discounted in full from the retail purchase price if you choose to order or count as credit towards other offerings of Frankentrikes. The vehicle itself will come in your choice of frame and panel color along with a mounted engraved plate bearing the purchaser's name.

   •   Priority Ordering for One Special Campaign Edition Frankentrike with choice of frame and panel color. Non-transferable
   •   Rickshaw Bagworks Mini-Zero Messenger Bag


$600 Trendsetter

    You would like to support the development of this transformative technology and be one of the first with access to it.

Not only do you have the opportunity to come into early possession of our tested and proven first model, but you will receive a nifty gift as listed below.

This contribution will be discounted in full from the retail purchase price if you choose to order or count as credit towards other offerings of Frankentrikes. The vehicle itself will come in your choice of frame and panel color along with a mounted engraved plate bearing the purchaser's name.

   •   Priority Ordering for One Special Campaign Edition Frankentrike with choice of frame and panel color. Non-transferable
   •   Naomi Vinbury T-shirt or Print

FOR ALL SPONSORS
When a production model has been completed and we are ready to take orders (estimated to be 16-24 months from campaign close if we reach our fundraising goal), you, as a Frankentrikes Sponsor, will be invited to purchase before a public announcement is made in order of Batch (Game Changer comes before Pioneer, One comes before Two, and so on).  Financing will become available as an option for payment once a production model is completed.


Experience what a Frankentrike can do!

Improve your garden

$500  Eight hours' use of the One and Only…Frankentrike!

 This massive cargotrike is available to you as a resource for 8 hours for any reasonable use you can imagine, such as: 1. move an office or small apartment , 2. shopping trip, 3. sag wagon for a ride in Napa valley, 4. tour of San Francisco; 5. taxi for a night out on the town, 6. Whatever you can dream up!  Driver included!

Range includes entire Bay Area -- Marin, Vallejo, S.F., San Jose. If you are not sure if you are within-range, please ask first before committing to this reward. Fully transferable

Fine print: Cargohold dimensions: 36" x 50". Max load 500lbs, max. length of 8' permitted on some items. Canopy removable. Frankentrikes reserves right to refuse to grant a request that is dangerous or beyond the limits of what the vehicle or driver can undertake. Test drives permitted with mandatory instruction at the driver's discretion. 

Night on the town

$250  Four hours' use of the One and Only…Frankentrike!

  This massive cargotrike is available to you as a resource for 4 hours for any reasonable use you can imagine, such as: 1. move an office or small apartment , 2. shopping trip, 3. sag wagon for a ride, 4. tour of Oakland; 5. taxi for a night out on the town in the East Bay, 6. Whatever you can dream up! Driver included! 

Range includes East Bay west of the ridgeline: Richmond, Oakland, San Leandro, Treasure Island. Fully transferable

Fine print: Cargohold dimensions: 36" x 50". Max load 500lbs, max. length of 8' permitted on some items. Canopy removable. Frankentrikes reserves right to refuse to grant a request that is dangerous or beyond the limits of what the vehicle or driver can undertake. Test drives permitted with mandatory instruction at the driver's discretion.


Nifty Gifts!!

$150 Rickshaw Bagworks Mini-Zero Messenger Bag with custom-embroidered logo. Classy water-resistant tweed spun from 100% post-consumer plastic with cordura lining. Outer dimensions: approx 9" x 8"x 4". Made in San Francisco

$75 Naomi Vinbury Design T-Shirt or Print -- Choice of  t-shirt in your size on Charcoal (L) or Gray-Green(R), or screen-printed on dark gray art paper.  T-shirt is 100% organic cotton printed to order at Grease Diner in Oakland, CA.


$50 Plush Tricycle Toy -- Approximately 12" long, custom-designed for Frankentrikes by Child's Own. Made in Thailand

$30 Pair of reflective slap anklets for cycling. Imprinted not sticker.
Can also be used around the forearm or bike frame.

$25 Group Picnic & Ride to the Troll
If you live or travel in the Bay Area, join us on one or more dates to-be-arranged for a bicycle ride and picnic. Origin will be at the West Oakland BART station, and we will ride up the new East Span of the Bay Bridge together and visit the one and only unsanctioned Troll hiding in plain view on the new span. Meet the maker and enjoy good company, good food and fun! Ride is about 10 miles roundtrip and is an easy ride, though having at least 3 gears is recommended.

$15 Reflective slap and snap anklet w/Djordje Milosevic's gorgeous imprinted logo (Demo shows as sticker not as imprinting). Extra long 15"; can be used around the forearm or bike frame. 

$20 Ballpoint Pen with logo imprinted

Stickers!

A. "My Other Car is a Frankentrike" full-sized 3.5"x 11" -- B. Frankentrikes full-sized 2"x 11" -- C. Transparent Bike-sized 1"x 6.5" -- D. Bike-sized 1"x 6" -- E. 2.5" Square logo -- F. 4" Square logo

******************************************************************

NOTE:  We accept Bitcoin!  Go to www.bitcoinstarter.com to contribute by Bitcoin.

Bay Area Victory Party: You will be cordially invited to the exclusive Bay Area Victory Party (contingent on reaching campaign goal, which is $50K combined on Indiegogo and BitcoinStarter).

Bay Area Victory Party VIP Benefits:  VIP's get free drinks at the party, official recognition, and a ride in the red Frankentrike (with a pro photo op) and/or an opportunity to test drive the trike.  (Celebration contingent upon reaching campaign goal, which is $50K combined on Indiegogo and BitcoinStarter).



Video by shootscutsflicks



 FAQ

  • I have unanswered questions specifically about the Frankentrike

    Many common questions that I've received over the years have been responded to in this F.A.Q. document prepared for the Press. A window might pop-up, but you can make it go away by clicking 'no thanks, continue to view' at the bottom of the window.  If this document doesn't answer your question, feel free to drop me a line at segue@frankentrikes.com


  • How much will they cost?
    How many things do you buy that are not manufactured? Not very many, right?  Well there's a reason for that.   Building things one at a time costs more than people want to pay, most of the time. 

    Compare the cost of a custom-made bicycle with a manufactured bicycle.  It's 2-4x more expensive for the custom bicycle right?  Okay, now expand the complexity by about 10x and you have a Frankentrike. 
       
    Now, even that custom bicycle you ordered is not totally 'hand built.' The creator is smartly using jigs to ensure correct alignment.  A bicycle fabricator can buy pre-made adjustable jigs.

    As a builder of Frankentrikes, I can't just order jigs; I have to make them myself.  And if each tricycle is different, I can't make jigs that will work for every build.

    I can't give you a price until our product development is complete, but I can tell you that your $5 to $1000+ contribution will enable me to make them for at least $10,000 less per tricycle than if I have to make them custom and one at a time.  So think of your donation as a small investment to the advancement of real-world technology that brings huge dividends in the near future. These vehicles are so much less expensive to own and operate per mile than a car that they will essentially pay for themselves in just a few years.  And just like Tesla, as we scale up, we will be able to bring the cost-per-tricycle down significantly.   

    • Developing and releasing a product of this complexity is a process. You are contributing to a project for a good cause and that is to make cycling safer, more practical, more fun, and more accessible to more people.

  • Why are you building these?  Isn't X, Y, or Z already doing this?

    Nobody else is doing a project like this in the world.  Take a closer look.   I challenge you to send me a link to something i haven't yet personally seen or experienced.  And I will point out the significant differences.   If I thought this need was already being met, I wouldn't be making this effort.  If I could just buy another vehicle that offers me anything even remotely close to what the Frankentrike offers, believe me, I would stop with all this extra work and just buy it!

archetype before for electric-assist.  We face the unique challenge of 
wanting to make the trike strong where it needs to be strong, and light 
where we can get away with it.  We're doing something that's never exactly been done before and are 
asking for the luxury of doing it right the first time and quickly, in 
service to the community and our world.
More info here


"We"
 is mainly the passion and dedication of founder, Segue Fischlin, with 
the generous assistance of countless individuals who share the vision of
 how this project can ultimately serve communities and move us as people
 to a higher quality of life.  She has literally 10s of 1000s of hours 
of development into this project. Click here to see the Project History and learn more about her and the origins of this project.

See details below in "Rewards Details" section

     You are one of the few who recognize that this vehicle acts as a systemic solution to the systemic problems that we face in modern society.  
Not only do you have the opportunity to come into first possession of our tested and proven first model, but you will receive recognition as a major contributor on our website, along with receiving many nifty gifts as listed below.

Bay Area Victory Party VIP Benefits:
  VIP's get free drinks at the party, official recognition, and a ride 
in the red Frankentrike (with a pro photo op) and/or an opportunity to 
test drive the trike.   (Celebration contingent upon reaching campaign goal, which is $50K combined on Indiegogo and BitcoinStarter).






Video by shootscutsflicks

 FAQ






I have unanswered questions specifically about the Frankentrike



Many common questions that I've received over the years have been 
responded to in this F.A.Q. document prepared for the Press. A window might pop-up, but you can make it go away by clicking 'no thanks, continue to view' at the bottom of the window.  If this document doesn't answer your question, feel free to drop me a line at segue@frankentrikes.com



How much will they cost? How many things do you buy that are not manufactured? Not very many, right?  Well there's a reason for that.   Building things one at a time costs more than people want to pay, most of the time.  Compare the cost of a custom-made bicycle with a manufactured bicycle.  It's 2-4x more expensive for the custom bicycle right?  Okay, now expand the complexity by about 10x and you have a Frankentrike.     Now, even that custom bicycle you ordered is not totally 'hand built.' The creator is smartly using jigs to ensure correct alignment.  A bicycle fabricator can buy pre-made adjustable jigs.As a builder of Frankentrikes, I can't just order jigs; I have to make them myself.  And if each tricycle is different, I can't make jigs that will work for every build. I can't give you a price until our product development is complete, but I can tell you that your $5 to $1000+ contribution will enable me to make them for at least $10,000 less per tricycle than if I have to make them custom and one at a time.  So think of your donation as a small investment to the advancement of real-world technology that brings huge dividends in the near future. These vehicles are so much less expensive to own and operate per mile than a car that they will essentially pay for themselves in just a few years.  And just like Tesla, as we scale up, we will be able to bring the cost-per-tricycle down significantly.   
Developing and releasing a product of this complexity is a process. You are contributing to a project for a good cause and that is to make cycling safer, more practical, more fun, and more accessible to more people. 
Why are you building these?  Isn't X, Y, or Z already doing this?Nobody else is doing a project like this in the world.  Take a closer look.   I challenge you to send me a link to something i haven't yet personally seen or experienced.  And I will point out the significant differences.   If I thought this need was already being met, I wouldn't be making this effort.  If I could just buy another vehicle that offers me anything even remotely close to what the Frankentrike offers, believe me, I would stop with all this extra work and just buy it!

story:
The Challenge:

Is to protect Ka'kabish, an ancient Maya city in Belize, from agricultural development that would see the site stripped of trees and the ancient temples and buildings leveled by bulldozers. The land is currently registered as agricultural and most of the land around the site has been cleared for farming. Pressure is mounting for this site to demolished in the same way. We are working with the Institute of Archaeology, a division of the National Institute of Culture and History, in Belize, to buy back this section of land and stop the impending destruction.

We are working against a looming deadline and must raise the money by May 2017 to prevent this from happening to Ka’kabish.

 

What is Ka'kabish?

Ka’kabish, was a thriving ancient Maya city, located at the edge of the Maya world. From its inception in the 9th century BC until its demise in the 15th century AD, Ka’kabish exhibited an amazing resilience. It not only survived the turmoil at the start of the Classic period (AD 250) that saw the death of many other cities, it also survived the chaos at the end of that period (AD 900) which brought about the end of all but a few cities and heralded the demise of Classic Maya civilisation.

Why it matters:

Once upon a time . . . all of this section of north-central Belize was covered by dense jungle forest and you could drive all the way from the ruins of Lamanai to Ka’Kabish and beyond seeing nothing but jungle and glimpses of the wild-life.  Today, this is not the case and every year more and more parcels of land are cleared for agricultural development leaving little in the way of forest cover and animal habitat.  The rapacious nature of the development now threatens to destroy the 3,000-year old ancient city of Ka’Kabish. 

Urgency:

As land in this area can only be farmed for 2-4 years before the soil is exhausted, there is increasing demand clear the few remaining pockets of jungle. Consequently, every year, more and more land is stripped, destroying smaller ruins and forcing wild-life to take refuge in what little jungle remains around Ka’kabish.  If we don’t act soon Ka’kabish will be destroying the same way.

 

How we want to help:

We want to finish the work we started and complete the purchase of Ka’kabish and make it a National Park. 

Working with the Institute of Archaeology, NICH, we will incorporate the site into the National Archaeological Reserve system of Belize. This will afford the site protection in perpetuity from clearing and development.  As part of the Archaeological Reserve system Ka’kabish will be accessible to the people of Belize and tourists who want to learn about ancient Maya culture.  

Through continued archaeological work at the site and engagement with the surrounding communities we will promote a better understand of the value of cultural heritage to make future rescue efforts like this one unnecessary.

 

The ask of you:

We need your help to raise the remaining $30,000 CND to complete the purchase.

 

What your contribution will fund:

All of your money will go directly towards the purchase of the site.  The perks that you received are supplied by KARP and paid for by Dr. Haines as part of her commitment to preserving the site.  

Funds raised above the currently needed amount will be used to purchase additional lands to the north of the site on which additional courtyard complexes are located and are still under forest coverage.

Please note, that this campaign is not tax-deductible in Canada.  

 

Who are we?

KARP is an international team of researchers and students who work with our Belizean colleagues and members of the Indian Church Village to not only investigate the history of the 3,000-year old ancient city of Ka’kabish but also strive to educate others about the ancient Maya and to protect the local heritage for future generations.

Meet the KARP Fundraising Team

What have we done so far?

We surveyed the forest area covering Ka’kabish which has allowed the ruins to be excised from the larger parcel of agriculturally-zoned land on which it sits. This paved the way for the ruin to be purchased and turned into a national park.  Previous fundraising efforts raised $24,000 CND with your help, which was used to make the initial down-payment on the site.

 

Other ways you can help:

We realise that not everyone can financially support causes no matter how worthy, so here are a few other ways you can help.

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family.
  • Like us on Facebook (www.Facebook.com/Kakabish) 
  • Check out our website to learn more (www.kakabish.org)
