story:
Time to Have Fun

Übuild is a flatpacked, modular series of modern playhouses for cats, dogs, toys, and whatever else needs a little home. We want you and your little ones to have fun.  Übuild offers a refined design with inventive pieces including additional floors, walls, pegs, and multiple holes for maximum fun.


Modern Modular

Thoughtfully designed, the houses can be assembled or disassembled in minutes by both young and old. Designed with a tab and slot system, the tiny houses are fun for all species and all ages. Made of sturdy birch plywood with a protective finish, these playhouses reflect our modern sensibility with a dose of quirky fun.


Crazy for Cats

We know cats are weird. And we love them for it.

The Cat Haus is built for all of your cat's idiosyncrasies. There are places for paws to dangle, a corner in which to snuggle, and a loft for the ultimate hiding spot. It's a cozy place for your kitty to sleep for 20 hours straight or hide from your guests. 

The Cat Haus can be assembled in minutes and comes with little additions like pegs, tabs, circles and stickers. 



Puppy Love

The Dog Haus is the largest of our houses and perfect as a cozy home for your small dog. We know your dog wants most of all to be with you, but when he can't this is the perfect shelter. It features a rounded door for easy access, a square base (for the constant circling) and little round holes for sniffing and viewing the world outside.

The Dog Haus is intended for indoor use, but can be left outside occasionally.
For the Kids

Playing is one of the formative activities for your kids. Playing helps us tell stories, make decisions, work out scenarios and get along with others.

The Toy Haus is a gender neutral playhouse for all kinds of toys; Barbies™, Darth Vader™, Minions™, you name it. There a multiple configurable rooms, pegs, and ways in which your kids can use this structure to enhance their playtime. We supply additional tabs, plywood circles and round pegs so your child can free play, using their imagination to the fullest.




Specifications

Timeline


What You Get

Your support will get you:

  • A discounted pre-sale rate of Übuild playhouses
  • Get one before anyone else does! Ships in November 2016


Rewards

EARLY BIRD PRICES, get them now!
  • Cat Haus ..... $179
  • Dog Haus ..... $209
  • Toy Haus ..... $179

COMBO SETS:

  • Cat Haus + Dog Haus ..... $379
  • Cat Haus + Toy Haus ..... $349
  • Dog Haus + Toy Haus ..... $379
  • All Three ..... $549

What We Need

You support will allow us to:

  • Purchase warehouse equipment for assembling and packaging 
  • Provide advertising funds to sustain our marketing plan


Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is to get the word out about our playhouses and gain the support of the community. 

  • We're inventive and we like to play. These houses are just the beginning of our designer product line. Help us achieve our goals!
  • If we don't achieve our goal, we are committed to manufacturing and shipping the pre-sold units to our supporters.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can help us by:

  • Spread the word! Share our campaign on your social media accounts, forward our video to your friends, or blog about our product.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! We'll have a raffle for a free Übuild house for our most supportive sharer!


About Us

We are Bldg Studio Inc, a design studio based in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. We design houses for grown-ups but thought that the little ones of the family could use a roof as well. Übuild is the launch of our new product line; industrially designed objects to enhance your daily life.

          

Bldg Studio Inc. started in 2010 with Crystal Bueckert, later joined by her cousin Jasmine Nickel. We are an award-winning design studio and are both Architectural Technologists with a passion for design and creating products for better living.

Thanks to Abby the suspicious cat, Henry the rock star Shibou, Hugo the daschund who stole our hearts, and Annike and Odin who showed us how to play! Thanks to www.bensound.com for the ukelele tunes.

story:
Summary

The goal is for everyone to be able to recycle used containers, take up less space and make their own products. 

This is RepopKnife, the tool that we developed after more than 10 years of experience. Now we want to make it accessible to as many people as possible.  We need your support to realize this dream.

The money will be used to produce lots of tools which will lower the cost and allow us to train a larger number of people who have no work, reintegrating them to the production system and helping our community.

What we need and what you get

We want to raise $ 9.000 to cover production and shipping costs and to recoup some of the investment made in the development of the tool and patent.

Each contributor will receive a tool to work with its original Stanley edge and a digital catalog with instructions.

The impact

Your collaboration will help promote the tool, that everyone will have one and thus more and more containers will be recycled and reused. You can design your own crafts and products.

Risks and Challenges 

We already have the design and molds to begin production. If we do not raise the total, we would like to bring the tool to everyone anyway. Our commitment is to deliver the tool!

Other ways you can help

Even if you don’t have the money you can help us by sharing this info via Facebook, Instagram and Twitter with your family, friends and colleagues.





     
  •  
  •

story:
20 Million Trees for Kenya’s Forests   

Kenya really does need trees

One of the least-forested countries in Africa, Kenya has less than 7% of forest cover, this has led to loss of biodiversity, droughts, flash floods, landslides, crop failures and power shortages.

By planting trees we'll help to restore natural landscapes in biodiversity, revive water flows, replenish soil fertility, reduce global warming, and enhance the livelihoods and wellbeing of people living around the forests.  Local communities will help raise, plant and take care of more than 15 million indigenous trees to restore highland forests, as well as a further five million trees that will be planted on local smallholder farms.

    The campaign has two foundation projects A) Phase One: Mount Kenya Forest Landscape Restoration Project and B) My 20 Trees and Me: Growing up together

    Phase One of the Centenary Campaign is the Mount Kenya Forest Landscape Restoration Project: is restoring the mountain slopes in Embu County. Communities living close to Mt Kenya who mainly grow tea and coffee on their smallholdings are keen to restore damaged parts of the forest and to plant more trees on their own land.  Trees help to conserve water and stabilise and fertilise soil, but can additionally provide food to eat and sell, fuel, poles, and also fodder for livestock – thus reducing demand on the forest. Find out more here

    The below pictures show how the community has supported the project by planting and tending seedlings, getting them ready for planting in the rugged terrain of Mt. Kenya.

    My 20 Trees and Me: Growing up together:  is an initiative spearheaded by our partners Mount Kenya Environment Conservation (MKEC), based in Kenya. The aim is to encourage local children from six primary schools to better understand the vital role trees play in sustaining life, as well as the biodiversity of the forest. 

    Each child who takes part in this programme signs up to plant  20 trees a year, tending to each tree ensuring it thrives – as they do – until they leave school. Five boys and five girls were selected based on their understanding of why planting trees are so important, their courage and their enthusiasm to participate in the initiative.   

    The trees are planted in the school compound so the children, together with teachers and fellow classmates will take care of the trees. They will have a photo taken of themselves next to their trees so we can see how they and their trees are thriving, which is a lovely connection.

    The project aims to plant a total of 1,200 trees and six schools and two teachers are involved in the initiative, supported by ITF and MKEC.

    The below photos are just some of the children chosen to plant the first of their 20 trees.

    A Centenary Campaign

    International Tree Foundation is almost 100 years old - so its fitting that our Centenary Campaign takes us back to where it all began - Kenya - with the creation of Watu wa Miti (People of the Trees) by Richard ‘St. Barbe’ Baker and Chief Josiah Njonjo. (Read more about our history here) 

    It's an ambitious campaign, needing in depth project management, scores of willing and able volunteers, enormous logistics and a budget of around £4 000 000.

    The difference we can make together is huge, we just need your help.

    Don't forget to check out our perks!!

    Here is some more detail about the Baobab Reward:

    Donation of £2,000 (or more) LIMITED TIME ONLY

    You could experience a week of breath taking Kenyan beauty in Spring 2017! 

    We're offering a trip of a life time to the first 10 generous givers who donate a lump sum of  £2000 (or more) to our campaign, to attend an exciting trip to Kenya.  It's a jam-packed itinerary - but what a week of memories you'll make!  But best of all - you'll get to see places and meet people that most tourists don't!  

    Just some of the activities include:

    1: Visiting local farmers, experiencing a day-in-the-life on a rural Kenyan farmer,

    2: Enjoying tea tasting 'at source' in one of the vast tea estates, and filling your lungs with crisp fresh air as you bask in beauty of the landscapes,

    3: Enjoy guided walks through the living forests, maybe lucky enough to catch glimpses of forest animals,

    4: Get on board and planting a few trees yourself as part of the 20M campaign - leaving your own living legacy on the foothills of Mt Kenya,

    5: Tasting the juiciest mangoes, creamiest avocados, freshest macadamia nuts as you enjoy traditional rhythms of some local performers.

    All this whilst you stay in a comfortable hotel with beautiful surrounding gardens.

    If you're one of the participants, all you need to do is get yourself to Kenya, and we'll take care of the rest.  This includes three meals a day, all travel within Kenya and your local accommodation. Excludes alcohol and personal purchases. Medium fitness level is recommended.
story_txt: 20 Million Trees for Kenya’s Forests   Kenya really does need treesOne of the least-forested countries in Africa, Kenya has less than 7% of forest cover, this has led to loss of biodiversity, droughts, flash floods, landslides, crop failures and power shortages.By planting trees we'll help to restore natural landscapes in biodiversity, revive water flows, replenish soil fertility, reduce global warming, and enhance the livelihoods and wellbeing of people living around the forests.  Local communities will help raise, plant and take care of more than 15 million indigenous trees to restore highland forests, as well as a further five million trees that will be planted on local smallholder farms.The campaign has two foundation projects A) Phase One: Mount Kenya Forest Landscape Restoration Project and B) My 20 Trees and Me: Growing up togetherPhase One of the Centenary Campaign is the Mount Kenya Forest Landscape Restoration Project: is restoring the mountain slopes in Embu County. story:
Stunning TREE themed pendants handcrafted by jeweler Tzipora Hoynik, whose designs are featured in “The Jewelry of Burning Man" book.  Made of cast pewter and embedded with cabochon cut treasures of rainbow paua shell from New Zealand or an array of natural semi-precious gemstones.  Each inscribed on the back with the message, “Art for Trees 2017 - Through Our Leaves, Breathe Out the Sky.”

*

TREES generously provide – one might say “gift” us – wondrous wood. Without it, civilization would not have flourished. Perhaps we act on the concept of RADICAL RECIPROCITY by gifting back to our forests? Not because we have to or are shamed into it but because we truly appreciate our planet’s generosity. A positive loving EXCHANGE between Trees and Burners.

*

Nature isn’t keeping a score card on how much we owe her – but I think it’s safe to say we are in debt. It’s a universal truth that sharing, asking permission, giving back, offering help, demonstrating gratitude, and practicing generosity are all qualities that promote healthy relationships and communities by fostering cooperation, growth, and love.

*

“When two givers indulge in a connection, it’s like magic. It’s alchemy. I water you, you water me, we never drain each other, we just grow.” – Billy Chapata

*

Our Gift Economy Principle: “Burning Man is devoted to acts of gift giving. The value of a gift is unconditional. Gifting does not contemplate a return or exchange for something of equal value.” This principle extends to animals, plants and all living beings on our planet. 

*

The restorative action of planting trees to replenish the wood that we use to build and burn art isn’t about absolving our sins – it’s simply gifting back to the planet that has so generously gifted to our gathering year after year.

*

And, yes, this one seemingly infinitesimal action you take today by donating to plant trees will have a ripple effect over time!  During the past 4 years, Art for Trees has planted over 30,000 trees!

I am truly humbled that this annual tree planting effort from 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 with our tree planting partners - Green Forests Work, For the Wild, The National Forest Foundation, Urban Releaf, and Common Vision - has had such a positive impact to date. I’ve seen recent photos from Green Forests Work’s mountain top removal remediation efforts where some of the seedlings we planted (yes, I personally planted 100 and it was back-breaking work!) on a surface mine in Appalachia in the spring of 2014 are 4-foot tall trees today! And, this year, we are branching out to support other social engagement initiatives to further promote Radical Reciprocity.

Thank you for your support,

Your Playa Crone-in-Residence

Melissa Barron (aka “Syn”)

story:
What do you do when you see the world around you being destroyed and people suffering? Some people ignore it in the face of their own daily struggles. Some educate themselves about it and do little things to improve the situation, and a select few dedicate themselves to a life of activism fighting to stop it. Despite the efforts of a passionate minority, the problems are only getting worse, and the shortage of sincere individuals is only a part of the problem. There is a large cultural divide that separates these groups from the mainstream, a gap that has grown wider in recent years.

I'm Appalachian so I have to start everything with a story.

Most of my life, I believed the best way I could take care of my family was by working hard and sacrificing myself to earn a high wage.  It was a belief that led me to become the fifth generation of my family to work in the underground coal mines of Appalachia and ignore the problems it was causing.

I eventually realized that taking care of my family, and giving my kids a better future, didn’t have to mean working in an industry that placed their profits ahead of the health of millions, if not billions, of people. In 2010, I left the mines and began an epic journey, pursuing a better life for my family, and fighting for justice against large corporations and their political allies.

Through four years of college, multiple marches, protests, and acts of civil disobedience, I have learned much. Despite feeling good about the work I was doing, I could not forget how my fellow miners and their families viewed environmental activism. Some justice advocates, despite having their hearts in the right place, were failing to communicate with the everyday working families who are the foundation of our communities.

So, I have begun yet another journey, built upon years of hard work and hard lessons, committing myself to bridging the cultural and political divides between progressive ideals and conservative values. Believe it or not, there is common ground, plenty enough for both sides to stand on, but it takes overcoming cultural differences through audience based communications. It is difficult and often unappreciated work, but it is work that needs to be done. 

And so I created Breaking Clean, a small media company through which I will bring years of life experience and a formal education in communications to achieve multiple goals: 

  • Provide communications training and strategies that decrease cultural divides and increases the effectiveness of non-profit organizations.
  • Help organizations develop systems to assess event outcomes and achieve continuous improvement in their public outreach.
  • Produce media that popularizes sustainability and sociopolitical change by helping people realize their individual benefit.

What’s Needed:

There are thousands of people dedicating their lives to just causes through a variety of organizations, many of which are working with little or no budget. I want Breaking Clean to offer its services for free to those organizations who cannot afford it. The public outreach we also intend to do will be offered free to the public via social media and public events. Through your contributions, you will help make that possible.

We need funds for operational costs, and travel and living expenses until we can hopefully tie into other sources of funding. We also need funds to upgrade media equipment from consumer level cameras and recorders to more robust mid-level professional gear to do our video outreach work.

After tallying everything up we need a minimum of $25,000 to achieve Breaking Clean’s goals.

$17,000 for our operational costs & family living expenses over the next 6 months.

$3,000 for travel

$5,000 for equipment

With this money we can really begin to get established, allowing us to focus more on increasing our outreach efforts through content production while assisting organizations as we develop other funding streams.
 

How you can help?

If you are financially able, please contribute to our Indiegogo campaign.   If you’re not in a situation to contribute financially, you can still be a huge help. Breaking Clean is about helping people who help bring about just change. It’s a different way of thinking about activism and organizing, and helping people to better understand one another.  We need your support spreading the word about this mission. Check out our Facebook page and website, please share this campaign, and let’s all work together for a better future. We really are depending on you, and I’m not just saying that.

About the Creator:

Nick Mullins is a 9th generation Appalachian and a 2016 graduate of Berea College where he received his B.A. in communications with additional focuses in Appalachian studies and sustainability and environmental studies. Known for the blog "The Thoughtful Coal Miner," Nick's writing and commentary have been featured in a variety of publications including Yes! Magazine, Audubon Magazine, The Hill, The Washington Post, C-SPAN’s Washington Journal, NPR’s The World  and many others. Nick's work in Appalachian issues earned him the 2015 Stammer Appalachian Service Award, and his research into the receptivity of environmentalists and environmental messaging in the Appalachian coalfields earned accolades within the undergraduate communications community. Nick’s work has also included two cross country public outreach tours and the short documentary Coal Mined. When he isn’t working, Nick enjoys spending time outdoors with his family and enlightening unsuspecting strangers on socioeconomic issues.

story:
This campaign is designed to help me extend the course to a National scale.  Incorporating the best available science into real estate investing is needed everywhere.  Markets work best when consumers are educated, and unfortunately some consumers are being left with a mortgage but little or no equity due to natural disasters. 

Did you know that over 20% of flood insurance claims are for property outside the 1% annual risk of flooding (100-year flood plain).  There is strong evidence that climate change is increasing the magnitude of precipitation events.  FEMA maps, which are based on historical records ignoring climate change, are inadequate for protecting consumers.  Many homeowners outside the 100-year flood-plain do not have any flood insurance so severe weather events can be financially catastrophic.  The National Flood Insurance Program is already $24 billion in debt due to due to Hurricanes Katrina, Rita, and Sandy, so the cost of flood insurance is increasing.  This is one example of the issues that will be covered.

The first four-hour class will be offered on September 7, 2017 in Asheville, NC, and is sponsored by the National Association of Realtors, the Land of the Sky Association of Realtors, and The Collider.  Please let me know if you want me to teach the course in your area!

Achieving the $10,000 goal will allow me to write a course text book that will facilitate achieving “Continuing Education” approval from real estate commissions across the U.S. Realtors must take CE courses and many are concerned about climate impacts.  My strategy is to write the course text book and teach the class in several states to collect letters of support from realtors to facilitate acceptance as a CE course.  The class will focus on the science of climate change and financial outcomes.  

About Me

I do have a strong background in education, with a BS, MS and PhD in environmental science.  I regularly publish in the peer-reviewed literature, white papers for Federal agencies, and the popular press.  I am adjunct faculty at Lenoir-Rhyne University and Michigan State University.  At Lenoir-Rhyne University, I designed and teach a course on the Economics of Sustainability for the Graduate Program in Sustainability.  My consulting work as the Founder of Ecological Services and Markets has centered on developing market-based strategies for mitigating the effects of habitat loss and adapting to climate change.  Prior to completing my PhD, I also worked as an environmental consultant supporting Superfund and Brownfield re-development.  I am a licensed realtor with Keller Williams. 

Your Impact

Your support will help change an industry.  The real estate market is viewed by many consumers as a great way to create and maintain wealth.  Such strong market-forces can be used to change where money is invested and help reduce financial losses associated with climate change.  The London School of Economics estimated that given no future reductions in carbon emissions, the global economy is could lose $24 trillion due to climate change.  Further, meeting the goals of the Paris Climate Accord, and reducing carbon emissions, could reduce the damage by $11 trillion.  Consumers must be educated on how to reduce their risk of financial loss - adapting to climate change will require smart investment.

story:
Chico Flax

Hello, I am Sandy Fisher. I have been a professional weaver for over 30 years in my beautiful hometown of Chico, California. I am also a social entrepreneur, gardener, and environmentalist.

Like any entrepreneur, I think I have a problem worth solving. With my company, CHICO FLAX, my dream is to turn flax into linen!

One day, about five years ago, I looked into a friend’s garden and saw this beautiful blue-violet flax plant. Knowing that linen comes from flax, I wondered, “Can I grow flax to produce a fiber that grows clean, adds no pollutant, and the finished fabric breathes better than cotton. I also wondered, “Is there a way to work together with local farmers to provide the most basic human necessity—our clothes—to change the textile industry as we know it today?” Since then, my husband, Durl, and I have answered the first question. YES. We can grow flax in a sustainable manner. We’ve experimented with different varieties, soil types, and planting times, and guess what: IT CAN BE DONE! 

 

Why is Chico Flax a good Investment

  • Flax hasn’t been grown, for linen, in the United States since early in the 20th century. 
  • We have proven that it grows well as a winter crop in Northern California.  
  • We have been processing our flax by hand, by taking the steps to mechanize the processing of flax into linen yarns, we will have a saleable product. 
  • There is a big demand from artisans and designers for locally scoured linen yarns.
  • We have partnered with California State University, Chico to determine which varieties of flax are best suited for Northern California soil and climate.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to reach our goal, we need $50,000. All of the yarns used in our gifts except for the tablerunner and hand made paper bowl are from highest quality linen from Belgium, the only source I have at the present time.

Based on your donation, you will receive:

 

$10,000 – Hand woven Linen Table Runner 

50% locally scourced Organically grown Vreseis cotton, 50% Chico Flax tow linen

 

$5,000 – Set of 4 hand woven linen hand towels

100% Belgium Linen, naturally dyed

 

$1,000 – Set of 4 hand woven linen napkins

100% Belgium linen

 

$500 – Set of 4 hand woven linen placemats

100% Belgium linen

 

$250 – Set of 4 linen coasters

100% Belgium Linen

 

$100 – Decorative paper linen bowl made of our flax by-products

100% Chico Flax by-product

 

Our Vision

To become Northern California’s first sustainable producer of naturally grown linen.

 

Our Mission

To plant, harvest, and process flax. We will create jobs through the sale of flax seed and flax fiber.

 

How You Can Participate

  • Like us on Facebook!
  • Become a hobby farmer and grow flax in your garden
  • Become a larger-scale farmer and dedicate a few acres to planting flax
  • Attend flax education workshops at Butte College and Chico State
  • Become a linen artist/creator
  • Sign up for our quarterly newsletter
  • Learn how to weave and spin fiber
  • Invest in us on Indiegogo.com 

.

Our Key Objectives

  • Create a seed bank

  • Work with local farmers to plant flax seed in November, and harvest in the spring

  • Provide a mill to process harvested flax into linen

  • Support cottage industries using our linen and by-products

  • Educational outreach, working with Butte College and Chico State Agriculture and Arts Departments

 
Visit us on Facebook! 
See more of our process on how we turn flax into linen on our Facebook page.
https://www.facebook.com/chicoflax.org/
story_txt:
Chico Flax
Hello, I am Sandy Fisher. I have been a professional weaver for over 30 years in my beautiful hometown of Chico, California. I am also a social entrepreneur, gardener, and environmentalist.
Like any entrepreneur, I think I have a problem worth solving. With my company, CHICO FLAX, my dream is to turn flax into linen!
One day, about five years ago, I looked into a friend’s garden and saw this beautiful blue-violet flax plant. Knowing that linen comes from flax, I wondered, “Can I grow flax to produce a fiber that grows clean, adds no pollutant, and the finished fabric breathes better than cotton. I also wondered, “Is there a way to work together with local farmers to provide the most basic human necessity—our clothes—to change the textile industry as we know it today?” Since then, my husband, Durl, and I have answered the first question. YES. We can grow flax in a sustainable manner. We’ve experimented with different varieties, soil types, and planting times, and guess what: IT CAN BE DONE! 
 
Why is Chico Flax a good Investment

Flax hasn’t been grown, for linen, in the United States since early in the 20th century. 
We have proven that it grows well as a winter crop in Northern California.  
We have been processing our flax by hand, by taking the steps to mechanize the processing of flax into linen yarns, we will have a saleable product. 
There is a big demand from artisans and designers for locally scoured linen yarns.
We have partnered with California State University, Chico to determine which varieties of flax are best suited for Northern California soil and climate.

 

What We Need & What You Get
In order for us to reach our goal, we need $50,000. All of the yarns used in our gifts except for the tablerunner and hand made paper bowl are from highest quality linen from Belgium, the only source I have at the present time.
Based on your donation, you will receive:
 

$10,000 – Hand woven Linen Table Runner 
50% locally scourced Organically grown Vreseis cotton, 50% Chico Flax tow linen
 

$5,000 – Set of 4 hand woven linen hand towels
100% Belgium Linen, naturally dyed
 

$1,000 – Set of 4 hand woven linen napkins
100% Belgium linen
 

$500 – Set of 4 hand woven linen placemats
100% Belgium linen
 
$250 – Set of 4 linen coasters
100% Belgium Linen
 
$100 – Decorative paper linen bowl made of our flax by-products
100% Chico Flax by-product
 
Our Vision

To become Northern California’s first sustainable producer of naturally grown linen.
 

Our Mission
To plant, harvest, and process flax. We will create jobs through the sale of flax seed and flax fiber.
 
How You Can Participate


Like us on Facebook!
Become a hobby farmer and grow flax in your garden
Become a larger-scale farmer and dedicate a few acres to planting flax
Attend flax education workshops at Butte College and Chico State
Become a linen artist/creator
Sign up for our quarterly newsletter
Learn how to weave and spin fiber
Invest in us on Indiegogo.com 

.
Our Key Objectives

Create a seed bank
Work with local farmers to plant flax seed in November, and harvest in the spring
Provide a mill to process harvested flax into linen
Support cottage industries using our linen and by-products
Educational outreach, working with Butte College and Chico State Agriculture and Arts Departments


 
Visit us on Facebook! 
See more of our process on how we turn flax into linen on our Facebook page.
https://www.facebook.com/chicoflax.org/

story:
www.ctgreenburialgrounds.org

What could be more simple and straight forward than a natural burial? Having a ceremony that invites family participation, has little carbon footprint and also conserves nature?

Yet this isn’t an option in Connecticut or in most of New England.

For years I have been aware of the green burial movement and found it the most personally comforting idea of death that I had ever had. Knowing for certain that I wanted to be buried this way, I began looking for options in Connecticut.

When I couldn’t find a natural burial ground in the State (or even New England at the time!) I called the Green Burial Council. I asked if there were any prospective green burial grounds on the horizon. Kate Kalanick, the Executive Director, greeted me with utter enthusiasm. Just the previous week she had helped a terminally ill woman from Connecticut make plans to have her body transported to another State—another State!—to fulfill her vision of a natural burial.

It was then I knew I needed to do it. Because, as the adage goes, “If not me, who? If not now, when?”

So I gathered a small group of like-minded individuals and we began to research and plan. Over the past year, we have spoken with Land Trusts, Conservation Committees, individual land owners, Green Cemetery directors from other states and funeral homes. We have participated in events such as Earth Day and the Connecticut Land Conservation Conference. We wrote opinion pieces for three newspapers, identifying the need for a green cemetery. I even resigned from my career as an ER nurse so I could devote myself to this pursuit entirely.

Our dream: a cemetery exclusively for organic burials—no embalming, no steel or concrete vault, no coffin unless of local, natural, unpainted wood, perhaps just a shroud of natural material. Over each grave, we plant a tree of native species designated by the deceased or a loved one. People become trees, and the cemetery becomes a forest preserved in perpetuity. 

The biggest obstacle we face is educating the public on this option and thereby making it accessible to everyone. Our comprehensive business plan shows that there is a need for this service and an increasing level of environmental awareness across every demographic. But there is a vacuum in the Northeast in terms of eco-conscious burial options.

The time has come. We are ready. Now we need help to buy land and cover start-up costs. Your donation, of any amount, will go towards those goals. We have established a not-for-profit organization, CGBG Foundation, Inc., and are a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, so your contribution is 100% tax deductible.

It’s time to make green burial possible. We can do it. With your help, we can do it.

story:
Si quieres cambiar el mundo, cámbiate a ti mismo. 

Nuestro planeta necesita necesita un cambio, y creemos que la mejor manera de conseguirlo es uniéndonos todos a un movimiento. CTP es un movimiento que muestra cómo con pequeños cambios en nuestro día a día podemos conseguir un GRAN impacto para ayudar a nuestro planeta. 

 

Te necesitamos

Necesitamos un empujoncito que nos ayude a:

  • Promocionar el proyecto, eventos y limpiezas de playas en redes sociales.

  • Financiar los materiales y el equipo necesario para la limpieza de playas.
  • Lanzar nuestra colección de bolsas y camisetas #plasticfreeoceans que estará disponible en nuestra tienda online, con la que además apoyaremos proyectos y organizaciones que luchan contra la contaminación por plástico. 
  • Financiar la post-producción del documental que estamos grabando desde el inicio de nuestro viaje.

¿Qué recibes a cambio?

A cambio de tu aportación podrás hacerte con una de nuestras camisetas y/o bolsas de la colección #plasticfreeoceans!

Camisetas CTP #plasticfreeoceans: Diseño único en acuarela están impresas en algodón 100% orgánico y tinta de base al agua, mucho más respetuosas con el medio ambiente y con tu piel!

 

Bolsas CTP #plasticfreeoceans: Diseño exclusivo en acuarela y mensaje muy molón. Algodón 100% orgánico y tinta de base al agua. 

 

Para ver la colección completa y elegir tu perk visita: 

https://choosetheplanet.com/es/coleccion-plasticfreeoceans/

Tu Impacto 

¿Qué conseguirás con tu aportación?

Cada gota cuenta en el océano! Tu aportación es importante para nosotros y para el planeta porque…

  • Desde Canadá a Costa Rica hay más de 8000 km de costa, y eso son muchas playas! Queremos limpiar tantas playas como podamos y dejar reluciente la costa del Pacífico :)
  • Con la colección #plasticfreeoceans apoyaremos proyectos e iniciativas de gente brillante y comprometida que están luchando contra el plástico, dándole un mejor propósito que el de convertirse en veneno para nuestros peces!
  • Imagina cómo molaría si con tu ayuda cambiáramos los hábitos de miles de personas pasando de un cepillo de plástico a uno de bambú… Si cada persona utiliza de media unos cuatro cepillos de dientes al año... Evitaríamos toneladas de plástico al año!

Y eso es sólo un ejemplo.

Quiénes somos? 

Somos dos jóvenes cabezotas con una misión:  cambiar los hábitos de millones de personas y salvar este planeta! 

  • Paloma: Desde pequeña soñaba con recorrer la selva grabando documentales (también quería ser panadera…!). Dividida entre mis dos pasiones, enamorada de la cocina y defensora de la naturaleza. Estoy convencida que el equilibrio es posible y según dicen soy bastante cabezota. 
  • Joseba: Lleva el emprendimiento en las venas y la naturaleza en el corazón. Hortelano aficionado, le encanta recoger tomates con su sombrero de paja. Amante del surf y de la música. Su secreto para ser feliz: sonreír siempre y nunca dejar de soñar. 
  • Mina (nuestro skoolie): Escogimos para nuestro 'skoolie' bus un nombre que nos recordara cómo empezó todo. Mina es un Orangután hembra que vive en la reserva de Bukit Lawang, Sumatra. Mina es conocida por todos por su 'carácter', no le gustan los selfies y mucho menos las plantaciones de aceite de palma... Pues eso, como anillo al dedo :)

 

Nuestra Historia

Después de nuestro visita a Indonesia, volvimos a casa traumatizados ante la contaminación por plástico. Queríamos expulsar el plástico de nuestras vidas y REDUCIR los residuos cambiando hábitos sencillos de nuestra vida cotidiana. Pero el aprendizaje fue lento y confuso!

Cuando empezamos este viaje hacia una vida más sostenible teníamos millones de dudas, nos equivocamos y nos encontramos con muchas dificultades… Y lo que nos queda por aprender todavía! Por ello queremos compartir todo nuestro aprendizaje contigo. 

Decidimos hacer este viaje por la Costa Oeste como un reto, una forma de demostrar a todos y a nosotros mismos que es posible vivir con menos, de una manera mas sencilla y generando menos residuos. En el camino pasaremos por momentos difíciles, encontraremos obstáculos… y plástico, mucho plástico. Pero también encontraremos soluciones y recompensas!

Queremos limpiar tantas playas como podamos, pero nuestro objetivo es descubrir el secreto para vivir en equilibrio con la naturaleza y compartirlo con el mundo. 

 

    Retos y Riesgos

    Pase lo que pase, tendréis vuestras camisetas y bolsas Choose The Planet! Pero como siempre, quien no arriesga no gana, y en este proyecto existe un riesgo. Si no alcanzamos la cifra de aportaciones necesarias, es posible que…

    • No podamos producir el documental. 
    • Es probable que limpiemos muchas menos playas o que no podamos acoger a tanta  gente en nuestros eventos y cleanups. 

    Pero una cosa está asegurada… No vamos a tirar la toalla! Seguiremos compartiendo con vosotros todo lo que aprendamos sobre ‘zero waste’ y las soluciones que vayamos encontrando en nuestro viaje. LLámanos hippies-yippies! Pero hemos puesto muchísima ilusión en este proyecto y AMAMOS este planeta. Tenemos la esperanza de que juntos, con pequeños cambios, podemos mejorar la salud de nuestros oceános y salvar a nuestra Madre Tierra. 

    Otras Formas de Ayudar

    Si no puedes contribuir con una donación o con la compra de una de nuestras camisetas o bolsas, no te preocupes! Hay otras formas de ayudar.

    • Comparte esta campaña con tantas personas como conozcas o que crees que podría interesarle. Utiliza los iconos en esta campaña para compartir vía Email, Facebook, twitter, WhatsApp o URL link.
    • Síguenos en nuestras redes sociales y suscríbete a nuestro canal YouTube y newsletter. Visita nuestra página www.choosetheplanet.com para saber más.
    • Atrévete a iniciar tu viaje y aprende a reducir tus residuos! Te animamos a probar algunos de nuestros consejos y cambiar pequeños habitos que tendrán un gran impacto. Así también estarás contribuyendo a conseguir nuestra misión!

     

    ( ENGLISH VERSION)

    Be the change you wish to see in the world. 

    The Earth needs us, and we need to change. Is wouldn’t be fair to ask for a change if we don’t make our best, right? This is our challenge. The best way to make this change happen is joining a movement. CTP is our movement to show how making better choices, small changes, decisions that we make every day can have a big impact on the planet. 

    We need you

    We need a little push to help us to:

    • Promote the Choose The Planet Project, workshop events and beach cleanups Ion social media. 
    • Cover the cost of the equipment and tools for the beach cleanup, and subsequent ‘recycling’  stage (finding a better use for all the plastic collected)
    • Launch the #plasticfreeoceans collection of reusable bags and t-shirts that will be available on our online store. 
    • Fund the production of the documentary we are filming since we started our trip and journey to a less-waste & plastic free living. 
    • What you get:

    You can get one of the tote bags or t-shirts of the #plasticfreeoceans collection!

    • T-shirts CTP #plasticfreeoceans: watercolor design printed with eco-friendly water-based ink onto a 100% organic cotton, white T-shirt- available in sizes S-L. Four designs available (Octopus, Sea Turtle, Blue Whale, and Seahorse). Printed onto the chest with the hashtag #plasticfreeoceans. 

    • Tote bags CTP #plasticfreeoceans: watercolor design printed with eco-friendly water-based ink onto a 100% organic cotton tote bag. Four designs available with different messages (Blue Whale, Seahorse, Sea Turtle, and Octopus). 

     

    To see the full collection and choose your perk visit: 

    https://choosetheplanet.com/plasticfreeoceans-collection/

     

     

    Your Impact

    Every drop in the ocean counts. Your help is important to us and to the planet because… 

    • From Canada to Costa Rica there is more than 8000 km of coastline… that means a lot of beaches to clean! We would like to clean as much as possible and meet thousands of people along the west coast, working together, and sharing our story :)
    • With the #plasticfreeoceans collection, we are donating 10% of profits from the sale of all products within this range to worldwide initiatives and organizations that are fighting against plastic pollution and doing their best to protect the environment and the marine wildlife. Also, we will support projects that are researching for a better use to plastic than becomes poison for our oceans!
    • Imagine how could be to change the shopping habits and lifestyle of thousands of people, just switching from a plastic toothbrush to a bamboo alternative… that could avoid a few tons of plastic waste going to the landfill every year! And that’s only an example.

     

    Who are we? 

    We a two people (both stubborn) with the same mission: to change the lifestyle of millions of people to save the world! 

    Paloma: Dreaming of filming nature documentaries from a young age, conscious about the environment and baker at heart. Divided between my two passions I’m convinced that it’s possible to find the balance… people say that I’m very stubborn. 

    Joseba: Young entrepreneur. Nature is in his heart. Gardening enthusiast who enjoys growing tomatoes in his backyard. Music and surfing are his passions. His secret for happiness is always smiling and never stop dreaming.

    Mina (our skoolie): We had to choose a name for our skoolie that reminded us of the beginning of this story. Mina is a rehabilitated orangutan who lives in the Indonesian rainforest of Gunung Leuser National Park, Sumatra. Mina is well known for her ‘bad temper’, she doesn’t like selfies with tourists and she hates palm oil plantations… we thought it fitted like a glove. 

    Our Story

    After our trip to Indonesia, we became aware of the plastic pollution problem. Rubbish was dumped into rivers or burnt in piles. We were shocked. 

    Back in London, we decided to get plastic out of our lives too… but it wasn’t an easy job! We changed our shopping habits, cooked everything from scratch and tried to reduce waste as much as possible.

    It was a long and confusing process. When we started our transition, we had millions of questions and doubts. We made a lot of mistakes (and we still make them). There is still a lot to learn on this journey, and we want to share it with you. 

    We accepted this trip as a challenge. Starting from scratch, living simpler and enjoying more. 

    Our goal is to learn how to live without generating trash, avoiding recycling. We know we will find a lot of troubles… and plastic. But we will also find solutions and rewards!

    We want to clean beaches but our mission is to find the secret of living in balance with our nature and sharing it with everyone. Finding the balance with our choices. Choosing better for the planet.

      Challenges and risks

      No matter what happens, you will have your perk (t-shirt or bag) #plasticfreeocean :) Unfortunately, who does not risk does not win, and we have a risk too. If we don’t get enough funds, we might not be able to…

      • Make the documentary. 
      • Organize the number of beach cleanups we wish, and fewer people will join us because either they didn’t hear about us or we are not able to host them. 

      But one thing is guaranteed… we are not going to give up! We will keep sharing with you our trip and transition to a zero-waste living and will tell you everything we learn on this journey. 

      Call us hippies-yippies! But we make this because we believe in the individual actions, we believe that small changes can make a big difference and together, we can save this planet.

      Other ways to help 

      If you can’t make a donation, there are still ways you can help: 

      Share this crowdfunding campaign with everyone you know. Use the share buttons on this website to share it by Email, Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp or just copy the URL link.

      Follow us on Instagram and Facebook and subscribe to our YouTube channel and newsletter. Visit www.choosetheplanet.com to know more.

      Challenge yourself to start your journey to a plastic-free living, reducing your trash with small changes that can have a big impact on your health, your happiness, and the planet!

https://choosetheplanet.com/plasticfreeoceans-collection/
 
 
Your Impact
Every drop in the ocean counts. Your help is important to us and to the planet because… 

From Canada to Costa Rica there is more than 8000 km of coastline… that means a lot of beaches to clean! We would like to clean as much as possible and meet thousands of people along the west coast, working together, and sharing our story :)
With the #plasticfreeoceans collection, we are donating 10% of profits from the sale of all products within this range to worldwide initiatives and organizations that are fighting against plastic pollution and doing their best to protect the environment and the marine wildlife. Also, we will support projects that are researching for a better use to plastic than becomes poison for our oceans!
Imagine how could be to change the shopping habits and lifestyle of thousands of people, just switching from a plastic toothbrush to a bamboo alternative… that could avoid a few tons of plastic waste going to the landfill every year! And that’s only an example.

 
Who are we? 
We a two people (both stubborn) with the same mission: to change the lifestyle of millions of people to save the world! 
Paloma: Dreaming of filming nature documentaries from a young age, conscious about the environment and baker at heart. Divided between my two passions I’m convinced that it’s possible to find the balance… people say that I’m very stubborn. 
Joseba: Young entrepreneur. Nature is in his heart. Gardening enthusiast who enjoys growing tomatoes in his backyard. Music and surfing are his passions. His secret for happiness is always smiling and never stop dreaming.
Mina (our skoolie): We had to choose a name for our skoolie that reminded us of the beginning of this story. Mina is a rehabilitated orangutan who lives in the Indonesian rainforest of Gunung Leuser National Park, Sumatra. Mina is well known for her ‘bad temper’, she doesn’t like selfies with tourists and she hates palm oil plantations… we thought it fitted like a glove. 
Our Story
After our trip to Indonesia, we became aware of the plastic pollution problem. Rubbish was dumped into rivers or burnt in piles. We were shocked. 
Back in London, we decided to get plastic out of our lives too… but it wasn’t an easy job! We changed our shopping habits, cooked everything from scratch and tried to reduce waste as much as possible.
It was a long and confusing process. When we started our transition, we had millions of questions and doubts. We made a lot of mistakes (and we still make them). There is still a lot to learn on this journey, and we want to share it with you. 
We accepted this trip as a challenge. Starting from scratch, living simpler and enjoying more. 
Our goal is to learn how to live without generating trash, avoiding recycling. We know we will find a lot of troubles… and plastic. But we will also find solutions and rewards!
We want to clean beaches but our mission is to find the secret of living in balance with our nature and sharing it with everyone. Finding the balance with our choices. Choosing better for the planet.

Challenges and risks
No matter what happens, you will have your perk (t-shirt or bag) #plasticfreeocean :) Unfortunately, who does not risk does not win, and we have a risk too. If we don’t get enough funds, we might not be able to…

Make the documentary. 
Organize the number of beach cleanups we wish, and fewer people will join us because either they didn’t hear about us or we are not able to host them. 

But one thing is guaranteed… we are not going to give up! We will keep sharing with you our trip and transition to a zero-waste living and will tell you everything we learn on this journey. 
Call us hippies-yippies! But we make this because we believe in the individual actions, we believe that small changes can make a big difference and together, we can save this planet.
Other ways to help 
If you can’t make a donation, there are still ways you can help: 
Share this crowdfunding campaign with everyone you know. Use the share buttons on this website to share it by Email, Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp or just copy the URL link.
Follow us on Instagram and Facebook and subscribe to our YouTube channel and newsletter. Visit www.choosetheplanet.com to know more.
Challenge yourself to start your journey to a plastic-free living, reducing your trash with small changes that can have a big impact on your health, your happiness, and the planet!

story:
Ecuador has more than 25,000 different kinds of trees and plants; 4,500 of them exists only in this Country, 78% are threatened to some degree, 8% in critical danger of extinction. Approximately 90,000 hectares (222,000 acres, 900Km²) are deforested annually since 1990, that is more than 16% of all the forest in 28 years.

When someone cuts a tree, parasitic plants and epiphytes such as orchids and bromeliads; birds, plants, etc, also lose their space to develop. If we do not take immediate action, the whole ecosystem may change and many animals and plants species will disappear.

Our Team Campaign´s Volunteers and I want to show that, pruning and gathering from the forest is more productive and beneficial over time, than cutting trees and deforesting.

How?

A tree is not only a living being; it is home, food, medicine, support, etc. of many other species that really depend on it; A beneficial ecological synergy is generated for everyone, including us, humans.

But how will we show that pruning and gathering from forests is more productive and beneficial over time, than cutting trees and deforesting?

We promise that for every essential oil blend that you acquire in this campaign, we will plant a native tree in your name. Furthermore, we will teach the success of this project to local communities so that they learn that while collecting leaves and fruits, and pruning branches to produce handicrafts, essential oils and creams, nature can provide constant income in a sustainable way, as opposed to the current and ongoing deforestation to obtain wood for immediate economic returns, in detriment to the future benefits of their descendants, and of all of mankind eternally.

Your contribution will lead to a snowball-effect of change, because it will significantly improve the economic situation of the natives giving them a constant source of income by maintaining and improving their local ecosystem.

We are sure that with your help, we will achieve it; and in the near future, the environment and our descendants will thank us.

We will invest the money of this campaign in the following way:

 

 The exclusive perks that we offer in this Campaign are:

 

  • A Big Thank You; We will name you in our social networks, thanking you for your support on this campaign.

 

  • We will plant a Tree in your name, you can choose one of these Trees: Palo Santo, Palo de Ajo and Algarrobo; plus we will upload the picture of the new baby tree beside a billboard of your name, with the message, "thanks to you, this tree is sown." onto our social networks; We will also provide the GPS coordinates where the tree is located. 

 

  • We will plant a Ceibo Tree in your name, plus we will upload to our social networks, the picture of the new baby tree beside a billboard of your name, with the message, "thanks to you, this tree is sown."; and the GPS coordinates where it is located.

 

  • Coast Jungle Blend (20ml)

The combination of Pure Essential Oils of Palo Santo and Camphor potentiates the Methyl Salicylate that they naturally contain, which makes it a powerful muscular and joint anti-inflammatory, as well as significantly reduces pain. Prices include shipping all around the world. Each time you acquire this Blend, we will plant a Palo Santo Tree in your name, plus we will upload to our social networks, the picture of the new baby tree beside a billboard of your name, with the message, "thanks to you, this tree is sown."; and the GPS coordinates where it is located.

 

  • Andean Moorland Blend (20ml)

The combination of these plants found in the Ecuadorian Andes (Lavender, Rue and Valerian), cause a relaxing feeling, help bring deep and restful sleep quickly. Prices include shipping all around the world. Each time you acquire this Blend, we will plant a Palo de Ajo Tree in your name, plus we will upload to our social networks, the picture of the new baby tree beside a billboard of your name, with the message, "thanks to you, this tree is sown."; and the GPS coordinates where it is located.

 

  • Amazonia Forest Blend (20ml)

These amazing Trees found in the Ecuadorian Amazonian Forest (Ocotea and Limon-Mandarina), cause a feeling of security, power with invigorating energy; it will keep you motivated and willing to take on all your daily activities in an alert mood. Prices include shipping all around the world. Each time you acquire this Blend, we will plant an Algarrobo Tree in your name, plus we will upload to our social networks, the picture of the new baby tree beside a billboard of your name, with the message, "thanks to you, this tree is sown."; and the GPS coordinates where it is located.

 

  • The 3 Campaign's Blends (20ml each)

Take home these 3 essential oils blends, and enjoy all their therapeutic power. Prices include shipping all around the world.  Each time you acquire this perk, we will plant 4 different Trees: Palo Santo, Palo de Ajo, Algarrobo and Ceibo in your name, plus we will upload to our social networks, the picture of each new baby tree beside a billboard of your name, with the message, "thanks to you, this tree is sown."; and the GPS coordinates where the trees are located.

 

Remember that 4% of the global species just exists in this tiny country located in the center of the earth, which receives more than 12 hours of sunshine every day; the center of the territory is crossed by the Andes mountain-range and receives direct winds from the Pacific and those from the Atlantic Oceans that have crossed the entire amazon jungle, these geographical conditions create a diverse and unique ecosystem.

In this blessed corner of the planet, the forests are dense, the soil rich in nutrients that make the vegetation grow strong and abundant. Researchers have studied the different species of the flora and have identified amazing therapeutic benefits. Some of these plants have been used in local traditional and ancestral medicine, and are already being extracted as raw materials to produce essential oils, so that their benefits can be enjoyed by everyone.

If we do nothing, deforestation will continue destroying the environment exponentially.

We need your support now! Together we can create a synergy that will improve and preserve - not only this corner of the Earth’s ecosystem, but that of entire world.

Please spread our campaign with all your contacts, help us reach as many people through the Indiegogo share buttons.

 

                                                                       Chat with us  

 

Our Social Networks

Share with Family and Friends

Follow us to see our Campaign's evolution

Have a question, send us an email to gb@jalach.com

story:
Car Washes Waste Billions Of Gallons Of Water

Water conservation needs to be a higher priority for Americans. People in the United States use more water per person than any other country. According to the Environmental Protection Agency, an American family of four uses water at a pace of 400 Gallons per day at home alone!

Hi, My name is Tom Stady, I've been a successful entrepreneur  for 43 years in the Home Appliance Industry, and Residential Real Estate Rental Business, with additional experience in Sales and Marketing of numerous products and services.

The idea for this project was born in October 2014, as my wife Norma, and I, and a couple of friends drove west from El Paso,TX. along Interstate 10 to California for a weekend car show.

As we drove through Arizona, I was appalled and disheartened at the hundreds of dead Palm trees that used to be beautiful lush green palms blowing in the wind, now reduced to lifeless timber dry, brown waste atop tall majestic trunks of dead wood. This left an impression with me that I cannot escape; and that is an impression of how grave our water crises really is, and what further wasting of our lifestyle will happen if we don't better manage the fresh water that we do have.

                                                              RIO GRANDE RIVER- EL PASO, TX. JANUARY 2015

With the car show on my mind, I immediately thought about the Waterless Car Wash Product that I was introduced to about 20 years ago. Now, with our water crises at hand, it made more sense than ever before to answer the question "WHY ARE WE WASTING BILLIONS OF GALLONS OF WATER EACH YEAR WASHING OUR CARS, TRUCKS, AND SUV'S, WHEN WE COULD BE SAFELY DOING THE SAME, AND EVEN BETTER WITHOUT USING WATER?!!!!!!!!!!"


The answer is quite simple!

Most of us either don't have the time or desire to get out and do a Hand Wash on our vehicles, so we drive through an automated or semi-automated car wash that wastes an average of over 100 gallons of water, per wash.

And, the truth is, no one has yet figured out a way to MASS market a nationwide WATERLESS car wash system. UNTIL NOW!!!


With your support, we will launch America's Finest, Franchised, Nationwide Waterless Car wash system. The concept is very simple, efficient, and safe for both your vehicle's finish, and the environment. Our locations will be in parking lots all across America. We will contract with existing property developers & businesses for ground leases about the size of 3 to 6 parking spaces.

Just imagine while shopping at a Big Box, or Retail Store, having your car professionally cleaned and detailed in about 20 min. without using a drop of water? Or, imagine, stopping for lunch at your favorite restaurant, and making use of that time to also have your car cleaned and shined while you are dining.



Each location will feature a new, state of the art mobile van equipped with power generator, vacuum and carpet cleaning machine, remote heating, and air conditioning units, and 2 to 4 employees to do the dirty work for you.


Our work shelters, will be attractive, 2, 3, or 4 simple poles, with a colorful low profile canvas top featuring 4 roll up canvas sides for additional weather protection when needed.

You will play a very important role in funding our goal for our start up operation, consisting of a commitment on a leased location for our Home Office, development and training center, including a exact prototype of a real operating location.

The prototype will include a fully equipped state of the art mobile van, and weather/work shelter. Your role, and your name, as a founding contributor will be recorded as a significant step in the realization that we must manage our fresh water if our future generations are to have the same quality of lifestyle that we have enjoyed. And, if your name is to be remembered for one more good and positive thing, why not it be immortalized at 100's or 1,000's of locations across the U.S. on our menu of services or our wall of fame at the $25 and above contribution levels.



Our vision is to have our "Shop and Shine Waterless Car Wash" and "Dine and Shine Waterless Car Wash" locations available to be franchised throughout America within3 to 6 months after the close of a successful campaign. Cars that are washed in the street can pollute our rivers and harbors. The soapy water that runs off the car into the gutters goes into the storm water system. Storm water, unlike the water which enters the sewers, does not undergo treatment before it is discharged into our waterways. Any pollutants in storm water ends up in our rivers, lakes, harbors, and oceans. Our Waterless Car Wash will avoid this pollution.



If you ever thought, somehow, it would have been great to somehow be involved in the excitement of the start up of one of America's Greatest Fast Food Chains, this is your opportunity, to instead , be part of America's Greatest Waterless Car Wash Chain, and make a real difference for the future.YOU will be part of our 1st BILLION GALLONS SAVED, and many more BILLION GALLONS SAVED thereafter. Please consider jumping on board, and helping us in any way you can before our 45 day campaign comes to an end. Thanks!  

Legal Disclaimer: This is not a offer to sell a franchise. An offer can only be made by prospectus. Visit our website at http://www.stopandshine.com for more information.


        Here's how your contribution will help us save Billions of Gallons of water!

                            (Percentage Break Out of Each Dollar Contributed)

                                                     Total Budget $125,000


In Summary, we all must act now in every way we can to conserve one of our most precious resources, that we have taken for granted and abused for decades. All the experts are now saying that we will have very serious water shortages very soon if we do not immediately reverse the current trends.
Your contribution and support to this campaign will be an important step in one way we think about how we use, abuse, or may alter the way we think about water. Not only will you receive the Perks we are offering, but you will be partnering with seasoned entrepreneurs,Tom and Norma Stady, who are in the habit of "making things happen", and the select Project Team members we have assembled.
We believe in giving back to a cause we strongly believe in. Therefore we have delegated 10% of all our company gross revenue to be given back to Water Related, and Humanity causes both here in the U.S. and worldwide.
And finally,if you just can't contribute financially, please help us to get the word out to all your social contacts about our project, and ask them to visit this campaign.

Thank you, & Muchas Gracias,
Tom, Norma, Sallie, & Cenay

story:
Our story.

Wellington Auxiliary Rescue Association (WARA - also known as "Wellington Rescue") is a non-profit volunteer-run search and rescue team based out of Prince Edward County's Wellington harbour.  We go out onto Lake Ontario to aid boaters in distress and we help them get safely back to shore.   Wellington Rescue is continuing the 125+ year-old tradition of operating a rescue boat serving boaters off the Southern and Western shores of "The County".

Wellington Rescue identified the need for a new boat a couple of years ago.  We have been saving funds towards the new boat for a few years and we just purchased her.  She has the "right stuff" to be a safer and more effective boat than our existing donated boat.

Now we need to refit her to search and rescue standards.  It is critically important that our search and rescue team members go out onto Lake Ontario with an appropriately prepared vessel and with the necessary equipment to safely and effectively rescue boaters.  Without your support to achieve this, the new boat will not  be able to be put in service.

What We Need

We will use the donations to fund our new boat rebuild.  We have to strip her down to the metal and build her back up.  This includes completely repainting her, rewiring her, welding in some panels for storage lockers, installing a bow thruster, constructing a new helm station, refactoring the roof, installing the engine and transmission (which are out of the boat) and purchasing and installing up to date electronics and safety equipment.

What You Get

Depending on your donation, we will offer perks such as a Wellington Rescue mug, a t-shirt, a framed-photo, an on-board recognition plaque - or more!  Items purchased or received from Wellington rescue are available for pickup only - we don't offer shipping.  Note that pickup is at advertised times and only occurs infrequently.  We will communicate that by email once we acquire the items and they arrive.

We are a registered charity and can provide you with a tax receipt for donations $50 and up.  Unfortunately, we can only do this if you do not select a perk since donations in Canada are only tax deductible if you do not receive any material benefit personally.

Anyone can purchase the mug, t-shirt or thank you photo regardless of whether they have donated or not.  That is accomplished by sending funds using Paypal to our paypal account paypal@wara.ca.  The amount to send is as follows: the mug is $15, the t-shirt is $30, the personalized thank-you framed photo is $50 and the onboard recognition plaque is $100.    If you just want the perk without a tax receipt, just go ahead and donate on Indiegogo and select your perk.   If you want just the tax receipt go ahead and donate on Indiegogo and select *no perk* - and enter your address .  If you want both a tax receipt *and* a perk then you have to make two independent transactions - first a donation on Indiegogo for the tax receipt and then second you have to purchase the item you want  via www.paypal.ca to paypal@wara.ca.  Voila!

The Impact

With your help, Wellington Rescue will have the new boat in the water sooner, which will allow us to go out in a wider range of situations.  That means we will be a safer and more effective unit sooner - with your financial help.

We have the expertise and proven track record of preparing and launching a search and rescue boat.  We have a team of people ready to do the work.  We just need your donation!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute financially - there are still ways you can support the initiative - you can help us get the word out to those who can donate!  You can share our campaign on social media or verbally to your friends and family.  Also, if you are local to The County, you can come out to our work parties to help us prepare the boat.
story_txt:
Our story.

Wellington Auxiliary Rescue Association (WARA - also known as "Wellington Rescue") is a non-profit volunteer-run search and rescue team based out of Prince Edward County's Wellington harbour.  We go out onto Lake Ontario to aid boaters in distress and we help them get safely back to shore.   Wellington Rescue is continuing the 125+ year-old tradition of operating a rescue boat serving boaters off the Southern and Western shores of "The County".
Wellington Rescue identified the need for a new boat a couple of years ago.  We have been saving funds towards the new boat for a few years and we just purchased her.  She has the "right stuff" to be a safer and more effective boat than our existing donated boat.
Now we need to refit her to search and rescue standards.  It is critically important that our search and rescue team members go out onto Lake Ontario with an appropriately prepared vessel and with the necessary equipment to safely and effectively rescue boaters.  Without your support to achieve this, the new boat will not  be able to be put in service.   What We Need We will use the donations to fund our new boat rebuild.  We have to strip her down to the metal and build her back up.  This includes completely repainting her, rewiring her, welding in some panels for storage lockers, installing a bow thruster, constructing a new helm station, refactoring the roof, installing the engine and transmission (which are out of the boat) and purchasing and installing up to date electronics and safety equipment.
What You Get
Depending on your donation, we will offer perks such as a Wellington Rescue mug, a t-shirt, a framed-photo, an on-board recognition plaque - or more!  Items purchased or received from Wellington rescue are available for pickup only - we don't offer shipping.  Note that pickup is at advertised times and only occurs infrequently.  We will communicate that by email once we acquire the items and they arrive.
We are a registered charity and can provide you with a tax receipt for donations $50 and up.  Unfortunately, we can only do this if you do not select a perk since donations in Canada are only tax deductible if you do not receive any material benefit personally.
Anyone can purchase the mug, t-shirt or thank you photo regardless of whether they have donated or not.  That is accomplished by sending funds using Paypal to our paypal account paypal@wara.ca.  The amount to send is as follows: the mug is $15, the t-shirt is $30, the personalized thank-you framed photo is $50 and the onboard recognition plaque is $100.    If you just want the perk without a tax receipt, just go ahead and donate on Indiegogo and select your perk.   If you want just the tax receipt go ahead and donate on Indiegogo and select *no perk* - and enter your address .  If you want both a tax receipt *and* a perk then you have to make two independent transactions - first a donation on Indiegogo for the tax receipt and then second you have to purchase the item you want  via www.paypal.ca to paypal@wara.ca.  Voila!
The Impact
 With your help, Wellington Rescue will have the new boat in the water sooner, which will allow us to go out in a wider range of situations.  That means we will be a safer and more effective unit sooner - with your financial help.
We have the expertise and proven track record of preparing and launching a search and rescue boat.  We have a team of people ready to do the work.  We just need your donation!

    Other Ways You Can Help If you are not in a position to contribute financially - there are still ways you can support the initiative - you can help us get the word out to those who can donate!  You can share our campaign on social media or verbally to your friends and family.  Also, if you are local to The County, you can come out to our work parties to help us prepare the boat.

story:
STMPO (Sand Trees Mountains Pacific Ocean) is a California Nonprofit 501(c)3 Public Benefit Corporation, based in San Diego, CA. The purpose of this crowdfunding campaign is to help us open a community space for yoga, fitness, healthy living, storefront, and a base for our beach cleanup efforts.

Where do the DONATIONS go?

By donating, you can help us meet our immediate and long-term goals. STMPO promotes active lifestyles, eating healthy, and a reciprocal relationship with nature. The founders of STMPO.org have backgrounds in community farming, and health and fitness.

One goal of our organization is to start a yoga studio to promote community fitness and personal health. Your donations will help STMPO to aquire, remodel, and open the location we have selected, within the next few weeks. For more information on our community-based yoga please visit http://bornagainnaturalist.com.

A long term goal of STMPO to build local community-based farms to help feed residents of that area, including the homeless and underemployed. Your contributions will go towards farming efforts: to purchase and plant fruit bearing trees and seeds to grow vegetables, plus the tools and equipment necessary for harvesting. 

We are developing a tree-planting project in designated areas along the coast, to involve members of the community. We are also looking for unused or under-developed land near our coastlines, to plant trees and community crops.

STMPO is striving to raise awareness about the harmful effects of pollutants in our environment, and increasing efforts to preserve the coastlines of the Pacific Ocean. 

Based in San Diego, STMPO is taking this campaign all the way up the West Coast, from Southern California (Mexican Border) to Northern Washington (Canadian Border).

Together we can help to preserve the environment by picking up trash, and reducing harmful pollutants like oil and garbage in our streets. Curbside drains feed into to the oceans and bays, and the results can be toxic - harming marine life as well as people. Everyone can do their part to preserve our coastlines.

Any donation you can give will help fund the startup costs of the CA Nonprofit, and to offset overhead costs of the t-shirts and clothing that we design and print. Our clothing features images of nature and coastal lifestyles. We are now using all eco-friendly water based inks on our printed garments.

You can also donate via paypal on our website http://STMPO.org, or purchase STMPO clothing via our website http://stmpoclothing.com.

Your contribution to our campaign is greatly appreciated!

story:
Who is Paddle Without Pollution?

We're a group of Water Warriors who uses boats—mostly kayaks, canoes, and stand-up paddleboards—to remove litter and illegally dumped debris from our region's rivers, creeks, lakes, and wetlands. Join us!

Since 2011, Paddle Without Pollution (PWP) has: 

• Removed more than 42 tons of litter from Western Pennsylvania’s watersheds 

• Engaged 300 volunteers per year in stewardship work that makes an immediate difference to the health of our waterways 

• Increased the public’s awareness of the effects of watershed pollution 

• Involved our community in direct action, low-impact events that enable anyone to make a positive difference through hands-on stewardship. 


PWP’s mission is to restore and protect the health of rivers, streams, lakes, and wetlands through hands-on stewardship and education, thereby benefiting the region’s communities, economy, and quality of life. 

Our solution is low impact but achieves big results. Our crews are able to clean entire shorelines and can reach areas that are inaccessible on foot. They work efficiently and effectively because they are actually in the water, not just walking alongside of it. In addition, kayaks and canoes produce no pollution that could further degrade the water, and they provide great exercise. PWP’s Water Warriors get an up-close look at the condition of our watershed, the causes of the pollution affecting it, and the importance of their work. 

We are proud to have been recently recognized with several awards: 

• American Canoe Association Green Paddle Award for Waterway Conservation 

• Western Pennsylvania Environmental Award from Pennsylvania Environmental Council 

• 1st Place in the Three Rivers Regatta’s Anything That Floats Race using a boat made entirely from repurposed items and trash. 


What We Need and Why We Need It

We need your financial support for this year's Watershed Stewardship Campaign, which will consist of at least 14 cleanups of rivers, creeks, and lakes. See the entire schedule here. Each year, we work hard to raise enough money, and we have some awesome funders. But watershed stewardship can be expensive, and we need your help.

Contributions are tax-deductible and will go toward things like: 

  • Equipment, safety gear, supplies like bags and gloves
  • Operational expenses like volunteer recruitment and promotion
  • Insurance, tire recycling, trash removal, launch permits

What You Get

We've got several cool thank you gifts for supporters, including stickers, shirts, and even your name on a boat! See the "Perks" in the column to the right. 

Other Ways You Can Help

• Join us on the water for a stewardship event. Even if you’ve never paddled before, you can make a big difference and have a lot of fun. We even have kayaks and canoes you can borrow. Register at paddlewithoutpollution.com/events. 

• Contribute through your workplace’s giving program—your donation could be multiplied—or check if your workplace offers grants in exchange for volunteer hours served. 

• Become a corporate sponsor. We offer several sponsorship levels which include promotion for your business. Just email us at paddlewithoutpollution@comcast.net to get started.
