story:
Please check out our videos and pictures in the GALLERY for a recap of the Blue Bahr Film Festival 2014! 

WE'VE STARTED A TRADITION!   Thanks to all of YOU - the individuals and sponsors who generously supported the first Edition of the Blue Bahr Film Festival, it was a HUGE success!   Now, back by popular demand, we are delighted to announce that the Blue Bahr Film Festival is sailing to Beirut again this Fall.

To be held again in Beirut's newest multi-complex Cinemacity theatres, the festival will continue to offer a visually stunning showcase of local, regional and international ocean films and videos, designed to entertain, educate, and inspire the public and instill an appreciation for the ocean.

Partnering with local NGOs, universities and ministries, the Blue Bahr Film Festival places great emphasis on community outreach and public education about our oceans, the world’s most important resource.

Honored to be supported under the patronage of the Ministries of Culture and Environment, the festival is rapidly becoming a much anticipated regional event.

The mission of Blue Bahr is also to encourage local filmmakers and our next generation of underwater filmmakers, and in 2015 we will again be awarding prizes to best local and regional films.

PLEASE help support us on this exciting initiative.  Your contributions will allow us to dub and subtitle the films into Arabic as well as secure film rights and educational outreach.  Our aim is to continue to have maximum student participation with daytime screenings for students and on-campus university screenings.

The Blue Bahr Film Festival operates as a not-for-profit organization and once again all profits and funds will be used to support the Blue Bahr Film Festival media and educational initiative, encouraging the Lebanese, its younger generations and future leaders to understand and appreciate the importance of our oceans.

The Lebanese have shared a special bond with the sea since the time of the Phoenicians, let's show that we care about this precious resource.

Let’s celebrate the sea!

story:
What we've done before the U Module

We are a family of Uruguayan builders with 25 years of experience. We have worked with concrete, steel, adobes, canes and wood to build houses. As the years passed by, we gained awareness of pollution coming from concrete and steel production. Therefore, our constructions became more ecologic by building more with earth and wood. In the latest 15 years we have mainly built American wood framing houses.  
Lo que hemos hecho antes del U Module
Somos una familia de constructores uruguayos con más de 25 años de experiencia. Hemos trabajado con hormigón, acero, adobes, cañas y madera para construir casas. Con el pasar de los años, nos hemos concientizado con respecto a la contaminación causada por la producción del acero y el hormigón. Entonces decidimos construir con sistemas ecológicos, usando más la tierra y la madera. En los últimos 15 años hemos construido principalmente casas Americanas con el sistema wood framing.
Siempre buscando maneras de construir de manera más rápida y eficiente, muchas veces nos preguntamos cómo ofrecerle a la gente un sistema que los ayudara a construir por si mismos, y ahora pensamos que lo encontramos: el U Module
Because we have always looked for ways to build faster, we wondered how to offer people a building system that would help them build by themselves. 

And now we think we have found it: 

U Module 

This U shaped plywood wooden module that can be put together in different ways is a solution to many of today´s everyday challenges. U Module can be used for wall and roof building for houses, sheds, or warehouses, and it can also be applied to a wide variety of household creations: beds, shelves, tables, seats, sofas, lavatories, slides, cabinets, closets, trunks, containers, sleighs, troughs, or anything you and your imagination can create with it. 
Éste módulo de multiplaca con forma de U que se puede ensamblar en maneras diferentes es una solución para muchos de los retos actuales. El U Module puede ser utilizado para la construcción de paredes y techos para casas, graneros o galpones y también puede aplicarse a una amplia gama de creaciones domésticas: camas, mesas, asientos, sofás, mesadas, toboganes, armarios, contenedores, trineos, baúles, estanterías, bateas, o cualquier cosa que vos y tu imaginación puedan crear. 
The system we have invented is very important to us because it saves material, time and energy when building and it helps mitigate Climate Cange. A wood framing structure is not necessary to build a one story house. It is directly built with the U Modules.
El sistema que inventamos es muy importante para nosotros porque nos permite ahorrar material, tiempo y energía al construir, y contribuye a la mitigación del cambio climático. No se necesita una estructura de marcos de madera para construir una casa de un piso cuando uno emplea el U Module. 

Here´s an explanation of how to raise walls: there are 2 ways of placing the U Module. 

Aqui podés ver una explicación de como levantar las paredes: hay 2 maneras de ubicar los U Modules. 
One is aligning them with their backs facing the outside. Each  U Module is fixed to the foundation with different options.
Una es alineándolos con las espaldas enfrentando el exterior. Cada U Module se ancla al cimiento con diferentes opciones. 


The other option is the zig-zag position, which makes the wall thicker and gives it a more attractive look. 
La otra es en disposición zig-zag, lo que hace que le da espesor a la pared, y una vista más atractiva. 

. 

If you want to maintain the original design in the U Module, all you have to do is to protect the wood with exterior paints for wood. 
Si querés mantener el diseño original del U Module todo lo que tenés que hacer es protegerlo con pintura protectora de madera para  madera.  

This image shows the construction covered by siding (you may cover it with whatever material you wish). Roofs can be perfectly covered with asphalt shingles. 
Ésta imagen muestra la construcción cubierta con siding (podés cubrirla con cualquier material que desees. Los techos pueden ser perfectamente cubiertos con tejas asfálticas. 

Build a roof with the U Module

Using the U Mole you can also build roofs. The roof shlould be protected against rain or any soure of water. 
Construir un techo con U Module
U Module puede ser usado para construir techos.El techo debe ser protegido de la lluvia posteriormente. 



Some suggestions for furniture:

Algunas sugerencias para muebles:

You can create anything you imagine with the U Module, some liquid nail and screws.  
Podés crear cualquier cosa que te imagines con U Module, clavo líquido y tornillos. 


Why to use the U Module

The system  saves material, time and energy when building. A wood framing structure is not necessary to build a one story house. It is directly built with the U Modules.
Using the U Modules is easy. Anyone can design, cut and assemble with them. You don't need special tools for it, just your normal saw, screws or even liquid nail. 
Your creations will be costum-made: you will choose what to do with it. Besides, you will make the U Modules fit your needs. The product is versatile, it is easily adjustable to any size. 
Painting the U Modules is as easy as painting your room's walls. Pick a color and get your brush ready! In addition, you may apply cover suitable for wood.
Wood is a strong material but it's also light, allowing any person to manipulate it. 
We want everybody know about this system because of these advantages which help mitigate the Climate Change. 

Porqué usar el U Module

Éste sistema ahorra material, el tempo y energía en el momento de construir. No se necesita una estructura para construir una casa de un piso. Se construye directamente con U Module. 

Usar el U Module es fácil. Cualquiera puede diseñar él, cortarlo y ensamblarlo. No precisás herramientas especiales, simplemente la sierra que usas generalmente, tornillos o hasta clavo líquido. 

Tus creaciones serán hechas a tu medida: vos elegís que hacer con él. Además, podés hacer que el U Module se ajuste a tus necesidades. El producto es versátil, puede concordar con cualquier medida que precises.

Pintar los U Modules es tan fácil como pintar las paredes de tu casa. Elegí un color y sacale el polvo al pincel. 

La madera es un material fuerte pero a la misma vez liviano, lo que permite que cualquier pueda manupilar los U Modules. 

Queremos que todo el mundo sepa acerca de éste sistema por todas sus ventajas, y porque nos ayuda a mitigar el Cambio Climático. 

What your contribution will do 

This project is in its first stages. We need your help to expand our workshop, do more advertising, search for new markets and look for representatives in other countries. If you become a contributor and then would like to enter the business (selling the U Module), you are more than welcome to the team.
In our initial stage we want to expand our workshop and that's why we need $50,000 for tools ($20,000) and infrastructure ($30,000). 

Lo que hará tu contribución

Este proyecto está en sus etapas iniciales. Necesitamos tu ayuda para expandir nuestro taller, hacer publicidad, buscar nuevos mercados y buscar representantes en otros países. Si te convertís en un contribuidor y te interesa entrar en el negocio (vendiendo U Modules), serás más que bienvenido/a al equipo. 

En ésta etapa precisamos $ 50.000 para expandir nuestro tayer: $ 20.000 para herramientas y $ 30.000 para infraestructura. 

What you can get 

If you contribute with $5: A Thank you email: No contribution is too small for us.  We'll be more than glad to thank you personally for your support. :)
If you contribute with $50 or more you will receive a complete construction course with all the details you need to know about building your own home, from the foundation to the roof.
If you contribute with $1000 you become a sales representative for the U Module.

Lo que podés obtener

Si contribuís con $5: Un email de agradecimiento: no hay contribución muy pequeña para nosotros. Estaremos más que dispuestos a enviarte un email personal de agradecimiento. :)
Si contribuís con % 50 o más, recibirás un curso de construcción con todos los detalles que precisas saber acerca de coo construir tu propia casa, desde el cimiento al techo. 
Si contribuís con $ 1000 te convertís en un representante de venta de U Module.

Your impact

Most people use cement, bricks and steel to build their homes. We want to offer a natural material to the world which methodology allows not only builders but anyone capable of using tools to build.  
By contributing to develop the U Module, you are helping mitigate climate change because U Module is a wood based material. Wood absorves CO2 for photosyntesis, and then emits Oxygen which we breath. On the other hand, concrete and steel don´t produce Oxygen; they produce CO2 in their initial manufacturing and every single time they are recycled.  Manufacturing wooden products implies a much lower impact.
In order to produce  1 tone of Portland Cement, 1 tone of CO2 is emitted. 
In order to produce  1 tone of steel,  1.8 tones of CO2 are emitted. 
In order to produce  1 tone aluminium,  2.6 tones of CO2 are emitted. 
In order to produce 1 tone of sawn wood, 0.2 tone of CO2 is emitted. 
Click on the next link to find out more about the advantages of wood. 
http://forestry.about.com/od/treephysiology/tp/tree_value.htm
U Modules can be easily applied in case of emergencies such as the recovery from wars or natural disasters because building can be done in record times.  Besides, the Modules are a light, which allow anyone build including women and children. At the same time, they can also build their own furniture like beds and tables. 
By contributing, you are helping people create, which enhances mental health of children, teenagers and adults. As we have explained perviously, with U Module you can create any furniture for your home. We commit to creating a manual to suggest ideas on how to build some of these furnitures. 
Those who buy the product will also have a series of videos with demonstration of how to use the U Modules.

Tu impacto

La mayoría de la gente usa cemento, acero y cemento para construir su casa. Queremos ofrecerle al mundo un material natural cuya metodología permita que no solamente los constructores puedan construir, sino cualquier persona capáz.

Contribuyendo a desarrollar el U Module estás ayudando a mitigar el Cambio Climático porque el U Module es un material a base de madera. La madera asborve CO2  para la fotosíntesis, y luego exhala el Oxígeno que los seres humanos respiramos. Por otra parte, el hormigón y el acero no producen Oxígeno, producen CO2 en su producción inicial, y cada vez que son reciclados. La fabriación de productos de madera tiene un impacto mucho menor. 

Para producir 1 tonelada de Portland, se emite 1 tonelada de CO2. 

Para producir 1 tonelada de acero, se emiten 1,8 toneladas de CO2.

Para producir 1 tonelada de aluminio, se emiten 2,6 toneladas de CO2.

Para producir 1 tonelada de madera aserrada, se emite 0,2 tonelada de CO2.

U Modules se pueden aplicar fácilmente en caso de emergencia tales como en situaciones de guerra o desastres naturales porque la construcción se puede llevar a cabo en tiempo récord. Además, los U Modules son livianoes, lo que permiten que cualquiera construya, incluyendo mujeres y niños. Al mismo tiempo, también los pueden usar para construir sus propios muebles como camas y mesas. 

Al contribuir, ayudarás a crear, lo que beneficia la salud mental de niños, adolescentes y adultos.  

Como hemos explicado antes, con el U Module podés crear mueblería para tu hogar. Nos comprometemos a crear un manual con ideas y sugerencias para tus muebles. 
Quienes compren el producto, también recibirán una serie de videos con demostraciones de cómo usar U Modules. 

Risks and challenges

You might be thinking What about fire? Our plan is to sell our U Modules painted with a coat of anti-fire painting. 
Some people may misunderstand how to use the U Modules, that's why those who buy the product will also have a series of videos with demonstration of how to use the U Modules.

Riesgos y retos

Debés estar pensando en el fuego verdad? Nuestro plan es vender nuestros U Modules cubiertos con pinturas anti-fuego.
Otro de los riesgos podría ser que quienes utilicen el U Module no entiendan como hacerlo, por eso quienes compren el producto también recibirán una serie de videos para entender como manipular los U Modules. 

Would you like to help us but don't have money?

Don't worry, you can still help us in a lot of ways:
- Share our campaign with your friends by email, Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media, or even just on the phone. Remember to use Indiegogo's sharing tools. 
- You can also leave a comment in the comments section and tell us what you think about the product and the project. 
-You may suggest ways to share our campaing or may be interested in different structures we are developing.
- Would you like to become a seller of the U Module?   
Just contact us and THANK YOU!

Querés ayudarnos pero no tenés dinero?

No te procupes, podés ayudearnos en muchas maneras:
- Compartí nuestra campaaña con tus amigos por mail, Facebook, Twitter, o cualquier otra red socual, incluso por teléfono. Recordá las herramientas para compartir que tiene Indiegogo. 
- También podés dejarnos un comentario en la sección de comentarios y contarnos lo que pensas del producto y del proyecto. 
- Quizás puedas hacernos alguna sugerencia de como compartir nuestra campaña, o estás interesado en otras estructuras que estamos desarrollando, o
- Te gustaría entrar en el negocio y convertirte en un vendedor de U Modules?
Simplemente contactate con nosotros, Y GRACIAS!
story_txt:
What we've done before the U Module
We are a family of Uruguayan builders with 25 years of experience. We have worked with concrete, steel, adobes, canes and wood to build houses. As the years passed by, we gained awareness of pollution coming from concrete and steel production. Therefore, our constructions became more ecologic by building more with earth and wood. In the latest 15 years we have mainly built American wood framing houses.  
Lo que hemos hecho antes del U Module
Somos una familia de constructores uruguayos con más de 25 años de experiencia. Hemos trabajado con hormigón, acero, adobes, cañas y madera para construir casas. Con el pasar de los años, nos hemos concientizado con respecto a la contaminación causada por la producción del acero y el hormigón. Entonces decidimos construir con sistemas ecológicos, usando más la tierra y la madera. En los últimos 15 años hemos construido principalmente casas Americanas con el sistema wood framing.
Siempre buscando maneras de construir de manera más rápida y eficiente, muchas veces nos preguntamos cómo ofrecerle a la gente un sistema que los ayudara a construir por si mismos, y ahora pensamos que lo encontramos: el U Module
Because we have always looked for ways to build faster, we wondered how to offer people a building system that would help them build by themselves. 
And now we think we have found it: 
U Module 
This U shaped plywood wooden module that can be put together in different ways is a solution to many of today´s everyday challenges. U Module can be used for wall and roof building for houses, sheds, or warehouses, and it can also be applied to a wide variety of household creations: beds, shelves, tables, seats, sofas, lavatories, slides, cabinets, closets, trunks, containers, sleighs, troughs, or anything you and your imagination can create with it. 
Éste módulo de multiplaca con forma de U que se puede ensamblar en maneras diferentes es una solución para muchos de los retos actuales. El U Module puede ser utilizado para la construcción de paredes y techos para casas, graneros o galpones y también puede aplicarse a una amplia gama de creaciones domésticas: camas, mesas, asientos, sofás, mesadas, toboganes, armarios, contenedores, trineos, baúles, estanterías, bateas, o cualquier cosa que vos y tu imaginación puedan crear. 
The system we have invented is very important to us because it saves material, time and energy when building and it helps mitigate Climate Cange. A wood framing structure is not necessary to build a one story house. It is directly built with the U Modules.
El sistema que inventamos es muy importante para nosotros porque nos permite ahorrar material, tiempo y energía al construir, y contribuye a la mitigación del cambio climático. No se necesita una estructura de marcos de madera para construir una casa de un piso cuando uno emplea el U Module. 
Here´s an explanation of how to raise walls: there are 2 ways of placing the U Module. 
Aqui podés ver una explicación de como levantar las paredes: hay 2 maneras de ubicar los U Modules. 
One is aligning them with their backs facing the outside. Each  U Module is fixed to the foundation with different options.
Una es alineándolos con las espaldas enfrentando el exterior. Cada U Module se ancla al cimiento con diferentes opciones. 


The other option is the zig-zag position, which makes the wall thicker and gives it a more attractive look. 
La otra es en disposición zig-zag, lo que hace que le da espesor a la pared, y una vista más atractiva. 

. If you want to maintain the original design in the U Module, all you have to do is to protect the wood with exterior paints for wood. 
Si querés mantener el diseño original del U Module todo lo que tenés que hacer es protegerlo con pintura protectora de madera para  madera.  


This image shows the construction covered by siding (you may cover it with whatever material you wish). Roofs can be perfectly covered with asphalt shingles. 

Ésta imagen muestra la construcción cubierta con siding (podés cubrirla con cualquier material que desees. Los techos pueden ser perfectamente cubiertos con tejas asfálticas. 

Build a roof with the U Module

Using the U Mole you can also build roofs. The roof shlould be protected against rain or any soure of water. 
Construir un techo con U Module
U Module puede ser usado para construir techos.El techo debe ser protegido de la lluvia posteriormente. 



Some suggestions for furniture:
Algunas sugerencias para muebles:

You can create anything you imagine with the U Module, some liquid nail and screws.  
Podés crear cualquier cosa que te imagines con U Module, clavo líquido y tornillos. 


Why to use the U Module
The system  saves material, time and energy when building. A wood framing structure is not necessary to build a one story house. It is directly built with the U Modules.

Using the U Modules is easy. Anyone can design, cut and assemble with them. You don't need special tools for it, just your normal saw, screws or even liquid nail. 
Your creations will be costum-made: you will choose what to do with it. Besides, you will make the U Modules fit your needs. The product is versatile, it is easily adjustable to any size. 

Painting the U Modules is as easy as painting your room's walls. Pick a color and get your brush ready! In addition, you may apply cover suitable for wood.
Wood is a strong material but it's also light, allowing any person to manipulate it. 
We want everybody know about this system because of these advantages which help mitigate the Climate Change. 


Porqué usar el U Module

Éste sistema ahorra material, el tempo y energía en el momento de construir. No se necesita una estructura para construir una casa de un piso. Se construye directamente con U Module. 
Usar el U Module es fácil. Cualquiera puede diseñar él, cortarlo y ensamblarlo. No precisás herramientas especiales, simplemente la sierra que usas generalmente, tornillos o hasta clavo líquido. 
Tus creaciones serán hechas a tu medida: vos elegís que hacer con él. Además, podés hacer que el U Module se ajuste a tus necesidades. El producto es versátil, puede concordar con cualquier medida que precises.
Pintar los U Modules es tan fácil como pintar las paredes de tu casa. Elegí un color y sacale el polvo al pincel. 
La madera es un material fuerte pero a la misma vez liviano, lo que permite que cualquier pueda manupilar los U Modules. 

Queremos que todo el mundo sepa acerca de éste sistema por todas sus ventajas, y porque nos ayuda a mitigar el Cambio Climático. 
What your contribution will do 
This project is in its first stages. We need your help to expand our workshop, do more advertising, search for new markets and look for representatives in other countries. If you become a contributor and then would like to enter the business (selling the U Module), you are more than welcome to the team.
In our initial stage we want to expand our workshop and that's why we need $50,000 for tools ($20,000) and infrastructure ($30,000).  Lo que hará tu contribución
Este proyecto está en sus etapas iniciales. Necesitamos tu ayuda para expandir nuestro taller, hacer publicidad, buscar nuevos mercados y buscar representantes en otros países. Si te convertís en un contribuidor y te interesa entrar en el negocio (vendiendo U Modules), serás más que bienvenido/a al equipo. 
En ésta etapa precisamos $ 50.000 para expandir nuestro tayer: $ 20.000 para herramientas y $ 30.000 para infraestructura.    What you can get 
If you contribute with $5: A Thank you email: No contribution is too small for us.  We'll be more than glad to thank you personally for your support. :)

If you contribute with $50 or more you will receive a complete construction course with all the details you need to know about building your own home, from the foundation to the roof.

If you contribute with $1000 you become a sales representative for the U Module.
Lo que podés obtener
Si contribuís con $5: Un email de agradecimiento: no hay contribución muy pequeña para nosotros. Estaremos más que dispuestos a enviarte un email personal de agradecimiento. :)
Si contribuís con % 50 o más, recibirás un curso de construcción con todos los detalles que precisas saber acerca de coo construir tu propia casa, desde el cimiento al techo. 
Si contribuís con $ 1000 te convertís en un representante de venta de U Module.
Your impact
Most people use cement, bricks and steel to build their homes. We want to offer a natural material to the world which methodology allows not only builders but anyone capable of using tools to build.  
By contributing to develop the U Module, you are helping mitigate climate change because U Module is a wood based material. Wood absorves CO2 for photosyntesis, and then emits Oxygen which we breath. On the other hand, concrete and steel don´t produce Oxygen; they produce CO2 in their initial manufacturing and every single time they are recycled.  Manufacturing wooden products implies a much lower impact.
In order to produce  1 tone of Portland Cement, 1 tone of CO2 is emitted. 
In order to produce  1 tone of steel,  1.8 tones of CO2 are emitted. 
In order to produce  1 tone aluminium,  2.6 tones of CO2 are emitted. 

In order to produce 1 tone of sawn wood, 0.2 tone of CO2 is emitted. 
Click on the next link to find out more about the advantages of wood. 

http://forestry.about.com/od/treephysiology/tp/tree_value.htm


U Modules can be easily applied in case of emergencies such as the recovery from wars or natural disasters because building can be done in record times.  Besides, the Modules are a light, which allow anyone build including women and children. At the same time, they can also build their own furniture like beds and tables. 

By contributing, you are helping people create, which enhances mental health of children, teenagers and adults. As we have explained perviously, with U Module you can create any furniture for your home. We commit to creating a manual to suggest ideas on how to build some of these furnitures. 
Those who buy the product will also have a series of videos with demonstration of how to use the U Modules.
Tu impacto

La mayoría de la gente usa cemento, acero y cemento para construir su casa. Queremos ofrecerle al mundo un material natural cuya metodología permita que no solamente los constructores puedan construir, sino cualquier persona capáz.
Contribuyendo a desarrollar el U Module estás ayudando a mitigar el Cambio Climático porque el U Module es un material a base de madera. La madera asborve CO2  para la fotosíntesis, y luego exhala el Oxígeno que los seres humanos respiramos. Por otra parte, el hormigón y el acero no producen Oxígeno, producen CO2 en su producción inicial, y cada vez que son reciclados. La fabriación de productos de madera tiene un impacto mucho menor. 
Para producir 1 tonelada de Portland, se emite 1 tonelada de CO2. 
Para producir 1 tonelada de acero, se emiten 1,8 toneladas de CO2.
Para producir 1 tonelada de aluminio, se emiten 2,6 toneladas de CO2.
Para producir 1 tonelada de madera aserrada, se emite 0,2 tonelada de CO2.
U Modules se pueden aplicar fácilmente en caso de emergencia tales como en situaciones de guerra o desastres naturales porque la construcción se puede llevar a cabo en tiempo récord. Además, los U Modules son livianoes, lo que permiten que cualquiera construya, incluyendo mujeres y niños. Al mismo tiempo, también los pueden usar para construir sus propios muebles como camas y mesas. 
Al contribuir, ayudarás a crear, lo que beneficia la salud mental de niños, adolescentes y adultos.  

Como hemos explicado antes, con el U Module podés crear mueblería para tu hogar. Nos comprometemos a crear un manual con ideas y sugerencias para tus muebles. 
Quienes compren el producto, también recibirán una serie de videos con demostraciones de cómo usar U Modules. 
Risks and challenges
You might be thinking What about fire? Our plan is to sell our U Modules painted with a coat of anti-fire painting. 
Some people may misunderstand how to use the U Modules, that's why those who buy the product will also have a series of videos with demonstration of how to use the U Modules.

Riesgos y retos
Debés estar pensando en el fuego verdad? Nuestro plan es vender nuestros U Modules cubiertos con pinturas anti-fuego.
Otro de los riesgos podría ser que quienes utilicen el U Module no entiendan como hacerlo, por eso quienes compren el producto también recibirán una serie de videos para entender como manipular los U Modules. 

Would you like to help us but don't have money?Don't worry, you can still help us in a lot of ways:- Share our campaign with your friends by email, Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media, or even just on the phone. Remember to use Indiegogo's sharing tools. - You can also leave a comment in the comments section and tell us what you think about the product and the project. -You may suggest ways to share our campaing or may be interested in different structures we are developing.
- Would you like to become a seller of the U Module?   
Just contact us and THANK YOU!Querés ayudarnos pero no tenés dinero?No te procupes, podés ayudearnos en muchas maneras:- Compartí nuestra campaaña con tus amigos por mail, Facebook, Twitter, o cualquier otra red socual, incluso por teléfono. Recordá las herramientas para compartir que tiene Indiegogo. - También podés dejarnos un comentario en la sección de comentarios y contarnos lo que pensas del producto y del proyecto. - Quizás puedas hacernos alguna sugerencia de como compartir nuestra campaña, o estás interesado en otras estructuras que estamos desarrollando, o- Te gustaría entrar en el negocio y convertirte en un vendedor de U Modules?Simplemente contactate con nosotros, Y GRACIAS!

story:
Who?

 

Jared M. and Tavish M. are the faces behind EcoSlick™. Currently both Jared and Tavish attend college and work full time in efforts towards getting EcoSlick™ to the public. We are working hard towards the fight of keeping earth clean, building a local company, and sharing our great product. We believe it will provide jobs in our community and inspire consumers to buy products that will NOT contaminate the environment. In addition, an awareness to the continued necessity for a cleaner future, by using ecologic-friendly products. We would like to get EcoSlick™ out to anyone who wants to make a change. 

Donations

The amount needed is $4,000.00 for EcoSlick™! The funding we receive would be going into purchasing product for our first production run to the public. We have used and tested the product but now our next step is getting it to you! Along with the production run funding would go towards marketing campaigns to reach more people. Any amounts received all go towards the same goal. If you donate to our project of course we return the favor! We have different brackets set up for different rewards you can get through EcoSlick™. We would love to share our product with you!

                            What is EcoSlick™?

 

  • Binding Capabilities - Seeps into pores of metal to bind with it and create a dry coat of lubrication to protect, condition, and keep damaging particles out.
  • Blue Technology - Our smart "blue technology" is greener than green. It's our little piece of magic which makes this product work so beautifully by combining the eco-friendly efforts while maintaining a strong solvent which isn't harmful.
  • Citrus Based - We know the struggle of finding a healthy cleaner which still gets the job done, this is why we have made EcoSlick™ citrus based. It keeps our Earth healthy while having the strength to go above and beyond.
  • Eco-Friendly - EcoSlick™ is a clean and eco-friendly cleaner because we know what harm we as humans have done to our environment, why not take steps to change that?
  • Multi-Purpose - We want to save you some money so instead of buying five different cleaners to get one job done we've made EcoSlick™ versatile to get everything done with the use of one effective cleaner and lubricator.
  • Petroleum Free - One of the best things about our lubricant is that its petroleum free. We try our best to reduce the consumption of oil. We are taking steps to come completely off of it giving our Earth a chance to recover. 

 

EcoSlick™ is a universal cleaner for your household, auto, mechanical, and industrial needs.

EcoSlick™ works best to keep metallic parts clean, moving, and protected against dirt, grime, rust, or other nasty particles and EcoSlick™ goes beyond that. EcoSlick™ has been known to clean sharpie off walls, sticky residue off surfaces, oven grease, and even squeaky door hinges! The best part is you can have ease of mind knowing EcoSlick™ is eco-friendly, biodegradable, and petroleum free.


EcoSlick™ is made from a citrus based technology with a finishing touch of a dry-coat lubricant.

What is that? Dry-coat lubrication is a revolutionary technology which leaves a protective coating around the surfaces you clean, binding best with metals. This technology causes for a safe protection from outside elements by seeping into the pores of your newly cleaned surface and blocking nasty stuff out. Not only that, the more you use EcoSlick™ the less you have to use (on metallic surfaces) due to the dry-coat lubrication and it's beautiful technology to consistently protecting against the outside world. Who doesn't want to save some money?

     

     

    Why?

    Most homes harvest harmful cleaning chemicals which not only effect you negatively but also your children and pets. 

    (see below fig. 1)

    (image credit http://www.petconnection.ca/)

     

     

    Not only that, if you use water distribution products most contain petroleum which we all know with the BP Oil Spill, and many other spills, is never beneficial for our Earth. 

    (see below fig. 2)

     

    The Impact

     

    Almost all household and other cleaning products contain harmful chemicals such as 2-Butoxyethanol, ammonia, chlorine, and more which can cause bodily harm so severe you must immediately contact poison control centers if you come into contact. According to those poison control centers in 2014 there was “1 poison exposure reported to U.S. poison control centers every 15 seconds.” 

    (fig. 1)

     

    • This is why we made EcoSlick™ safe, biodegradable, eco-friendly, and even citrus based! You don’t have to worry if you come into contact with it because it won’t damage your skin or harm your lungs if you breathe around it!

     

    According to research done by International Tanker Owners Pollution Federation (ITOPF) it is estimated that between the years 1970 and 2012 there have been approximately 5.75 million tonnes of oil spilled due to tanker incidents.

    (fig. 2)

     

     

     

    • If we wean ourselves off of petroleum based products then we may begin to recover and not cause damage to our environment and Earth, the only one we have. That is why EcoSlick™ has created a petroleum free cleaner, a step towards a brighter future. 

     

      Risks & Challenges

      The challenges we face is not receiving enough funding to create a large enough production run to get the product to the general public. If this problem does occur then we will still begin our launch but in a much smaller size which may cause us to create pre-orders.

         

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Some people just can't contribute and that is okay! Anything helps, other ways you can help us out is by...

        • Telling your friends about us
        • Like us on Facebook
        • Follow us on Twitter
        • Share our posts
        • Use the Indiegogo share tools
        • Let us know how to improve our efforts

        Find us on Facebook by searching for the "EcoSlick" page or clicking our link below

        Follow us on Twitter at @ecoslick or find our link below

        Visit our website at www.ecoslick.net

        Thanks for stopping by!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute and that is okay! Anything helps, other ways you can help us out is by...

Telling your friends about us
Like us on Facebook

Follow us on Twitter

Share our posts
Use the Indiegogo share tools
Let us know how to improve our efforts

Find us on Facebook by searching for the "EcoSlick" page or clicking our link belowFollow us on Twitter at @ecoslick or find our link belowVisit our website at www.ecoslick.netThanks for stopping by!

story:
EcosPure is offering Sustainable, Gardening and Agriculture products that conserve water, accelerate plant growth and clean up the environment. Together we can change the world, one planter, garden and farm at a time.

EcosPure has developed a new approach to growing plants with stunning results. We have developed  Pot, Planter and Garden Smart liners that absorb water like a sponge when you water your plants. This Smart material liner holds onto the Nitrogen, Phosphorous and Potassium (plant nutrients) and water in the plant root zone. The liner then slowly releases the plant nutrients and the water back to the plant, conserving water and enabling your plants to grow faster.


How does it work?

GrowSmart Oasis™ 

Is not a fertilizer, but a plant nutrient magnet that traps the plant nutrients at the root zone of the plant, for the plant to use, and stops the nutrients from being washed away when you water. 

Laboratory testing of plant growth over 14 days, under 24 hour grow lights, demonstrated an average increase of up to 15% in plant growth height and an average increase of over 25% in the number of leaves or branches over control plants using the same amount of fertilizer when the plant roots were in contact with the GrowSmart Oasis material.


Using GrowSmart Oasis in your planters, gardens and landscape reduces the amount of seasonal irrigation water needed by up to 25% or more while dramatically reducing Nitrates, Phosphorus and Potassium nutrient percolation into ground water systems which can end up polluting your drinking water.

GrowSmart Oasis™  for home indoor and outdoor planter and garden use is made of bio-friendly materials.  

Pot, planter and garden liners are available in several sizes and shapes that fit #1  pots up to #10 pots, for size reference go to ANSI horiculture standards. Flat discs and squares are available for larger pots and planters up to 36 inches in diameter or square. 

Just place plants on top of the GrowSmart Oasis material fill in with your favorite potting soils or garden earth, fertilize and water as needed and let your plants do the rest.

Larger rolls of material are available in Growers Rolls in 1", 2", 3" and 4" widths. While wider Garden Rolls are available in 12", 24", 36". and 48" widths in 10 ft., 50 ft. and 100 ft. lengths. 

EcosPure GrowSmart Oasis products are made in the US with our new bio-friendly smart materials that store the water and fertilizer nutrients for your plants and keeps them available for later use by the plants, just like an oasis. 

The liners allow water to pass through but keep the nutrients from leaching out the bottom of your pot, planter or garden improving the amount of nutrients available to your plants each time you water. 

Using GrowSmart Oasis material will help produce the most beautiful plants you have ever grown.

Water Your Lawn Once a Week!

New Hydra Mat™

California Drought can be fixed! convert to Hydra Mat water storing material for developped for lawns and greens.


How does it help the Ecosystem ?

One of the largest problems facing global agriculture food production today is the pollution from Nitrate and Phosphorus rich, excess water runoff.   The use of soil surface applied fertilizers and effluent from livestock areas are major contributors to this problem when rain and irrigation water turn into agriculture runoff. 

The Nitrate and Phosphorus rich water runoff pollutes groundwater supplies of drinking water, as well as streams, rivers, lakes, and ocean environments where it causes eutrophication. Eutrophication has become a  global environmental problem that we can solve. 


What is Eutrophication?   

Eutrophication is excessive richness of nutrients, ie Nitrogen and Phosphorus, in an ocean, lake or other body of water, most frequently caused by runoff from agricultural land, which causes a dense growth of plant life and then death of animal life from lack of oxygen in the water environment.


The dense growth of plant life often results in algae blooms. Algae blooms can be toxic and so large that they can be viewed from space, as seen in the Great Lakes image below, lighter green areas in the water are algae blooms (NASA Image).


EcosPure NPK Mat™  (below) for agriculture runoff. The NPK Mat stops the dissolved Nitrogen, Phosphorous and Potassium before it can enter the watershed and cause the harmful algae blooms. 

EcosPure products have bio-compatible smart materials that tackle the agriculture runoff pollution head on by attracting target pollutants that are in the runoff water and holding on to them so they do not enter the watershed ecosystem.

EcosPure NPK Mat is available in three different thicknesses all made of natural materials.

In Agriculture areas the EcosPure NPK Mat is installed in a farm runoff area or in catch basins areas.


Once in contact with runoff water the NPK Mat strips the Nitrogen, Phosphorous and Potassium molecules out of the runoff water that comes into contact with it, dramatically reducing the harmful components of the agriculture runoff that can enter the watershed. 


Here’s the Science behind How It Works  

The EcosPure materials absorb up to 10 times their weight in water and then slowly release it back to the soil and plant. The molecules we put into the smart materials that coat the natural mats and fabric attract the target pollutant molecules and separate them from the water.  

Laboratory testing demonstrated that one square foot of GrowSmart Oasis material removes concentrations of 10-10-10 fertilizer mix as high as 1000ppm per gallon of water, of the following common fertilizer components- Ammonia 99.9% removed, Nitrate 96% removed, Phosphorous 60% removed and Potassium 40% removed per square foot of material. Material will last several planting seasons and is  disease  and fungal growth resistant.

Plant roots in contact with the GrowSmart Oasis material are able to use and absorb the plant nutrients that are captured by the material. While the GrowSmart Oasis material is filling up to capacity with the target molecules, the target molecules are at the same time being used by the plant and depleted. This makes room for attracting more target nutrient molecules each time you water. 


What We Need & What You Get

The technical work is done, the data is in, we now need your help!  

This Indiegogo campaign is to help us raise $25,000 dollars needed to purchase, install and start manufacturing on our pilot production line with which we will be able to scale up production of the ecosystem saving EcosPure materials.

The Manufacturing line will be able to produce large rolls of Grow Smart Oasis material as well as rolls of the NPK Mat material in volumes that make it affordable and cost effective to produce.  The pilot production line will produce large 1000 ft rolls of the material in several widths. We currently make material  by hand in short lengths 3 feet wide by 4-8 feet long for testing purposes.  

The production line consists of a roll feed mechanism, spray bars, rollers to shed excess material, drying fans with heaters and a rolling area to roll the material into a new roll as well as a measurement cut off area for cutting rolls to specific lengths. 

We also need to make molds to increase production of the formed shapes for growers and gardening Pots and Planters. 

Although the material is high tech, the manufacturing process is not and once all the kinks are worked out production can be scaled up from this initial production line exponentially.

Together we really can change the world by saving water and reducing Phosphorous and Nitrate pollution in drinking water and watershed areas, of both fresh water and saltwater regions around the world.


Perks

EcosPure is offering several perks from original artwork T-shirts to products for your home, garden and agriculture needs. If you happen to be a commercial farmer or agriculture professional we are offering the NPK Mat in lengths up to 100 ft. 


EcosPure  T-Shirts (children)

T-Shirts are available in white, yellow, blue, green, purple, pink and dark grey

EcosPure  T-Shirts (adult)

T-Shirts are available in white, yellow, blue, green, purple, pink and dark grey


GrowSmart Oasis™ granules- limited availability 

a)  Available for purchase with or without nutrients; the granules will pick up excess fertilizer when you feed the plant, or purchase it fully loaded with nutrients ready for the plant to use. We will need to register this material in individual states as a soil supplement material so this material may have limited availability until it is registered in your state.

GrowSmart Oasis™ Pot and Planter molded shapes

a)  Available for purchase as molded pottery and planter liners the fabric will pick up water and excess fertilizer when you feed the plant, and release both slowly over time for the plant to use. 

Specify pot size 1 through 10

Specify planter size round, square or rectangle

18 inches, 24 inches, 36 inches

Rolls of EcosPure GrowSmart Oasis material

Specify Roll width and length, 

Growers Rolls available for planting 6 packs through 4inch pots.  Rolls are available in 1, 2, 3 & 4 inch widths and 10 ft, 25 ft, 50 ft or 100 ft lengths.


Garden Rolls for larger areas are available in 1 ft, 2 ft, 3 ft (shown above), 4 ft widths, which are available in 10 ft, 25 ft, 50 ft and 100 ft lengths.


EcosPure GrowSmart Oasis™ CoCo fiber



EcosPure NPK Mat™ biodegradable matting for Agriculture runoff

Nitrate, Phosphorus and Potassium scavenging material 


Available for purchase in three bio friendly substrates as 36 inch width rolls in 50 ft or 100 ft lengths of reusable biodegradable mat for commercial growers and agriculture for use in runoff areas and catch basins.

Specify Thin (Burlap), Medium (Coconut Fiber) or Thick (Birch strips) in 50 ft or 100 ft lengths.


Team

Mark Banister - I have a long agriculture background starting with 4-H as a youth, then as an Award winning Landscape design, installation and maintenance contractor for 12 years. As an Entrepreneur with over thirty five years experience in business this I am very excited to be able to combine my agriculture and chemistry backgrounds to bring this product to life. Using my know how in Product Research and Development, Manufacturing, Polymer Chemistry, and Smart Materials I have developed this product to make a difference.  
Over the last 11 years I have been developing and inventing smart materials and work experience as award winning Principal Investigator on several National Science Foundation and Dept of Defense SBIR STTR Grants for smart polymer materials and product development. I Currently hold 11 issued Patents and 35 pending Patents and I am an author and  co author on several published research papers and a book chapter on polymer actuators and smart polymers.
Steve Banister- Has over 20 years experience in landscape irrigation installation and maintenance as well as Landscape and plant maintenance, with deep understanding of water conservation and plant issues in the Southwest. 

Risks & Challenges

The technical risk is done, if we are not successful at raising our total goal we will still be manufacturing the EcosPure NPK Mat™ and GrowSmart Oasis™ products, just not as fast.  You will still get your product this spring but we wont be saving the watershed ecosystem areas as fast as we would like. 

Some states require registering the materials, unfortunately there are no uniform standard requirements that all states use in this process. We are currently applying to each individual state and working through this as fast as possible but some states will take longer than others. We will keep you updated if there are any delays in this process.


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out & Earn an EcosPure Perk.

If you cant afford to support us by purchasing one of our perks, you can still contribute and earn a Perk.

We need help in getting the word out to everyone that can use these ecosystem saving materials. Refer us to, or let us know of any gardeners or farmers you may know by sharing this link with them and earn your way to a perk.
story_txt:
EcosPure is offering Sustainable, Gardening and Agriculture products that conserve water, accelerate plant growth and clean up the environment. Together we can change the world, one planter, garden and farm at a time.
EcosPure has developed a new approach to growing plants with stunning results. We have developed  Pot, Planter and Garden Smart liners that absorb water like a sponge when you water your plants. This Smart material liner holds onto the Nitrogen, Phosphorous and Potassium (plant nutrients) and water in the plant root zone. The liner then slowly releases the plant nutrients and the water back to the plant, conserving water and enabling your plants to grow faster.




How does it work?





GrowSmart Oasis™ 
Is not
a fertilizer, but a plant nutrient magnet that traps the plant nutrients at the
root zone of the plant, for the plant to use, and stops the nutrients from being
washed away when you water. 



Laboratory testing of
plant growth over 14 days, under 24 hour grow lights, demonstrated an average
increase of up to 15% in plant growth height and an average increase of
over 25% in the number of leaves or branches over control plants using the same
amount of fertilizer when the plant roots were in contact with the GrowSmart
Oasis material.






Using GrowSmart Oasis in your planters, gardens and landscape reduces the amount of seasonal irrigation water needed by up to 25% or more while dramatically reducing Nitrates, Phosphorus and Potassium nutrient percolation into ground water systems which can end up polluting your drinking water.

GrowSmart Oasis™  for home indoor and outdoor planter and garden use is made of bio-friendly materials.  



Pot, planter and garden liners are available in several sizes and shapes that fit #1  pots up to #10 pots, for size reference go to ANSI horiculture standards. Flat discs and squares are available for larger pots and planters up to 36 inches in diameter or square. 



Just place plants on top of the GrowSmart Oasis material fill in with your favorite potting soils or garden earth, fertilize and water as needed and let your plants do the rest.
Larger rolls of material are available in Growers Rolls in
1", 2", 3" and 4" widths. While wider Garden Rolls are
available in 12", 24", 36". and 48" widths in 10 ft., 50 ft. and 100 ft. lengths. 

EcosPure GrowSmart Oasis products are made in the US with our new bio-friendly smart materials
that store the water and fertilizer nutrients for your
plants and keeps them available for later use by the plants, just like an
oasis. 


The liners allow water to pass through but keep the nutrients from
leaching out the bottom of your pot, planter or garden improving the amount of
nutrients available to your plants each time you water. 

Using
GrowSmart Oasis material will help produce the most beautiful plants you have
ever grown.

story:
We are Driven! Inspired by the power of the sun, we are a group of engineers from the University of Johannesburg, committed to exploring alternative energy sources.  Now we want to share that fervour and motivate all of Africa to join us!


Our solar car, iLanga 2 (meaning "THE SUN" in Zulu), attracted attention across South Africa as we competed against international teams in a gruelling race in 2014. Wherever we traveled, people were amazed at how solar energy could be a sustainable solution to overcome some of the most basic obstacles they face in their daily lives. And this gave us an idea to spread the word:

We want to be the first African solar vehicle to take part in the World Solar Challenge, which takes place in the vast Australian Outback in September this year. Since we need to prepare in order to even stand a chance, we chose one of the most hostile territories on our continent as the ultimate testing ground: The Namib Desert of South West Africa. But we need your help in our efforts to share knowledge with Africa...

Our aim is not only to test the car and the team, but we're also pretty big on youth and entrepreneurial development.  We want to promote science, technology, engineering and math in Africa. 

This little vehicle has the ability to carry a new way of looking at energy and the environment to communities that may never before have seen this technology in action.  As iLanga 2 visits Namibian towns, we will leave behind sustainable solar installations that will literally light up people's lives - a lightbulb to do homework under at night...  A pump that keeps clean water flowing...  A fridge in a desert town, to keep healthy food fresh... 

And of course Namibia is also one of the most beautiful places in the world: Ghost towns half-swallowed by sand, spectacular sunsets, the highest dunes on earth...

The best way for us to show the world what solar energy can do for Africa is by documenting our Namibian test race in a stunning documentary, a 13 part series and a coffee table book of incredible photographs.


What We Need & What You'll Get

To make this possible, we need $80 000 and since we're all students, we don't quite have the money to make this all happen.  Every cent raised will go towards travel expenses, any modifications the car might need and camera equipment to produce a classy documentary of this once-in-a-lifetime event. We're also giving one talented local student-photographer an opportunity to photograph the entire experience.

You can help us make this happen.


Perks!

Our top 3 contributors will fly out to experience this life-changing journey with us - young African children getting electricity in their homes for the first time ever, the sheer beauty of the land and of course the dramas of racing a solar car in the harshest conditions on earth.

Other contributors can have your name placed on a plaque to be left in Africa or even receive a personalised 'Thank You' video from us on location in Namibia! 

You can also get a copy of the full feature length documentary of us following our solar car through Namibia.

Of course we'll have hoodies. Everyone loves hoodies! And more stuff...

Don't miss the opportunity to get the beautiful coffee table book which will feature fabulous photography of the breathtaking desert landscape, the towns we go to, and the solar car driving on dusty Namibian roads.


The Impact

As it stands, the development of Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths in Africa is poor.  This trip has the power to reach people and to promote all of these fields.

Through our participation in solar racing we have developed a platform through which we engage with communities and energy innovation industries. The program was designed to function as an educational tool to train and develop graduates with real-world experiences associated with managing projects.

By documenting what happens, the potential reach is staggering.


Risks & Challenges

As you can see, taking the car through Namibia will be daunting as the weather is harsh and the roads can be unforgiving. The sand is a concern as it could damage the solar cells.

However, we have competed in 3 solar events including the 2014 SASOL Solar Challenge where we placed 5th with iLanga 2 against some of the top international teams.  


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody can contribute financially. But you sure can share our adventure across your network.

We will keep you posted on our social media platforms:

Facebook: www.facebook.com/UJSolarCar

Twiter: www.twitter.com/ujsolarcar

YouTube: www.youtube.com/UJSolarCar

story:
Living Soil Is Important


If there is a church, park or school you would like to benefit from this project, please let us know by email, Facebook, USPS or however!


Soil is NOT a kitchen sponge!  Soil is the living, breathing, bio-diverse skin of the Earth; or at least it is supposed to be.  As the results of our soil testing piled up, we found that only a small portion of land has been well-tended by gardeners who realize the importance of soil.  The vast majority of this land is grass, and our testing has shown that soil under grass, especially lawns, is deficient in LIFE.  Several textbooks, universities, soil scientists and most extension offices agree that 5% organic matter (life) is the optimum level to have in the soil.  Typically soil under grass will have between 1-2% organic matter and often times less.  It is our goal, with this campaign to change this by raising soil organic matter on land owned and operated by non-profit organizations.  

Parks, schools, churches and non-profit organizations simply cannot address the issues of poor soil due to the lack of funding and the lack of knowledge.  Thousands of acres, in each state, across the United States are under baseball fields, soccer fields, open spaces and lawns and each acre can be used to combat climate change.

The term climate change is used so often and it may be difficult to hear from yet another project.  Soil is the largest carbon storage system on Earth.  Soil is so effective at storing carbon we have been able to power our lives with its coal for over 100 years.  More carbon is stored in soil than anywhere else, which is one reason large companies are looking at something called carbon sequestration.  One form of sequestration requires carbon dioxide be captured as it is released at factories or power plants and it is piped into (you guessed it) the ground.  This system doesn't work for houses and things that move like cars and airplanes. The other way we can sequester carbon in the soil is to use plants and microorganisms. Plants use carbon in the air to grow roots, and through those roots they deposit sugar (also made from carbon) into the soil. After every rain, as water soaks into the ground, it is replaced by air containing more carbon dioxide. This is the action that breathes life into microorganisms (also made of carbon), if they are there. Increasing the life in the soil means increasing carbon sequestration and reducing the carbon in the atmosphere.

Alone, we cannot condition the soil, provide the microorganisms currently missing from the soil, and supply the food to support this life. To make this happen, we need everyone's help. Our business is growing quickly, but not quickly enough to be able to provide this for free for the places that need it the most.  Our modern lives today, all release carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. Please help us pull that carbon back out of the air and put it into the ground.

DEEZ BUTTS

Even today, manure is a great form of soil organic matter and food for microbes. These t-shirts are trying to bring awareness to the lack of organic matter in the soil and how easily it can be replenished.  From left to right, worm castings, or worm poop, is an excellent source of nutrition for plants, microbes and organic matter. Chicken manure is a staple for feeding grass as it is a slow-release plant food that is abundant and inexpensive.  Rabbit manure is also a great supplement as it is high in nitrogen and organic matter.  Cow manure is cow manure, few have not heard or smelled its benefits.

The Expected Results


Each funding level shows how much ground is being improved with that investment.

Q: What is the goal to this project?

A: To increase the amount of organic matter in the top six inches of soil on properties controlled by non-profit organizations.  Improvements will be demonstrated with soil tests.

Q: Will this change the current way these organizations work with their ground?

A: It will be advisable to follow fertilizing instructions provided with the soil test and to limit herbicide and pesticide use, otherwise the land can be used as before. All products supplied will be natural or organic.

Q: What happens if you get more than your requested amount?

A: We will expand, hire more people and possibly continue the project into Fall 2016. Our suppliers are capable of producing the biology and products to support much more than we hope to raise during this campaign. Tens of thousands of acres can be improved with the products available to us. 

Millions of active biologicals turn into billions within a few short weeks when properly taken care of.  A small input now reaps huge rewards in a short time.

If you do own a car, but do not own a yard, we have t-shirts and hats and stuff to show your support of the environment.  If you have soil that could use improvement there are several perks that allow you to improve your soil and soil that couldn't be helped without you.  If you own a business or have a very generous heart, the top supporters will be awarded a high quality plaque showing exactly how much land you have improved.

Q: If you don't reach your goal, what happens then?

A: We will do the maximum we can with what we are funded.

****The whole is greater than its parts****  Volume discounts are a big deal in the natural soil amendment industry.  More funding means discounts on products and more area improved per dollar.  Please don't keep this to yourself, let others know and lets get a larger area of soil pulling carbon out of the atmosphere.


The Process

                                       

The first step of this process is to make soil a happy home for living things.  We
want healthy bacteria and fungus in the soil and healthy roots in the soil, these living things work together to improve soil fertility, water holding, carbon capture and improve the quality of the plants on top of the soil.  We use a product which is an anionic fluid made of all natural products (palm oil extracts, molasses extracts, lemon extracts and others)  which helps small soil particles from sticking to each other too closely and allow air and water to percolate through the soil.

The second step is to add the actual life into the soil.  This ranges from chemolithotrophic bacteria (doesn't need light but does need CO2) and photolithotrophic bacteria (does need light and CO2) and various forms of mycorrhiza fungus (umm.... wikipedia that one).

Step three will be to add the food for all this bacterial that has just been added to the soil.  Depending on the soil type, this could be a compost product or a liquid carbohydrate.  Compost teas are also effective at feeding soil bacteria.  

These three processes are the most effective and inexpensive way to take existing soil and improve its quality and capture carbon from the atmosphere.  That is our focus however is should be known that improving organic matter in soil also improves water retention (less flooding problems), water retention (drought mitigation), cation exchange (how well soil holds onto fertilizers) and fertility (how well plants grow) among many other beneficial factors.

The impact of soil biology can not be overstated.

What Worries Us

2015 was declared by the UN as the year of the soil, however in 2015 we have also seen the hottest year on record.  Never before have there been 3 category 3 hurricanes in the pacific at one time, and in 2015 there were 3 category 4 hurricanes at one time.  Hurricane Patricia went from tropical storm to the most intense hurricane ever recorded in 30 hours.  We are worried that we will simply not be able to do enough to help the planet soon enough.  We couldn't hope to achieve any of this goal without your help within the next 15 years.  With your help, we can help plants and the ground sequester billions of pounds of carbon in the soil.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a yard, please test your soil.   If you don't have nitrogen but do have phosphorus, DO NOT put a balanced fertilizer down. Set a goal for yourself to get 5% organic matter in any soil you can work with.  Read the labels on all product you put on your soil and follow all directions.  Read articles on the internet or go to the library and find out how you can improve the life in your soil.  Buy local or grow your own veggies.  Small changes do help


The most damaging thought to the world is "I wont do anything because I cant do enough"
story_txt:
Living Soil Is Important
 If there is a church, park or school you would like to benefit from this project, please let us know by email, Facebook, USPS or however!

Soil is NOT a kitchen sponge!  Soil is the living, breathing, bio-diverse skin of the Earth; or at least it is supposed to be.  As the results of our soil testing piled up, we found that only a small portion of land has been well-tended by gardeners who realize the importance of soil.  The vast majority of this land is grass, and our testing has shown that soil under grass, especially lawns, is deficient in LIFE.  Several textbooks, universities, soil scientists and most extension offices agree that 5% organic matter (life) is the optimum level to have in the soil.  Typically soil under grass will have between 1-2% organic matter and often times less.  It is our goal, with this campaign to change this by raising soil organic matter on land owned and operated by non-profit organizations.  


Parks, schools, churches and non-profit organizations simply cannot address the issues of poor soil due to the lack of funding and the lack of knowledge.  Thousands of acres, in each state, across the United States are under baseball fields, soccer fields, open spaces and lawns and each acre can be used to combat climate change.
The term climate change is used so often and it may be difficult to hear from yet another project.  Soil is the largest carbon storage system on Earth.  Soil is so effective at storing carbon we have been able to power our lives with its coal for over 100 years.  More carbon is stored in soil than anywhere else, which is one reason large companies are looking at something called carbon sequestration.  One form of sequestration requires carbon dioxide be captured as it is released at factories or power plants and it is piped into (you guessed it) the ground.  This system doesn't work for houses and things that move like cars and airplanes. The other way we can sequester carbon in the soil is to use plants and microorganisms. Plants use carbon in the air to grow roots, and through those roots they deposit sugar (also made from carbon) into the soil. After every rain, as water soaks into the ground, it is replaced by air containing more carbon dioxide. This is the action that breathes life into microorganisms (also made of carbon), if they are there. Increasing the life in the soil means increasing carbon sequestration and reducing the carbon in the atmosphere.
Alone, we cannot condition the soil, provide the microorganisms currently missing from the soil, and supply the food to support this life. To make this happen, we need everyone's help. Our business is growing quickly, but not quickly enough to be able to provide this for free for the places that need it the most.  Our modern lives today, all release carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. Please help us pull that carbon back out of the air and put it into the ground.


DEEZ BUTTS

Even today, manure is a great form of soil organic matter and food for microbes. These t-shirts are trying to bring awareness to the lack of organic matter in the soil and how easily it can be replenished.  From left to right, worm castings, or worm poop, is an excellent source of nutrition for plants, microbes and organic matter. Chicken manure is a staple for feeding grass as it is a slow-release plant food that is abundant and inexpensive.  Rabbit manure is also a great supplement as it is high in nitrogen and organic matter.  Cow manure is cow manure, few have not heard or smelled its benefits.
The Expected Results
Each funding level shows how much ground is being improved with that investment.

A: To increase the amount of organic matter in the top six inches of soil on properties controlled by non-profit organizations.  Improvements will be demonstrated with soil tests.

A: It will be advisable to follow fertilizing instructions provided with the soil test and to limit herbicide and pesticide use, otherwise the land can be used as before. All products supplied will be natural or organic.
Q: What happens if you get more than your requested amount?
A: We will expand, hire more people and possibly continue the project into Fall 2016. Our suppliers are capable of producing the biology and products to support much more than we hope to raise during this campaign. Tens of thousands of acres can be improved with the products available to us. 
Millions of active biologicals turn into billions within a few short weeks when properly taken care of.  A small input now reaps huge rewards in a short time.
If you do own a car, but do not own a yard, we have t-shirts and hats and stuff to show your support of the environment.  If you have soil that could use improvement there are several perks that allow you to improve your soil and soil that couldn't be helped without you.  If you own a business or have a very generous heart, the top supporters will be awarded a high quality plaque showing exactly how much land you have improved.

A: We will do the maximum we can with what we are funded.
